review: Jeu que j'ai acheter 5$ avec ma maman au magasin et que je peux jouer apr√®s avoir fait mes devoirs. C'est mon troisieme jeu pr√©f√©r√© apr√®s minecraft et fortnite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106927602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2174, 'last_played': 1642036292}
review:
This game is an absolute blast! It has a lot of depth and strategy involved if you're aiming for the high scores and the top of the leaderboards but can be played casually as well for the fun and glorious chokepoint massacres of orcs! There are a lot of traps/weapons to choose from as well so you can try different strategies and see which one works the best in each case. Trap/weapon combos are really well made too. After all these years it's still as entertaining as the first day of play.
Pros:
-Low-ish PC requirements(Availability), Fun and diverse levels, Funny dialogue and many more.
Cons:
-Some settings aren't present in the game(e.g. refresh rate etc., game still runs smooth and fast though) and I also found that the lowest mouse sensitivity setting is still quite fast for my taste(for the low DPI lovers).

author: {'steamid': '76561198037651328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 7239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7239, 'last_played': 1641575716}
review:
One of my all time favorites.  Oodles of fun and lots of replay-ability.

A really innovative combination of 1st person shooter and defense system.  Well made game, with good animations, sound and variety.

You will develop your own strategy for what weapons and traps you like.  You will find out that it sometimes doesn't work and work on new layouts and strategies for new levels.  The ability to unlock new features and upgrade things means you may find something seems impossible at first, but with some grinding... a rewarding victory can be had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186530370', 'num_games_owned': 2630, 'num_reviews': 570, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1640197830}
review:
The game is a tower defense without the maze building. You have a lot of traps, but you'll find yourself using mostly the same ones every level. The enemies are often similar each level so the only real difference is the map. It's a kind of casual game you can play a map or two, go off and do something else, then come and play more.

Overall, quite fun if a short and lacking in story. I liked it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156036994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1689, 'last_played': 1639431327}
review:
Killing orcs is fun. That‚Äôs it. There‚Äôs no need to say anything else. Oh, you want more? Ok. [i]Orcs Must Die![/i] is a tower defence game, mixed with a decent dose of third-person shooty action. It‚Äôs relatively simple in mechanics, and doesn‚Äôt have much replayability, but it‚Äôs also crazy addicting for the 30 or so hours most will need to do everything there is to do here. So, what are you waiting for?! Go kill some orcs too!!!

[b]Cubed3 Rating:[/b]
[b]7/10[/b]
[url=http://www.cubed3.com/review/6549/1/orcs-must-die-pc.html][b]Read Full Review Here[/b][/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198017953129', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1483, 'last_played': 1639949342}
review:
Un autre die and retry. Une similihistoire qu‚Äôon a du mal √† suivre : il n‚Äôy a que quelques cin√©matiques et les dialogues se passent au d√©but de chaque niveau, au moment o√π on est occup√© √† pr√©parer l‚Äôattaque et pas vraiment suivre ce qu‚Äôils disent.

On se retrouve souvent √† utiliser les m√™mes pi√®ges, surtout quand certains sont d√©bloqu√©s, ils deviennent incontournables. Il y en a d‚Äôautres dont je ne me suis pour le coup jamais servi. M√™me chose dans les arbres de comp√©tence, l‚Äôon se retrouve √† utiliser la m√™me chose et √† n‚Äôutiliser jamais certaines choses.

La mont√©e en difficult√© est selon moi mal g√©r√©e. Certains niveaux du d√©but sont beaucoup plus durs que d‚Äôautres √† la fin. Je pense particuli√®rement √† la chambre du chaos qui est selon moi un enfer de gestion entre les deux portes compl√®tement oppos√©es.
L‚Äôon se retrouve en fin de compte √† chercher une soluce pour certains niveaux, surtout pour les hauts niveaux tels que ¬´ cauchemar ¬ª qui sont impossibles √† moins d‚Äôavoir une technique pr√©cise et millim√©trique. Tout se jouant dans les premi√®res vagues, cela se faisant tout seul ensuite avec les pi√®ges.
On se rend compte, surtout avec les soluces, qu‚Äôil est n√©cessaire au final de n‚Äôutiliser que quelques types de pi√®ges, et donc toujours les m√™mes. Cela devenant donc redondant.

C‚Äôest un jeu int√©ressant, mais il vaudrait peut-√™tre mieux se diriger vers les jeux suivants de la s√©rie. Celui-ci ayant peu d‚Äôint√©r√™t, les m√™mes cartes se trouvant aussi dans le 2 apparemment (pas encore test√© au moment de l'√©valuation).

Quelques bugs sont √† noter de mon c√¥t√© : Impossibilit√© de modifier le son Windows lorsque je suis sur le jeu, je dois en sortir pour modifier le niveau et retourner sur le jeu ensuite. Quelques freezes √† noter √©galement, surtout quand il y a beaucoup d‚Äôennemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308285722', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1639667431}
review: This game is a hidden gem. Solid single-player game that should give you about 10+ hours of great gameplay. Quite a lot of replay value (fun but not too grindy achievements) and gives you a good amount of challenge even at the easiest setting. Not a lot going on story wise but it's not bothersome at all. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561199071024808', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3016, 'last_played': 1639476758}
review:
Si eres de los que gusta poner trampas y esperar a que las ratas caigan. Este es tu juego. Aqu√≠ tendr√°s trampas de todo tipo, solo estar√°s limitado por el espacio que tengas para ponerlas y tu imaginaci√≥n para acomodarlas.
Gr√°ficamente el juego es sencillo, es b√°sico y suficiente para el tipo de juego que es. El dise√±o art√≠stico se ve reflejado en el aspecto caricaturesco de sus personajes. Esto tambi√©n sirve para darle cierto carisma al entorno, personajes e incluso trampas.
Conforme progreses en el juego adquirir√°s mas trampas y aparecer√°n nuevos enemigos. Los escenarios podr√°n ser mas sencillos o mas complejos. 
La historia tambi√©n es bastante simple y es contada de una forma graciosa por un difunto personaje y la poca fe que este le tiene al protagonista del juego. Por desgracia, solo cuenta con 3 episodios y todos estos con im√°genes y relatos. No hay ninguna cinem√°tica en este juego. Pero cr√©eme que ni te importar√° si es que el juego logr√≥ engancharte.
En cuanto a la dificultad pues es bastante relativa, me explico, evidentemente los primeros niveles ser√°n los m√°s accesibles. Es normal que la dificultad incremente poco a poco, sin embargo,  depende del sistema de trampas que utilices para pasar los niveles para determinar lo que la dificultad realmente supondr√° para ti. Depende mucho de la imaginaci√≥n que tengas para acomodarlas y sacarles el m√°ximo beneficio. Es ah√≠ donde esta la gracia de este juego y lo que realmente puede llegar a ser muy adictivo.
Y si desp√∫es de habertelo completado todo aun no fue suficiente, tienes el modo pesadilla donde pondr√°s a prueba tu talento para armar tus sistemas de trampas con casi nada de tiempo para ponerlas y con ventajas para los enemigos.

Me divert√≠ mucho armando las trampas y ver como los orcos mor√≠an de todas las formas posibles de acuerdo a los sistemas de trampas que cree. Es netamente satisfactorio. 
Los comentarios del protagonista,  las conversaciones de este con la antagonista, y los comentarios de los orcos, a√±aden su peque√±a cuota de gracia.
El precio en oferta por todo el pack completo es un regalo. Si no me equivoco, al menos de momento hay una demo disponible para sacar todas las dudas.
Lo recomiendo, es un juego simple y en su simpleza logro tener cierta complejidad que me cautiv√≥. No espero menos de la segunda parte, pronto la probar√©.

review: Overall great and tough game. There are some notable bugs with some places with the maps and some traps won't go where you think they should. So spend a bit of time going through with traps and test them out where they can and can't go but if you don't place the trap then you won't be locked into the setup as you can't access the book again even if you pick back up all the traps. Kinda stupid on that bit. Also if you do need help you can look up help guides on YT but do keep in mind that most of them are old and before some patches so some things won't work like they show.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055577644', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2360, 'last_played': 1638736128}
review:
TLDR Loved the game
*The Good
-Art style still holds
-Gameplay
-Story simple but well done
*The Meh
-Music
*The bad
-Some mobs pathing get stuck in wall making impossible to end the mission having to retart
-I dont really like the crossbow and you are stuck to bring it
-Some maps gimics are annoying frocing you in playing with traps that you don't like

*Opinion
the game is a solid 8/10,I don't know what I would more out of the game to be a 10/10 but it still holds up and is a totally satisfying play

author: {'steamid': '76561198079183831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 977, 'last_played': 1452015827}
review:
Loved this game. It combined the concept of tower defense with 3rd person shooters making you strike a balance between fighting and making good defense management. It has nice music, playful dialogue/themes and the visuals are appropriately cartoony. I liked the second game more since it expanded upon many aspects of the first one, but this is nevertheless a very strong start to the franchise.
I recently played 3 and got mildly disappointed, but also had low expectations knowing it was a Stadia exclusive before releasing to PC.
Also, I watched Sips play it back in like 2013 and that's why I got it back then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977222008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3564, 'last_played': 1700611067}
review: Remember playing through the first mission or two 10 years back and had the game on my wish list.  Cruising through the Steam Store I saw Orcs Must Die 3 and thought, "Damn...don't even remember getting to number 2."  Bought 1 and 2 on sale and just finished playing through 1.  Couldn't stop playing.  60 hours later, all missions completed on both regular and nightmare and I have to say it was the most fun I've had playing a game in a while.  Looking forward to starting up the 2nd and then, likely, will move on to the recent 3.  Definitely worth the purchase.

review: Rewarding, entertaining, and humorous, Orcs Must Die is a fun twist on tower strategy by adding in an action role-playing element. It's addicting without being overly time consuming to advance and unlock more traps and powers, adding a lot of replay value for when you do unlock everything. The weaver functions add extra dimensions and possibilities. I highly recommend this game and if you're already interested in the series definitely play this one first!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025102926', 'num_games_owned': 1728, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1634587688}
review:
Well, for starters -- I didn't finish the game, not even close. It's just too chaotic and difficult.

However, what I've seen wasn't bad at all; it's just not my game. You're placing traps to prevent the orcs from reaching the portals; however, since you don't have the resources to just cover the level with traps, you also have to get your own hands dirty. Later on, when you get more entrance points, more exit portals, and the levels don't allow you to funnel all orcs into a single kill zone, the over-reliance on combat is what usually brought me down, along with not enough real breaks to really focus on your trap placement. For example, taking down an Ogre or Hunter can take quite some time, and you're not doing anything else while you deal with them.

Still, if you like that kind of game, I'm pretty sure this qualifies as a good one.

No story either, and the game itself doesn't explain anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058442015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1633479358}
review:
Reviewed early in my playthrough but this is a Ronseal type of game - it delivers exactly what it promises to deliver.  Neatly combining FPS and tower defence you set up your defences, unleash the Orcs and try and kill them all before they reach their target.  And then - more Orcs and monsters, more defences, upgrades.  Fast, frantic fun.  Probably best on a PC with a replaceable keyboard than a laptop.

S.x.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047812590', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1633275320}
review: For a Tower Defense, only one level is called, The Tower.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075847445', 'num_games_owned': 1063, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1691528299}
review:
The first Orcs must die unlike the sequels is a single player only game which is very short.


Still serve as a very good entry in the orcs must die universe , traps are unlocked by beating each levels , visually this game aged pretty well with it's well done style.

Orcs must die 1 is probably the most balanced of the 3 Orcs must die games when it's come to solo play , it's also have less grinds then 2 and 3. So if all you want is a game you can quickly be done with in a weekend then yeah you might like this one more then the others.

the story is simple enough that you won't feel lost even if you start with 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010203905', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2647, 'last_played': 1632340048}
review:
I revisited this game after being really busy for 10 years and it is a very fun game with enjoyable humor in the story line with some good gameplay mechanics, It is very satisfying to watch your death traps eat waves of foes, and still offers a good challenge if you are looking for it.

PROS:
-The story is fun for what is a pretty simple premise
-Three appropriately scaled difficulty settings for relaxed, regular and hard play
-Good variety of traps
-Decent weapons that make you feel powerful
-interesting levels that make you try different trap combos 
-watching others play online there is no one right way to beat a level
-DLC not required to win, and it does not cheese the game

Cons
-Mouse sensitivity settings are bonkers, I moved my hand a millimeter and my character did a 720, I had to put it on minimum settings and adjust my computers mouse setting as well
-Hidden timer, to get 5 skulls (the best score) on any level you have to beat is without letting any orcs through, and under a certain amount of time. only way to see the par time, is to complete the level and then look at your stats to see how much you missed it by.
-Overlapping audio on Nightmare mode, Your character will call out important things in a level such as beginnings of a wave, and he will give exposition at the start of the game. there is no downtime in nightmare, leading to his lore and info overlapping to make sound garbage
-placement glitches, sometimes you will try and replace a trap and the space will be occupied even when it isn't, making your perfect deathtrap asymmetrical

My level of experience with this game:
I beat the game without DLC items on the regular and Nightmare difficulties and 100% the game. I used no cheats or exploits. I did look online to see how other people set up traps for harder levels and altered my strategies based on what I liked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143793523', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1650750685}
review:
Bom jogo, mas extremamente irritante, bem dificil (sem ser no apprentice) e demorado , recomendo pra quem tem paciencia kkk


Dicas (Coisas que eu fiz pra vencer mapas no modo normal):

Melhores armas:
- Vampiric Gauntlets e Bladestaff
Melhores "Armadilhas":
- Barricade, Tar Trap e Push Trap
Melhores Armadilhas (Dano):
- Spike Trap e Floor Scorcher

Minha estrat√©gia:
- Antes de come√ßar o jogo sempre escolha a Steel Weaver..
- Obrigue os inimigos a passarem por um espa√ßo de um bloco s√≥ com as Barricades e abuse disso com as armadilhas de dano e Tar Traps.
- Caso os inimigos estejam invadido a tua base, fique encostado no portal e utilize as Vampiric Gauntlets, voc√™ vai conseguir recarregar ela muito rapido e sem perder toda a sua vida, por conta do portal.
- Se tiver um espa√ßo de tr√™s blocos com duas paredes dos lados, coloque uma push trap em cada parede, isso vai prender os inimigos por um bom tempo e vai ficar jogando eles pros lados, al√©m de dar dano, e recomendo tambem botar armadilhas de dano no ch√£o, obviamente, entre as duas push traps e em volta, com barricades e tar traps pra realmente dificultar a passagem da maioria dos inimigos, fazendo isso chega um momento que fica impossivel de qualquer coisa passar, principalmente se voc√™ liberou na weaver o upgrade que faz os monstros grandes serem empurrados e lan√ßados tambem.
- Em certas fases com multiplos spawns, voc√™ consegue bloquear a maioria dos caminhos com as Barricades, obrigando todos os inimigos a passarem por um lugar s√≥.
- √â muito facil derrotar os monstros grandes com a Bladestaff, s√≥ ficar rodando em volta deles e atacando, com cuidado pra n√£o tomar stun, se a fase tiver aquela crossbow gigante q tu aperta E pra usar, use ela pra derrotar os monstros grandes se eles tiverem sobrevivendo suas traps.
- Use uma porrada de arqueiros se sobrar dinheiro, eles ajudam muito, principalmente contra os bichos voadores, depois com o upgrade da weaver fica muito foda ver as flechas de fogo voando.

Enfim, √© um bom jogo, mas vai fazer voc√™ passar muita raiva, cuidado para n√£o quebrar alguma coisa que esteja por perto.

review:
It's so damn stressfull and infuriating at times I end up banging my fist on the table and roaring at the screen. But I keep coming back to get those 5 skulls on every level!

It's very fun and can be very intense at the higher levels. There is a good mix of planning your defence and franticly running around and slaying things. 

Btw, most negative reviews on this franchise are by people who clearly just gave up on beating a level and is furiously blaming the game, ayy lmao

author: {'steamid': '76561198066259273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1631100606}
review:
I loved this game back in the day and with the new game Orcs Must Die 3 I wanted to go back and play and actually the first 2 games, however a bug has arised that prevents you from opening up your spellbook which you need to do to even play the game.  I have searched around to see if there was any fixes, but no there is not from what I can tel and there are many who are experiencing this bug and apparently have been for a few years now.

I cannot recommend this game, even though I find it fun, until this game breaking bug has been fixed and until then I highly do not recommend this game unless a community or official fix is made.

Shoot I won't even recommend the new game until the developers get off their asses and actually care to fix their older games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995299604', 'num_games_owned': 663, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1630525098}
review:
Das Trommeln gegen das Tor l√§sst die Balken brechen. Eine Horde zahlloser Orks und Oger rasend br√ºllend auf den Spalt zu, um in die Menschenwelt einzudringen. Mit Waffen und Fallen im K√∂cher stellt sich ihnen ein Magier in den Weg. Wird er Erfolgreich sein?
Orcs Must Die!. Ein ungew√∂hnlicher Hybrid aus Towerdefence und Ego-Shooter.
Ein alter, m√§chtige Magier schlug Orks, Oger und sonstigen Abschaum Jahrhunderte lang zur√ºck um sie davon abzuhalten in die Menschenwelt einzudringen. Bei seiner letzten Schlacht fand er sein Ende, als er auf Orkblut ausrutschte und sich den Kopf auf einer Treppe aufschlug. Nun f√§llt seine Aufgabe auf seinen Lehrling wieder desen Markenzeichen seine unfassbare Naivit√§t und Dummheit ist.
23 Festungen gilt es im Verlaufe des Spiels zu verteidigen. Am Anfang jeder Runde k√∂nnen wir uns ein buntes Paket aus Zaubern, Fallen und Waffe zusammenstellen um gegen die √úberzahl an Feinden auftrumpfen zu k√∂nnen. Bodenstacheln hier, eine Barrikade da und ab geht die Luzie. Anschlie√üend geht das Spiel flie√üend √ºber in einen Action-Teil bei dem wir mit Bogen und Schwert uns in bester Rambo Manier durch die Horde arbeiten. Ist die Welle bezwungen gilt es verdiente Taler schnell in neue Strukturen zu investieren. Unterschiedliche Level Layouts und wechselnde Gegnertypen sorgen stets daf√ºr das wir unsere Taktiken immer √ºberdenken m√ºssen. Was auf Karte 1 noch wunderbar klappte, geht auf Karte 2 tierisch in die Hose. Und als Kirsche auf dem Eisbecher werden die Festungen jedes Mal mit humorvollen Dialogen untermalt.
F√ºr TD und Shooter Fans geht eine klare Empfehlung raus. F√ºr Aufbau Spieler des gem√§chlichen Spieltempos eher nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051762021', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3116, 'last_played': 1630207599}
review: One of the best and most unique tower-defence games I have played. Definitely not a TD where you can idle in between rounds, but the game gives you a great selection of weapons/spells so that you can battle the hordes yourself. Easy to pickup and learn but still offers a great challenge. If you enjoy tower defence games, you will definitely enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106332639', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1666562010}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a mindlessly fun game that mixes tower defense with third-person shooter/sword play elements. Essentially the game gives you traps or allies which you can place around the map to your liking. I found that the levels sometimes played out like a puzzle where you would try and find the best combinations of traps/weapons/magic to make a map more manageable. The game has a ton of enemy types which add variety to the map that forces you to react and adapt or else you'll find yourself not making the 5 Skull score.

One issue I had with this game was that it was very easy and you'll find yourself leaning toward a particular group of traps for a good portion of the game. Also, a small portion of the traps/magic/weapons are completely useless in my opinion. Another thing about the game is the story, which isn't very good and is just thrown in to make the game seem less like an arcade game.

Graphics: 8/10
Gameplay: 9/10
Story: 3/10
Music: 5/10
Difficulty: 4/10 (Medium) 7/10 (Hard)
Game Length: 27 hours if you're going for 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561198077020855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1629824974}
review:
Ors Must Die! is a Tower Defense game that adds a main character as a third person action figure to the classical gameplay of such games.
You place traps and soldiers at crucial locations before each round and as soon as the round starts, you actively participate by casting spells, shooting with your crossbow, or entering melee combat.
Throughout the playthrough you will literally kill ten thousands of enemies, which are quite manifold and require different counter measures: there are not only orcs, but also ogres, kobolds, gnolls, and flying enemy types. The huge array of traps and accessories is entertaining and allows different approaches and tactics.
Orcs Must Die! is a very fun game I can recommend to anyone who likes action or TD games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076379593', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1629660147}
review:
[h1] Orcs Must Die! 100% Review [/h1]

This game was a blast to play, and if you love tower defense games that also require you to take action while in game, you'll love this. This version of the game is single player and the achievements are not hard to obtain, there a great guide to help you along your way to 100%. I ended up beating every map with a 5 skull rating on every diffaculty before obtaining the 30k Orc achievement, but it only toke me 3 extra map runs to get me the kill count. Very enjoyable, very fun, would recommend anyone picking it up when it is on sale.

review:

L'opus original de la s√©rie vaut encore le coup pour ceux qui se demandent, bien qu'il soit clairement suclass√© par ses successeurs. Toutefois, bien qu'il ait moins √† offrir et notamment pas de partie en coop√©ration, il reste tr√®s bon sur tous le plans :
- Graphismes "un peu cartoon" ayant l'avantage de ne pas souffrir du temps qui passe.
- De bonne sessions d√©fouloires.
- Beaucoup de pi√®ges pour varier les plaisirs et les combos.

- Une difficult√© bien dos√©e (d'autant plus que vous serez seul, pas de coop possible).

Si vous h√©sitez entre cet opus et le 2√®me Orcs must die!, pr√©f√©rez tout de m√™me le 2 : il comprend les niveaux du 1 (niveaux "classiques" et permet les parties en coop ou le mode infini.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053232583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1480, 'last_played': 1694301364}
review:
Tower Defense games and I haven't really ever gotten along. The gameplay loop often got stale quickly and I found myself just going through the motions - that said. Orcs Must Die! was able to hold my attention for a long time and I found myself sinking in many hours playing it.
The gameplay is quick and easy to pick up and yet the levels offer enough of a challenge (especially on 'Nightmare Mode') to keep you on your toes.
Sure you'll have the traps and spells you like but you'll find yourself in a level that will require a new strategy that you'll need to think up on the fly.
The music is fun and simple, nothing to bother or distract you while playing and the story is rather simple and straightforward.
I picked the game up a while back and never really got around to playing it until now and honestly I'm glad I did.
I highly recommend 'Orcs Must Die!' to anybody who likes the genre or just somebody looking for a neat little game.
Score: 8/10

review:
Orcs Must Die √© o melhor Tower Defense que eu j√° joguei na vida. T√£o bom que voc√™ platina sem perceber.

Absurdamente divertido, estrat√©gico e terap√™utico. Perfeito para desestressar no dia a dia, enquanto espera a √°gua do miojo ferver ou naqueles 10 minutos entre um servi√ßo e outro.

Me faltam palavras para descrever essa formosura em forma de jogo. Basicamente voc√™ vai utilizar armadilhas e magias para causar um genoc√≠dio de orcs invasores de propriedades alheias, usufruindo de t√°ticas que unem intelig√™ncia, sadismo e prazer, limitados apenas pela sua criatividade assassina.

T√° com raiva? Frustrado? Entediado? Com pris√£o de ventre? 
Vem matar orc. 

Nota: 10/10

review:

Orcs must die der p√• given dato er en trilogi, er blevet en serie jeg er rigtig glad for. De er hyggelige, ikke for komplicerede og s√• har serien et sk√∏nt glimt i √∏jet. Denne titel er kun singleplayer men det var helt fint dengang. Jeg vil stadig anbefale Orcs must die, da det for sine egne pr√¶misser er et rigtig godt spil, men skal man v√¶lge imellem dem, vil jeg forsl√• at man spiller 3‚Äôeren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177311526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1626798967}
review:
Game has a goofy and like-able protagonist, a basic but decent story line. Game-play is quite straightforward, the Orcs Must die, and you gotta make it happen.

Good things about the game:

	- Solid 15 to 20 hours of game-play
	- Achievements are relatively easy to get (you get most of them by just playing the game)
	- Both Graphics And Game-play doesn't feel dated at all

Criticisms:

- Lack of infinite (wave) mode
	Some levels really makes me wish i can fill up Every inch of the level with traps and have 1000s of orcs running in every wave.

- Traps balance
	All traps and weapons are useful in some scenarios, but some are just too "meta" when you're working with limited resource, an infinite mode would've helped mixing up trap setups.

- Trap upgrades
	You gotta finish the Whole game, in 2 different difficulties to get all the upgrades, and you don't even get to feel OP by the end either, coz of the previous 2 points.

All these 3 issues are solved in the sequels thou.

Side note:

	DLC weapons are quite op, recommend playing without them, but if you're struggling in a certain level they can help you out.

Concluding thoughts:

	Definitely a good game for the first of the series, highly recommend if you wanna give the orcs series a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147937223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1627058897}
review:
Yes, yes and yes. 

A tower defense with a twist. You get to be part of the defense! You can actively shoot your crossbow, throw your spells or go in with your sword. It's super fun. 
There's a lot of variety when it comes to the traps, different types of enemies, maps and spells. You can upgrade your traps with the skulls you earn (depending on how well you do on the levels). There's a lot of solutions to each level, be creative.
A simple story and funny interactions with the orcs and the villain. Nothing spectacular but it's a nice detail that it's there.
Three difficulty levels (the nightmare one made me sweat, but hey, i completed it). 
And it's relatively cheap and will give you at least 10 hours of fun (just for the main story on normal difficulty).

review: The game's great, so is the franchise, but this is incredibly difficult at times, with meta heavy builds that cannot be ignored or else you'll pay by losing, a lot. The worst part is this one didn't have COOP so some of the levels are incredibly hard and you can't seek for help from another player. It's the game that started the franchise, it's amazing but I just wish this was properly balanced.

review: I was first introduced to the "Orcs Must Die!" Series on PS4 through their free game at the time "Orcs Must Die! Unchained," and I fell in love with it. I love most "Tower Defense" genres and this met more than most my expectations going in blind and almost 100% trophy unlock the game. So I then bought OMD1 and 2 on sale here on steam and its humorous, a fair challenge at times and is a great game to just burn, shock, or blast some Orcs beyond the senses they already lack. I'm playin through 1 and soon to start 2 before the release of 3. I did play a bit of 3 on the Stadia and its nice that it is multiplayer. Go get those Gibs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198870002005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1654100161}
review:
In short: a very fun tower defense that can be played as a hack n slash instead, with a whopping 24 fortresses that get a really hard nightmare difficulty too. The one thing that makes this one distinct from the other titles though, is the weavers, who generally give you the option to make your traps ultra powerful, yourself powerful, or the power of making loads of money off of orcs killed by magic. However, the game is still suprisingly short, I completed my playthrough of both difficulties around the 17 hour mark, but either way the replayability is pretty insane.
So go ahead, grab your spells, warp in some archer, barricade most reasonable ways to the rift, and watch them shred everything to pieces, only for them to all die to a single gnoll.

review:
Este es un juego de matar, donde debes matar, no hay m√°s.

Recuerdo haber jugado esta entrega pirata hace a√±os y al enterarme recientemente de la salida del 3 me dieron ganas de re jugar el primero y el segundo.

Es un titulo interesante y simple, solo debes abatir las hordas de orcos que van a por ti para esto dispondras de armas y trampas, una premisa muy simple, pero funciona a la perfecci√≥n.

La historia es bastante simple, y tampoco es tan largo, yo me lo pase en las dos dificultades en 8 horas m√°s o menos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053442697', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1716, 'last_played': 1624256734}
review:
Este es un juego de Tower Defense. Sos el aprendiz de un mago (medio torpe, pero la ultima esperanza para frenar la invasion de los orcos)
Son varios niveles, donde tenes que ir colocando trampas para detener a los orcos.
La idea es que no lleguen a las fisuras, porque si llegas a cero, perdes el nivel.
Es un juego viejo, lo encontras de oferta muy seguido, y realmente en argentina no llega ni a un cuarto de dolar de valor.

Asi que mas alla de que no vas a jugar tanto (unas 30 horas para completar todos los logros) y que no tiene cooperativo (para eso recomiendo la segunda entrega del juego) el juego es entretenido y realmente por lo que vale...es imposible no recomendarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185162943', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1623869507}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a classic of games. If you are fan of Tower Defence or not you will love it. By a lot types of traps and magic weapons you will enjoy with every level of this game. Killing enemies is enjoyable so much that you will see how much blood is spilling out. Every level has diffrent type of distribution of gates and halls and every trap is good according to level. 
Highly recommended to everyone

author: {'steamid': '76561198322748351', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1623945610}
review: This game is truly wonderful. I encountered this game when i was at least 10 years old at a disc store. Wasn't interested because doesn't seem to look fun in the covers. Now when i see it again with a fair discounted price, I bought it and regret that I did not buy the game with it's intentional cost. Amazing graphics for an old game, even there were so many mobs to clear. My game never lagged even if my computers seems to be a broken toaster. I like there are some comedy inside the storyline and it just works. Planning to play the 2nd game after I finished every levels. The only complain that i would say is that I dont like that i can't change the trap options during a break in the game but it would've been too easy if I could. So overal this game have given me a full satisfication. A 10/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100336902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1624066263}
review:
More than your average tower defense game, Orcs Must Die! allows you to jump directly into the fray. The gameplay is hectic, and fun. Even when I make a tactical error, it's fun to watch my not-so-well-laid-plan crumble as slathering orcs overwhelm me. Eight levels in, the game gradually gets more complex but feels manageable and forgiving. Completing a level, by defending the level's rift - the orc's ultimate goal, unlocks new traps and earns you Skulls which you can use to upgrade said traps. And you can revisit previous levels with your new and upgraded traps as many times as you'd like to earn the skulls you might have missed the first time around, or to simply try out different strategies. Each level ends up feeling like a sandbox waiting to be crafted into the ultimate orc-killing deathtrap.

The presentation is solid, landing on humorous, without being over the top. The graphics are charming and colorful. But you won't be writing and fan fiction about the main character. This game is pure fun and experimentation. The story, if you can call it that, exists merely to provide a basic framework as to why you're defending this rifts from orcs in the first place.

Pick this one up if you need a light-hearted change of pace between more serious games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048977206', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1623255701}
review:
Unlike normal Tower Defense games, Orcs Must Die allows you to freely control the game flow and engage the enemy in third person. If you get this game expecting to idle all the time, this is not the game for you. Sooner or later enemies becoming increasingly difficult to hold off with your traps, so you'll have to properly aim and fire your weapon/spell and get headshots.
Although this game was made in 2011, the core gameplay has aged well and I believe newcomers will like this game.

PROS
+ Simple story line, just straight to gameplay
+ Tactical game with numerous ways to tackle hordes of enemies
+ Engaging gameplay where you have to constantly move/shoot/cast/place traps
+ Varied death animations depending on which trap was triggered

CONS
+ You don't really know what a trap can do until you actually try using it and seeing the effects for yourself
+ Trap placement is sometimes weird - cannot place a trap in certain places even when it looks like you can
+ Enemy AI is weird - sometimes even if you block off a route the enemy would just break through it, even though there's a clear alternative path it can take
+ Enemy diversity is a bit limited, such as FROST OGRE, FIRE OGRE, ARMORED OGRE

Nightmare mode is extremely punishing - the difficulty spike is insane compared to war mage. You only get 3 seconds of free time per wave with tankier and stronger enemies. I had lots of frustrations going through the levels so if that's not your cup of tea, just ignore them and play whatever you want to your hearts content!

Keep in mind this is an Indie game made in 2011. Its not a perfect game but the overall enjoyment outshadows the problems. Solid game overall.

review: This is a great game!! I've had a lot of fun trying out new combinations, and some of the maps are actually kind of tough, and require some thought on how best to approach them.  The only complaint I have really is that the timber requirement to get the 5th skull is dumb.  A way I would change it is to first have a timer counter on the screen so you can track how much time has passed in the match, and have the timer pause during the breaks.  But all in all, really fun and is worth a buy.  I bought my copy on a third party website (Eneba) and got my Steam key for much cheaper than if you would buy it on Steam website.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065541078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1620948321}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a fun and enjoyable experience, it is an excellent tower defense game with a slay them yourself mentality. The Constant Killing and slaying of a variety of orcs started out simple and straightforward to soon being out of hand to which you wish you had a buddy to watch your back. Well its just your luck as there is a second Orcs Must Die! 2 and its just that. Co-op with your buddy and play through numerous levels and challenges and enjoy killing millions of orcs with either creative traps and or just your bare fists.

My favorite trap sets have been scenarios where you can kill all orcs by throwing them into the acid in the level or lava to which they die instantly, For the other levels I really enjoyed the wall traps and decoy to lead them to instant pain. The first one was a thrill to play, but if it were up to me, just play the second one as its so much better and you can bring a pal to join in on the action.

9/10 Experience and enjoyment for sure worth the purchase if you have no friends or just like killing orcs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011511137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1620945375}
review:
This was a fun little tower defense type game. I enjoyed it - it was a welcome change from the larger and more complex games I typically play. Sometimes it's nice to just zone out and slash up some Orcs!

I did have one complaint about this game, though. There doesn't seem to be enough incentive to try out new builds. Especially when I was going for 5 Skulls on each level, I tended to stick with what had worked for me in the past, rather than experimenting with different traps and weavers. That's probably more on me, but it would have been nice to have had some sort of built-in reason to try out different traps.

Overall, I enjoyed Orcs Must Die! I think it was certainly worth the sale price that I got it for, and if you're looking for a fun way to kill a few hours, I think it's worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275143839', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1262, 'last_played': 1619026243}
review:
Style: Strategy Game
House Party Game: No
Completable Solo: Yes
Completable Multiplayer: N/A
Combat Involved: Yes
Combat Weaponry: CQC, Magic, Traps
Combat Type: Medevil
Difficulty Rating: 5
Difficulty Scale: (0 = Infant, 10 = No life, no friends, no job and no soul)

Deep Dive:
The game can be beaten on "apprentice" difficultly from beginning to end with minimum effort.
In terms of achievements however, this is where the game gets...tricky. Certain levels are designed to stress you and some deliberately put you in a lose - lose situation unless you can thread the needle.

In addition there are bugs with how the enemy's move and certain drops can fall through the floor, especially on stairs, which may not seem like a big deal but it can ruin a run if you need a health potion in a pinch or a coin purse for a crucial trap.

Negative Rating:
This game leaves a lot to be desired in terms of mechanics/combat, you have a variety of weapons and traps but the cost/damage balancing draws you back to only using the cheapest items in order to maximise efficiency and control the levels better. 

In my opinion this makes around 50% of the weapons/traps redundant and as such it failed to meet my expectations, especially as a single player game. I can appreciate it, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11093, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1672746779}
review:
This is a hybrid tower (trap) defense/third person shooter/brawler where you fight off waves of orcs running along a dungeon path.

The game is very well made, although light on config settings.  The game could use a respec option, but overall it's fairly fun.  The asking price is a little steep but you can get the game very cheaply on sale or in bundles so it's worth grabbing when the opportunity arises.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016343991', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4492, 'last_played': 1616234492}
review:
Pros:
It's pretty forward thinking of Robot Entertainment to let people launch the Orcs Must Die 2 level DLC as a standalone game, that's convenient for anyone who accidentally bought the DLC without the game and doesn't have the money to buy the full game right away when they realize their mistake.

Cons:
I mean I guess it's to be expected considering this was designed as DLC for another full game, but when you run it by itself this DLC has a lot of balance and coding issues. Like the enemy pathing wigs out all the time and most of the weapons and traps are pretty broken without other weapons and traps from the full game to balance them out. You really should just play this through Orcs Must Die 2 instead and save yourself the trouble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033356283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 13789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13789, 'last_played': 1579231374}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a 3rd person shooter + tower defense with a fantasy setting and cheesy humor.

This is one of my favorite games. The actual content of the game with DLC is probably 30 hrs or less. But I have 230 hrs at the time of this review because I have replayed it several times over the years and also played for high scores at some point, both of which are not usual for me. That is how fun I found it.

You start with some basic traps to slow down or eliminate the attacking horde. New levels unlock new traps, weapons, and bonuses. As you defeat levels you are rewarded with skulls. You can use those to purchase upgrades for your traps.

You might think to try to use only traps or only your player weapons to defeat levels. But most maps are balanced where you must use both at least initially. Often by the last few rounds I can have traps taking care of nearly everybody.

There are some physics traps like pushers and spring loaded floor panels. Aside from the obvious things like throwing orcs into lava/acid, I have seen videos where there are more orcs flying through the air than on the ground.

The DLCs are worth it for the price. Artifacts of Power is marginal but cheap. I only use the Floor Scorcher from that but I use it a lot. Some of the other ones can be useful depending on your playstyle. Lost Adventures has extra maps and enemies and more skulls for trap upgrades.

FWIW, Orcs Must Die 2 is also great and adds co-op, but I like this first one slightly more.

This game is so much fun and I really wish more people knew how awesome it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996891752', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1614200606}
review:
A cool but flawed spin on the "Tower Defence" game genre.

The good:
* Some levels have unique one time use traps

The bad:
* The sensitivity in this game doesn't go low enough (or rather the slider doesn't feel like it is doing much at the low end) so aiming the crossbow was quite annoying
* No way to rebind controls
* The air enemy paths are badly designed. In certain spots on certain levels the only anti-air trap you have will simply not reach the enemies making the trap useless. Worst offender is the Balcony level which has many air enemies and they only fly high enough to be hit by the ceiling trap at the very end of the level. Placing ceiling traps is also very awkward and pretty much impossible if your camera gets stuck in a floor trap.
* There's no way to see what enemies will come in the next wave even during an intermission, or which door they will go through first at level start.
* No windowed mode.
* Some animations like level end and the controls screen are too long.

The meh:
* Quite limited upgrade paths. Each tower has only 1 pre defined upgrade.
* Level design limits creativity in trap placements. One could argue that's to force players to to use specific/different strategies each level, but ehh?
* No weapon upgrades

review: Orcs Must Die! is an action packed tower defense game. You have a variety of weapons, spells and traps to murder orcs, ogres and more. The maps reach from easy as hell to extremly hard. The orcs are talking stupid shit while dying brutally which gives the game even more charm. I really recommend this game if you like the genre. The only "bad-ish" thing is the Nightmare mode. If you dont use the same traps on every level you wont make it. Which is kinda meh. BUT nevertheless did I had a blast playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375892314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7840, 'last_played': 1653088839}
review: WHat I love most about this game besides the carnage and the absolutely hilarious one liners the orcs say is that it can be easy as well as still be challenging. but the best thing for me is that it does not set of my explosive temper when I am unable to win a level. I cant tell you how many controllers I have destroyed over the years out of extreme frustration with some of the games I have played. I love the various traps and all the different ways you can kill the enemy coming at you. I love the fact that the big bad Villain is a woman, its so nice to see this. but most of all I love the good guy is not quite smart enough to tie his own shoe laces and yet he is full of charisma and quite a good dancer with Phenomenal flexibility.  all up I would highly recommend this game to anyone looking at wasting a few hours of their life and having a good laugh at the expense of a few hundred orcs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976885557', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1610700176}
review:
What it is: Tower Defense/3rd person shooter

I liked the game. The first couple acts were relatively easy, but the difficulty ramps up for the third. The final stage is a bit brutal and the only one I had to repeat multiple times to beat. The orcs have a little personality and the story is mediocre, but that's not the point of the game. The game is all about setting up kill rooms and committing genocide against the orcs hordes. 

I will mention that the in game engine has some bugs in it. The physics spells/traps sometimes don't behave the way they should. Also, pits (acid/lava) sometimes don't kill enemies because they'll be on some glitched part of the wall that allows them to live. I've also see the enemies actually get SPRUNG OUT of a pit. I have no idea why that happens, but it has multiple times. Also, the game crashed the moment I beat the last stage. So, I have no idea how the story ends. Meh

Aside from the bugs, it's an enjoyable little romp.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062398170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1374292387}
review:
Orcs Must Die! √© aquele jogo que te surpreende pela qualidade na simplicidade. O jogo funciona com sistema de hordas, onde devemos nos preparar com armadilhas e estrat√©gias, para derrotar determinadas quantidades de inimigos (Orcs). Em cada fase, voc√™ deve se preparar para novos desafios, com novas dificuldades e novos poderes para facilitar sua vida. O jogo possui excelente dublagem em portugu√™s, o que deixa a narrativa mais interessante. 
Foi o meu primeiro jogo da Steam e me diverti muito com game.

Recomendado com sucesso!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960812673', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2539, 'last_played': 1635561280}
review:
I played this game for the first time a year or two ago after knowing it by name and owning it for years, but never giving it a shot -- that was a big mistake. This was my first experience in a first-person tower defense game and I loved every second of it. It does a great job balancing the shooter mechanics with the tower defense ones, and the campaign missions are great. The campaign also does a good job in the typical tower defense format of presenting one new enemy and counter trap/spell per mission. As someone who is decent at FPS games but prefers the tower defense components I heavily enjoyed this game and didn't feel like I had to be good at shooters to do well, although it did come in handy.

The aesthetic is wonderful too, and even though I played it 7-8 years post release it didn't feel dated one bit, and actually felt superior to some more recent games I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961566470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1390, 'last_played': 1571074832}
review:
Forgetting to upvote this awesome game (and its sequel) was a major oversight on my part.

Pros:
- I loved the mixed puzzle/action gameplay: first planning out your strategy, and then running around helping your traps to kill as many orcs as possible.
- Good music, albeit repetitive.
- Max's anachronistic voice acting is hilarious

Cons:
- FOV is too low (but there are workarounds)
- The graphics are OK, nothing special
- Wooden barriers are comically short. They look like they shouldn't be able to stop the orcs, but they work anyway.

Note: OMD1 maps are included in OMD2, but the OMD1 cutscenes/storyline/dialogue are only available in OMD1 itself. Also, the AI is tweaked in OMD2 so your experience may be a bit different between the two games.

[INT. AN ORC-INFESTED CASTLE - The War Mage, surrounded by traps and chaos, takes a moment to address the audience.]

WAR MAGE: (with a smirk) Well, well, well, look who's come to talk about a little game called Orcs Must Die. I'm the War Mage, the guy who spends his days defending fortresses from hordes of the green, ugly, and not-so-smart fellas. But hey, it's a living!

[The camera pans to a line of spring traps flinging orcs into the distance.]

WAR MAGE: (laughs) You know, in this game, Orcs Must Fly! These spring traps? They're like the catapults of the orc-launching world. You haven't lived until you've seen an orc do a graceful, albeit involuntary, swan dive into the abyss.

[Cut to the War Mage placing barricades to funnel the orcs into a kill zone.]

WAR MAGE: (strategically) You see, it's all about strategy. You set up traps, you block their path, and you watch the chaos unfold. It's like planning a surprise party, but the surprise is a horde of orcs crashing the party!

[The camera reveals the Weavers, magical beings who enhance the War Mage's abilities.]

WAR MAGE: (enthusiastic) And oh, the lovely Weavers! They're like my personal cheering squad. With their help, I can be even more deadly ‚Äì faster reloads, stronger traps, and all that good stuff. It's like having a whole team of magical coaches.

[The War Mage unleashes a powerful spell that obliterates a wave of orcs.]

WAR MAGE: (with a grin) But let's not forget my favorite part ‚Äì the sweet satisfaction of obliterating orcs! It's like a stress relief session, but with more explosions and fewer angry letters from the neighborhood watch.

[The camera pans out to show a fortress filled with traps and orcs meeting their hilarious demise.]

WAR MAGE: (concluding) So, in Orcs Must Die, you'll laugh, you'll strategize, and you'll definitely make some orcs fly. It's a wild, trap-filled adventure that'll keep you entertained for hours. So grab your crossbow, set those spring traps, and let's get rid of some green, not-so-friendly faces!

[The War Mage winks at the camera before turning back to the chaos of the battlefield.]

review:
So This game is a lot of fun, I feel like you need to get use to it and pick up your own style of play.

Some Levels are made for a certain trap to be used, but you can totally bypass that to use other things. Don't stress about getting 5 skulls every level to start, just focus on beating the levels, you can go back later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154004822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 1559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1603749513}
review:
Super Spiel.

Pro:
- Viele unterschiedliche Level
- Drei Schwierigkeitsgrade
- Viele unterschiedliche Fallen
- Story h√§lt sich in Grenzen, ist aber lustig

Kontra:
- Gegner zittern ab und zu vorw√§rts, was das eigene Zielen schwer macht
- Man hat sehr schnell seine Favoriten und dagegen sind viele andere Fallen sehr schwach

F√ºr Erfolgsj√§ger: Viele sind gut machbar, allerdings teilweise auch ein wenig Zeitintensiv. Bei anderen braucht man ein wenig Gl√ºck. 

Ich kann dieses Spiel, obwohl es √§lter ist, nur empfehlen. Es macht Spa√ü immer neue Level zu verteidigen. F√ºr jedes Level bekommt man eine neue Falle. Au√üerdem bis zu 5 Sch√§del, die man in st√§rkere Versionen der einzelnen Fallen investieren kann. Ca. 20 Stunden kann man sich hier bestimmt aufhalten, wenn man Spa√ü an Tower Defence Games hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368724267', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 3553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1061, 'last_played': 1693088149}
review:
A fun tower defence game where you get to kill Orcs! You unlock new traps and depending on your rating you can upgrade traps to be even more devastating. I highly recommend to anyone who wants a little fun with this game, though be very careful with the upgrades at the later levels can be really daunting. 

Pros:
+excellent mix of tower defense mode and action
+combining traps and combat skills
+ level design
+ price

Objection:
- in each mission, you have to reassemble a set of traps and weapons

author: {'steamid': '76561198025478065', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 1905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1905, 'last_played': 1596208377}
review:
Je n'aime gu√®re les tower defense, mais Orcs Must Die! est une exception.
C'est un jeu tr√®s sympathique o√π il faut poser des pi√®ges pour stopper des hordes d'orcs. Mais on est plus qu'encourag√© √† participer au combat avec diff√©rents sorts et anneaux magiques mis √† disposition.
Il y a une bonne vari√©t√© de pi√®ges et de sorts et les niveaux sont souvent assez diff√©rents pour que ne puisse pas utiliser toujours la m√™me strat√©gie. Cependant, tous les pi√®ges ne sont pas √©gaux et j'avais tendance √† un peu toujours utiliser les m√™mes.

La plupart du temps les orcs (et autres vari√©t√©s de monstres dont des volants) viennent de deux ou plusieurs directions √† la fois, ce qui implique qu'il faille g√©rer en temps r√©el les flots d'ennemis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392798165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1678703598}
review: Played this game once again after a kind friend of mine gifted me on Steam. And it was a nostalgia trip that I really loved having. Orcs Must Die is a game that you can always get creative on and try different ways of your tower defense strategies. There is not a perfect way of playing this game, the traps and weapons on this game gives you an insane flexibility, I genuinely can play this game any time I'm bored and have fun with it. And with it's good flexibility and nice humouristic traits and art within the game, I can happily tell that this game backs everything up it has with a good difficulty as well. First difficulty type where you can only get 2 skulls is obviously easy and for learning basics mostly, but pushing your limits with harder difficulties and trying new methods for levels is actually possible. And I'd like to mention the maps out of Classic Mode where it's way too harder than usual. And game actually rewards your effort nicely by rewarding you with skulls that allows you to upgrade certain traps and weapons. Don't take the fact that it's a relatively old game lightly, it still packs a nice amount of punch and joy to play. The only bad thing about is that it's probably losing it's flavour with time since it becomes repetitive after pushing your limits over and over, but that's where the second game comes in! So, I genuinely advice you to buy and try this relatively cheap game, you won't be dissatisfied!

review:
"Slice them, burn them, skewer them, and launch them - no matter how you get it done, orcs must die in this fantasy action-strategy game from Robot Entertainment.

As a powerful War Mage with dozens of deadly weapons, spells, and traps at your fingertips, defend twenty-four fortresses from a rampaging mob of beastly enemies, including ogres, hellbats, and of course, a whole bunch of ugly orcs. Battle your enemies through a story-based campaign across multiple difficulty levels, including brutal Nightmare mode!"

review:

Si te gusto "Plants vs Zombies", este te va a fascinar.
Si no te gusto "Plants vs Zombies", este te va a fascinar!

author: {'steamid': '76561199041486494', 'num_games_owned': 1897, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1633489924}
review: Thumbs Way Up. Great game.  I played through most of the campaign in about 6 hours. I only have one level left but I will definitely replay it all over again, I'm having that much fun with it. There isn't much of a story, which works for me, but if you really want your games to have a great story this isn't going to be for you. But the gameplay is addictive you will want to keep playing one more level all night long. It's definitely worth the price but if you can get it on sale then you have no reason to not play it. I can't wait to check out orcs must die 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008332774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 467, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1599076803}
review:
Not a bad TPS Tower Defense game. Even in 2020, it still is quite fun to play and challenging. There are a lot of different traps to choose from, Every level you unlock a new toy to play and kill orcs with.

It lacks some QoL features, like showing from which gate the orcs will start to attack you. Some levels just takes to long to complete. Orc pathfinding is a little bit sketchy. Gets a bit repetitive after a while. So there is that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036581382', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1596744390}
review:
How come those most goofy and friendly-looking games are usually the most frustrating and merciless to the player. Overall rather infuriating experience.
But for sure you can get it for its humor, beginning stories of characters (as it's a trilogy now) and armies of greens to kill nonetheless.
Just because I didn't like it doesn't mean you won't but again it's quite punishing past chapter 1

author: {'steamid': '76561198092043493', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1596679439}
review:
√â um jogo que eu recomendo se voc√™ gosta de tower defense com uma bagagem de carisma bem bacana. 
N√£o cheguei a zerar o jogo porque n√£o sou muito chegado neste estilo de jogo, por√©m cheguei bem pr√≥ximo do final, n√£o zerando apenas porque j√° estava um tanto enjoado do estilo do game e tamb√©m porque n√£o havia coop ( tanto online quanto tela dividida). 
Em termos gr√°ficos o game √© bonito, bem desenhado e lembra bastante uma anima√ß√£o da pixar, onde temos algo bem ao estilo "cartoon"  que agrada at√© os gostos mais refinados. Temos bons efeitos dentro do poss√≠vel, uma variedade bem legal de orcs, e quando digo isso n√£o me refiro aos tipos de inimigos, mas nas apar√™ncias dos orcs base do game, que mesmo sendo inimigo mais b√°sico do game possui diferentes apar√™ncias, dando uma sensa√ß√£o real que estamos lutando contra uma horda e n√£o apenas um monte de "inimigos reciclados". 
A jogabilidade √© boa, sendo muito intuitiva e simples de se aprender. Os controles n√£o s√£o complexos, pois o real desafio est√° na escolha e local que voc√™ vai colocar as armadilhas ( algo normal para tower defense). Se voc√™ montar armadilhas em lugares ruins e n√£o estudar o ambiente vai se dar mal! isso aqui n√£o √© um hack and slash, mas um jogo que onde voc√™ precisa usar um m√≠nimo do seu c√©rebro, caso contr√°rio n√£o vai conseguir passar nem do primeiro ato! 
Quanto a hist√≥ria e carisma do game eu devo admitir: n√£o esperava algo t√£o bacana, e mesmo n√£o sendo uma hist√≥ria √≥tima, ainda sim √© "legal" dentro do estilo que o jogo oferece. O que mais segura nossa aten√ß√£o √© o protagonista, que sempre faz piadas aleat√≥rias a todo o momento, e nada t√£o for√ßado, pois s√£o piadinhas engra√ßadas at√©. √ìbvio que n√£o podemos comparar a hist√≥ria com um RPG da vida n√©??? 
O meu √∫nico ponto negativo vai para o inexistente multiplayer do jogo. A tem√°tica de orcs must die poderia, FACILMENTE, ter um coop online, porque convenhamos: N√£o √© muito bom jogar um game deste estilo sozinho, mesmo se voc√™ gostar. 
Enfim, orcs must die √© um game bacaninha, leve e barato. Que mesmo sendo curto e n√£o t√£o profundo ainda sim vai te arrancar um sorriso do rosto. Eu recomendo bastante para quem √© mais "forever alone" e curte um tower defense.

Really really fun game in the Tower defense style of game.
Fun and addictive, just a perfect game for short gaming  sessions. Pity they didn't implement any multiplayer mode unlike OMD2.  Later stages get quite difficult. Must buy for any action game lover anyway!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078654394', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1703451746}
review:
Having finally gotten every achievement in the game, i can list some stuff about the game, and some cool stuff about it

[h1] Cool stuff [/h1]
The game is simple and has 3 difficulty levels depending on how easy/hard you find it

Its not super pricy for how much content it gives (29 levels)

Diversity in what kind of defences you want (alot of traps and weapons)

If you own this game and buy the second, you gain even more levels as extra content

[h1] Your 3 best friends when you play [/h1]
Steel Weaver, using this weaver will allow you to buff up your guardians and traps to insane levels, and gain even more money from them.

Paladin Guardian, This guy can take alot of punishment for a relatively low cost, and with Steel Weaver, you can get regeneration and stun added.

Swinging Mace, If your enemy isnt an ogre, chances are this thing will 1shot it with ease, pair it with some tar and basically nothing stands a chance.

[h1] Overall i would highly recommend this game, or at the very least the second one since it improves on EVERYTHING [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198137284043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 757, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1595853552}
review:
It's a pretty good Tower Defense game, but more the kind of game where your constructions don't do all the work, you have to kill alot of enemies yourself. This one has a lot of maps where you can easily force enemies to move a single direction and kill them all easily from there, but some maps where the enemies come from multiple directions. Overall this one is the better singleplayer experience, since the levels are designed for one player.

Time to finish: 6,8 hours

review:
Orcs Must Die is an awesome tower defense game where you take a major role in repelling incoming orcs by shooting them with your blunderbuss while you buy time for your defenses.
Orcs Must Die 2 is definitely better though, since it offers more enemies, more weapons, more towers, and even co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198963920547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1594514272}
review:
level design: 10/10 the map design is amazing and really tests the players skill
difficulty: 7/10 the reason i gave it a 7 because you can literally beat the game without using any traps and in higher round you can literally do nothing and let the traps do your job
story: 8/10 the reason i gave it a 8 because the story really fits a game like orcs must die plus it fits the simple concept of orcs must die i would have given it a 10/10 if the story was more action packed
graphics: 10/10 honestly the graphics are very optimized and gives a cartoony felling to the game which is unique to a game with gore
traps: 6/10 as much as i like the concept of the traps and how they look and feel and how they help the atmosphere interns of gameplay i dont need to move

 50/50: i dont need to explain why i gave this game a 50/50 if you want to know why play the game 

do you recommend playing the game?: yes

review: Orcs Must Die embellishes your devious side, encouraging you to devise clever ways of fulfilling the command of the title. For the not-so-clever, mowing down invaders with an automatic crossbow is also a great time. Whatever your approach, an orc's pain is your gain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075640742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3519, 'last_played': 1593791948}
review:
An excellent game that stands the test of time. I've played almost every level on every difficulty, and I am not usually one to try and 100% video games. There are so many different ways to approach levels if you are creative. 

I would note, while this game is controller compatible, you're going to have a bad time on nightmare if you're not use a keyboard and mouse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040952603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 837, 'last_played': 1593468213}
review:
Grade: 7/10
Recommendation: Would definitely recommend
On-sale recommendation: There is no reason not buy this game

This game is the basis on which the sequel that me and my best friend have sunk a lot of time in. Having played the sequel first it was fun to see play the work on which it builds.

This game has a lot of fun features and is i.m.o. a great "first-person-horde-tower-defense game". It has some fun features which allow the player to go for either the player doing most of the work, the traps doing most of the work or a nice mix of both.

It has good level design and most allow you to have full creative freedom on how you play the game. the levels which do not allow you to do this at first I despised because I was very rigid in my way of doing things. However, this "railroading" forces you to think outside the box and had really given this game a metric ton of replayabillity. 

On replayabillity, the core gamepay is fairly short. Having said that, I have only finished the game in my own playstyle, but with scores deciding the amount of base game upgrade points, the nightmare mode adding more upgrade points and the weavers adding a lot of destinct playstyles I could play through the entire game atleast two more times before I would have to actually think about new ways to play.



Thank you for reading and I scincerely hope you get as much enjoyment out of this little game (and the franchise) as I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373924597', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1593380756}
review:
Just take a look at the overwhelming reviews and you will quickly realize you didn't need my extra 'thumbs-up' to understand this game is awesome! 
This being said, and the only reason why I am adding my grain of salt here, is that many TD games are adding some first-person/third-person shooter elements to their gameplay.
But if you expect the same here, keep in mind this is really an FPS game and not so much a Tower Defense. Even the many (and fun) traps you can build along the way are mostly secondary accessories only there to help your main first-shooter character.
As such, this game shall be even more appealing to the so many FPS players out there. But not so much for the old farts like me who've never liked FPS games and really s**k at it.
So as long as you know what you are walking into and like this type of games, you will for sure love this one! The game runs solid. The graphics have passed the test of time. And the omnipresent humor will guarantee you many hours of energetic shooting with a very large grin on your face!  Well...just like an Orc, really! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034303835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 3866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3866, 'last_played': 1485542939}
review:
[i]Orcs Must Die ![/i] est un tower defense dans lequel vous allez devoir prot√©ger votre donjon en repoussant les vagues ennemies de monstres, que cela soit √† l'aide de diff√©rents pi√®ges mortels mais √©galement gr√¢ce aux capacit√©s magiques de votre h√©ros.

Si ce jeu semble √™tre assez classique, il se d√©marque de la concurrence par son ambiance loufoque totalement assum√©e qui vous fera souvent sourire. C'est ainsi un r√©gal de pr√©parer ses pi√®ges en d√©but de partie puis d'encha√Æner les vagues en tranchant, en tailladant, en br√ªlant, en d√©coupant et en d√©membrant les peaux-vertes, ce qui fait que l'on ne voit pas le temps passer dans ce jeu tr√®s addictif. 

Il faut aussi mettre en avant que les pi√®ges et les ennemis sont suffisamment vari√©s pour √©viter de se lasser rapidement. De plus, le mode cauchemar donne envie de rejouer et de refaire les niveaux pour obtenir les 3 cr√¢nes √† chaque fois, ce qui donne √† l'ensemble une dur√©e de vie respectable. Les graphismes "cartoon" sont assez plaisants et collent parfaitement √† la l√©g√®ret√© de ce titre, √©dulcorant ainsi les violences inflig√©es √† vos adversaires. Enfin, on pourra juste reprocher l'absence du multijoueur qui en contrariera probablement un certain nombre d'entre vous mais cela reste un petit d√©faut tant le plaisir est √©norme en solo.

[i]Orcs Must Die ![/i] s'affirme donc comme un tower defense incontournable tellement il est addictif et amusant gr√¢ce √† son ambiance loufoque et d√©cal√©e. Il est donc √† acheter les yeux ferm√©s, d'autant que le prix est ridicule (1‚Ç¨ en promo) donc foncez sans h√©siter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355018521', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1577795030}
review: This is kind of like a 3rd person tower defense; you can place traps and summon a few minions to help defend, and you get waves of enemies who you need to keep away from an objective, which you can do with a variety of weapons and spells, some of which are rather standard, like a sword or crossbow, some of them require careful planning to be useful like pre-placed teleportation pads and a pushing spell which sends targets flying in a moderately sized cone. There are often natural hazards on maps such as pits to fall in, and you'll also see enemies come from different directions sometimes. It also has a wide range of invading monsters which include faster ones, slow tough ones, and even some that use weapons similar to yours. It's good as a strategic game with a fair amount of humor thrown in, but that's about all there is to it, beyond trying for achievements if you're very skilled at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000901647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1617, 'last_played': 1589896941}
review: Brilliant game, high replay value (return to completed levels for perfect scores/higher difficulty). Can also replay whole game with friend/partner for a whole new experience. 10/10 for this and its sequel which is more of the same with some improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042358327', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1589764659}
review:
I've been a big fan of the Orcs Must Die series since a friend introduced it to me just before OMD2 came out, so I had picked this one up when it was on sale. But before I got around to beating this game the sequel came out and I began playing that instead, because who wouldn't want to slay orcs with a buddy?

Anyways now that I've had the urge to play the series again, I went back and started from the beginning. After completing WarMage (and just getting started on Nightmare mode) I feel it's as good a time as any to drop a little review. 

This game is pure fun. Even after being almost a decade old at this point, the game has aged incredibly well, and visually has not suffered (thanks to the game going for a more cartoony approach, rather than realism). The first few levels are very basic and the trap selection is limited, but that helps train you on the core of the game, as well as improving your aim and non-trap orc killing ability (which you will need in some of the later levels). The game quickly starts ramping up in the challenge factor, and requires you to use your knowledge on how traps interact with each-other to create the perfect orc-slaying machines. The game has a ton of replay value, either through trying out new traps on old levels to unlock missed skulls or for new highscores, or for testing your skills at a more fast paced nightmare mode, giving you little to no time to set up traps before the hoard is upon you. Though it is a fairly simple story, the storybook-like cutscenes are nice to see after each act, and our main protagonist Maximilian  always provides some good chuckles while playing, and his voice actor did a perfect job in nailing the cocky underdog that he is.

All in all, this is a fantastic little indie tower defense TPS and I highly encourage you to pick this one up if you ever see it on sale, as it is just as fun to play as its sequel. I'm looking forward to OMD3 when it releases on Steam after its timed exclusive period on the Stadia is done, and all in all thrilled to see that series is continuing after some rocky times that Robot Entertainment hit over the last couple years.
