author: {'steamid': '76561197982808320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1597562846}
review:
This game surprises me. I was caught off guard by how fun it is. I kind of threw it off based on my initial impressions of the screenshots. I didn't really know much about it. The GUI looking like something out of world of warcraft like a power set bar tray, in my opinion the only downside of the design. I get its functionality. It takes getting use to selecting a load out on every level. My initial impression is the difficulty feeling very easy. I could see myself getting more advanced. But then again i'm only about 6 levels in and I have not played the whole game yet. I can understand the appeal. I have more time to play this game but I can recommend as it's fun!

Also, the music is great. If you can play this game at full loud volume then it makes you feel immersed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095041903', 'num_games_owned': 787, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1588548435}
review:
Simple Action Strategy fun. Can't believe it took me this long to get this. Performances are done well, graphics are that nice style of cartoony that makes it light hearted enough to not raise alarms for paranoid parents, while being gory enough to make shooting an orc in the face with a flaming crossbow bolt satisfying.

The balance between action and tower defense gameplay is also pretty perfectly handled, with switching between the two on the fly being fast and easy, and having enough depth with both to make them enjoyable. Both are fun to do init of themselves, but the focus is clear that they depend on one another to shine as both would be simplistic by themselves, but together they hit the sweet spot of not being too simple but not overwhelming to juggle both.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126688912', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2734, 'last_played': 1590126476}
review:
[b]Orcs Must Die est un jeu d√©fouloir de type tower defense o√π vous jouez le stagiaire du ma√Ætre protecteur des failles qui emp√™chait les orcs de passer et de tout ravager. Malheureusement d√©c√©d√© suite √† un accident domestique, c'est √† vous de jouer son r√¥le. Vous devrez donc bloquer les orcs avant qu'ils ne p√©n√®trent dans le portail. Vous disposez pour cela de pi√®ges, d'armes et de sorts en tout genre.[/b]

Un niveau se passe en trois manches. Vous commencez avec des jetons que vous pouvez utiliser pour acheter des pi√®ges avant que les orcs n'arrivent. D√®s qu'ils pointent le bout de leur affreux nez, c'est √† vous de jouer. Chaque orc tu√© vous fait gagner des jetons que vous pouvez investir dans des pi√®ges entre les manches.

Le gameplay est vraiment amusant et bien fait, les niveaux sont de plus en plus difficiles avec de nombreuses failles √† prot√©ger et plusieurs passages √† surveiller. Le jeu n'est pas du tout redondant, au contraire. Plus on grimpe les niveaux, plus on gagne de pi√®ges. Il est uniquement regrettable de ne pas avoir de mode multijoueur, ce qui aurait √©t√© encore plus amusant.

Graphiquement le jeu est tr√®s beau bien que mal optimis√©, avec parfois quelques ralentissements assez p√©nibles. Au niveau de la bande sonore rien √† dire, les musiques sont tr√®s bien et colle parfaitement au th√®me du jeu.

[b]Pour terminer, je vous recommande Orcs Must Die. Si vous souhaitez vous d√©fouler, c'est votre jeu ! Petite pens√©e aux chasseurs de succ√®s car certains succ√®s requi√®rent pour √™tre d√©verrouill√©s de finir le jeu en mode cauchemar, le mode le plus difficile du jeu. Bonne chance ![/b]

[i]Merci d'avoir lu mon √©valuation.[/i]

review:
Aunque ya tiene sus a√±itos, este juego envejecer√° muy bien...

Siempre me han gustado los juegos tipo Tower Defense. Y que este tenga variedad en sus trampas, variedad en las mejoras y habilidades, y ese humor tan particular para contar la historia lo hace un obligatorio en nuestra biblioteca para esos momentos en los que tienes unos minutos libres y no quieres liarte con algo mucho m√°s profundo.

En muchos mapas la fase t√°ctica ser√° un desaf√≠o. Y el nivel DIFICIL es una aut√©ntica locura.

Muy recomendable para iniciarte en esta saga antes de meterte con la segunda parte (que adem√°s tiene coop).

author: {'steamid': '76561198326103085', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 2416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1472, 'last_played': 1663326932}
review:
Many orcs have died in making of this review. 

[h1]Pros/Cons:[/h1]
[b]Pros:[/b]
[b][+][/b] The story follows a general tone of the artstyle and doesn't take itself too seriously. It's quite light-hearted which IMO serves it well as a de-stressor game [i](That's at least how I use it!)[/i].
[b][+][/b] Fun gameplay, requires a bit of thinking but also some twitch reactions and juggling of multiple tasks. 
[b][+][/b] Very nice, slick cartoony graphics, and it's all holding up extremely well!
[b][+][/b] Very, very few bugs. I had one, specifically, and it wasn't unsolvable or particularly game-breaking: It was an ogre who fell into a pool of strange, blue, presumably acidic liquid, and refused to die. I just had to put him out of his misery with my crossbow, honestly, no biggie. 
[b][+][/b] You will want to go back to previous levels and try to get the 5/5 Skull result again, and again, and again. 
[b][+][/b] Achievement hunting is actually extremely fun in this game! 
[b][+][/b] Plethora of guides and videos to help you along the way in case you get stuck.
- - -
[b]Cons:[/b]
[b][-][/b] AFAIK there is no way to tell which gate opens first, so you might just wanna start a level and then restart quickly so you can prepare properly. This is, however, a huge issue on later multi-gate levels, especially if some gates open late into the round. 
[b][-][/b] No area unit pathing indicators, same issue as with the above.
[b][-][/b] Some levels can feel like a chore or impossible without later traps or some really out of the box thinking and quick timing. The latter part isn't necessarily the issue, but I do consider the former to be.
[b][-][/b] Some levels on Nightmare can only be beaten with one or two very specific tactics at most, pigeonhole-ing you into a type of gameplay you do not want to experience or are not a fan of. 
[b][-][/b] Some of the builds are super niche, and will hardly be enjoyable on half of the maps, if not more. Additionally, some of the Weavers are a bit underwhelming as well, and extremely inconsistent. The general critique here is that it can feel a lot more like a timed puzzle on occasion rather than a tower defense game where you have multiple choices on how to go about winning the game.
[b][-][/b] No Skull respec. Very frustrating especially when coupled with the previous two points.
[b][-][/b] DLCs are quite underwhelming.



[h1]Disclaimer:[/h1]
I got this product for free from a friend, who knew it was on my wishlist and bought it as a gift at a discount. This may affect my enjoyment of the game and, given that I enjoyed it, made said enjoyment bigger. Please purchase at your own discretion, and only if you really enjoy the positives and can roll with the negatives.

review:
For Blood and Glory, tis is a fun Orcs Slaying game, your trap hit em so hard they explodes into pieces, an "RPG" action TD game, Trap placement is important for this kind of game tho, the character attacking animation is lacking...but I think the trap solved that problem in this type of game

Game is hard AF
For some reason, this kind of game always makes me go for 100% perfection even for the 1st playing the new stage...but in reality, it never goes according to your plan

Almost make it to 10 hours but still, Yet to finish the game

Oh you know what...If you like what you saw....consider trying Dungeon Warfare...before this, this Dev earn my money cuz i don't know Dungeon Warfare Exist, 

1) You cannot "Reset Upgrades" in this game...like WHY? WE PAID FOR THIS !!! You can however, in dungeon warfare

2) Why even bother to "Babysit " your traps like this game when you don't have to? This game makes you run around from point A to point B cuz your trap are not working as planned (but in dungeon warfare, you just observe and put stuff down

3) Hack n slash with a sword is bad...in this game, you don't want to go up close combat even if you're a skillful player

4) Most of the time you think you had the "perfect plan" after 1 /2 tries, but Baaaam ,SURPRISED ATTACK, you got Flying enemies ( game don't, can't tell you which way the enemy gonna come next, or WHAT, WHO is coming

review: I love this game and the freedom it gives you in creating a defense for a given level. The story is pretty simple but it's a good enough reason to go through each level. The real fin in this game is being able to wall off, trap up, and fill each level with damage traps, obstacles, and mercenaries. Choosing your placement and distancing are the perfect skill ceiling for a game like this. If you like tower defense games, this is a must play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994336693', 'num_games_owned': 2306, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1915, 'last_played': 1585099489}
review:
As a steadfast believer in turtling and applying my cowardly passive-aggressive personality into video games, I love and hate Orcs Must Die!. I love it because it is a tower defense game at its core that provides you with some very creative ways to murder wave after wave of those poor orcses, depending on how devious your little mind is. But I hate Orcs Must Die! because it thrusts me into third person where I can be physically assaulted and mangled by said orcs. No longer am I a disembodied omniscient being that hovers overhead, sedately plopping down traps and yawning at my immunity from harm. Now I am stuck inside the body of our idiot brotagonist, the War Mage, casting my spells and shooting my crossbow, getting lost in my own halls, and occasionally falling into my own acid pit. What is THIS? A bloody action game that requires map and spatial awareness?! Goodness, this isn't how it's supposed to be! Draw the curtain aside and what do you have? A mere mortal! But one forged with ice and steel and fire in their veins and the battle fervor of a headless chicken in their hearts! To me, orcs! To your demise and doom, as I flee and hide behind my archers and knights! These orcs must die!

Ok so: it's a really fun TD game that throws you in the middle of the orc throng in third person gory glory. An oldie but goodie.

[h1] 8 / 10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198015581270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1589640510}
review:
This must be one of my favourite Tower Defense games of all time. So much fun and humour, the level design is excellent. Some levels are easy, some are hard, but always a challenge.

It's a first person tower defense game, you will be building towers, traps and some fighting from yourself helps.

Yes, it's an older game from some years ago. Just buy it when it's on sale and if you love tower defense games, you'll easily get 10 hours of fun out of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019028025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6496, 'last_played': 1486444249}
review:
This is a great game! I dismissed it original due to the cartoon-ish look, but after it went on sale, I said, "why not?!?!" and sure glad i did.  It's the game that got me started on 100% achievement hunt and really liking interactive tower defense games.  Heck, then I did the same for Orcs Must Die 2! 

Tip: Learn about the combos.  Game is much harder to get achievements till you learn the combo system... huge difference.  If like me, play it without learning it, beat the game, then learn about combos, re-beat the game for 100% achievements! Fun twice...

review: Pretty fun. I don't really like the main character but it makes sense for the story and all. It's not your usual Tower Defence, but it is still one. TD is a genre i like and this game is worth it's price. I've seem many TDs that sucked, this is not one of them for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064058799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1580847071}
review:
Tower Defense Strategy, meets over-the-shoulder shooter with a cartoony flair and excellent humor. Alter the orcs path with barricades then kill them with the help of the guardians of the order, your traps, and your trusty magic crossbow. Let the Gibs fly!

DLC adds additional equipment and traps but is in no way required to excel at the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074709579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1577349328}
review: This game is just a bunch of fun, orc killing goodness. There is a surprising level of complexity to the game, especially in the later levels, and there are often multiple ways to attack a level. Does the games art style and cheesy dialogue seem old fashioned? Well, it's from the early 2000's. If ya don't like playing more active tower defense games, than this probably isn't for you. But if you want a game that has plenty of fun mechanics, a great selection of traps, and a lovable protagonist, this game is for you. And oh yeah, the cheap price more than validates the game play. Would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013321186', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2910, 'last_played': 1574484452}
review:
Orcs Must Die + DLC Review

When Orcs Must Die came in 2011 it was like watching a Saturday morning cartoon at times with orcs asking ‚ÄúCan I be the Good guy now ?,‚Äù and them being trick to go into my ACME traps with a loud SIGN that says BOOM. It was a time when tower defense games really became extremely popular among smartphones and tablets. Orcs Must Die gave a new spin on it by putting you right in the middle of it with a glorious dose of goofy humour and cartoony visuals. It felt unique while at the same time keeping all the hooks of a tower defense game.

Replaying it again just to review it and rediscover the games that was kept in my digital shelf, I was once more reminded of the joy of playing this quirky game during my Uni days from Robot entertainment. As mentioned earlier, at its core Orcs Must Die is a tower defense game. You the apprentice of a mage must build traps to stop the orcs from progressing further and entering the rift gate that will bring harm to the world. Stilted cartoony images and a rather funny but monotone narration by the mage tells the apprentice funny ordeal in stopping the horde. The story is nothing to write home about but does the job. The humor elevates that experience somewhat.  The game was different at the time due to the third person action combat, making you feel like you were right there planning and battling the horde with your tools and wits. 

The level design for each of the stages was really awesome and inventive with hallways and giant pits of acid or lava next to it, stairs littered with logs at specific strategic location that can be shot at precisely the right time to create carnage and mayhem. The game often start with you picking your traps and weapon of choice. Your options are limited to 9 slots with the first slot being your trusty bow. The traps and tools, the main gist of the game was a lot of fun to mess around with to create your elaborate death mincer. The traps include the tar trap which are your staple slow down trap types, while your spike trap and arrow walls does the job of clearing the horde. Other such traps include creating barricades to make the flow go differently thus funneling the orcs to their impending doom. Guardians such as archer and paladins can be used to thin the horde. Place strategically spore mushrooms can turn the tide of battle converting huge ogres and other enemies as allies. The dlc addition of the floor scorcher trap was so much fun to use as they can burn and can be used as a sort of spring to push the enemies back that I kept using it for most of the stages. Enemies are varied and interesting with unique cartoony design that highlight the game own brand of goofy humour. Sometimes the enemies force you to change tactics and experiment with different traps in order to get the intended outcome.  An example would be the gnoll hunter goes after your guardians which can be very costly as the enemies wave‚Äôs progress. 

The graphics although nothing to shout about was great. The bug eye look of orcs and how they are being massacred looked like something from a bugs bunny cartoon. Their goofy massacred bodies explode or get impaled with unique hilarious death animations. The bright colours only highlight the cartoony elements. Sound design and narration makes all those things become a complete package of a Saturday morning cartoon with goofy one liners from the apprentice and the orcs. Not all the jokes land but it did manage to make me laugh at times.  At the end of the day, Orcs must Die is a game with a lot of fun and have to thank the developers for making an entertaining and smart tower defense game. 

Out of 10

Gameplay and Fun ‚Äì 8 It‚Äôs a blast planning and watching it all work while you mow down orcs with your trusty bow
Graphics ‚Äì 7 Some goofy visuals brings memories of old cartoons 
Sound ‚Äì 7 Entertaining voicework and funny narration 
Story ‚Äì 6 not the greatest but then again a game like this. Is all about the gameplay and the fun factor

author: {'steamid': '76561197970712072', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1560643011}
review:
I highly recommend to folks who like the idea of tower defense games but have never been able to get into the overly serious or overly stripped down iterations seen elsewhere and just want a light, fun, single player tower defense game with a controllable main character and the barest trappings of a story line to keep the levels moving. Each mission can be easily completed in anything from 10-20 minutes and the soft cartoon graphics ensure the game can be run on almost any system.

The premise of tower defense games is pretty simple: the computer sends wave after wave of AI enemies at you and you have to lay down a gauntlet of traps before the reach their objective, which in this case are portals that bridge magic between another realm and the human world. Lay down a solid set of overlapping traps and you might not even have to lift a finger during the course of the level. Use the incorrect mix and you're scrambling to limit the damage before the next wave even begins.

OMD adds some spice into the mix by allowing you to control a playable character from an over the shoulder perspective and participate in the battle, activate pre-placed traps, use "weavers" which provide a sort of "skill tree" with upgrades that can be purchased using money from, what else, killing orcs.

The game was a legitimate blast and I would recommend, looks like it was a bit of a sleeper hit, likely on sale for a handful of bucks on Steam and elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061216994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1640719259}
review:
Orcs must die is a great title and good fun to play, killing Orcs with either traps or personal combat. If you enjoy both Tower Defense and shooter games, perhaps this mix is right up your alley. There are many possible combinations and options, so explore and find what works for you.

Though it is a great game, it does seem the original engine did not age well on steam. Sometimes Orcs clip, fly through the air or get stuck. Worse, sometimes they get to walk past your barricades. It does not make the game unplayable, but it can frustrating at times. 

That being said, it is still a game worth a good couple of hours of fun. You can also play the original levels in Orcs Must Die 2 if you have both. I would recommend picking it up when its on sale and checking out Orcs Must Die 2 at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043782587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 598, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1572928121}
review:
This game is jawsome. I mean, you can see that it was a budget title at a time... AA level? A level? B level? Whatever. It was sorta before indie boom?

But man.

Orcs explode into gibbities.

Is great.

One heck of a tower defence combination with third person shooter. Set up traps, set up guardians that you can upgrade in a level to regenerate health. Watch ogres get thrown into lava through half of a level. Shoot a bit. Thankfully, crossbow loses accuaricy as you shoot so you don't just hold down M1 and spam. No, you come close and spam. UGH. Well, in reality you after a while set up enough traps that you can just relax and watch it all destroy the orcs, cute furry wolves aside who rush in to cuddle you and guardians. I love that. Wolves too. Well, fiiine, "gnolls".

And it comes with awesome music. Well, not always awesome but memoriable pieces are super memoriable and epic. Too bad that the game is also a bit unbalanced when it comes to trap. Few traps have no situations where they are better than others. It even gets funny where Nightmare difficulty gets easy after a while because you get to do the meta trap placement. You can also abuse the fact that if you block the alternative path with the barricades, then orcs will choose another path only if they get close to it. It sure can lead to some really slow-paced stretched out waves.

The game may not be too long but it's gold while it lasts. You get new toys in every single new level. What a joy.

Protip: arrows that archers shoots can be blocked by pretty much everything. Including traps, you and other archers. So that means you can't just slap multiple lines of archers or expect the line to go hyper-Legolas in parallel. lel.

Oh, and don't use the explosive poison potions from DLCs until you get to Act 2, okay?

And on top of that the game features the only good orcs portrayal in the multiverse of media market, all of it, from one horizon to another. They run around, yell for mommy, complain about allergy to blades, have middle-life crisis. This is what World of Warcraft should have been. And Warcraft 3. And Warchammer. And Warcraft 2 as well. And Warcraft: Orcs vs Humans. Not to mention that anytime I wanted to Google something about this game, I would start typing "Orcs vs Humans" which means that it can easily replace Warcraft and no one will miss anything. Of course sometimes I would type "Ghouls vs Humans". What a rad WAD for Skulltag (HAI CARNIE!). It was my first ever class-team-based multiplayer FPS, way before TF2. Just don't tell any person who rants about how arena were murdered by kids on Internet about it. After all, their minds will explode over fact that such respectable old-school community like Doom one was spending all their days playing something class-team-based that doesn't even have rocketjump or whatever was that Quake straferunjumpsadfs instead of pwning noobs in arenas duels.

Ok, last thing. Giving no setup time for Nightmare difficulty kinda sucks, yo! It's not that bad however. Having 5 skull requirement that limits time you have to spend on a level seems fine until you find out that setup time counts toward wasted time too, ughuuuu.

review: After years of being dormant in my inventory, I played for half an hour. Few levels were ok, but it didn't hold my interest. With there being newer renditions of this game, this is probably not really the one you'd want to go for. But if you enjoy the idea of 3D tower defense and having a character to control during the waves, then this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020313592', 'num_games_owned': 984, 'num_reviews': 574, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1571705223}
review:
[h1] Overview [/h1]
[b]Orcs Must Die![/b] (OMD) is a single-player Tower Defense / Third Person Shooter hybrid developed by [i]Robot Entertainment[/i], and narrates of the endless battle between the Breach Guardians and endless Orc armies, the latter determined to conquer and lay waste to the kingdoms of Earth from another dimension. In this title, players will impersonate one of the silliest and apparently least capable War Mages, in a desperate attempt to repel now better-organized Orc attacks on the fortresses of the Order. 

[b]One of the main reasons OMD is an excellent title lays in the way it successfully blends the two significantly different genres of TPS and Tower Defense[/b], offering equal parts exciting action and defensive strategy as baselines of its gameplay. In each of the proposed 24 levels, [b]players will find themselves elaborating tactics based on which types of traps work best in that specific structure, considering not only layout, but also environmental hazards and static machinery[/b] already present by default. 

[b]There are many ways to effectively overcome a level, limited only by individual creativity[/b] - though some are much more efficient than others. The presence of [b]trap upgrading systems rewarding perfect completions, three different skill trees granting varied passive abilities, and a great variety of traps and weapons[/b], increase the variety and complexity of gameplay. other than that, the [b]action is great to look at, with dozens of orcs flying around and dying in the most diverse ways, while the TPS part keeps players involved[/b] and an active part in how every level plays out.

This being said, OMD has [b]some flaws as well: the most prominent lays in balancing issues, with several traps being at best situational or at worst completely useless[/b], while a select number of them are the "best" ones players will find themselves using most of the time, because they are just better in most aspects. Secondly, [b]the fact Nightmare difficulty doesn't give any strategy time to elaborate a tactic, but instead forces players into rushing[/b], throwing at them hordes the second every level begins, is a [b]really bad game design choice that has no place in the Tower Defense genre[/b], where strategy and planning always come first before action. Lastly, having a Par Time criteria for having a perfect clear on a level again is something out of place for this genre as it forces players, again, to rush and complete levels in the least time possible, else risking being out of Par.

[b]Overall, OMD is an excellent, involving, fun tower defense hybrid[/b] that nails the most important gameplay components of both genres almost flawlessly, resulting in a quality title fans of both shooters and tower defense will love. [b]Offering around 12-14 hours of content to clear everything on Normal + Nightmare, excellent quality, the current price of 10‚Ç¨ is absolutely a steal and I can recommend getting this game full price.[/b]

[h1]Rating:[/h1]
[b]Very Good[/b]

[quote]Liked this review, and want to see more of the same quality? Check out [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39323490]Tamaster's Review Archive[/url] to see all my Reviews in a single, convenient location.[/quote]

[h1] Pros & Cons [/h1]

üîµ [b] Pros [/b]
+ Perfect blend of Tower Defense and TPS, offering exciting action and tactical depth at the same time.
+ Great variety of traps, machinery, weapons and passive skills to discover, upgrade and utilize on the field.
+ Well diversified enemies, each with its own strengths and weaknesses to exploit.
+ Excellent content and quality value for the current price.
+ Fluid action with satisfying physics based gore and ragdolls, looking good for a 2011 game.

üî¥ [b] Cons [/b]
- Some balance problems with traps and passives, some being too strong, while others almost useless.
- Lack of strategy time on Nightmare difficulty and Par Time to achieve a perfect clear are bad game design choices.


[h1] In-Depth Breakdown [/h1]

üéÆ [b]Gameplay Analysis [/b]
The gameplay of Orcs Must Die is divided into Planning, Combat and Character Management.

[b]Planning[/b] is the most important phase of any level, and consists first in selecting which traps to carry in your Spellbook and use in the level: the slots are limited, so not all traps can be deployed in a single stage, selecting the right ones for the current layout is fundamental, considering also cost, initial resources, number of enemy gates, and eventually other factors. Next up, once unlocked, players are able to select one of three passive skill-trees, each specializing in different features, such as empowering traps or instead the player itself, with powerful bonuses, altering sometimes considerably how machinery, traps and skills work. On Normal and Easy difficulties, Planning phase has unlimited time and there are several during the course of a level, to sell traps, change layouts, and fine-tuning the formation. On Nightmare instead, this part is completely removed, forcing players to deploy traps and elaborate a strategy while enemies are already coming.

[b]Combat[/b] focuses equally on player skill and trap efficiency to overcome a level, this is especially true on Nightmare difficulty: on one side, well-placed and combined traps will fend off enemies in large part, but sometimes, especially in early waves and higher difficulties, also players will have to do their part, repelling, killing or slowing enemies enough when traps simply cannot muscle all the work yet. Mechanics like headshots, elemental weaknesses and passives empowering player-exclusive skills are all in place to make your Warmage a powerhouse on the field. Your hero can die, and that comes at a penalty on Breach Health, as if several monsters broke through, so staying alive is pretty crucial: don't expect to tank whole hordes yourself unless severely buffed with passives.

[b]Character Management[/b] comes with the already mentioned passives, costing resources to purchase and unable to being refund once approved, empowering either yourself or your deployables. Other than this, at the end of each level Skulls are awarded on a scale of 1 to 5, four based on the remaining Breach Health, while one on Par Time, meaning if players cleared all waves under a certain time limit. These skulls can be used to upgrade deployables and traps, improving their functionality in different ways unique for every trap.

üî© [b] Performance Analysis [/b]
[u]PC Specs: RTX2080Ti, Ryzen 3900X, 32GB RAM DDR4.[/u]
The game is pretty old and should run well even on today's low-end machines without issues. There are no performance, compatibility or stability issues to note.


[h1] Final Thoughts [/h1]
[b]Orcs Must Die[/b] is an overall a very good Tower Defense / TPS hybrid that boasts satisfying gameplay and overall good quality content - some design choices aren't the best but considering the larger picture, it's a solid title fans of both genres will enjoy.

review:
I LOVE THIS GAME!!

It's not for everyone but it's a great Tower Defense game that isn't just setting up defenses but you can also go head on into the fight and attack the Orcs yourself! The levels are definitely challenging and there are 3 different difficulty levels and then an Endless mode. There are upgrades as well for your traps and weapons. 

Give a shot! Maybe you'll find yourself hooked to it like I did. (:

review:
I've have a very limited amount of time to game on weeknights recently, but playing this for even 15 minutes is satisfying, and gives a sense of progression & achievement after completing a level. The "just one more level" feel will test your commitment to routine, I assure you.

I cant recall if I bought this on sale, however I've no regrets if I paid full price. Well worth it. 

(* tips hat in general direction of development team).

author: {'steamid': '76561198015897402', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1564819358}
review:
[b]Orcs Must Die[/b] has a simple premise and great gameplay.

The cross play of FPS and Tower Defense is appealing from the get go. Orcs Must Die also raises the difficulty and complexity quite gradually so that you never get completely frustrated and your options and strategy only get more complex with time.

One of the few things that I didn't like about it is that on levels with multiple entrances there's no way to know in advance where the orcs are coming from, which may lead to you building defenses where they are not needed and that in turn leads to repeating a mission from the very beginning.

However, if you can get past this (or are really good at building quickly while battling orcs) there are almost no other faults to this game. It runs on low specs and the gameplay is smooth. Even though some traps are objectively better than others, there is room for experimenting with different loadouts and general strategies. Worth buying full price

author: {'steamid': '76561198118953946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1691168483}
review: I've played this game for just about 2 hours and I'm TOTALLY HOOKED! This game has got to be the greatest Lost Adventure game secret in video game history. To me this game is TEAM FORTRESS 2 meets TORCHLIGHT 2 in every way except that it's not a team based arena game... but then again.... it kinda is. Just like Team Fortress 2 you defend a "base" against your opponent. This game is a Tower Defense/Arena RPG hybrid.... BRILLIANT. I've had this game on my Wishlist for awhile waiting on the summer sale. I will tell you this... if you like Team Fortress 2 you better get this. I'm just sad it took me 8 years to discover it. Where was the marketing for this game back in 2012 when I busted out $59.99 for Xcom: Enemy Unknown and logged about 150 hours at least. You mean to tell me I could have been going back-and-forth from Enemy Unknown to Orcs Must Die?! This game could have definitely made me cheat on some X-com just a little bit. You know... a little harmless side fling-a-ma-jigger. After about 2 minutes of turning this game on I knew it would was going to be one of my all time faves. And it is! I can't believe how good it is, the kind of game you dream about, wishing someone would do.... and then you realize.... holy shit, this thing is AWESOME!!! ROBOT gets mad props from me on this.... keep it up... maybe we can see a team style "Fortress of Orcs" in the future??? 9.75/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198005681482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2413, 'last_played': 1613093498}
review:
Third person tower defence game of the Tolkien kind.

As far Tower defence games go, this one sticks out by lacking what is generally a staple of such games: Rather than allowing you to channel your enemies through a self build maze, "Orcs must die!" provides the maze for you - leaving you the sole task to fill it with traps. 
And traps there are of all kinds, half of which you will have heard about in some clicheed story or seen them in some random action flick. 
Arrows shooting out the walls? Check. And boy do they send the titular orcs flying.
Burning floor tiles? Check. And any Orc who steps on them begins tiptoing rather rantically.
Spring traps? Oh yes. Check. And by virtue of this being three dimensional, you can watch as the Orc trails through the sky, smashes against the next wall, and the falls into a bottomless pit. Or an acid lake. And if they won't be coerced by liberal traplaying to amend their ways, the Player can always grab two weapons out of their arcane arsenal and get physical himself. Headshots do exist in this game.

Long story short, Orcs must die is an absolute blast. If I had one thing to complain it is that most of the time you do not have the time to actually see your traps do their deadly work, but on the rare occasion you do, watching an Orc step on one of your traps, which sets him on fire, then running around in panic, which triggers the arrow wall, which then sends him carreening onto the spring trap, only for THAT to catapult him across half the level with fire and smoke trailing behind him will induce an earsplitting grin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105998978', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1624984283}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a very enjoyable tower defence game where you, as a character, get to participate in the action. There are many different ways to approach and complete each level, with a myriad of different traps and items to choose from. Once you have completed the main campaign on the standard difficulty you have a chance to go back through it all again but on nightmare mode where enemies are harder to kill and there are fewer lives to lose. While it is a shame that there is no co-op mode in this game, the opportunity for that becomes available in the sequel which is just as good as the first and has even more levels and content to explore.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998531755', 'num_games_owned': 3112, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1559064742}
review:
O jogo √© uma j√≥ia escondida. Vale a pena o seu tempo, especialmente quando voc√™ pode escolher o seu pacote t√£o barato.

Este jogo n√£o parece t√£o divertido como deveria ser. Primeiro, √© o design da masmorra. Os desenvolvedores usaram uma paleta de cores bastante sombria que d√° ao jogo cores escuras desnecess√°rias. Os n√≠veis visualmente s√£o bastante est√©reis, mas funcionais. A quest√£o √© que a est√©tica de um jogo est√° faltando e n√£o √© nada colorida, o que √© uma enorme oportunidade perdida para jogos como este. Outro fator de porque este jogo n√£o √© t√£o agrad√°vel quanto deveria ser √© o AI base de Orks. Eles apenas correm atrav√©s de voc√™ at√© a fenda. Isto torna-se bastante frustrante, em seguida, lidar com v√°rios caminhos que faz o jogo se sentir como uma tarefa, corrida contra o tempo na preven√ß√£o de inimigos de entrar no rift. √â aqui que a ader√™ncia aos jogos de defesa de torres faz com que este jogo sofra. O her√≥i precisa de um pouco de tempo para chegar onde precisa estar. Alguns n√≠veis s√£o at√© mesmo confusos em seu layout. No jogo normal de defesa, voc√™ √© onipresente, pois sua mobilidade √© bastante limitada. Isso faz com que voc√™ corra, persiga e cuide de caminhos em vez de realmente segurar a horda. O jogo teria se beneficiado da IA ‚Äã‚Äãque tentaria despachar o her√≥i primeiro antes de priorizar o rift e excluir os rushes para tipos espec√≠ficos de inimigos.

Al√©m disso, o design de n√≠veis pode se tornar cansativo. √â tudo sobre o novo truque que os desenvolvedores introduzem ou melhor, uma nova arma. Os n√≠veis tamb√©m s√£o fortemente baseados em oportunidades ambientais. Raramente parece que voc√™ pode apenas configurar o que voc√™ gosta e √© melhor adaptar-se ao novo n√≠vel. Enquanto uma mir√≠ade de diferentes abordagens pode funcionar, o jogo ainda tem √™nfase no estilo espec√≠fico atrav√©s dos mapas. Toda a jornada parece mais como "ei, vamos agora tentar essa coisa nova" ao inv√©s de "jogar do seu pr√≥prio jeito".

DLC me pegou de surpresa. Em uma primeira miss√£o, n√£o tive tempo de me preparar e, nas primeiras ondas, vi que ficou muito mais dif√≠cil. Se alguma coisa, isso s√≥ me incomodou, mas eu acho que √© bom para pessoas que querem conte√∫do mais desafiador. Por√©m, √© bastante um pico de dificuldade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085504066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1557548465}
review:
Kia ora!

Orcs Must Die is perfect for casual gaming! Just have fun! Played through the game pretty much in one go. Two sessions with a little sleep in between. The game has good replayability, however I moved straight to OMD 2 instead of playing through nightmare difficulty or tidying up levels.

If you like Tower Defense Games definitely buy it! Oh and by the way the soundtrack is awesome and one track in particular really gets you pumped up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963660521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 1066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1320998400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998038269', 'num_games_owned': 1589, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1557695056}
review:
Well, game is quite a hidden gem. It is worth your time, especially when you can pick its bundle so cheap. 

I will focus on things which are problematic in this game. First of all, game is quite unbalanced. For example, traps which pushes orks away are too powerful. They are dead cheap, have no upgrades. Yet, when you combined with overclocked springs upgrades, it gets insane value. It is just 1000 upgrade to kill Ogres and it is not hard thing to do. In the final mission and wave this was extremely ridiculous as I had put one such trap next to each doorway. Guess what had happened. That's right. All ogres just got killed instantly and I won the game without firing a single shot. Combat tree on the other hand suffers the most as you can't really be everywhere on later levels and its usefulness compared to trap tree is just overall bad. Game is full of upgrade trees and traps of various usefulness and it suffers from general attitude "if it is not PvP content, you don't have to balance it". Game relies too much on headshots, but hit boxes for those are iffy. Crossbow does pitiful damage otherwise and sometimes it becomes highly frustrating.


Then, this game doesn't feel as fun as it should be. The issue is few fold. First, it is dungeon design. Developers used quite grim colour palette which gives game that unnecessary dark colours. Visually levels are quite barren, but functional. The issue is that aesthetics of a game are lacking and it is not colourful at all which is a huge missed opportunity for game such as this. Other factor of why this game is not as enjoyable as it should be is base AI of Orks. They just run through you to the rift. This becomes quite frustrating then dealing with several pathways which makes game feel like a chore, race against the time in preventing enemies from getting into the rift. This is where adherence to tower defence games makes this game suffer. Hero needs quite a bit of time to get to where he needs to be. Some levels are even confusing in their layout. In normal tower defence game, you are omnipresent, in this your mobility is quite limited. It makes you to run, chase and to babysit pathways rather than actually holding the horde. Game would had benefited from AI who would try to dispatch hero first before prioritising rift and excluding rushes to specific enemy types.

In addition, level design can get tiring. It is all about the new gimmick which devs introduce or rather, new weapon. Levels are also heavily based upon environmental opportunities. It rarely feels that you can just set up what you like and it is rather adapting to new level. While myriad of different approaches can work, game still has emphasis on specific style through maps. The whole journey feels more like "hey, lets now try this new thing" rather than "play it your own way" approach.


DLC took me by surprise. In a very first mission I got no time to prepare and in first waves I saw that it got a lot more difficult. If anything, it just annoyed me, but I guess it is fine for people who want more challenging content. Though, it is quite a difficulty spike.


Ah, the last, but not least. This game has no story at all. Well, it technically has, but devs did not play tested their game even once. How do I know it? Story is being told during combat. This results in you being unable to listen and all the dialogue being heavily overshadowed by all the action, explodey noises which you and your traps make. Really, such an annoying rookie mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298824224', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1559047520}

I am currently using the latest computer btw so maybe that's why and not the driver being disable at all.  Such a waste of my $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967291614', 'num_games_owned': 3248, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1555260114}
review:
Ich bin kein Freund von Tower Defense Spielen, Orcs Must Die! √§ndert da auch nichts dran.  Dennoch ist das ein gutes Spiel, was wohl mit daran liegt, dass es sich in 3rd-Person spielt statt Topdown. Was ich sehr gut an dem Spiel finde ist die Komik von Orsc Must Die! die sich aus einem Mischmasch von Grafikstil, der Kommentare der Figuren, der Art der Erz√§hlung und Bilddarstellung √° la Ladebildschirm und damit mitten ins schwarze meines Humors trifft. 

Das Gameplay l√§uft sehr fl√ºssig, soll hei√üen mir f√§llt nichts ein wor√ºber ich auch nur im Ansatz meckern k√∂nnte, der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist ausbalanciert, macht es nicht zu leicht, dass man sich langweilt, macht es im Umkehrschluss nicht zu schwer, dass man das Spiel frustriert beendet. Man gewinnt und man verliert, Punkt. Mit Abschluss des Spiels hat man genug Fallen und Zauber im Repertoire, dass man die Missionen auf die vielf√§lltigsten Weisen erneut l√∂sen kann was Abwechslung ins Spiel bringt, egal ob man den Heighscore versucht, seine f√ºnf Sch√§del zusammen bekommen m√∂chte oder einfach die Orcs fliegen sehen will. Dieses Spiel lohnt sich auf jeden Fall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019727990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3006, 'last_played': 1520432687}
review:
[h1]JC's Games Discount Group[/h1]

[b][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/JCsGamesDiscounts]Click here - and add yourself to JC's Games Discount Group[/url][/b]

This is a brilliant game, and one well worth playing!

I enjoyed the animation, the simplicity and the mild but daft humour throughout.

Personally speaking, I prefer this to Orcs Must Die 2, but each to their own.  This was and is exactly what I wanted in a first person 'tower defence game', without wanting the coop experience that version 2 brings.

The key to winning is using the environment to your advantage, i.e. where there are cauldrons attached to the ceiling, use them!!.... and perfect your aim to get head shots!!

For those of you looking to increase the challenge then aim to complete all the achievements, they're a blast!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 2041, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1551538928}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Orcs Must Die! is a game developed and published by Robot Entertainment

The game offers some nice graphics, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

The game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nonetheless

Orcs Must Die! overall, however, is a fun game to play, yet sometimes repetitive and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is a great tower defence strategy game to play in short bursts!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

review:
great game and it started me off on a journey to kill even more orcs in orcs must die 2..... which i ended up loving also...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960313396', 'num_games_owned': 2, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1549555327}
review:
An action and well polished tower defense.

[h1][b]Performance: 10\10[/b][/h1]

     [b]- Optimization:[/b]  

The game is really optimized, I'm playing it in 3440x1440 at locked 100fps and never experienced an fps drop.

     [b]- Bugs\Glitches:[/b]

Never encountered a single bug or glitch, my 2 playthroughs were flawless.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1647749869
[h1][b]Gameplay: 7\10[/b][/h1]

     [b]- Challenge:[/b]

This game is really challenging, granted you play in the hardest difficulty and try to complete every level with the highest rating (5 Skulls). I had a pretty hard time getting 5 skulls in every level in Nightmare difficulty. I really enjoyed it.

     [b]- Content:[/b]

The story is nothing memorable (you don't play this game for the story), and I completed it in about 10 hours the first time, then another 4 hours to replay it in Nightmare difficulty. I will not play this game again, it would be repetitive, but that's just me. Will surely get OMD 2 though.

     [b]- Controls:[/b]

I'm more of a static dude in Tower Defense games; I much rather put my towers\traps and then sit back and watch how it plays. I'm not an huge fan of this action based gameplay that OMD offers. That being said, if you prefer a more "active" gameplay then this game is really for you.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1647750053
[h1][b]Design: 8.5\10[/b][/h1]

     [b]- Graphics:[/b]

I was really surprised with this one, the graphics are awesome for a 2011 game. Textures, particles effects, and models are really well made. The art design is perfect.

     [b]- Sound:[/b]

Sounds are well made, albeit there are not many different effects for orcs. Music is nothing special, but that's not really relevant in a game like this.

     [b]- Interface:[/b]

The interface is functional and clean, I liked it.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1647750116

S√≥ joguei Plants vs. Zombies de Tower Defense a vida inteira, n√£o tinha muita paci√™ncia para esse tipo de jogo, ent√£o achei na Steam um jogo chamado Orcs Must Die! e chamou a minha aten√ß√£o pelo fato de ser em 3¬™ pessoa, gostei de ver algumas imagens e v√≠deos de gameplays. Tomei a decis√£o de comprar em uma promo√ß√£o para experimentar e n√£o me arrependi, o jogo √© bacana, visual cartoon, cen√°rios um pouco repetitivos, por√©m a equipe desenvolvedora se esfor√ßou para trazer mapas mais complexos e al√©m de tudo a jogabilidade √© leve e fren√©tica desde o come√ßo, bem diferente do PVZ que come√ßa bem devagar. 
O jogo te deixa √† vontade com sua criatividade, √© um game que te deixa montar as armadilhas como quiser, defender a fenda/torre √†s vezes √© bem complicado, mas √© confortante a sensa√ß√£o de vit√≥ria no game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046038030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1558098300}
review: This is a tower defense / RPG game. You place traps to help slow down and thin out the orcs that swarm you while you yourself attack them as well. The gameplay is quite fun and it does have one heck of a challenge. You really have to pay attention to how you set up your traps because you will be fighting hordes upon hordes of orcs. As you get farther in the game you start having to protect multiple portal from the said horde of orcs so if your not careful you will get overran very quickly. All in all it is a fun game with a good challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041415814', 'num_games_owned': 1179, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1298, 'last_played': 1601576265}
review:
Orcs Must Die! es una mezcla de tower defense, MOBA y shooter. A lo largo de veinticuatro niveles, divididos en tres actos, nos encargaremos de eliminar a todos los orcos, goblins, ogros, gnolls y dem√°s criaturas que han conseguido adentrarse en nuestro castillo mediante unos portales interdimensionales.

Para afrontar cada nivel, tendremos que invertir oro (que se obtiene matando orcos) en un arsenal de trampas, armas y hechizos que nos servir√° para frenar a las oleadas de enemigos que se precipitan a invadir "La Fisura", que no es otra cosa que el √∫ltimo portal que tenemos que defender. Nuestro cometido es aniquilar a estos seres haciendo uso de nuestra astucia en un juego que tiene un elevado componente estrat√©gico, ya que tendremos que determinar la posici√≥n de cada trampa, comprar guardianes como paladines o arqueros, lanzar hechizos elementales o tener precisi√≥n con la ballesta, que es el arma principal de nuestro mago.

Pese a tratarse de un juego de 2011, el t√≠tulo luce muy bien a d√≠a de hoy gracias al trabajo de Robot Entertainment. Este estudio de desarrollo consigui√≥ optimizar a la perfecci√≥n su obra y adem√°s, logr√≥ darle un toque humor√≠stico realmente acertado. El dise√±o de niveles es muy satisfactorio, ya que a medida que vamos avanzando en la historia se nos presentar√°n pasillos, c√°maras y salones del castillo que tendr√°n diferentes pisos, varios portales con diferentes caminos, techos abiertos por los que entrar√°n enemigos voladores y un sinf√≠n de posibilidades que complicar√°n notablemente nuestra tarea.

Personalmente, Orcs Must Die! me ha parecido un gran juego en relaci√≥n calidad-precio, es muy adictivo y sus tres modos de dificultad lo hacen totalmente rejugable. Muchos niveles nos llevar√°n a situaciones l√≠mite en las que tendremos que clickear el bot√≥n izquierdo del rat√≥n sin parar para frenar a las hordas de orcos que se abalanzar√°n sobre nosotros. Tambi√©n tendremos la opci√≥n de mejorar nuestro arsenal pagando con "cr√°neos", la moneda del juego que se consigue haciendo buenas partidas en cada nivel. 

No tiene multijugador, aunque su segunda parte s√≠ lo introdujo, sin embargo, es una experiencia que recomiendo a todos aquellos que quieran enfrentarse a un reto verdaderamente desafiante. Tambi√©n aconsejo comprar la expansi√≥n "Lost Adventures", puesto que incluye cinco niveles adicionales.

review:
Good tower defense game, has a fun comical style. 

I picked it up in a bundle with the sequel, which has a lot of improvments, and is an all around better game.
I would recommend getting the second one if your only going to pick up one of the two titles. However, both are equaly enjoyable, and the story is continuous, so if you skip this one you will miss out on that, if that matters to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263316031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1545600038}
review:
Muy buen juego de defensa de torres en 3D, desidi darle una oportunidad sin muchas esperanzas, pero me diverti mucho.
Como defensa de torres no a√±ade nada a la formula (talvez hasta quita esa de mejorar las torres en cada mapa). Tienes una serie de trampas, bastante variadas (que acomodas en la fase de preparacion) y ordas de enemigos, durante la fase de combate puedes participar con tu ballesta y algunos hechizos.
Los mapas son variados y no siempre te valdran las mismas trampas (porque solo puedes llevar algunas a cada mapa,de tu eleccion claro). 
Es un juego satisfactorio, en su dificultad normal, no lo tendras facil y puede que pierdas algun mapa, pero no mas de una vez. Eso si cuando descubri las habilidades pasivas (que se compran y reinician en cada mapa) se rompio, podia comprar trampas y trampas, ya digo super satisfactorio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009752238', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1542779383}
review:
This was a very fun game. Orcs Must Die is a Third-person action-strategy game. I almost wanna call it tower defense since the object of the game is to defend your portal from orcs. How do you do that? Well that's where the fun comes in.

You play as a war mage apprentice who's job is to protect the portals. You get to lay out traps, learn spells, and use weapons to defend yourself and the portal from the orc horde. In the beginning you only have access to a few traps and a bow. But as the game progresses you get a huge arsenal to really help you in your line of defense. From simple tar pits that slow enemies down, to wall darts and ceiling crushers! Oh yeah, and that's just a taste of what you can use.

I really enjoyed this game and the challenge was just perfect. There's this great sense of glee you get when you have your traps perfectly set to where you don't have to move, all your handiwork is taking care of the threat for you. However, I do wish they had more traps to take care of flying enemies. I felt that you didn't have many options to use against them aside from the archers (which are amazing when you upgrade them) and the mini ballista (which I thought was too slow, but that's just me).

So if you're looking for some strategic chaos and lots of fun and exciting ways to kill orcs, you need to check out this game!

TL:DR: Very fun third person strategic action game with hilarious ways to destroy hordes of enemies. Very fun and presents a nice challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972978861', 'num_games_owned': 1477, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1543097966}

author: {'steamid': '76561198128885199', 'num_games_owned': 2385, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1542059410}
review:
Uno de los mejores t√≠tulos basados en el g√©nero supervivencia, quien le guste este, no es entrega par perderse. Es simple, desde todos los puntos de vista, sonoro, gr√°fico, configuraci√≥n, con un peculiar entorno casi animado de ogros y magia y una decente optimizaci√≥n. Tiene una breve variedad de trampas disponibles para ejecutar de diversas maneras a tus enemigos como envenen√°ndolos, inciner√°ndolos o aturdirlos mientras incrustas una flecha en su cabeza.
El estilo de los escenarios siempre se mantiene con una distancia entre lo corto y lo mediano para que sea bastante din√°mico. Sin embargo, los ultimos niveles de la campa√±a, en mi opinion, su dificultad es elevada a tal punto de que parezca estar dise√±ados para m√∫ltiples jugadores. Los escenarios podr√≠an ser un poco mas complejos o diversos para agregarlo algo mas distinto a su estilo.
Por otro lado, encuentro un poco desbalanceadas el da√±o de las armas cuerpo a cuerpo respecto el da√±o que recibes por la semejante cantidad de enemigos que hay (la mayoria son de da√±o cuerpo a cuerpo y no a distancia).
Es recomendado, no una compra obligatoria, pero si de oferta con sus DLCs e incluso su excelente secuela que encuentro con casi las mismas cr√≠ticas que esta.
Los DLCs valen la pena ya que amplian un poco el armamento y a√±aden bastantes niveles similares a los de la campa√±a con un entorno diferente, ejemplo, nieve, antiguo, etc. Mas que ello no se debido que no los tengo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991957072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review: It's a tower defense game where you actively participate in the combat. it also reminds me of Trapt, which was a pretty fun game for back in the day. it's frantic fun with hordes of baddies charge headlong into your traps and get decimated. it's pretty fun and the enemies are standard fare for a tower defence. Overall an enjoyable game, worth getting on sale or in a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004492343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1540936915}
review:
Tower defense. The frustrating, stimulating sport of Kings! Or their guards, to be more specific. Otherwise known as Bouncer Across the Multiverse. Keep the orks and ork-related baddies out of the magical rifts since your mentor died and you can do so much better than that old fogey anyway.

It combines strategy rather well with third person FPS and hack-and-slash. Rewards button mashing and strategic upgrades alike. Basic storyline but mild humor to lampshade the typical save-the-universe jive. Arcade-y with the global leaderboards.

Eventually turns into  let's-discover-new-ways-to-disembowel-all-participants-in-the-latest-WAAAGH

author: {'steamid': '76561198011306765', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2496, 'last_played': 1590177949}
review:
A little gem! 
I found this game by an accident and absolutely felt in love with it! Perhaps it is the immersing story or the exaggerated main protagonist, but you just wish to play and play(and to get better in it!). Essentially this is a game of building a sufficient traps to stop the overwhelming attacks of all the nasty creatures you can imagine. There is a decent arsenal of weapons, upgrades and character specific spells/artefacts. Levels allow for multiple scenarios and are challenging.
Combined with a cartoon graphic, fast paced TPP action packed with explosions and magic flying all over the place we have a very tasty product that should give you hours of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041990871', 'num_games_owned': 877, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1536986039}
review: Very fun game. Haven't finished all of the levels yet, but this is a great game overall so far. The traps are pretty cool, and the dlc weapon, Vampiric Gauntlets, is awesome. The only thing that I wish for this game is that there were different play styles. Like one class that is mainly focused on traps and less on attacking with the character, or one that is super mobile and damaging but only has basic and not great traps. I like what they do with the different weapons, but I want more specializations. Nothing bad to say about the game though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022980827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1380199339}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a fun 3rd person tower defense game released in 2011. As with most tower defense games the goal is to defend the stages rifts (some stages have more than one) from the waves of enemies that spawn at each of the maps entrances (there are multiple entrances and some open at different times). While not being overly difficult to finish it‚Äôs not easy to get a perfect score in the stages and allowing too many orcs through will require a restart.
 
You play as the War mage, the last surviving member of the order who were destroyed in an ambush by the mob, a group of creatures that includes orcs, ogres, imps and other assorted creatures that wish to swarm into the human world from the dead world. The narrator (your teacher) doesn‚Äôt believe you up to the task, and is quite surprised as you manage to keep the mob at bay. I liked the Hero‚Äôs design and voice work, and he has a killer dance he breaks out in when he finishes a stage.
 
Gameplay is roughly broken into 2 separate parts, the initial setup phase where you pick up to 10 traps and items that you want to use in that stage and place the initial traps depending on your available money. The second part is a frantic fight as you watch how your traps are working, take the fight to the enemy, collect any dropped money, and try to save as many rift points as possible. As soon as the last enemy dies from one wave, the next wave starts, leaving a very small window to heal, take stock of the situation and prepare for the next wave. You do get a much needed break after every 3rd or 4th wave to do proper take on the situation, allowing you to change your trap placement, upgrade traps or character attributes (for that stage only) and plan for the next few waves. When you finish a stage you are rated in skulls (up to 5) for your performance, with the skulls being used to buy permanent improvements for traps, items and magic that are applied across all stages. This does allow a slight customization to the hero, as you can choose to focus more on traps or upgrading character abilities, though to complete the game on nightmare its likely you will have unlocked all the upgrades or a good amount of them before stating it.
 
The traps can be placed on generally any surface (floors, walls roofs), and with the stages design often lead to humorous scenes of watching orcs fly into vats of acid, be frozen and shattered, impaled, set on fire, shot, melted or crushed to death. As everything is drawn in a cartoonish style so what could have been a charnel house turns into a waiting game of gleefully watching them die and hoping the trap timers reset quick enough to send the next load of enemies to their death in often funny fashion. If your well equipped you can take the fight to the enemy but this can be a risk as a death will remove rift points.
 
If you are chasing 100% achievements then it‚Äôs possible but it requires a very good knowledge of each map, where to place traps and what spawns on each wave.

For more reviews please visit https://store.steampowered.com/curator/31327216/

author: {'steamid': '76561198271550483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1652721140}
review:
The Warlords of Draenor! Led by the demon corrupted Gul'dan, the orcish horde travels through rifts to the land of Azeroth to wreak havoc and setup the long awaited return of the Demons... Oh wait, wrong franchise.
Orcs Must Die! is a third person shooter with tower defense elements. Unfortunately, I mostly felt like it doesn't do either one aspects reasonably well.

The game has around 20 or so levels, and in each level, there is at least one rift, where the orcs and other greenish bastards are rushing in, and it's your job to keep them out of those rifts for several waves. The main character is armed with a crossbow, and once unlocked, you can equip several spells and traps to help you further defend the portals.
Shooting with the crossbow is often times frustrating. If you shoot too fast, you lose accuracy. But the orc horde is so vast, you often end up shooting as fast as you can click the mouse. AOE fire spell is good choice against them, but you only have enough mana to cast few of them. That's why you need the traps.

Your traps start with basic spikes coming out of the floor, until eventually you gain swinging maces and other painfully sharp tools. But the main problems are the cost and the variety. On early waves, you barely have enough money to even barricade some routes, so you mostly have to rely on the annoying crossbow and spells. After surviving a few waves, you've gained enough funds to afford some better laid out defenses. The game even occasionally puts the orcs on a break, and sends them after you only after you are ready. Here is the cost problem: you don't usually get enough credits to create those cool dedicated killing zones during a level. And since the variety of the traps are low, you end up doing the same cost effective strategies on most maps. This eventually starts to get boring.

The story is nothing to brag about, since it isn't even the main point of this game but at least the main character has funny dialogue. It is also hilarious to listen to the orcs talk. They often speak something like "my vacation starts tomorrow" just seconds before walking into a wall grinder. The music is also quite nice to listen to.

Being released in 2011, Orcs Must Die! runs well on any machine today. RTX 3060 Ti manages easily 240 fps at 1440p. The game also runs well, but I did encounter some weird bugs, where certain enemy types didn't have any walking or attacking animations and instead they advanced in an almost t-pose like stance.

The game falls short on both the third person shooting and tower defenses. You earn too little coins, forcing you to rely on the crossbow more, which isn't fun to use. When you start to earn enough money, the level is already over. You'll just end up doing same trap systems for most levels, since there really isn't a lot of interesting, innovating or improvised traps. It's a nice game for a while, and it's best played in short amounts at a time. I'd score this a 2/5. It is quite cheap, so it's worth a purchase, and therefore I can recommend it for the small amounts of enjoyment you get from time to time, like when you actually have enough credits to create a perfect orc smashing path of pain.

review: This is my first game ever that could be considered a tower defense so I'm not aware if there are better ones out there. Orcs Must Die!, however, was very fun to play and landing multiple kills with your traps that push orcs into fiery pits or melting several at once with your throwable acid bottles is pretty satisfying. There are not that many levels and most of the time they all look similar (with a few exceptions), but I dug the gameplay and the humour so I recommend it when it's on sale.

review: This is an amazing sequel to the previous games. I've played a bunch in beta and am really enjoying the new Sabotage mode. This is not a tower defense game for amateurs...you've really gotta know your stuff. Don't expect a lot of hand holding. Love the game's sense of humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212756277', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2294, 'last_played': 1617104995}
review:
Nella mia prossima vita spero ci sia ancora Steam per poterlo rigiocare!
Questo non √® il classico tower defence dove piazzi torrette e stai bello tranquillo ad aspettare che i nemici si ammazzino da soli come lemmings: dopo aver piazzato le trappole dovrai imbracciare le armi e combattere o quegli orchetti varcheranno la breccia! Ogni livello √® una sfida non banale e richieder√† sempre una certa dose di ingegno, tempestivit√† e anche un po' della stupidit√† del protagonista, che continuando a parlare per tutto il tempo trascina il giocatore nel suo mondo. Tuttavia l'impegno sar√† ben speso dato che ad ogni livello completato verranno sbloccate nuove armi e trappole.
Il gioco √® davvero bellissimo e, anche se alcuni livelli ho fatto veramente tanta fatica a finirli senza far passare neanche un orchetto, altri mi sono divertito a giocarli pi√π e pi√π volte per sperimentare nuove combinazioni di trappole. La trama √® molto semplice ma non per questo povera, anzi: ci sono diversi punti di svolta e, dalla met√† del gioco in poi, diversi momenti capaci anche di far emozionare.
Un gioco pienamente riuscito, pochissimi difetti decisamente ignorabili e SOPRATTUTTO riesce a funzionare a grafica alta senza nessun problema sul mio pc patata, cosa decisamente non da poco!

review:
Orcs must die! Es un defiende la torre en tercera persona bastante fren√©tico y sobre todo muy divertido con mucha variedad en cuanto a trampas, armas y habilidades que nos permite jugar de diferente forma m√°s efectiva o bien, m√°s destructiva.

La campa√±a principal te puede llegar a durar las 5 horas y con la posibilidad de aumentar ese tiempo al jugarlo en dificultades m√°s altas que te permiten utilizar todas las trampas y objetos desbloqueados para poder aguantar y terminar con vida de tantas oleadas consecutivas sin tiempo para planear, poner trampas o tener un respiro, un reto para los amantes de los tower defend. 

No puedo decir m√°s que, es un juego muy recomendado para los amantes de los tower defend.

review: This really is a gem. Nicely polished and tons of replayability. There are enough tools to allow for creative and emergent play, but enough constraints so it isn't overwhelming. And if you get bored of improving the efficiency of your killing machines, you can dig into the combo and scoring system which is a whole other game by itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155755820', 'num_games_owned': 1234, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1539015543}
review: For me this the best Orcs must die! game. Especially the levels design. 24 Fortresses to Defend ‚Äì Twisting passages, tall towers, and wide-open chambers all need a war mage to protect them. Extensive Replayability ‚Äì ‚ÄúNightmare Mode‚Äù and a skull ranking system provide extended play. 9 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029972608', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 404, 'playtime_forever': 1769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1548, 'last_played': 1665750853}
review:
[b]PROS:[/b]
+ 24 interesting levels
+ huge weapons & traps variety (+ upgrades)
+ nice mix of tower defense & action
+ cool soundtrack
+ funny story

[b]CONS:[/b]
- clunky placement of some traps
- some weird AI pathing
- no co-op
- cannot reset upgrades

[b]Comment:[/b]
Story elements are fun though the connection of the levels could have used a campaign map of sorts as to why/how we move between these locations in the first place. Each level has a certain best possible path of using traps to ace it. But the good thing is that this is not mandatory and you can experiment too. Often you will find creative, or weird, uses for traps and master the levels your own way. While some levels let you build up your defences evenly others you just have to run a couple of times to know what enemies will spawn in which door. Your skill counts in not just the strategic placement of traps. But also delivering headshots is a great way to get enemies down quick, if your aim is good. Personally I love the crossbow. Mixed with the flame bracers the fighting felt really satisfying. While this worked for ME the choice is entirely yours, I believe most weapon & trap combinations can work. There are Apprentice, War Mage and Nightmare difficulties but the last one has to be unlocked. This is good because you do not get real breaks between waves in it and upgraded traps are needed. Speaking of which you can upgrade each trap using skulls you win by finishing the levels. However, the number of skulls you can get is fixed and upgrading is permanent so choose wisely based on what you like/use. The funky archer (& some trap) placement get in the way sometimes when you want to hurry but you need to keep shifting your cursor or the player to find a spot. This is annoying especially on Nightmare where you have limited time. Also the AI pathing is a bit weird but this can be both advantage and disadvantage (barricades FTW!). There's no cooperative mode though you can find that in the sequel Orcs Must Die! 2. The plus side is that you can finish this game yourself, as it was designed, while OMD!2 is more difficult to do on your own. Overall it's a good mix of tower defense and third-person action. Designed for people who like to place traps/units but don't just want to sit by and watch. Definitely worth a try.
------------------------------------------------------------------
[b]If you liked this review you can find more on the [/b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28638055-Subjective-Reviews-Corner/][u]Curator page[/u][/url][b] or in my [/b][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/srcorner][u]Review Corner[/u][/url][b].[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198200273126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1506369908}
review:
Este juego para lo que ofrece es bastante divertido y puede llegar a ser tan adictivo que te lo puedes termianr en tan solo 5 o 6 horas, y para ser parte del genero de los Tower Defense es bastante diferente y tambien mas intenso, la premisa es facil, se han abierto portales en donde orcos aparecen y quieren llegar a un nucleo para destruirlo y nuestro objetivo es deternlos.

Si buscas pasar el rato y divertirte matando orcos y protegiendo el nucleo, su precio no esta mal, talvez no sure mucho pero se que lo pasaras bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025171737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1529301156}
review: This game is awesome if you like things like Dungeon Defenders and the tower defense genre.  The idea is like every other tower defense -- place traps between the gate(s) that the orcs come out of and the rift they're trying to get to.  The implementation is great, it's light hearted, the traps are interesting and it's really satisfying to repel a huge wave of orcs with careful planning.

review:
A very fun and satisfying Tower defense like no other. Gameplay is based on preferance and playstyle, the artstyle is nice and it is addictive! Some of the later levels require a specific stratergy which is what put me off completing it as i just had to watch a video and it would be easy. With that being said, i still had fun playing and would recommend. :D

UPDATE: I managed to beat the game without help from youtube. It can be hard at times but try different things and you will be rewarded!

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971544967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2004, 'last_played': 1520486386}
review:
Really fun action, tower defense game.  This is a tower defense game where you are a character in the game and can attack just like a shooter.  You will pretty much need lay traps as well as fight personally to get through most levels.  The game has a good challenge level, but you should never get too frustrated on the normal level.  There is a good variety of traps and weapon types that are slowly given to you as you progress and there seems to be many strategies that will work.  As you progress you will also be able to improve your traps (but not your weapons / spells) so you can tailor your strategy how you like a bit (but upgrades are permanent so if you make a mistake, you are stuck with it).

Not much else to say, game has a good personality, nice presentation, sound and there were no bugs that I found.  Very polished and worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042571202', 'num_games_owned': 1137, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1404, 'last_played': 1519387892}
review:
A classic FPS Tower Defense game with one simple goal, to not let the Orcs reach the Rift.

This game is amazingly enjoyable, but after about 10 levels it begins to get a little bland. Personally, I prefer the sequel 'Orcs must Die! 2' as it is more rounded, easier to get achievements and it is also multiplayer. However, this has a certain nostalgic charm to it that you just gotta love. I dunno, hard to describe. Try it and see.
