author: {'steamid': '76561197960559290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1318489200}
review:
It seemed like a cool idea, but it's shit.

Just look at Fortnite PVE it's basically the same thing only more to explore and build.  It's also boring af and just feels like a grind because you end up doing A LOT of shooting along side your towers.

When I play TD type games I'd prefer to be able to relax while I play.  This is just a non stop pointless grind.  If I wanted high energy (running around constantly having to assess surroundings and react ahead of time and responsible for taking out most targets) I'd be playing CSGO or something else.



[quote=Enyxk0]Every heard of just tagging it as not interested[/quote]

No & thanks for the suggestion. I probably didn't notice it because I'm in a rush constantly to get things done behind the scenes which are bogging me down. It's also possible I just chose to not use it. I'm concerned using it will hide related games that I enjoy and that might be why I ignored it. Shops using algorithms to shove games in my face.. I want a clean, clear way to sort and look through the games myself. Games are being promoted on Valve's end rather than suggesting games that would fit my tastes. Why feed the machine if it's just looking to maximize profits rather than make me happy? There's very little difference between systems like this & others that I benefit from immediately.  :steamhappy:


[quote=The CheesePuff] The whole point of this genre is it isn't just a tower defense game. It's a shooter/ tower defense. You are just supposed to sit there and wait for the towers to do all the work. It's the opposite of a grind, isn't it? A grind is doing the same thing over and over again, whereas in this game you place you towers and your traps and get to move all over the map fighting. [/quote]

From your perspective it's not a grind? And no shit sherlock about "it isn't just a tower defense game" - that's why I bought it and was super excited about it. You obviously didn't understand what I meant so let me clarify for you: The FPS aspect isn't providing the same rewards that other FPS provide. It feels way too close to Diablo 2 & 3 :steambored: with the amount of frantic clicking involved VS skilled, pre-planned and even sometimes intuitive reaction shots, which the game hardly recognizes aside from a headshot. In other FPS if I pull insane 200iq or reaction shot plays (or better yet a combo) I'm immediately rewarded big time, mostly by my peers. :csgoanarchist::csgogun::csgogun:

And no you don't just get to move all over the map. You need to stay put in strategic positions to maximize your traps efficacy or else you will lose. I don't mind challenges, what I do mind are challenges that just test your patience over and over. Ones that feel like a grind designed to just keep you glued to the game doing the same mundane actions over and over. Extreme repetition. That is fucking boring as hell!!! So no it isn't the opposite of a grind, it's made the entire goal behind the game even more grindy than being able to sit back and handle all the strategy side of things, because not only do you have to click like fucking crazy, but you have to constantly aim at heads and shift around in the same small area to get angles. This game requires MASSIVE amounts of clicking just as I said with Diablo 2 & 3, and I'd argue it requires even more.

review:
Orcs Must Die! Un juego super divertido y recomendadisimo! Perfecto para jugar con algun amigo , graficos muy buenos para el 2018 , el protagonista en parte es muy cabron jaja , y eso de las trampas va muy bien , El juego en si lo encuentro muy especial , ir matando orcos , explotarlos en 100 pedazos con bombas y trampas , *c toma un descanso para escribir :v* 
Recomendable comprar los DLC's despues de completar al 100x100 la campa√±a . El modo Pesadilla es un dolor de cabeza! un juego que te dara bastantes horas de diversion!

10/10. 
*agreguen para jugar partidas n.n*

review:
¬°Gran juego! Muy entretenido, con gran variedad de armas y trampas bastante diferenciadas entre s√≠. Muchas formas de completar cada nivel dependiendo de las herramientas que elijas para llevar a cabo el trabajo, y dependiendo tambi√©n de tu estrategia y de tu forma de jugar.

Tiene buena duraci√≥n, tiene comedia, y una excelente banda sonora que te acompa√±ar√° mientras destroces hordas de orcos una tras otra.

Como requieres de calaveras para mejorar tus herramientas, y cada nivel te da un m√°ximo de 5 en total (siendo 5 la cantidad que obtienes por completarlo a la perfecci√≥n), vas a necesitar ganar todos a la perfecci√≥n si deseas poder mejorar todo tu equipamiento al m√°ximo, y esto le a√±ade reto, y varias horas m√°s de diversi√≥n matando orcos.

¬°Muy recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6823, 'num_reviews': 1307, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1515322981}
review: Orcs Must Die! have the same vibe as the other Tower Defense game, where not only "towers" do all the job - Sanctum. But instead of all of kind futuristic stuff we have here orcs, traps, spells and other fantasy things. It's fun and challenging. The only thing I'm missing here is some kind of endless mode. If you ask me, it's one of more interesting games from this genre. It took me around 8 hours to complete all of the normal levels + the ones from DLC, but there is also challenge mode, achievements, skull system (rating), so there are lots of more stuff to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238181648', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2593, 'last_played': 1597020028}
review:
Gran juego para pasar el rato, si es que para eso lo quieres. Porque si quieres algo mas, puedes pasartelo en todas las dificultades y con todas las "estrellas" y conseguir los logros que ahi es donde esta el reto y si quieres aun mas consiguite el DLC que trae otros 5 mapas, que tambien tienen su dificultad.

Desde el punto de vista tecnico esta muy bien optimizado, tanto asi que mi carbonera lo corre :v, el humor es bueno y la jugabilidad esta bien para lo que es la tematica del juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064186438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1346396400}
review: This game is tower defense style game play with an interesting twist  because it is from the Third-person Perspective. I find the concept of planting traps and using the various methods at your disposal to deal with orcs an interesting one. That being said I would never buy this game. I got it free with the purchase of a Radeon card. Honestly, I don't know why anyone would buy it. It's mildly entertaining, but it really isn't that good. When I think "what game do I want to play?" I don't think Orcs Must Die! But, that is just my opinion if you think you will be a die-hard fan of this game don't let me stand in your way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967628475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1457070855}
review: Another fantastic "play with your friends" type of game. Similar to Dungeon Defenders. Setup your traps and try to keep the orcish hoards from getting through. A classic. 9-10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198021263677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 3259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1709435857}
review:
This game was a lot more fun than I had expected.

The combination of tower defence and shooter works well.  Very rarely can you get away with only one - any given level may let you get away with relying on directly taking down the mobs for the first few waves but you'll need strategic traps to get through to the end.  Many later levels devolve into having properly set up traps taking out pretty much everything except for the boss mobs, and even those you'll want to have some heavy assistance to take down.

Some levels do seem to rely a little more heavily than I would like on having your character rapidly bounce between different invasion points on the map, and that (with the rapid portal system) was sometimes disorienting and annoying more than fun, but that might be because I was more into the tower defence than the pew-pew.  The mini-map is essential at times to work out what is going on across the level, and it ... functions, but I would have liked more of a sense of being able to tell what was going on - are some of those red dots bosses or rezzers - without actually popping out to take a look.  But that's ok, it's part of the game you get used to.

The story is ok even for it being a thin veneer to take you through what is essentially just a series of puzzle scenarios.  The humour is good - the dopey machismo of the protagonist is played well.  I did, however, miss pretty much the entire dialog of the antagonist - the volume levels were wrong and she kept getting drowned out by the lines from the grunt orcs and the hero because her lines were only played during active parts of the fights which was a bit unfortunate.

While every level uses the same basic stone castle aesthetic, I was surprised by how visually appealing the environments and mobs are.

It's not a long game if you just play to get through the levels, but there is plenty of replayability if you're driven to get a perfect score on each level and to challenge yourself with 'nightmare' difficulty.

The upgrade system is very basic - each trap has one upgrade - but it's enough to make you want to get good scores to afford to upgrade your favourite traps.

The variety of traps combined with the choices provided by the Weavers provides for a lot of flexibility in deciding how to tackle a level, and I very much appreciated that.  There is a lot of challenge, not just in getting perfect scores, but just successfully getting through some of these levels, and coming up with any solution - let alone a perfect solution - takes thought, and not just a "oh I've used this combination before, let's just do this again every time".

Having said that some of the traps sound good in theory but I found to be almost impossible to see actual benefit to using in practice.  The 'wall push' being one - it can only be mounted on walls, but it seems to only have a short range and a short push, so the number of scenarios it can be used successfully directly was very small.  Perhaps it was intended to be used to adjust mob position in relation to other traps, but if so the cost is all wrong because you can always buy a spike trap or some such that will, by itself, be more effective.  Similarly I wanted to use the floor mounted spring traps to send orcs flying into pools of acid more, but ... while visually a lot of fun they just never seemed to be more effective than some other more mundane trap.

There are some problems:
* Placement of traps - particularly the champions - I found fiddly and unnecessarily difficult in some places.
* Pathing through barricades seemed non-obvious to me.  Normally a barricade in a particular place will force the orcs to take a different path, provided there is a viable path.  But sometimes even though to me there was a clear alternative path the orcs would just decide they had to go through this barricade at this point and it was never clear why.
* Controller support is there but it just seems ... incomplete or broken to me unless I was missing something - the buttons and controls the on-screen guide shows don't do what the guide says they should do.
* I did experience a few nasty game freezes which Windows 10 struggled to deal with and basically required me to restart my computer.

But overall, a surprising amount of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092052349', 'num_games_owned': 1273, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1072, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1511805246}
review:
Vous ne passerez paaaaas ! 

Orc Must Die! est un bon "tower-defense" qui se d√©marque par son style graphique agr√©able √† regarder et ses m√©caniques de jeu vraiment int√©ressantes. Pour chaque niveau, il y a de multiples possibilit√©s ! D'ailleurs, une fois que vous aurez d√©bloqu√© tous les pi√®ges, vous pouvez refaire les niveaux pr√©c√©dents et ainsi r√©ussir ces niveaux d'une autre fa√ßon ! Il y a tout un tas de niveaux et de pi√®ges donc vous avez de quoi faire. Rajouter √† cela un peu d'humour et c'est le ponpon !

Le sc√©nario vaut ce qu'il vaut mais on est l√† pour d√©foncer des orcs avant tout, n'est-ce pas ?

Il n'y a pas de coop donc vous devrez r√©ussir les niveaux tout seul, comme un grand. C'est l'un des points faibles du jeu malheureusement. 

Egalement, je trouve le jeu quand m√™me un peu r√©p√©titif. C'est d'ailleurs pour √ßa que je n'ai pas eu √† 100% tous les cr√¢nes car √† la fin, je me lassais !

N√©anmoins, vous pouvez passer pas mal de temps √† vous amuser sur ce jeu et c'est ce qui compte !

Je le recommande donc ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049181223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1513723714}
review:
[h1]Orcs Must Die![/h1]
Die Spielzeit von 9,6 Stunden ist irgendwie nicht korrekt, ih muss zeitweise offline gewesen sein. Da war mit Neuversuchen der Levels doch etwas mehr Zeit drin.

[b]Positiv:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Ich mochte die Story mit dem Spacken-Helden, passt gut zum Spielkonzept
    [*]Nette Comicgrafik
    [*]Ziemlich Spa√üiger Mix. Viele Towerdefense-Spiele geht schnell sehr in die Richtung, dass man exakt das richtige Anwenden muss und wenn man mal was nicht vorher wei√ü, hei√üt es Level von vorne, das hier ist da recht in Ordnung
   [*]Dickes Plus daf√ºr, dass die Firma Demos ihrer kostenpflichtigen Spiele anbietet
[/list]

[b]Nicht so gut:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Das Spiel hat bei mir st√§ndig in Kampf andere Items angew√§hlt, so dass ich im Armbrustfeuer √∂ften mal eine Falle wild in die Gegend gesetzt habe, das macht es spielerisch zuweilen etwas hakelig
    [*]Die Explosionskobolde haben in ihrem Auftreten doch eine recht hohe Notwendigkeit auswendig gelernt zu werden, in einem Spiel in dem man sich sonst recht gut dynamisch anpassen und mit cleveren Konstrukten gewinnen kann
[/list]

[b]Fazit:[/b]
Spa√üig. Kostet nicht mehr die Welt, selbst wenn man es nicht komplett durchspielt gibts doch gut Spa√ü¬¥f√ºrs Geld.
Ich hab die Game of the Year Edition, die Zusatzlevel habe ich nicht gespielt, aber der Lebenspunktesaugen-Ring aus dem Artifacts of Power DLC ist schon wirklich gut. Das hat mein Schwieigkeitsempfinden sicher beeinflusst.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985824774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1512616717}
review:
[b]A simple tower defense with a mix of third person action. An old staple of Steam's indie boom. A straight-forward concept that packs a surprising amount of playtime. It's a bit dated compared to OMD2. Those who enjoyed OMD2 may want to consider revisiting this one. Newcomers may want to start with 2 instead.[/b]

A solid concept that is fairly well executed, and provides a decent twist on the tower defense genre. That said, if you're looking at this and are interested in the series, I'd recommend getting Orcs Must Die 2 instead. It's the same game, just more polished and has more quality of life improvements.

This one is arguably harder than the second, due to the limitations on certain traps and restrictive level design. Most maps tend to have only a handful of strategies that are viable. This is due to how the level geometry denies usage for at least half of the traps in your arsenal. I know this was done in an attempt to get you to use all the traps, but it feels somewhat cheap to have a level with absolutely no ceiling tiles, or a level with almost no wall tiles.

It's still a pretty fun time killer that requires a bit of strategy, and maybe some luck. However, with OMD2 being superior in every way, it's hard to recommend revisiting this one. If you are a die hard fan, then I'd say go for it. Otherwise, there are better alternatives.


[EDIT: Removed OMD Unchained references.]


[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33370076/]Steam Curator[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198089706462', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1512365214}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070591452', 'num_games_owned': 1415, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2737, 'last_played': 1511557843}
review:
[b] Kickass metal soundtrack speeds up the massacre of orcs and ogres in this fun tower (or trap..?) defense/shooter hybrid. Interesting but unfortunately very short levels without any kind of endless/survival mode to let the player enjoy it‚Äôs levels to the max. Good amount of traps for a few different playstyles but also couple overpowered combos making the short levels feel even more easier. [/b]

[h1] Bruce Campbell, is that you? [/h1]

Our hero, that feels heavily like Bruce Campbell in all of his movies that i‚Äôve seen, is humanity‚Äôs last hope! So everything should be pretty good? Bruce Campbell always wins against undead hordes, i don‚Äôt think orcs would pose a much different threat.

Main character has that same cocky and straight-to-the-point attitude, similar looks and overall characteristics as our beloved Bruce ‚ÄúBane of the undead‚Äù Campbell. He makes some fun remarks along the levels, and also has a couple dialogue bits with the female sorceress who is the main villain controlling the orcs. Plot is advanced by these dialogues amidst the levels and few cutscenes when a chapter is finished. It isn‚Äôt something anyone would consider a deep plot, or much a plot at all. It‚Äôs just there, like Campbells movies. Fun and entertaining, featuring chauvinistic jokes here and there.

As a sidenote i just have to mention some of the orc one-liners that they‚Äôre shouting while marching to their doom that made my girlfriend giggle while she was watching me playing this: ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt we all just get along?‚Äù, ‚Äúdon‚Äôt step on my foot!‚Äù or the classic ‚Äúwatch out for traps!‚Äù, all delivered with a proper orc-accent.

[h1] Plan and execution [/h1]

We defend the rifts either by our own melee & ranged weapons and/or with various traps that can be placed on the floor, walls or on the ceiling. We also have one melee and one ranged guardian that i personally don‚Äôt count among the traps because ‚Äúthey‚Äôre living soldiers‚Äù, you get the point. There are multiple tactics to use in winning the levels but some trap combinations are clearly overpowered, that made even the nightmare mode feel too easy. Even if it felt easy, i still had fun, it was satisfying to see a group of orcs getting hammered to pieces by the massive mace swinging on the ceiling, or pierced by the arrows shot from the walls. 

In addition to traps and our own weapons, we eventually unlock the help of magic, three different categories that each support a different playstyle by giving us specific bonuses/buffs related to our playstyle.

Controls are intuitive, and those hectic moments when you‚Äôre shooting and placing traps in a continuous motion, works smooth. I had few situations where i was mainly running backwards, shooting at the horde, placing a trap, switching to my crossbow to get a couple headshots, and again placing a few more traps. Those are the moments that made this game extremely fun for me, and satisfying when i succeeded.


[h1] Actual footage! [h1]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fXFvAzv_FT0&index=18&list=PLSkXIDuUIe6LBJbmjOXTzEtPFbFjmO2dP

[h1] Should you buy it?!? [/h1]

YES! This is fun, although short and not offering any replay value after completing the levels with the best grades, but the nightmare mode offers a few good challenging moments. Kickass soundtrack and smooth action, satisfying moments when your trap placement works and you can sit back while watching those orcs get put to their place.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992229015', 'num_games_owned': 1175, 'num_reviews': 776, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1512087753}
review:
Great value for the price. You'll easily get about 8-10 hours out of this, just playing through the levels, but there is at least one more difficulty after "normal" and to get 5 skulls for every level is a feat in and of itself...

Basically this is 3rd person tower defense. You place traps in corridors and on walls/ceilings to stop the unrelenting tide of green Orcs. Every level in the campaign lets you unlock a new trap to decorate the walls with blood! And oh they are satisfying to watch. You can slow, maim, impale, shred, burn, zap and even mind control your enemies. Glorious.

And you'll also take an active role in the combat, killing Orcs and Ogres, etc. with crossbow, sword and magic spells. And headshots deal massive bonus damage. Lovely.

The enemy variety is also nothing to laugh about: From simple Orcs to shield bearers, archers, small runners, giant Ogres and even necromancers, hero hunters, exploding suicide bombers and flying "dragonlings" the game's got it all. And you'll never know how they will hit you, until you get to that wave...and can remember it.

Your goal is simply to protect the core(s) and enemies can come from 1 or more entrances, which may be on opposite sides of the level. These are definitely the hardest ones in my opinion, since they require a lot of planning and movement.

But of course, no game is perfect. For example: It's not possible to change your trap setup or even view the enemy types that will assault you after you have built the first trap, which is a bit of a shame, since halfway through a level you could realize that what you selected no longer works, but bad luck, better start from the beginning.

Enemy pathing is also an issue sometimes, Orc archers shoot so randomly that dodging their shots is often just pure luck (i.e. you just dodged right into an attack that was aimed 10 meters to your left).

You simply have no way of finding out what a trap really does and especially in the campaign you get a new trap after every level and you can upgrade those traps with "skulls", which you get after each level for your performance. The amount of skulls you can get is capped of course, but unfortunately you can't refund trap improvements, which often means you're stuck with upgraded traps you don't even use anymore, because you simply got better ones...and those upgrades ain't cheap. It would be great if you could adjust that for every level.

Barricades let you wall off sections of the map. Unless you block the enemy's access to your core, they SHOULD work, however, on more than one occasion these barricades simply got destroyed by the game or the enemy. Through trial and error I've found out that enemies will destroy them if you position archers behind them. Ok. They can also be blown up by bombers and destroyed by archers, if they want to...whatever really triggers those...in 1 level the bombers will always go for the barricades, in others they simply ignore them...and at least in 1 level they simply got insta destroyed despite not blocking access. I've tried the same level positioning the barricades slightly further behind and then everything was fine, but oh boy, why? Doesn't make any sense. At least give the player clues as to why that is.

All in all still a pretty entertaining and even challenging game in which you can't just rely on your traps, but have to do your part. A combination of strategic planning and your own accuracy are vital for success.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151401862', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1595654222}
review:
Incredibly surprised by how fun this game turned out to be. Got the bundle on sale (11 bucks instead of 60 so i figured id give it a shot since I have a couple of friends that say it's fun) but wow I could not put it down played for 5 straight hours first night I got it didn't even alt tab the entire time.

The premise of the game is simple, tower defense game where you use a combination of traps (Floor, wall, and ceiling traps) and guardians (basically a mini armor of archers and paladins) along with crossbow/sword and a series of magic abilities your character can choose to fight with. The orc swarms come from designated gate points on the map and you design your defensive strategy prior to the first wave, between waves, between rounds and more particularly adapt it during the round as you kill more orcs and gain more coin.

Just playing on medium difficulty it is intricate and almost punishingly enjoyable, to adapt your defense set ups in real time as different types of enemies and swarms come through the waves, falling back when your line of guardians falls to 5 giant ogres coming out of nowhere and steam rolling them

Fairly big diversity of weapons and abilities, along with quite a few different types of enemies make it challenging and rewarding. definitely worth $2.50 USD on sale but honestly I'd buy it at the full 10 dollar price because this game is just too fun.

I usually don't leave reviews but this is one of the most pleasant surprises for what i expected to be a dry and simple game so just popping in to say buy the hell out of it.

Well, I'm gonna go back to killing some orcs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126081939', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 344, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1510783266}
review:
I've won this game at Steamgifts website. 
This is a solid title, however it is not remarkable. 
The difficulty of the game introduces different enemies on map, thanks to that there is some replayability (I'm an offline player, one can check achievements).
Different maps prefers different "gear" however there are few I used almost all the time, what is good here is that usually one needs to mix traps with own abilities, relaying in only one side usually means defeat. Also some thinking and good management is needed here as well. The dark humor is nice addition too. Still there is nothing spectacular here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040962188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1230, 'last_played': 1511295913}
review:
As a lover of defense games and also a lover of exploding Orcs into little giblets, this game was seemingly tailor-made for me. 

I recall first picking this up years ago and being really overwhelmed...I had no idea how to handle airborne opponents so I ended up spamming the Vampire Gauntlet you get in the DLC. Of course this is no long-term strategy and I grew frustrated. 

Years later I return older and wiser and discover that spamming the ever-loving crap out of the Archers is a pretty fantastic solution to a huge number of orc-and-monster based issues on any given level. 

Joking aside, it was fun actually realizing I could learn how to be good at this game. If you want something that is simultaneously fun and relaxing but also stressful as hell, this game is a great way to put a few hours behind.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996215447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2426, 'last_played': 1577797838}

It's old but still a lot of fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198381148224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2099, 'last_played': 1511684019}
review:
[b] What is Orcs Must Die!? [/b]

A Tower Defense-Action game by Robot Entertainment.

[b] Did you like it? [/b]

Yes, I did.

[b] Why should I buy it? [/b]

It's a game with very fun gameplay. There are 24 various levels and each requires it's own special tactic. Also there are many different traps, spells and enemies. The graphic style is fitting the humour of the game and adds it's own charm.

[b] Are there any flaws? [/b]

I didn't notice any flaws.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028212295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1491902499}
review:
This game is a fantastic blend of tower defense/RPG with third person shooter elements.
Very satisfying to play with certain builds and on what works for you (Mix of traps/spells/weapons).
Even more fun when played with a friend, since you can diversify your builds with more traps.
Replaying maps to improve your star rating is very satisfying.
Experiment with different builds and strategy as certain map layouts favor certain traps.
Check out its sequel if you like it!

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198089538772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1509744696}
review:
Modernisant le genre Tower Defense en le rendant plus dynamique et immersif, Orcs Must Die est un super jeu ind√© si vous prenez le temps de vous y investir une 15 √®ne d'heures pour la campagne principal. Car si dans l'ensemble le jeu est propre et facile √† prendre en main, il vous faudra d'avantage de temps pour ma√Ætriser le syst√®me de jeu. Technicit√© oblige. A vous de voir si vous avez le courage d'affronter les arm√©es de Sauron aussi longtemps. 

Comique dans son design et sa narration, le jeu nous place dans la peau d'un apprenti mage de guerre. Devant prot√©ger les failles contre les orcs, le jeune guerrier se veut perp√©tuer le combat de son ma√Ætre mort pr√©matur√©ment. Ainsi, partant de ce pitch de base le jeu s'√©toffera le long de l'aventure vous offrant d√©tails narratifs et pi√®ge suppl√©mentaire √† chaque niveau termin√©. Cependant si le choix de pi√®ge offert √† chaque nouvelle map coule de sens ( en fonction de son design ), ce n'est pas toujours le cas. Prenez la peine de tout tester afin de voir l'impact de chacun sur les mobs. 

Ce conseil se r√©f√®re directement au genre du jeu : le Tower Defense. Etant un jeu √† Pathfinding, tous les mobs suivent un chemin sp√©cifique en fonction de leur pattern. Faille, joueur,pnj : tous n'ont pas le m√™me objectif ! Observer le comportement de chacun d'entre eux et jouer avec lui. Cela vous sera tout aussi utile que de les attaquer car oui les orcs sont b√™tes et pr√©visibles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037003601', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1407968144}
review: I really enjoyed OMD. It containted lenty of humor in the dialogue and character outbursts. Death animations were amusing as well as the character models in general. Just as the game has a good blend of comedy mixed with killing things, the game deftly integrates an action/third person shooter gameplay with strategy elements. As you play, you get a good sense of progression and by the end of the game you truly feel like a powerful wizard with a broad selection of weapons, spells, and traps to choose from.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156058850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1747, 'last_played': 1505693934}
review:
Orcs Must Die! √® un tower defense misto ad un gioco d'azione.
Oltre a piazzare "trappole" e "guardiani", controllerete infatti (in terza persona) il mago-guerriero protagonista nella sua missione: bloccare l'invasione degli orchetti.

Voi siete l'ultimo mago-guerriero dell'ordine rimasto in vita, dopo la morte del vostro mentore. L'obiettivo √® solo uno, fermare i nemici prima che essi raggiungano la breccia. [spoiler] Il popolo degli orchetti √® controllato da una strega, il cui obiettivo √® ottenere il potere solo per se. [/spoiler]

Il gioco si sviluppa su 3 atti, ciascuno con un intermezzo narrativo. Ciascun atto √® suddiviso in 8 livelli, tutti diversi tra loro, per un totale di 24 livelli.

A vostra disposizione ci sono:
[list]
    [*]Armi, 6 in tutto, le usate personalmente, possono essere magiche (consumano mana) o fisiche. La balestra √® l'arma principale del protagonista ed √® obbligatoria in ogni livello.
    [*]Trappole, sono 19 e vanno piazzate in giro per la mappa, aiutano in modo automatico il giocatore a completare la missione. Nel gruppo sono comprese trappole da terra, da muro, da soffitto, guardiani (spadaccini e arcieri) e armi piazzabili a uso singolo.
    [*]Vi sono inoltre alcuni elementi interattivi nelle varie mappe con la quale potete interagire. Tra questi ci sono lampadari da far cadere sui nemici, baliste giganti e calderoni di acido da rovesciare.
    [*]Tessitrici, 3 diversi "alberi delle abilit√†", che aggiungono bonus vari, sia alle trappole che al giocatore stesso. Ciascun perscorso √® diverso dagli altri e potete sceglierne solo uno a partita, che rester√† lo stesso fino alla fine.
[/list]

Con l'avanzare nel gioco, sbloccherete man mano tutto l'equipaggiamento.

Le trappole possono essere potenziate con i teschi guadagnati nei livelli. Il potenziamento prevede una modifica che varia a seconda della specifica trappola che volete potenziare (abbassa il costo, aumenta i danni, si ricarica pi√π velocemente, raggio pi√π ampio ecc).

I livelli sono strutturati a ondate di nemici. All'inizio potete scegliere dal [i]grimorio[/i] l'equipaggiamento (10 armi/trappole, una per ogni numero sulla tastiera, anche se uno slot √® sempre occupato dalla balestra) e la tessitrice. Una volta avviata la prima ondata, le seguenti sono distanziate da un timer (circa 10 secondi). A volte sono presenti checkpoint che bloccano lo scorrere del gioco, rigenerano i guardiani e vi permettono di riorganizzarvi per bene.

Sono presenti diversi tipi di nemici, ciascuno con le proprie caratteristiche. Le uccisioni vi fanno guadagnare oro con il quale potete acquistare dalle tessitrici o piazzare trappole.

Potete affrontare il gioco in 3 differenti difficolt√†: apprendista, mago-guerriero e incubo (rispettivamente facile-medio-difficile). Nella modalit√† facile avrete i teschi ottenibili limitati a 2 ma √® molto semplice. La media √® bilanciata e potete vincere 5 teschi [i](di fatto il gioco √® completabile giocando anche solo la difficolt√† mago-guerriero, in quanto i teschi si sovrappongono, tuttavia la modalit√† facile pu√≤ essere usata per testare varie strategie)[/i].

La modalit√† incubo invece √® scollegata dalle precedenti (di fatto √® una seconda campagna). Oltre ad avere una difficolt√† aumentata dovrete scegliere il vostro equipaggio fin da subito e poi le ondate di nemici saranno tutte una dietro all'altra, senza checkpoint.

Il gioco √® molto frenetico. Raramente avrete un attimo di pausa e non dovrete perdere concentrazione. Il mio consiglio √® capire bene il funzionamento di ciascuna arma o trappola e di sviluppare una buona strategia.

Il gioco supporta anche il controller ma secondo me √® molto pi√π giocabile con mouse/tastiera.

Il sonoro √® ben fatto, sia per quanto riguarda gli effetti sonori, sia la colonna sonora di sottofondo. A volte capita di sentire parlare gli orchetti il che √® fantastico. Unica pecca √® che spesso ci sono brevi dialoghi tra il protagonista e l'antagonista, ma questi avvengono in game ed √® difficile sentirli o farci attenzione.

Graficamente √® al top. Lo stile √® cartoonesco ed √® perfetto per un gioco che ha alla base una certa dose di ironia. I nemici volano via, si carbonizzano, si sciolgono con simpatiche animazioni ben fatte. Gli ambienti sono molto dettagliati, anche se forse un po' monotoni [i](questo per√≤ √® abbastanza normale dato che si tratta di varie stanze della stessa fortezza)[/i].

La difficolt√† non √® eccessiva. Imparando bene il gioco si possono ottenere abbastanza facilmente 5 teschi per ogni livello nella difficolt√† media e completare la modalit√† incubo. Per i 5 teschi in incubo invece bisogna essere molto bravi e pazienti.

Gli achievements sono tutti fattibili, qualcuno magari richiede un po' di impegno in pi√π ma niente di che. Forse l'unico che pu√≤ dar problemi √® la kill-streak. Questo per√≤ √® fattibile sfruttando un bug di un livello nel quale i nemici se bloccati da una barriera si raggruppano tutti vicini senza distruggerla. A quel punto basta ucciderli tutti insieme con una delle armi ad area.

Sono disponibili 2 DLC che aggiungono rispettivamente 4 strumenti (2 armi e 2 trappole) e una side-adventure di 5 livelli.

In definitiva il gioco mi ha tenuto occupato per circa 30 ore. Ho completato al 100% la campagna della storia principale, completato la modalit√† incubo (senza 100%) e giocato e finito la mini avventura. Posso dire tranquillamente che il gioco mi ha attirato fin da subito e mi √® piaciuto molto. Consiglio assolutamente!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007428578', 'num_games_owned': 1799, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1504558744}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a type of tower defence game. You have to use traps, spells and weapons to prevent massive hordes or Orcs from reaching the rift that your defending. I'm not normally a fan of the genre but I really liked this game. You can unlock a wide variety of traps and its quite fun to use them to slaughter waves of Orcs. The cartoony, over the top violence is quite funny even though putting Orcs through a gauntlet of murder machines is quite sadistic if you think about it.

This game also puts your character directly in the action so if some part of your defences isnt holding up you have the option to personally intervene and help defend using weapons and spells. I found this was quite good as it feels you have more control in shaping the situation.

My main criticism of the game is the balance of how useful each trap is. Some are only really useful in a couple of levels and I rarely used them. Others like the Swinging Mace for example are really overpowered.  Ultimately I found myself using some traps almost exclusively as they're just too effective not to use.

Overall though its a fun game and I did enjoy it quite a bit which is saying a lot as I'm typically not a fan of these types of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027946970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1498795212}
review: This game is excellent. It's a 3D tower defense game with a bit of third-person shooter. Very satisfying to solve puzzles and kill stuff. Only about 10 hours of gameplay, so be aware of that. I would buy the sequel but I don't have any friends. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198073404675', 'num_games_owned': 2302, 'num_reviews': 251, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1626621850}
review: I love tower defense games, and this one did not disappoint.  It's got a funny story and a unique twist on the traditional tower defense genre that lets you be right there in the action.  My only warning is if you have bad wrists like me, the crossbow requires constantly clicking the mouse to fire, which can cause some pain after a while.  Overall, this was a ton of fun!

Co do dubbingu no g≈Ços [b]czarodzieja i tajemniczej antagonistki[/b] by≈Çy wporzƒÖdku, ale g≈Ç√≥wny bohater no.. [h1]mog≈Ço byƒá na pewno lepiej :D[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197996899357', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1502285735}
review:
Good shit, decently challenging, my only complaint is having to spam left click with the crossbow, would have just been nicer to have it be automatic firing.

If you're in the market for a quick and easy to grasp defense game with a relatively casual atmosphere then this'll sort you right out. Only on the hardest levels did I find myself having to retry a handful of times to figure out the right formula for success.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054982103', 'num_games_owned': 1995, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 5064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5064, 'last_played': 1499189147}
review:
Eat, Sleep, Kill Orcs, Repeat... Eat, Sleep, Kill Orcs, Repeat... Eat, Sleep, Kill Orcs, Repeat... 
That, in a nutshell, is how this game goes. Absolutley loved this little game, the levels, the frustrations, the fun, is out of this world! I played this game thinking it was going to be a walk in the park, because, how hard can it be to kill a few orcs every now and again, right... WRONG!! You start a level with a plan, but everyone has a plan until they get punched in the face! Levels need to be played and once, and a strategy needs to be played out if you're going to complete the maps on nightmare mode, trust me, i should know, having completed all maps, and it truly is a nightmare! Other than that, games great, no bugs, smooth gameplay, and i loved it! 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198062798061', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1475, 'last_played': 1526894322}
review:
A third person ,,shooter" in which you can place traps and allies like in a tower defence game.
Your job is to prevent an orc-invasion into our world!
On your hand you have a sword, a crossbow, some magic, a little skill tree, quite some traps and archers and knights. From all of them, you can only select a few at the start. Traps and things in the skill tree cost money which you get from the enemies.
Also every map plays differently, as the environment could have cliffs or tiny hallways calling for other traps, as different enemies approach and as you often have the enemies approach from multiple sides!
Be aware that this type of game is much more fun than you think it is! It is a hell of a lot of fun, you shouldn¬¥t miss on it!
Even though it lacks an option to bind your keys. But it also has a great soundtrack!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053160084', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2398, 'last_played': 1558764949}
review:
This game is by far my favorite "tower defense" game. It requires a fair amount of skill in addition to clever trap placement. I loved this game so much that I completed it. To complete the game, you have to get five skulls on every level on war mage difficulty, and then you have to do it again in nightmare difficulty. Plenty of challenge, but I would just keep coming back to work on the next level and before I knew it, it was over. 

The story is fun, and not really repetitive which is surprising given how many times you have to play through it. The shooting is arguably the best part, and you can just chain together headshot after headshot for massive damage. The DLCs add some fun traps and levels as well if you couldn't get enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015706746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1499604331}
review: A tower defense game with an active shooting/melee component.  Story is very limited, but the gameplay is satisfying.  Three levels of difficulty depending on how invested you are.  The game lost a bit of its luster about mid-way through, but it's a good game to play between other more involved titles.  Did not experience any bugs or crashes during my ~13 hours played.  The base game provides 24 fortresses to defend and the DLC (Lost Adventures) adds another 5.  The Game of the Year edition is a great buy on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122163676', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1977, 'last_played': 1489260495}
review:
Non mi ero mai confrontato con un tower defense dinamico, quindi ho deciso di cominciare con un classico. 
Ho fatto davvero bene.
Come gi√† anticipato, il gioco consiste nel piazzare un diverso numero di trappole (crescente man mano che si avanza) in giro per il livello, con l'obbiettivo di uccidere pi√π ondate possibili di orchi. Noi nel mentre, armati di tutto punto, cercheremo di fare la nostra parte. 
Il gioco mi √® piaciuto davvero tanto e mi ha conquistato fin dai primi momenti. La grafica cartonesca √® particolarmente azzeccata sia l'ambientazione medievale sia per i personaggi. 
Il grado di sfida offerto non √® eccessivo e l'approccio ad ogni livello pu√≤ essere tutte le volte differente vista la buona variet√† di trappole che si sbloccheranno durante l'avanzamento. Nel caso per√≤ voleste affrontare qualcosa di pi√π impegnativo, la massima difficolt√† vi dar√† pane per i vostri denti.

In generale consiglio il gioco davvero a tutti, sia agli amanti del genere sia ai neofiti come me, visto che comunque anche la longevit√† √® variabile a seconda della vosta voglia di tritare orchi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168883388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1656199675}
review:
Um jogo acima de √≥timo, com uma jogabilidade extremamente fluida e uma intelig√™ncia artificial incrivelmente bem trabalhada, Orcs Must Die! √© um jogo perfeito, considerando a √©poca em que lan√ßado e o g√™nero ao qual pertence.
 Sua jogabilidade √© extremamente simples e comum, com cerca de 9 bot√µes apenas. A dublagem √© total e muito boa, e a historia e o protagonista s√£o engra√ßados, tornando a gameplay e a narrativa ainda melhores.
 Os √∫nicos dois pontos negativos s√£o a dificuldade de jogar em um controle, qualquer um, √© muito dif√≠cil pegar o esquema de bot√µes, e a movimenta√ß√£o fluida e r√°pida do personagem torna complicado evitar buracos e desviar dos orcs usando-se um joystick. Outro pequeno ponto negativo √© o baixo volume da dublagem, que muitas vezes fica inaud√≠vel em meio aos sons dos orcs e a m√∫sica de fundo.
 Desnecess√°rio dizer, mas esse jogo √© mais do que recomendado.

review:
Lo consiglio molto a chi ha davvero voglia di mettersi al pc e staccare la spina per un ora o due, Orcs Must Die! eccelle in tutto quello che propone, a partire dal design di mostri e trappole fino alla costruzione labirintica ed originale dei livelli, capaci di regalare un buon grado di sfida anche ai giocatori pi√π esperti. Un acquisto consigliato dunque, che vede come unico grande difetto l'assenza di una modalit√† multiplayer, fattore che avrebbe permesso al titolo di fare un meritato salto di qualit√†.
Decine e decine di trappole da usare
Grafica stile "cartoon"
Buon livello di sfida.. 
Consigliatissimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005406191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1497863885}
review:
Greetings Everyone!  So, Orcs Must Die is a bit of an oldie but I still enjoyed my time through memory lane with it.  If you didn‚Äôt know OMD is kind of a tower defense game where you play as a War Mage; someone who has access to spells, weapons and traps to defeat waves of orcs that are trying to get to your heart.  If they get to it they will damage it so it is your job to use your tools to kill them before they do.

Death to Orcs:  As the title suggests your primary goal is to kill orcs‚Ä¶a lot.  But you have a few interesting ways to do this.  Yes you can shoot or stab them but the primary point of the game is to use traps you set up to combo and kill them for more points.  I find this more enjoyable than even shooting them and enjoyed creating interesting combos to bounce orcs around into amusing death contraptions.

Need not Apply:  One minor gripe I have for this game is how limited it is; this is primarily fixed in the sequel (spoiler alert) but you are really only given weapons to tidy up and it is next to impossible to play as a dedicated ‚Äòfighter‚Äô.  In addition, aside from the campaign and some DLC missions there really isn‚Äôt much to do unless you like leader boards.  The game doesn‚Äôt come with any multiplayer but I find myself not really caring all that much‚Ä¶the game is still very fun to play!

Look how Awesome I am:  The game has a story; albeit a small one.  One that I actually enjoyed and was amused with; of course you could argue for more but I feel the game completed exactly what it was trying to do.  Not sure how I‚Äôd improve on the raw mechanics aside from some of the issues I mentioned above.  Most of which are hindsight kind of issues; ones that I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôd think of until after the first game was finished.

After all is said and done I feel this is one of those games you just need in your library.  Sale or not I‚Äôd buy it and play around with it; even if you aren‚Äôt a tower defense player you may find something here you like.  Although, if you want to play with your friends you may just want to skip to the sequel which I feel improved on the game in every way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262879890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1558810430}
review:
It's a simple, intuitive, and fun hybrid of third-person shooter, and tower defense.  I could say more about the gameplay, but the developer has helpfully provided a free demo version. 

Great game, but hard for me to recommend because I haven't touched it since getting into the sequel.  Sequel adds co-op, fixes everything annoying about the skill progression, and has more useful audio warnings when especially dangerous enemies spawn.

Worth buying when it's on sale or in a bundle, just because owning it unlocks the classic map pack in OMD2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097722549', 'num_games_owned': 1597, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1495926779}
review: Very fun game and every trap is useful in its own way. There is a lot of levels which all brings new things to the table, and it keeps it from getting repetitive. It is also somewhat of a strategy game, due to the fact that you need to use different traps in different levels to actually succeed. I have seen some reviews describring guardians as less powerful than traps, but that is not always true. The key is to find levels where you can place archers where the orcs can¬¥t hit them. There exist a few of those levels and it is very satisfying to just see orcs get destroyed by fire arrows. So in conclusion, Orcs must die is a must have when it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990329200', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1505, 'last_played': 1495991560}
review:
Spa√üiges, suchterzeugendes Spiel.

Positiv:

+ Spielprinzip aus Mischung von 3D-Shooter und Tower-Defense ist genial.
+ Gameplay super fl√ºssig und pr√§zise.
+ Level dauern maximal 15 Minuten - perfekt f√ºr eine Runde zwischendurch.
+ Es gibt meist sehr viele Wege, ein Level zu meistern - sehr abwechslungsreich.
+ Es macht extrem Spa√ü, verschiedene Fallen+ und Waffenkombinationen zu testen.
+ Normaler Modus fordernd, aber nicht zu schwer.
+ Albtraum-Modus teilweise richtig knackig - wenn in jedem Level das Maximum von 5 Sch√§deln herausgeholt werden soll, kann das richtig frustig werden.
+ Humor - ich musste bei einigen Spr√ºchen der Orks oder des Protagonisten ziemlich lachen.

Negativ:

- Kein richtiges Tutotial, keine Hinweis-Texte. So wurde mir z.B. erst irgendwann im sp√§teren Spielverlauf klar, dass der eigene Tod Spalten-Punkte kostet (ich bin teilweise fast durchgedreht, weil ich der Meinung war, mir w√§re irgendwo ein Ork durchgeschlupft). Auch fehlten mir Angaben zu den Waffen (was machen die Sekund√§r-Funktionen?. Muss man alles selbst testen.
- Das Platzieren der Fallen gestaltet sich manchmal etwas hakelig (PC).
- Das Spiel ist extrem hektisch, man hat (zumindest auf Albtraum-Niveau) quasi keine Sekunde Pause. Zuschauen, wie die Fallen die Gegner-Horden dezimieren ist nicht drin, man muss durchgehend mitk√§mpfen. Das ist vielleicht nicht f√ºr jeden Strategie-Fan etwas.
- Story extrem rudiment√§r (was mich allerdings nicht gest√∂rt hat - hier steht absolut das Gameplay im Fordergrund).

author: {'steamid': '76561198103346917', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1495392414}
review:
Good action game!
8/10

+ Good graphics and visual effects.
+ Good music and sound effects.
+ Good humor.
+ Great gameplay.
+ Good combat system.

No open world, no deep storyline, no epic super chosen-one hero, no loot and stats, no quests... Finally, something new in the game industry!

review: Orcs Must Die is a great 1st person tower defense game. The levels are challenging but not too challenging. There are many ways to go about defending each level and you begin to have a preference for certain traps. If you like tower defense games try this out! 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198292325099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1557788721}
review: This game is fun! If you're bored of classic tower defense, buy this fun spin on the genre. This game is more trap based and also throws you into the fray to whack things yourself. May seem dorky, and is, but in all the right ways. A must-play for Tower defense junkies! (Also, the 3 extra bucks for the DLC is definatly worth it New traps and maps are always great!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198075849015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 2974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1590925015}
review:
80/100 ..solid action-rpg TD-kind of game!
Playthrough time ~10-15 hours for those 24 Levels
(~40-50 hours for 80% Archievements)

PRO:
-Combo-kills
-funny talk from the mage-novice
-excellent game to kill your mouse.. and dozens of hours ;)
-solid gfx, fast and no bugs
-all Friends are shown in Top10 Ranking List for each Level
-Playerbase of 500k+ (Ranking Boards)

CON:
-quite hard to get a perfect score in War-mage difficulty^^
-units (eg Archers) are much worse than traps
-no Save-option for preferred Traps/Skills
-difficulty-mode decides your level-reward (->limits your upgrading)
-only Solo-mode (no Multiplayer!)
-higher difficulties force a certain playstyle for the max of 5 skulls, therefore it gets boring trying again and again, just to see after 10min that it doesn¬¥t work, since 1 minion slipped through ;((

-> Worth it if you like arena and RTS games! Quite challenging !!!
Otherwise better TD games out there, since this seems very much like the Solo-version of a typical Coop-Shooter. For Multiplayer-fights go for "Orcs must die - UNCHAINED" (Free to Play)..

author: {'steamid': '76561198155219276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1572093398}
review:
It's a good game!

There's something cathartic about killing orcs with the traps that you have set. I have enjoyed playing through the campaign as it moves up on difficulty while getting and improving better traps. I have yet to complete the Nightmare mode but the first few nightmare levels are very challenging to players that have beaten the game on Warmage or Apprentice Difficulty

However, some people might see it as repetitive or boring since you just put traps and stand on the other side as orcs walk to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1491424307}
review:
Good game!

I played this game 6 years ago. I have good feelings about this game. I have seen the game on a sale, so i wanted to give a try one more time.

The graphics for six year old game still looks pretty nice. There is nothing else to say about it.

Let's speak about the most interesting part of this game. Gameplay is addictive. Very very addictive. You control a hero like in FPS games. You can move, jump and shoot. Also, you can put different traps at the field to make your enemies' life harder.

So, the rules are simples. Place traps, attack with your hero, don't let orcs reach the portal. That's all. And, yeah, it's very addictive gameplay.


You unlock new traps and enemies become tougher and more varied with every new level. So, the game has a lot of content and hours of gameplay. I can say for surely, the game is good!

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=899069691
I just want to write here about minuses of this game so you will be aware.

Firstly, there is no difficulty settings. And the game is easy. Actually, there is Nightmare mode, but youcan't play it until you pass the campaign on Normal. So if you are hardcore player when the game won't be challenging for you. For example, i have passed first 5 levels using only hero without traps. So, if you are Dota player or similar - this game ll be boring for you.

Secondly, yeah, every new level is slightly different from the previous, but, anyway, they are the same: 1-2 entrances and 1-2 exits. So i condider the level design of this game is below average.
Also, the bestiary is poor. You will fight with 1 orc type (with different skins) during the first 3 missions. I really want more diversity in the enemies' units.

Overall, the game is good. It's addictive and enjoyable. You should give it a try. 
The price tag for 6 year old game is too high, but I can recommend this game with 70% or higher discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031483527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1494006228}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034795432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1957, 'last_played': 1493582122}
review:
Lots of fun! The first few traps won't be very exciting (IMO), but do stick around because the game gets more fun as you unlock more traps and spells. You can get pretty creative with the ways you can deal with the orcs. You will often be forced to change your strategy from one map to another, which helps keep the game fresh. The story is very simple, but the narration can be entertaining.

Orcs Must Die! is a great game, overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008580123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 371, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1492023018}
review:
Honestly... this game is REALLY funny, hectic, hack and slash strategic tower RPG defense game!
System is simple. You are controlling a hero... for real surprisingly... who is in the dungeon and who is trying to protect a magical portal against really huge orc hordes.
To stop them You can use a really lot of variable traps / defensive systems + also a magic and weapons (crossbow / pike).
My favourite: sucking grinder : ), explosive scarecrows, hypnotic mushrooms
But... You have also a little RPG system there too, which can improve your traps, weapons aor your hero.
The game rounds are fast and hastly in a good way.
So... try it. It is not expensive game and it is a really good funny challenge-game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098185561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1747, 'last_played': 1491457223}
review:
This game is by far one of the best tower defence games ever made. There are many things that make Orcs Must Die stand out from other tower defence titles such as:
[list]
[*] varied traps and weapons
[*] a good amount of stages
[*] a good unlock system
[*] unique theme
[*] good voice acting
[*] good art style and animations
[/list]

The ''story'' is meh but doesn't hurt the game overall and I'm surprised that a tower defence game has a story that's even ok.

The only major con of this game is the fact that there isn't multiplayer. This has been capitalized on in the sequel but some of the levels in this game would be perfect for co-op play.

This game is the perfect segway for the somewhat more complicated Orcs Must Die 2 and is good for getting into the series as it is simpler and cheaper (or if you don't have any friends to play the sequel with).

author: {'steamid': '76561198035128231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1493466866}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a Third Person Shooter Tower Defense, where you are a battle mage fighting against wavs of (guess what?) orcs.

I recommend it because of the humor inside that permeates this game, the increasing challenge given by levels, and the incredible possibility to solve any level in any way you think is the best: think of every map as a problem which has different solutions!

I enjoyed very much the variety of maps, and the possibility to improve in game your way of pushing back hordes (increasing traps or weapons utility). Every trap has a well given reason to be used, and so every weapon.
A big help is given by Guardians, NPC units that can be summoned for goods.

If you like Tower Dfense strategy game, but you wish for a bit more of action, here is your game!

Rate: 8.5/10. A point and a half missing because of the low personalisation/improvement of traps and because of the little longevity of this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960912290', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1401781445}
review: An escalating dungeon defense game. Fun at first, but like virtually ALL defense games, the enemies strength grows faster than your capacity to defend and eventually you'll lose because of bad math and no other reason. If you're looking at this and really into the idea though, I highly recommend you check out Dungeon Defenders 2 instead, it's multiplayer and very very well balanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034165301', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1476147586}
review:
Vorweg muss ich eins festhalten: Wenn ich von Tower-Defense-Games h√∂re, betrachte ich es immer zugleich mit einem weinenden und einem lachenden Auge. Ich komme aus einer Zeit, in der ich noch die so ziemlich ersten 3D-Tower-Defenses gezockt habe wie bspw. die zahlreichen DOTA-Mods von Warcraft 3. Sp√§ter kam dann irgendwann League Of Legends, welches ich ebenfalls einige Jahre aktiv gespielt habe. Diese gro√üen Vorrreiter machen es mir schwer, Games die das Genre dann erst im Nachhinein angehen, von Vornherein ernst zu nehmen oder als Konkurrenz zu betrachten.

Nun aber zum eigentlich wichtigen Spiel. Orcs Must Die war f√ºr mich als es rauskam eben genau das. Ein Spiel das sich auf dem Erfolg anderer ausruht und das Ganze um ein Action-RPG-Element erweitert. Jetzt, Jahre sp√§ter, hat man mich dazu √ºberredet bekommen, dem OMD-Franchise eine Chance zu geben, um mal ein vern√ºnftiges Koop-Spiel zu haben, welche einige Spielstunden Spa√ü garantiert. Der erste OMD-Teil hat zwar leider noch keinen Koop, bietet sich deswegen aber geradezu an die Spielmechanik zu lernen und zu lernen alleine klarzukommen. Den wenn man das schafft ist jeder weitere Koop im darauffolgenden Teil ein Klacks, da grundlegende Gameplay-Mechaniken hier weitestgehend beibehalten wurden.

Bei OMD geht es darum, sich euch entgegenstellende Orkhorden mit Hilfe eures Helden (wo ihr √ºbrigens auch nur einen von habt), und entwaiger Fallen zu schnetzeln. Im Groben ist es immer wieder ausprobieren oder man ist mit einer wirklich guten Vorstellungsgabe gesegnet.
Die Kampagne ist in 3 Kapitel aufgeteilt, wobei nicht wirklich von einer Story geredet werden kann. Die witzigen Spr√ºche, die es immer wieder gibt, sind allerdings ganz einfallsreich.
Das Spiel macht schon Laune. Der Schwierigkeitgrad kann auch ganz schon heftig werden!
Richtig Spa√ü macht es dann allerdings erst zu zweit im 2. Teil.


Preisempfehlung: 3‚Ç¨ inkl. aller DLC's

author: {'steamid': '76561197999282226', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1355817600}
review:
I'm not a huge fan of Tower Defense games in general, but Orcs Must Die managed to catch my attention some years back and I'm glad it did.

The game functions like a combination of Tower Defense and Third Person shooter, much like a certain dungeon defending other game that is absolute garbage and will not be discussed in this review. As you make your way through levels, by accomplishing various feats you gain Skulls that you can use to unlock and upgrade traps and guardians you can place in the levels, as well as unlock and upgrade gear for the Warmage Maximillian, who you run around fighting with while your maze does its work.

Every level serves up its own array of challenges but for the most part there's a solid strategy to be found in the basic sort of "put up barricades so there's only one bottleneck, then shove them through as many traps as possible." On Nightmare mode that attitude changes entirely, but for the game's normal mode, that basic strategy will get you through pretty much the entir game with only a few rough spots.

Enemies run the rnage from a bunch of orc types, who just blindly run at the Rift, to kobolds, who ignore everything and just attack the rift, to gnolls, who tend to ignore everything else and just come to kill you. There's also Giants, Trolls,and Ogres who are massive lumbering foes who are barely stopped by any traps and require immediate attention or prolonged trap work to kill. Frantically rebuilding your mazes while hacking and blasting away at orcs is a lot of fun no matter how you slice it.

The game's not overly replayable, IMO, unless you're going to max out five skulls on every single level on both difficulties, but if you do want to do that, there's plenty of playtime ahead of you. If you're interested in score and leaderboards, the game also does have that, but I wasn't personally interested in it. Some of the levels are very challenging though, especially in Nightmare, and unless you suss out the level's specific trick, especially on Nightmare, getting 5 skulls can seem like an impossible task. At this point the game becomes as much a puzzle as it does a Tower Defense hack and slash game. You can also go back to older levels with the new unlocked trap gear and marvel at how your upgraded traps smash through orcs like so many dominos while the Warmage gets to watch.

There's a reason this first game spawned a sequel, a F2P MMo, and even a boardgame: It's because the game is a whole lot of fun. The story isn't anything amazing, and mostly serves as a backdrop for why there's orcs everywhere (You're the guardian of a Rift in a massive castle, and you're shutting them all to stop the Sorceress from sending armies through.), but that's fine. The only real downside to the game is that there's no multiplayer.... but hey, the sequel has multiplayer! So play this one to get the background and get your feet wet, then jump in with some friends into Orcs Must Die 2: Bigger and Better-er. Absolutely recommended.

review:
Bei "Orcs Must Die!" eigentlich um eine Art Tower-Defense-Spiel in einem Fantasie Universum. Mit Magie und Orcs und Ogern und Kobolden etc. 

Man steuert seinen Protagonisten, einen etwas d√ºmmlichen aber schwer von sich √ºberzeugten Kampfmagier. Der muss in aneinander gereihten Missionen daf√ºr sorgen, magische Spalte vor den Monstern zu bewachen. So weit so einfach. 
Die Monster werden von mal zu mal vielf√§ltiger, und jedes Vieh braucht seine eigene Taktik. Auch bietet das Areal oft Anlass zum umplanen. 

Die Story ist ganz nett erz√§hlt, bietet aber wenig Wiederspielwert und ist sonst eher platt. Allerdings entbehrt das Ganze nicht den Charme des Kriegsmagiers und seiner Selbstverliebtheit. Seine Spr√ºche die er ihm Kampf immer wieder zum Besten gibt, wiederholen sich zwar recht h√§ufig, und trotzdem musste ich immer wieder schmunzeln.

Die Spielmechanik hat es daf√ºr in sich. Sp√§testens nach der 6 Mission zieht der Schwierigkeitsgrad an. Da sollte man sich schon sicher sein, wo und wie man die Fallen einsetzt. Wie eingangs schon erw√§hnt, positioniert man mit einem Startkapital Fallen in der Spielwelt und macht so den Orcs das Leben schwer bzw. beendet es. Aber man muss auch mit seiner Armbrust gut mithelfen. Nur dabei stehen und zukucken ist nicht. 

Das Spiel ist von mir aus zu empfehlen. Ist ein netter Pausenf√ºller und nimmt sich nicht ganz so ernst. Wenn's mal in einem Sale g√ºnstig her geht, zugreifen.

Euer Weltraumdackel

review: Orcs Must Die! (and it's sequel) are some of the best "hidden gems" on Steam. The games are hilarious, and the tower defense action is very enjoyable. Just so you're aware: the levels are nearly impossible without the use of barricades. With them, however, the game becomes fairly easy.

review:
This is a great game, perhaps not all the time, but when you feel like Aragorn,(lets hunt some orc) this is a perfect game.
you play as a wizard and you can go slice and dice with a sword staff, but you also get hit more that way. this is definatly a good buy on steam sale,(i got it 90% off i think).
either way, if you decide to play this tower defence, you will have fun.
appologies for poor spelling and punctuation.

review: This is a form of tower defense games where you setup traps and you use yourself to deflect the enemies from defeating you. i gotta say its pleasant to see orcs tossed into acid, or minced meat orcs, burned, orcs etc. there are a few ways to deal with them. there are a few levels 3 difficulties and a few combos of how to do things. always look at the mobs before starting so you can plan.

review:
Un juego de defensa de torretas muy entretenido y c√≥mico. Tiene una duraci√≥n moderada y m√°s de cuarenta horas si pretendes sacarlo al 100% con el DLC. Lo mejor son los comentarios del protagonista y el manejo es sencillo. Recomendado si te gusta el g√©nero y tambi√©n para aquellos que nunca lo han jugado. El arma principal es una ballesta, por lo que aparte de poner trampas puedes demostrar tus habilidades de tiro con resultados muy buenos.

Por decir algo malo, hay armas y trampas que son prescindibles, yo me he terminado el juego al 100% y hay trampas que jam√°s he usado.

review:

- on ne tire pas toujours l√† o√π l'on vise lorsqu'on se trouve sur un escalier
- sur la minicarte, les monstres qui ne sont pas au m√™me √©tage sont presque invisibles, ils apparaissent en rouge sombre transparent sur un fond sombre. Souvent g√™nant !
- les r√©pliques des personnages, - et il y en a peu mais bien - sont souvent inaudibles √† cause des bruits d'ambiance de pose de pi√®ge, des explosions et des cris des orques. Il aurait fallu les r√©duire pendant que les personnages parlent. L√†, on rate une bonne partie de l'histoire.

review:
Game is unplayable. That's not hyperbole. The game is unplayable. You click "play" and it goes to black screen, puts up an error message that you can't read (because the screen is black) and if you click any button it closes. Game is unplayable. I requested a refund, but couldn't get it because I bought the game at a sale, and didn't run it right away to see if it even functioned as an executable that would make a game appear on my computer. 

DO. NOT. BUY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001117740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1484825218}
review:
It's super fun and addictive and after being out for over 5 years now, I'd have thought they would have FINALLY allowed changing binds/keys, but alas no they haven't and I can't recommend this game as this is a massively fatal flaw in the delivery of the game as a package.

Clearly they've taken the time to make the game fun an engaging, so it boggles the mind as to why they didn't include something extremely simple like customisable binds.

Then to add insult to injury, they've ignored the MANY forum and user requests to add this feature to the game over the years too.

*sigh*

author: {'steamid': '76561198237514536', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1484515007}
review:
I was sold on the idea of using savage and over the top traps against an endless parade of orcs, and the game certainly delivers. 

Sending orcs cartwheeling into lava rivers was fun, sure, but the real joy for me came from finding the optimal way to exploit the level's layout for maximum damage. This is where Orcs Must Die! really shines through - the stages of careful planning at each level and the subsequent circus of death that follows after like some sadistic reward for your troubles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999668580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1983, 'last_played': 1481113989}
review:
Overall Score 8/10

Fun factor 8/10
Control and Gameplay 8/10
Graphics 8/10
Sound 8/10
Replayability 8/10

As tower defense games go this is one of the better ones I've played, coming out as a steampunk-isk genera. Mixing magic with machinery giving you some cool traps and weapon. As for difficulty it's pretty laid back and requires a small amount of strategy and skill something you can casually play for hours of fun. I'm going to admit I rushed through a lot of the levels and tried quite a bit more than the average player would have. It still took me 30+ hours to grab every achievement and finish all the levels and unlock all trap upgrades. If you can pick it up for 50%-90% off, you won't regret it as it‚Äôs well worth the time and money spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998119247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1483801308}
review:
Robot Entertainment have produced a slick action game here based around the popular tower defence genre. This game follows the traditional tower defence script of building traps to stop a constant stream of enemy foe but introduces player spells and weapons to assist.
Far from becoming confused the game merges the 2 styles effortlessly, there are occasions when building an intricate series of diversions and traps is the order of the day and other times when equipping your poking stick and some fire gauntlets is required to smite the raging hordes.
The game follows a steady learning curve, those new to tower defense games will be handheld throughout the first stages and with the game introducing new skills and abilities as you go along you will never feel overwhelmed at the pace.
The games real charm rests in the war mage himself, the character story is developed via cut scenes between levels, he's equipped with a few witty one liners that he will dole out at various times and you cant help but like the guy!
The graphics are good, the music is solid and atmospheric . Some people will play through it once but with the introduction of the "skull ranking" system many will replay the levels in order to 5 skull them. In this game skulls mean upgrades and upgrades means more dead orcs! ... This game takes its place as one of the best tower defence games available today. With the announcement of a sequel on the way things are looking good for Robot Entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107109105', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1527442848}
review:
[b]Orcs must die[/b] belongs to a genre that is obviously meant to be have repetitiveness, but in a good way so no reason to explain that . You have to stop horde of ogres from getting into some kind of orb that powers you and the valley. Use traps, weapons, guardians and powers to stop the horde. It may sound boring but trust me you'll love it. It has a bit of story that continues on OMD 2! so it is recommended to buy both on bundle.
+ Play as you wish. First 2 levels are meant to teach you but after that kill them however you want.
+ Plenty of creative environment kills available
+ Increasing difficulty doesn't mean the health bar will just increase. Instead, a lot of varied types of ogres come that requires good knowledge of weapons that you'll pick before starting the stage
+ Creative weapons
+ Funny
+ Really cheap on sale

-Just when you think you have the grip, the game ends
-No boss ending, kill the last horde and the game will just end after a cutscene

~Stages are not sorted according to difficulty well. There are difficult levels and some dead easy levels right after that. But maybe thats how they want it to be.

[b]Overall I give this game 7/10 Nick Cage and a big heeeeehaw! [/b]

review:
This is a fun singleplayer tower defense game. You are gifted with new tricks and learn to refine their uses to achieve nothing less than 5skulls! bladestaff+vampire glove are killer combo and once you get guardians and really make use of the weaver cars. The combo possibilities are endless they are mostly determined by the level layout. 

No fun with friends and fun for kids if they can handle killing monsters.
