author: {'steamid': '76561198194599329', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1650, 'last_played': 1479520872}
review:
An utterly fun game, Orcs Must Die! combines FPS with placing down traps. Probably not a new idea, but that doesn't in any way, shape, or form detract from the enjoyability, so let's get into some pros and cons.

Pros
-It has some story elements (a big thing with me). This game could have gone without story altogether and still been fun, but the developers decided to spice it up! I mean, sure it's a pretty basic story, but, considering the game genre, I'll consider it a pro.
-Responsive and intuitive controls that are easy to learn and get the hang of.
-Normal (Warmage) difficulty getting boring? Try Nightmare difficulty for the challenge you crave.
-Great music and graphics.
-Great replayability across most levels (I say most because the first level, even on Nightmare, will get easy pretty quick).
-Funny commentary from the characters.
-DLC adds new weapons, traps, and levels.

Cons
-No multiplayer. If you're not into that then this point is moot.
-Only one character and set of weapons/traps.
-DLC costs money. Might be a con to some. I wasn't personally bothered by it, but, then again, I probably got it on sale 'cause I'm cheap like that.

So, yeah, that's all I got. So go get it. It's worth its full price, but if you want to get it on sale, that's understandable. Anyways, it's a great game I would recommend to just about everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253126354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1483313106}
review:
Orcs Must Die! √â um Tower Defense (g√™nero onde o objetivo √© impedir que os advers√°rios percorram um mapa e atinjam determinado ponto especifico) de a√ß√£o e estrat√©gia, com vis√£o em terceira pessoa e combate em tempo real para um jogador. Foi desenvolvido e publicado pela Robot Entertainment, respons√°vel por jogos como Age of Empires Online e Hero Academy, e lan√ßado somente em formato digital para Xbox 360 e PC em Outubro de 2011.

O enredo gira em torno da Ordem dos Magos de Guerra, um grupo de magos, respons√°veis por proteger as Fortalezas da invas√£o de Orcs (e outros monstros), para que eles n√£o atravessem as Rupturas localizadas dentro delas, estas s√£o a fontes de poder m√°gico vital para manter a vida na terra e um portal entre o mundo dos homens e dos Orcs. A hist√≥ria se inicia quando o Velho Mestre (e narrador) sofre um acidente ao defender uma das Fortalezas e aparentemente morre, cabendo ent√£o ao seu aprendiz (o protagonista do jogo, chamado apenas de o Mago de Guerra), defender as fortalezas em seu lugar, lutando contra as invas√µes crescentes e cada vez mais organizadas dos Orcs.

O jogo n√£o possui uma hist√≥ria profunda e detalhada, apenas um conceito, que √© uma justificativa para os acontecimentos do jogo, o foco principal √© a jogabilidade. O enredo √© contato atrav√©s de cutscenes com imagens est√°ticas ao fim de cada ato, e atrav√©s de di√°logos do protagonista ao inicio de cada fase. A trama √© focada no humor muitas vezes negro. O Mago de Guerra √© um personagem muito carism√°tico, seus coment√°rios e di√°logos durante o gameplay s√£o realmente bem engra√ßados.

O jogo possui um total de vinte e quatro fazes, dispostas em tr√™s atos. Voc√™ come√ßa cada fase dentro de uma fortaleza diferente, o objetivo √© impedir que os Orcs atravessem as Rupturas, e voc√™ tem uma certa quantidade de pontos de Ruptura dependendo da faze, voc√™ perde pontos caso algum inimigo atravesse ou voc√™ morra, se estes pontos chegarem a zero √© Game Over e vai ter que recome√ßar toda a faze novamente. Os inimigos surgem em hordas, cada faze tem um numero diferente de hordas, e voc√™ tem um intervalo de dez segundos (tr√™s no modo pesadelo) entre uma e outra, e alguns momentos de pausa para se organizar, comprar seus itens e posicionar melhor suas defesas.

Para conter os inimigos voc√™ tem um arsenal de armas, magias, guardi√µes (que s√£o NPCs que te auxiliam ao longo da partida) e principalmente armadilhas com diversos efeitos e usos diferentes a sua disposi√ß√£o, que podem ser melhorados com a utiliza√ß√£o de caveiras dadas ao fim de cada faze, al√©m de tecel√µes que servem para melhorar suas habilidades. Uma boa estrat√©gia √© vital para vencer, voc√™ deve estudar muito bem a faze antes do inicio da partida, fazer um bom posicionamento de cada armadilha ou guardi√£o durante as fazes √© essencial para conter os advers√°rios. Mas apenas isso n√£o basta para segura-los, √© necess√°rio utilizar armas e magias, e ser r√°pido e preciso, tomando cuidado para n√£o levar muitos golpes, pois seu personagem √© muito fr√°gil e procurar controlar seu reservat√≥rio de Magia para que ela n√£o se esgote, felizmente voc√™ pode se recuperar rapidamente chegando perto de uma Ruptura.

Os inimigos do jogo s√£o bem variados desde Orcs normais, Kobolds pequenos e fracos, passando pelos mortais Gnolls, at√© grandes e poderosos Ogros, entre muitos outros, cada um com comportamentos e habilidades diferentes. Por isso √© bom tomar cuidado, al√©m de inimigos mais poderosos causarem mais dano, custam mais pontos de Ruptura.

O gameplay √© r√°pido e fren√©tico, voc√™ vai se ver muitas vezes correndo de um lado pelo outro pela faze, algumas com v√°rios caminhos, a fim de conter seus advers√°rios, felizmente o jogo responde muito bem aos comandos, tocar de armas, para armadilhas ou magias √© r√°pido e feito alternando as teclas num√©ricas ou scrolll do mouse (e gatilhos no caso do controle), tornando o jogo r√°pido e din√¢mico.

A ambienta√ß√£o do jogo √© por vezes repetitiva as fortalezas s√£o bem parecidas umas com as outras, com mudan√ßas de design em cada faze, mas sempre com mesmo visual, apesar disso elas s√£o bem feitas e detalhadas. Os gr√°ficos do jogo seguem o estilo cartunizado, as cores s√£o vivas e combinam muito bem com todo o resto, apesar disso a viol√™ncia gr√°fica √© moderada, com Orcs sendo fatiado e suas partes voando pelo cen√°rio (e desaparecendo logo em seguida).

O jogo apresenta total localiza√ß√£o em nosso idioma, com menus e dublagem em portugu√™s, sendo um dos pioneiros na Steam nesse quesito, o que para um jogo independente √© algo digno de respeito. E de fato a dublagem √© excelente, todo o di√°logos e piadas foram muito bem executadas, e n√£o possuem qualquer erro, al√©m das vozes combinarem muito bem. A ressalva fica por conta do gameplay com frases sendo repetidas a exaust√£o, o que chateia um pouco, mas nada que tire o brilho do jogo. A trilha sonora apesar de limitada cumpre seu papel nada de especular, ela √© agitada nos momentos de combate e calma nos demais momentos.

Orcs Must Die! √© um jogo bem divertido e desafiador que vai proporcionar v√°rias horas de divers√£o, ele pode parecer dif√≠cil a primeira vista, mas a medida que voc√™ progride aprende, ganhas novos itens e habilidades e tra√ßa estrat√©gias ele se torna bem mais f√°cil. Ele seria melhor √© mais completo com um modo multiplayer, que foi adicionado em sua sequencia Orcs Must Die! 2, mas ainda sim √© um jogo excelente e merece ser jogado, principalmente se voc√™ gosta de a√ß√£o e estrat√©gia. Orcs Must Die! custa R$ 16,99 a vers√£o normal e R$ 21,99 a vers√£o GOTY com todas as DLCs.

DLCs:

O jogo possui duas DLCs, j√° inclusas na vers√£o GOTY Edition:

Orcs Must Die! - Lost Adventures, inclui mais cinco fases que expandem o jogo original, elas s√£o bem mais desafiadoras que as da campanha principal, e s√£o uma boa pedida quem quer um pouco mais de desafio ou caveiras extras para melhorar seus itens. Al√©m disso jogo apresenta dois novos inimigos o Morcego de Gelo e o Mago Ciclope, e um novo item.

Orcs Must Die! - Artifacts of Power, que acrescenta duas novas armas e duas novas armadilhas.

Aqueles que fizeram a pr√© compra do jogo receberam a roupa alternativa Cavaleiro da Ordem, que nunca foi lan√ßada via DLC. Todos os monstros, armas e roupas, lan√ßadas como conte√∫do adicional neste jogo vieram por padr√£o em Orcs Must Die! 2.

O QUE PODE AGRADAR:

- Jogo viciante e realmente divertido, rende muitas horas de gameplay.
- Legendas e dublagem totalmente em portugu√™s brasileiro, que ficaram muito boas por sinal.
- O jogo √© realmente leve e possui excelente otimiza√ß√£o, n√£o h√° quedas de FPS mesmo com a grande quantidade de elementos na tela ao mesmo tempo.

O QUE PODE DESAGRADAR:

- Di√°logos muitas vezes repetitivos durante o jogo.
- A ambienta√ß√£o tem poucas varia√ß√µes entre as fases.
- Aus√™ncia de um modo multiplayer, muito comum neste g√™nero de jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033300542', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1477591760}
review:
Orc must die

 -Jugabilidad: Posee una duraci√≥n un poco corta ya que solo tiene la campa√±a y me la he pasado solo en 8 h y eso que he repetido muchos niveles para conseguir mejor puntuaci√≥n. Al solo tener la corta campa√±a como √∫nico modo de juego le resta muchos puntos al juego ya que se le podr√≠a sacar mucho partido si tuviese un modo cooperativo o un modo de supervivencia de aguantar rondas hasta perder, tambi√©n Un modo duelo de enfrentarnos contra alguien en online y quien aguante m√°s rondas gana. Son necesarias m√°s actualizaciones en las trampas y m√°s armas ya que hay poca variedad pero tiene una buena variedad de enemigos y de trampas (La mayor√≠a de lo que le falta a este en Orc must die 2 lo tiene). Por todo ello punt√∫o este apartado con un 6.5

-Tecnolog√≠a: Este juego funciona sin ning√∫n problema, sin ca√≠das de frames ni nada por el estilo. Los efectos de luz y sombreados est√°n bien. Punt√∫o este apartado con un 7.  

-Gr√°ficos: Est√°n muy bien siendo gr√°ficos caricaturescos que combinan muy bien con este juego tower defense. En todo el juego no he tenido problemas con ninguna textura. Las animaciones del juego est√°n muy bien tanto las de las trampas, armas, enemigos, etc‚Ä¶ Punt√∫o este apartado con un 8.  

-Sonido: Tiene una banda sonora muy buena, todas las canciones que han puesto en los niveles me han encantado y no me han resultado repetitivas. Los efectos sonoros de las trampas, las armas y los orcos est√°n muy bien. El doblaje a espa√±ol me ha resultado impecable ya que las voces que ten√≠an cada personaje les quedaban muy bien. Punt√∫o este apartado con un 9.

-Innovaci√≥n: Lo innovador de este juego es que ha mezclado los g√©neros de acci√≥n en tercera persona y tower defense y les ha quedado genial aunque en ese mismo a√±o hay otro juego que ha mezclado esos dos g√©neros que se llama Sanctum (juego que no lo he jugado pero tiene buena pinta). Hay que  destacar los enemigos voladores que nos har√°n tener que centrarnos no solo en las trampas a ras de suelo, tambi√©n a la altura adecuada para que alcancen a los enemigos que vuelan. Punt√∫o este apartado con un 8.



Finalmente este juego recibe, desde un punto de vista cr√≠tico, un merecido 7.5.

review: Orcs Must Die! is a rare gem. It's basically a fantasy tower defense game with no way to see the whole strategic battlefield at once. Instead you run around like crazy, setting out traps for the bad Orcs and Ogres that burst out of the doors to save the world as a non-talented wizard apprentice. IMHO it's better than the second part as it's really pure and straight fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014333343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2859, 'last_played': 1626590474}
review:
20 years ago Lemmings one of the most popular video games of its time saw you guide and eventually rescue cute little suicidal rascals through a plethora of destructible landscapes. Now fully fleshed out in a 3 dimensional take on what made this game so fun has been mastered. The wit, premise, control, Ui, art style, characters, gameplay, even plot in what is essentially a tower defence game is superb. I haven't played Nintendo in a long time but this game distinctly reminds me of its charm, knowingness and ability to throw you in the deep end of fun.

Orcs Must Die hard mode aptly named Nightmare and the games achievements offer re-playability to OMD on par with Super Meat Boy one false move and you have to try your best again. The nail biting choices you have to make with your fully loaded arsenal are many. Usually these choices will make themselves self evident: a little nook for archers where they oversee a choke point or noticing you will be facing fire dragons you choose the ice ring knowing they a vulnerable to it. But sometimes you will be forced to change your tactics in the face of defeat. It's a mad house at times: fine tuning, timing and running about building, fixing and fending off the horde until your sophisticated blender of death is running at optimum efficiency.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027873712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1480022655}
review:
This game is not a casual game. OMD is deceptively challenging and ramps in difficulty pretty quickly in only a few levels; it's nothing rage inducing unless you are a perfectionist seeking a perfect skull score on each level (compare it to getting full stars in Angry Birds). 

At it's core it's an ultra-competitive score attack arcade game and is best played as a marathon rather than in short bursts as you'll have time to warm up and eventually play at your best. 

Pros:
- Smooth gameplay
- No spoonfeeding
- Great balance between budgetting, planning, setting up traps and commencing the action
- Replay value

Cons:
The game has a number of annoyances but nothing worthy of including in this review.
Simply put they could have tweaked certain things a bit more for my taste.

Note: If you don't have a strong fan for your PC be wary of overheating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014422409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3490, 'last_played': 1514353504}
review:
This is a great example of how to combine action and tower defense gameplay.

Gameplay is very fun; the variety of weapons and traps gives you plenty of ways to complete most levels. However, some traps/weapons need to be upgraded before they're useful IMO.

The art style, soundtrack and story (what little story there is) are all fun and upbeat, and make a very fun atmosphere. The dialogue is gold, too.

Nightmare mode is exactly what is says on the tin.

Absolutely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174436470', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1675880072}
review:
[h1]Vorwort[/h1]

Ein Magier soll ein Portal verteidigen durch das die Orks in die Menschenwelt gelangen k√∂nnen. Irgendwann jedoch bei√üt der alte Mann ins Gras und sein d√ºmmlicher Lehrling muss seine Aufgabe √ºbernehmen. Dies tut er auch mit entsprechenden Kommentaren. So kloppen wir uns nun in der Rolle des Lehrlings durch verschiedene Level immer mit der Aufgabe die Orks daran zu hindern die Portale zu betreten. Hierf√ºr stehen uns eine ganze Reihe unterschiedlicher Waffen,Fallen und Zauber zur Verf√ºgung. Wie wir die Orks umlegen ist ganz uns √ºberlassen und nur durch die Umgebung begrenzt. Nebenbei erfahren wir wie alles seinen Anfang nahm und wer wirklich hinter der Invasion durch die Orks steckt. Haben wir das alles hinter uns gebracht warten mit der Erweiterung noch weitere Level die von uns gemeistern werden m√ºssen.

[h1]Wertung[/h1]

[b]Pro[/b]
[list]
  [*]3 Schwierigkeitsgrade
  [*]24 verschiedene Level + 5 mit Erweiterungen
  [*]18 verschiedene Fallen + 4 mit Erweiterungen
  [*] die aufgewertet werden k√∂nnen
  [*]12 verschiedene Gegnertypen + 2 mit Erweiterungen
  [*]3 w√§hlbare Talentb√§ume
  [*]Ranglisten
[/list]
[b]Contra[/b]
[list]
  [*]manche Level teilweise unfair vom Schwierigkeitsgrad
  [*]kein Multiplayer Modus
  [*]keine freie Tastenbelegung
  [*]Tutorial nur in Bildern und nicht spielbar
  [*]Erweiterungen ohne eigene Story
[/list]
[h1]Schlusswort[/h1]

Wer f√ºr nebenbei ein Spiel sucht bei dem man nicht viel machen muss und etwas kreativ ist der ist mit Orcs Must Die! Gut aufgehoben. F√ºr Fans von Tower Defense genau das richtige. F√ºr 10‚Ç¨ kann ich es ohne Bedenken empfehlen.

Applying third person shooter with a tower defense element was like a match made in heaven with me, the variety of maps, weapons, traps and etc. really made for various types of strategies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198229231924', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1457298315}
review:
Orcs must die is a tower defence game and third person shooter wrapped up into one.

The plot is as simple as it gets. There are two worlds, our world, and the orc world (insert warcraft joke here). They are connected by rifts, which allow travel between the two worlds, and for magic to flow into both worlds. An order has been set up to protect these rifts at all costs, using massive forts filled with traps to stem the hordes. You are a thick beefcake trained by the best old man the order had, before he died, it is your task to defend the rifts and keep back the hordes.

The meat of the game is wave based tower defence, where in you spend mana to set up defences along lanes in order to protect the rift from any nasties trying to get through. You yourself are loaded with weapons as well which allow you to take an active roll in the defence of the rift. You have a set amount of slots with which to select your tools of death and are locked into those until the end of the level. Weapons and traps both take up a single slot, so choose wisely.

Its a difficult but extremely satisfying process, going through each wave and being careful with how you plan everything out, from basic trap set up to the shooting mechanics, every enemy is dealt with in a slightly different way, with no true stratagy to perfectly stop the incoming hordes, you're always moving, always setting up new traps, always doing something. Its chaotic, but rarely overwhelming to the point where its impossible to handle right up until the end when you've failed to make the optimal trap set up somewhere or haven't been active enough in your own personal combat against the creeps. 

Visually the game is very cartoonish, everything is very clean and it goes well with the cheesy comedy aspect, really hammering home the fact the game is light hearted, which is fine. The music scores, while not the greatest pieces, are memorable and even weeks later i can perfectly remember the main theme, i personally found them fantastic, but your tastes may differ.

The game overall was a wonderful experience from start to finish, being one of the most addictive games i've ever played in my life, and it was also the first game i ever played on PC, forever bringing me into the folds of the PC master race. I whole heartedly recommend this game to anyone looking for a fast paced tower defence game, or third person shooter with heavy focus on not doing all the work by yourself.

review:
Un Tower Defense int√©ressant avec un th√®me m√©di√©val-fantastique teint√© d'humour pas d√©sagr√©able.

Comme avec Sanctum, vous devrez intervenir par le biais d'un personnage en compl√©ment des pi√®ges que vous disposerez, ce qui donne beaucoup de dynamisme au GamePlay (on aime ou pas). Vous avez donc √† votre disposition plusieurs mani√®res d'aborder les niveaux (arbre de comp√©tences, pi√®ges, pouvoirs, armes). 

Vous ne construirez pas ici le parcours des monstres, les dongeons successifs sont globalement d√©finis avec parfois plusieurs parcours possibles ou altern√©s et m√™me des pi√®ges d√©j√† existants, au mieux vous pourrez diriger un peu les flux de monstres en disposant des barrages (plut√¥t chers).

J'ai pris beaucoup de plaisir √† y jouer car il-y-a une atmosph√®re vraiment plaisante/amusante. M√™me si l'on peut traverser assez facilement chaque niveau, la difficult√© est quand m√™me pr√©sente si l'on veut r√©ussir √† terminer un niveau avec la note maximale √† chaque fois.

review: Jogo simples f√°cil e divertido o jogo vai evoluindo com voc√™ pois conforme voc√™ vai avan√ßando no jogo os orcs v√£o ficando cada vez mais fortes e maiores n√∫meros a quantidade de chances de o orc passar e voc√™ n√£o perceber √© grande pois voc√™ geralmente vai focar na rota em que voc√™ est√° mas muitas vezes alguns deles pegam atalho e quando vai ver o orc j√° est√° quase encostando no portal e bate a afli√ß√£o continua defendendo ou sai e acaba se atrapalhando pois muitas vezes pode ser at√© um grupo de v√°rios orcs ou at√© mesmo um troll bem recomendo para todos

author: {'steamid': '76561198028673669', 'num_games_owned': 7009, 'num_reviews': 401, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1420737797}
review:
Amazing game, totally love it <3.

It has everything to spend a great evening:
+Cartoonish but high-quality graphics - Great animations of everything - traps, spells, orcs deaths. Lovely.
+Variety of enemies (and even allies) - different enemies, different approaches.
+Gameplay: provides awesome replayability which is just great for a single player game - this is a tower defence game AND you are playing as a hero that places those towers, so you can play with more offensive traps so they do everything for you, you can put more effort into leveling your character and kill all the orcs manually, or you can buy some troops and make more defensive traps to block the enemies. Great game. Good level design and nice story.
+If you lucky enough - you can catch this game for 90% on sale - instabuy (don't forget the dlcs they are very useful)
+3 difficulties
+Nice OST

Overall, I loved everything about this game. Very well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995480115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1262, 'last_played': 1476560908}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a very nice take on the tower defense genre. Seeing as I only played through the Single Player portion of the game and on Warmage difficulty my review will be based on that.

The game starts out with a short cinematic of an old archmage who meets his untimely demise at the hand of some stairs. As he falls Orcs are about to storm the portals into our world with one last obstacle in their way, the archmage his terribly unskilled apprentice, you.

Throughout the campaign the game slowly expands your arsenal of weapons and traps that you can use to slaughter the oncoming horde as they attempt to break through. At no point are you overwhelmed with choice or are you left with few options on how to handle a given situation.

While some strategies are more effective in certain situations you are always free to take the hard path. The difficulty level is not too high in this game and greatly depends on your preffered play style. Once I developed a certain preffered trap combo I found myself using it over and over with great effect until certain maps came along where the combo was entirely useless forcing me to adapt my playstyle.

The only shortcoming in this game is that while the difficulty is okayish in most levels there are certain spikes that can come as a complety suprise and force you to figure out some mechanics without being informed about them so this might be frustrating for some players who prefer to casualy walk through a game.

The only noticeable bugs I encountered were with flying enemies going straight through walls in some stages and in another some enemies managed to get stuck at the bottom of an acid swamp without dying. Overal these encounters were few and once you were aware of the possibility of them occuring not all that problematic.

Overal score of 8/10, Would totally recommend this to fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010738109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1524, 'last_played': 1476281638}
review:
Pros

+Good variety of traps, weapons, and spells that allow for different playstyles. Want to go heavy on traps? How about heavy on spells and weapons? Or a nice mixture of both? Finding the perfect combination for what works for you can feely very rewarding and fun.
+Good map variance. Maps can force you to switch your build so there's rarely a comfort setup that works for everything. 
+Good music that very rarely grows tiresome or reptitive.
+Graphics are good and still hold up even several years later. Gives off a cartoony vibe, which I enjoyed.
+Good variety of enemies that require different combinations to kill effectively.
+A good amount of challenge from the Nightmare level maps that might require multiple set ups or attempts to figure out the perfect combination.

Cons

-Some of the voice lines that trigger when you set up traps can grow tiresome and reptitive really quickly.
-I suffered some audio issues where a voice line would either stutter halfway through (but the gameplay would be fine) and some waves on some maps just not playing music.
-The story is nearly non existant, but who plays a tower defense game for the story?
-No Co-Op or online play.

Overall Orcs Must Die! is a very fun rewarding Tower Defense / Third Person Shooter hybrid that I highly recommend to fans of those genres.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012111055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1475789453}
review:
No me ha convencido para nada. He intentado ver sus bondades pero quiz√°s el juego me parezca demasiado simple o puede que no conecte con su estilo. 

T√©cnicamente reconozco que es correcto. Mapeados en 3D con alturas, variedad de trampas (aunque en el fondo todas me parec√≠an lo mismo), montones de enemigos que van a pi√±√≥n fijo, sin IA, avanzando por donde les dejas. Cosa que por otro lado es normal en los Tower Defense, no esperaba otra cosa. Vamos, que en aspecto t√©cnico no he visto anda que me chirriase m√°s all√° de lo normal sobre todo teniendo en cuenta que el juego ya tiene sus a√±os.

Pero como Tower Defense me pareci√≥ ca√≥tico y poco satisfactorio. Imagino que si pasas bastantes horas le pillar√°s el truco a como combinar las distintas trampas para que el escaso oro que te dan salga rentable, pero no pude llegar a ese punto. De hecho a la hora y pico se me hizo bastante cuesta arriba continuar porque, sinceramente, me estaba aburriendo. No soy un entendido de Tower Defense pero s√≠ que me he viciado horas largas en alg√∫n juego antiguo del g√©nero en m√≥vil. Quiz√°s aqu√≠ el hecho de tener un mapa con alturas o el verlo en tercera persona me resultase m√°s confuso.

Como Hack & Slash si que me pareci√≥ malo con avaricia. Disparar la ballesta es un ejercicio de azar ya que las flechas van para todos lados. Por suerte hay tantos orcos que es probable que le des a alguno, pero no es nada divertido y parece que simplemente tienes que aporrear botones. Lo mismo me pasa con la espada o con el guante que lanza a gente por el aire. Supongo que luego hay m√°s armas pero no me quedaron ganas de continuar. Es especialmente frustrante dejar pociones o barriles por el medio y ver como explotan cuando no deben simplemente porque tu ballesta decide disparar hacia la derecha en vez de hacia la izquierda que es por donde 'apuntas'. 

Por tanto la suma de dos g√©neros que a priori me podr√≠an gustar result√≥ desastrosa para m√≠.

En cuanto al humor del juego... bueno, pues vale... seguro que si me tomo unas ca√±as me hace gracia. Bastantes ca√±as. Muchas ca√±as. Es que es muy simple, casi de 'pedo, caca, pis'. No me result√≥ insufrible pero tampoco es que fuera inspirador.

Tengo la segunda parte (deb√≠ pillarlos en alg√∫n bundle) y supongo que le dar√© un tiento, pero sin demasiadas esperanzas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009326106', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1591630279}
review:
I'm enjoying this game a lot at the moment and it reminds me a lot of Dungeon Defenders. I purchased this and Orcs Must Die 2 in a Steam sale around a year ago I think and i definitely see myself replaying the game on Nightmare difficulty.

Your character is a funny war mage tasked with defending the various dungeons and bastions from an onslaught of ogres, kobolds and orcs. You get to control the war mage in third person as well as actively managing your traps.

Unlike some games you have to wait for a break or stoppage in waves to replace or build traps. In this game you can sell, and lay traps whilst the waves are happening (as long as you or an enemy aren't in the place you want to place your trap).

I felt like they could of expanded the story each level to give a sense of immersion, but the gameplay makes up for this flaw.

If you love tower defense games but want an alternative to your standard one then give this a try.

Pros:

- Fun Gameplay
- Nice Assortment of Enemies
- Quirky Main Protagonist
- Plethora of Traps
- Dynamic Trap Management
- Cool Looking Artwork/Graphics

Cons:

- Not a very in-depth Storyline
- Short Campaign
- Graphics May not Appeal To Some
- No Coop or Multiplayer Aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250793062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2270, 'last_played': 1569818855}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is one h*ll of an amazing game. I loved it so much that I played it over and over again until I got all the achievements for the game and cleared every single stage (including the ones from the DLC) with flawless victories. Then I still kept playing just for the heck of it. And I mean, I usually don't even bother getting every achievement for the games I play. 
I don't really remember why I chose to buy this game at first. I must've got the game w/o even watching the gameplay because I thought this is one of those old, classic tower defense games. The thing is, it was actually so much more than that. This game is an excellent combination of a third person action shooter with a tower defense-like aspect. [b]The best part of the game is there are so many ways you can play this game (depending on the stages and your preferences). You can just lay a whole lot of traps and watch the hapless orcs get sliced, crushed, and burned to cinders without even lifting a finger (this usually requires some advanced traps and upgrades you get about halfway through the game, so you won't be able to do this from the very start). You can also become the ultimate orc-slayer and butcher hundreds of orcs single-handedly with your crossbow and bladestaff (well, with the help of a few barricades to limit their paths). Or you can actually act like a War"mage" by equipping yourself with a bunch of different magic armaments and blast the orcs with arcane fury (again with the help of some barricades, I suppose).[/b] Depending on which traps and spells you choose to employ, the possibilities are practically endless. You just have to be creative. 
Also, this game differs from those boring, classic tower defences where you just build the towers, sit, watch, and wait until the long waves end. This game is fast paced (especially on insane difficulty where you only get 3 seconds for preparations!) and action-packed. Even if you choose to just build a whole lot of towers and watch, you will still feel like you are constantly "In-action" due to the way the levels are designed.
[b]One warning here though: if you absolutely hate third person shooters, this might not be the game for you[/b] as you do have to make extensive use of your crossbow in the early game (but as I said, it is possible to completely rely on your traps and guardians and not lift a finger on most of the later stages if you so choose).
Another possible downside of the game is that it has no co-op or multiplay (which became the central part of the later series of this game). It's a pure single-play game. I personally think this is completely acceptable because: 1. If you absolutely want co-op, you can just play the sequels; 2. Unlike the sequels, where the levels are designed for multiple players, the level design of this game is made to be challenging but manageable for a single player.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972347749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1473402012}
review: I didn't expect to have as much fun with this game as I did, but it is a really fulfilling game. I got this one sale for something insanely cheap, and kept in in my library for a long time before I even got to play it. I'm sad I didn't boot it up until now. The game is a mix between a third person shooter (although there is a melee weapon) and some tower defense/strategy elements. As you successfully defend each level, you'll be able to unlock new magic/defenses/units/passive buffs and it is all really rewarding in the end. I would love it if this game was multiplayer, but even still in its current form, it is a blast to play around with.

review:
+) I liked how the game was. Your view, aim, the battle, sound and effects, etc.
 +) Various types of enemies were interesting.
 +) The fact that basic traps don't become obsolete was good.

 -) It would've been more nice if we could fight the witch or was it mage?.
 -) They make you click a lot. They should've made it auto so you can just press on. Not everyone is using game pads.
 -) Having passive skills or upgrade for personal improvement would've been amazing but there was no such thing. There is a similar one but that's a choice and you have to spend defense money so NO to that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160017153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1671783800}
review: Ottimo gioco, uno dei migliori per gli amanti, come me, dei tower defense in tempo reale. la possibilit√† di uccidere le orde di nemici simultaneamente con le trappole posizionate grazie all'ingengno e con spada e balestra grazie all'abilit√† del giocatore rende il gameplay profondo. Doppiaggio in italiano perfetto e divertente. Grafica cartoonesca molto piacevole e livelli diversificati. Buona anche la longevita grazie a un discreto numero di livelli e una grande rigiocabilit√† dell'avventura grazie alle 3 modalit√† di difficolta presenti e il desiderio per i perfezionisti di terminare tutti i livelli con il massimo delle stelle. Nel complesso, in cambio di circa 10 euro, si ottiene un ottimo tower defense, quasi esente da difetti. Altamente consigliato

review: Good game! It can get challenging and have you truly under pressure but good strategy and using some basic evil intuition will have you mulching orcs into a pleasant and nutritional sauce! Bathe in that stuff youngster... it'll keep you sharp and youthful inside long past the point where hope and happiness fades into a bitter diy tincture that doesn't heal the wound that won't close... yes.... a most excellent orc genocide simulator! Bonus creatures included for happy end!! and it had a very good sequel also! :D

Juego realmente "Original" en su momento, y creativo con respecto al mezclaro lo de las trampas y cosas de rol como mejorar detalles del jugador, muy adictivo y entretenido a la par de desafiante, lo eh jugado muchisimas horas en offline cuando salio (otra historia) pero ahora le dedique un tiempo a completar los logros y a revivir los jugado, y de verdad lo volveria a jugar, ya hay secuelas pero a quien le gusta el genero de verdad se lo recomiendo que lo juegue porque no es una perdida de tiempo, mas que eso seguro que se lleva alguna gran risa entre los comentarios graciosos del personaje en la campa√±a, buenos momentos entre los desafios y emocion de querer seguir matando orcos, ogros y gnolls! xD

P.D: 8/10, en lo unico que no le pongo exelente es porque no tiene el modo multijugador, lo demas, impecable! . recomendadisimo se√±ores! xD

author: {'steamid': '76561197969328503', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3010, 'last_played': 1469323692}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a tower defense game where you are in control of the hero who will be fighting off Orcs and planting traps. The game plays like a 3rd person action game mixed in with the traditional tower defense formula. The player plays an extremely active role and your crossbow will be needed just as much as wall arrow traps. There are numerous traps at your disposal and you unlock more as you go along. By the end of my play through I ended up using just about every single trap. They are all designed very well and most of them work well with each other to produce great kill boxes.

The game features three difficulties but you'll want to start on War Mage as you don't gain many skulls (the currency used to upgrade traps) on Apprentice (the easiest). At the end of each map you are awarded between 1 and 5 skulls based on your performance. Getting 5 skulls will require a significant amount of strategy (especially on Nightmare, although there's no achievement for getting all 5 skulls on all stages on Nightmare, just War Mage). You'll need to pretty much know what is going to come out and during what wave so that you can prepare adequately. YouTube is an excellent reference if you're having trouble and is great for learning new strategies that you may not have figured out on your own.

There's not much more to the game outside of the general story mode but getting all 5 skulls on War Mage and Nightmare will take a while, making the game a great value considering it's already quite cheap. The game features leader boards so you can always go back one you've fully upgraded your traps and go for a better score on the global rankings or among your friends. Overall this is a great tower defense game that is well worth your time if you have any love for the genre. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 400, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1469042718}
review:
Orcs Must Die! 

[b]POSITIVES[/b]

+ gute deutsche Sprecher (auch wenn das nicht gerade sonderlich viel ist)
+ 19 t√∂dliche Fallen die man langsam aber stetig hinzubekommt
+ im Level platzierbare Bogensch√ºtzen und Paladine die einen bei der Verteidigung unterst√ºtzen
+ 11 abwechslungsreiche Gegner (unterschiedliche Orks, Gnolle, Oger, Kobolde, H√∂llenflederm√§use)
+ gute Spielperformance ohne Ruckler
+ sarkastisch-ironische Spr√ºche des Helden und der Orcs
+ gutes Leveldesign (mehrere Orc-Eing√§nge, mehrere Spalt-Portale, verwinkelte Architekturen, Teleporter, Lavagruben, weit ge√∂ffnete Hallen, enge Passagen, usw.)
+ leichte Steuerung (√ºbrigens auch Pfeiltasten, auch wenn das in den Steuerungsoptionen nicht angezeigt wird)
+ guter mittlerer Schwierigkeitsgrad (von 3 m√∂glichen namentlich Lehrling, Kriegsmagier, Albtraum) der langsam aber stetig zunimmt
+ Siegestanz nach jedem geschafften Level
+ wer einen Level gut abschlie√üt, wird mit Sch√§deln belohnt, mit denen man seine Fallen aufwerten kann
+ im sp√§teren Verlauf kann man unter drei verschiedenen sogenannten Weberinnen w√§hlen, die verschiedene Boni, F√§higkeiten oder Fallenverbesserungen gew√§hren, quasi Spezialisierungen
+ motiviert ungemein und ist sehr unterhaltsam
+ 24 Festungen zum Verteidigen mit immerhin 10+ Spielstunden auf dem mittleren Schwierigkeitsgrad

[b]NEGATIVES[/b]

- Klickorgie (Dauerklicken mit der Linken Maustaste zum bet√§tigen der Prim√§rwaffe)
- Mini-Map ist nicht wirklich √ºbersichtlich, aber immer noch besser als ohne
- kein kooperativer Modus, was sehr Schade ist, da sich das Spiel echt daf√ºr anbietet

[b]FAZIT[/b]

Orcs Must Die ist ein Tower-Defense-artiges Spiel mit einer starken Action Komponente in der Third-Person-Perspektive das sehr viel Spa√ü macht. Man m√∂chte eigentlich nur noch diesen einen Level machen, nur noch die n√§chste Orkwelle in die perfekt positionierten Fallen locken, ohne dass Langeweile aufkommt. Ich konnte und wollte einfach nicht aufh√∂ren, bis ich nach etwa 11 Stunden komplett durch war, obwohl ich es ja eigentlich nur mal schnell probespielen wollte. Und das schaffen nur sehr wenige Spiele, dass ich sie mit einer solchen Spielzeit an einem Tag durchspiele. Definitiv ein Daumen nach oben!

Wenn ihr an weiteren Reviews von mir interessiert seid, dann folgt meiner [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/10868887-Dark-Chummer%27s-Reviews/?appid=63110]Gruppe[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198079559139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1386629611}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is third person a hilarious sit-game-com settled in fantasy medieval theme.

Technically:
[list]
[*] the game is a fantasy / medievial "tower" defence + third person "shoot everything that survived trap lines",
[*] 30 traps, spells and weapons (total), mostly upgradable
[*] 20 (24?) levels to beat + a few in DLC, approx 10h of gameplay,
[*] nightmare difficulty, another 10h of gameplay,
[*] challanges - max score per level - 5-10h,
[/list]

Gameplay notes:
[list]
[*] The difficulty per wave grows with number and setup of enemies, and shrinking space for traps, 
[*] The enemies do not seem to have increased HP per wave,
[*] Most of levels are balanced so that the Mage needs both traps, spells and wepons to hold the line,
[*] Weapons require item slot, there are two in the game: sniping crossbow and melee blade staff,
[*] Spells require equipment slots and to use in the mission and mana to cast,
[*] Defender minions require item slot, and gold to place them,
[*] During a level the Mage can buy upgrade from one of three 'weavers': generic trap upgrade, spell upgrade, mixed upgrade.
[*] Traps cannot be directly upgraded during the level. They can be upgraded during the story.
[*] Some levels have two or more distanced attack paths, of which at least one must be fully secured with traps,
[*] No endless mode (can be found in OMD!2),
[*] It is possible to replay old levels with improved trap set for better score.
[/list]


All of the characters are stereotypic to the point of lunacy.
[list]
[*] The main hero, 'The Warmage' is a young, dumb lad.  Blindly convinced of his own awesomeness. He needs to prevent orcs from enering portals to our world (at which he is good)... and to figure out (at which he is terribly bad) a more permament solution. 
[*] His (former) Master shows up in the story by his memories. He was the last (failed) hope for the world, spare his student, but the only thing greater then his apprentice's ignorance, is his stupidity.
[*] The Sorceress (the prime enemy in the game), does not show up directly, but magically takes quarrels with the Warmage.
[*] Most of her arguments are attempts to insult the Warmage so that he can't figure that out (which is not that hard afterall).  Most of Warmage's speech are (futile) attempts flirt up the Sorceress, and show that he is the most handsome and awesome man in the area (which if of course true, as he is the only one).
[*] The orcs are main competitors for the price for The Best Cannon Fodder in video games: dumb, ugly, run and die in hundreds, have hilarious (though still dumb) speach lines, can be headshot-ed.
[/list]

General info
[list]
[*] OMD is settled in medieval-themed bastions / castle /  dungeons. There is only one level theme.
[*] Forget about cinematics. The storyline is presended via semi-animated drawings. This is a great idea and fits great into the game.
[*] The orcs, the Warmage and the traps have a bit grotesque, comic design. Again, this suits the overall game mood, and slows down graphics 'aging'.
[*] Amazing music. If you run into game OST, do buy it. I managed to get one from Humble Bundle.
[/list]

Any problems?
[list]
[*] Trap balance - some traps are simply better, some are just useless (Hint: use traps with large AOE and fast or no reload),
[*] Since trap upgrades are permament, The Warmage usually sticks with favourite set with little room for experiment.
[*] No co-op game (solved in OMD2)
[*] The super-arogant hero can be hard to get used to. The humor can be sometimes percieved as primitive.
[*] High emphasise placed on combat, it is not possible / extremly difficult to play only with the economy.
[*] First two levels in nightmate are... too nightmareish, the difficulty seems to be easier further.
[*] there are two levels in the game (including final), which must be simply learnt and played by hearth. In each wave the 
Mage must build traps in particular area, buy a proper upgrade and solo secure another corridor. 
Mispacing traps will leave the attacked corridor unsecured.
[/list]



Strong sides
[list]
[*] humor,
[*] nice character design,
[*] good overall ballance in map design,
[*] good balance of strategic / economic components in gameplay (unless you don't like action in tower defences),
[*] interesting maps,
[*] high 'replayablity', level score to be maxed.
[/list]

You should avoid the game, if you:
[list]
[*] dislike action in tower defence and prefer them to be purely economic,
[*] dislike arrogant and dumb protagonists
[/list]

Do play if:
[list]
[*] don't mind thinking / action hybrid,
[*] look for a lot of fun,
[*] tend to max each level
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198272081313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1461452358}
review:
This game is quite simple: Shoot, slice and blow up all the orcs.  08/10!

Its a nice mix of TD and a medieval fighting game. WIth the talent-like choices you can personalise how you wanna play each level, going trap heavy, combat heavy or a mix.
The story is not bad but is not the strong point. The funny coments you character makes sometimes are quite cool tho. 

Pros:
- Kill orcs (need say more?)
- Several diferent levels with diferent kinds of enemies
- Choose how you wanna play (TD heavy or slash/shoot heavy)
- Smart ass coments that can actualy make you giggle (maybe...)

Cons:
- Not story rich
- Could get repetitive (but really, killing orcs gets boring for you guys??)

author: {'steamid': '76561198010267364', 'num_games_owned': 1212, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1467576119}
review:
Most Tower Defense games are a fairly hands-off genre; you build towers and they do their thing, with your involvement being where to put them and when to upgrade. But lately there have been some that let the player get into the action more personally, and Orcs Must Die is a great example of that. Compared to the nameless protagonists of the last two games, OMD puts you in the shoes of the Apprentice, one of many War Mages tasked with defending rifts to the human world from bands of invading orcs. His tutelage has come to an end though, thanks to his master taking a fatal tumble, forcing him into the role completely. As the Apprentice is a combination of Gaston from Beauty and the Beast and Groose from Skyward Sword, this isn't necessarily a good thing, especially not when the orcs seem to be getting more organized suddenly.

Instead of defending whole territories like other games, each level in Orcs Must Die takes place in a different fort, with a rift on one end and the orcs (as well as other enemies) charging in through the other. So rather than towers, you'll be placing down booby traps instead: spike traps on the floor, walls that shoot out arrows, even swinging maces you can put on low ceilings. It's not too hard to create a total death course enemies will futilely try to wade through. The game's combo system, the ragdoll physics, and the orcs' voice clips as they're being pulverized all help encourage this very well. The Apprentice also has some weapons of his own for crowd control, or the odd enemy that manages to get through your traps.

Each level offers up to five skulls, four for not taking any damage and one for speed, which you can use to upgrade your traps permanently. These range from extra damage on some, to slowing enemies, to dramatically increasing speed. It can make many traps much more useful, although what you spend can't be refunded. The game has 24 levels, which I beat in about ten hours. That unlocks the Nightmare difficulty, which offers tougher enemy placement and much less time to prepare between waves. I didn't find the base game that difficult, so it's a nice option if you want it. There's also some cheap DLC, which offers a few extra tools and some new levels; nothing necessary, but good if you want to get a bit more out of the game. And with one this well-made, there's not much reason you wouldn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055763215', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1598, 'last_played': 1479959981}
review:
Best kind of game genre hybrid. This game takes the mechanics of a tower defence game, and adds the excitement of fast-paced FPS gameplay into the formula to make killing orcs as satisfying as possible. And it doesn't take itself too seriously, either, leading to a fun time on every map, during every cutscene, and in every part of the grueling challenge that comes with completing the final levels on nightmare difficulty.

A dang good game that entertains and plays well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980647317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2176, 'last_played': 1346828400}
review:
[h1]1-sentence review :[/h1]
Perfect mix between a 3rd Person Shooter and a Tower Defense Game !

[h1]Pros :[/h1]
- Challenging without being too difficult
- A bunch of really different "towers"
- A ton of enemies
- Varied & interesting Levels
- Funny main character

[h1]Cons :[/h1]
- Lacks a little bit of polishing on user-friendliness
- Orcs Must Die 2 is better (It's not a con for me, but it's the reason some idiots don't recommend this game :) )

author: {'steamid': '76561198171278762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1464902515}
review:
I got this game for .99 cents when it was on sale, I thought it wouldn\'t be much fun but the opposite is true. This game is a surprising rendition of a classic TD but has a very unique element to it, You are the Character setting traps and slaying orcs with a crossbow. This game with all its unique trap combos, my favorite the Floor Burner with a spring trap to make them endlessly run through it again and again, makes the gameplay enjoyable, there are a few annoying maps but all in all a great game 

Lets take a minute to go through the pros and cons

Pros- The game is surprisingly addictive slaughtering orcs over and over with a trap combo
          The game has unique traps and different map levels each time so you don\'t get used to the same strategy
          The headshot feature is my personal favorite  
          Archers on a bridge are OP
          The Graphics are suprisingly great
   
Cons- The music for the orcs is a bit redundant but fun
           I wish OGRES weren\'t so OP as well as the Fliers if you get caught offguard 

Overview- I would recommend this game for someone who likes TD\'s and Strategy 

PS. Or slaughtering orcs :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198102206785', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2804, 'last_played': 1627803730}
review:
I got this game from a bundle sale, I wasn't expecting it to be good.

After some months after buying this game I gave it a try and the experience is sweet!

The game offers you a simple yet challenging gameplay.

Like a tower defense game you only need to prevent the enemies (in this game Orcs,Gnolls,Ogres,etc.) from getting into the Portal (Rift).

You can plant traps and use you hero to cut them,shoot, and kill them with spells, this makes the game more interactive. (which isn't like other tower defense game where you have to wait and watch after planting your towers)

The story is good too simple and funny which makes getting to another level somehow enjoyable as you get to know what and why the orcs are attacking.

The Hero isn't boring either and you get to somehow love the guy as his humor and sarcasm is pretty entertaining and funny.

Grab this game and have some fun. (Have some fun and watch what the traps do to the Orcs.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198010367135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1464357020}
review:
Orcs Must Die! Is a first-person tower defence game developed and published by Robot Entertainment. It was released in October 2011. You play as a War Mage that defends his rift, or base, against the enemy orcs and fellow allies. In the first-person aspect, your War Mage has weapons that you use against the enemy and you construct defences to defend your Rift. This game is purely single-player. This review will cover the overall concept in regards to story and downloadable content, gameplay, and to a smaller extent, performance.

Orcs Must Die features a simple concept with an easy learning curve. The simple concept is tower defence and there is no tutorial because you place units to defend and should not require assistance. This game features 25 base game missions with 5 separate missions through the Lost Adventures DLC and there is a small story attached to the base game missions. The DLC contained new units and new levels, so while there is a passable amount of content, for $2.99 it does no harm. There is three difficulties so this game has enough replayability for 25 hours. Regarding the story, I did not overly understand the actual story at hand because it was not emphasised. The start of each level had the War Mage advancing the unclear story such as him being alone in the mages and having to defend against the enemy. There were around three cut scenes in the entire base game missions that succulently revealed the story but without those, the attached story was unclear and an afterthought. If the story was emphasised more through cut scenes this game would have been better. Moving on, each level is different and vary in difficulty, providing a new experience with most of the levels. For instance, as one level progressed it increased in difficulty. As the missions progressed, it became harder in difficulty. Therefore, I praise the level designs that are neat and add diversity and fun towards the game. As for enjoyment, I enjoyed the missions and the overall concept and style for the most part, but levels started to become stale and therefore, were becoming boring but luckily I finished all missions on easy difficulty without being burnt out.

The gameplay is basic and has a large amount of variety. The gameplay aspect is a wave begins and your units and your player beat the enemy, gaining income to spend on other units or upgrades. There is a very nice variety of units because there is a total of 30 units and weapons, and while I used the same eight for each mission there were other options at least. One feature is the upgrade tree, which is three different trees with different abilities and the player chooses one per level. You spend your currency you gain from killing enemies on unlocking abilities in the tree through a vertical skillset approach, which is you unlock skill one, then you can unlock skill 2 and so forth. For instance, one skill may be reducing the reload times for timed units. I like this but I believe its unbalanced because for 29 missions I used only one tree and the other mission I used another one, as that particular tree I mainly used drastically improved the powers of my units. Another system is the upgrading of abilities and/or reducing the cost of your units after the levels by using skulls. For instance, upgrading archer guardians would reduce the price from 600 coins to 500 coins. This proves incredibly useful because of the course of the level, as things get harder, you need stronger units. The game makes the little things count, such as witty comments from your War Mage to the sweet killing animations, providing a light-hearted atmosphere. Furthermore, the artwork is very nice with its cartoon approach that freshens the games apperance. The one main issue I had with the gameplay was the generic movements by the AI and their lack of animation in attacking and rushing. For instance, I felt that each unit lacked diversity in movement and animation because the ogres have different clothing and names but all have the same animations and movements. This is the same with the orcs and the flying units. It gets repetitive as well because you get the feeling its like 'oh, the ogre is charging at me again'. The other small issue was the pathfinding bugs with enemies, but not a major issue.

The performance was consistent and is optimised. I could play on max settings at 60+ FPS. This is not a big deal but just thought I would mention it.

Orcs Must Die is a solid game. It benefits from the simplicity and diversity of the game in enemy characters, units and the basic nature of defending against multiple waves of enemies. It suffers from the lack of animation and movement in enemy, that makes the game repetitive and towards staleness. The story is very disappointing as it is an afterthought, though it has its small moments. The artwork and gameplay is neat and light-hearted and the overall atmosphere of the game matches this description. I completed the game in eight hours and this was an appropriate length because I was close to being bored. But, I enjoyed it for the most part because of the simplicity. Furthermore,  has its pros and cons and is a solid game, however, it does not stretch into being a good game. At $12.99 for the game of the year edition, I recommend it on sale. It‚Äôs a fun game that is casual and easy to play but there is not enough fresh content to play this for twenty hours.

Ratings system:
For this particular game, I will rate the concept and gameplay judging from what I wrote and average those scores. I will then range the score to what I felt it should be given.

Concept: 6.5/10
Gameplay: 5.5/10
Overall: 5.5/10

Thanks for reading my review! If you liked this review, rate it and join my review group. http://steamcommunity.com/groups/AntwogReviews If you have questions comment below or post in Antwog's Analysis (Reviews) general discussion page.

http://store.steampowered.com/app/102600/

author: {'steamid': '76561198109670840', 'num_games_owned': 885, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2222, 'last_played': 1464264605}
review:
I don't understand all the fuzz about this game. Bought it in a promotion with all DLCs for like 5bucks but even so it is not worth it. I had fun the first few levels but it got old very quickly. I finished all maps (including DLC) in nightmare+5skulls and the only feeling I have is that I wasted 30hours of my life. Most of the levels, namely on nightmare, are more a game of "find-out-the-only-strategy-and-loadout-that-works-in-this-map-lol-screw-fun" than a real game. In a lot of maps there is only a winning strategy - not a balanced game for different types of playrs/loadouts.

If you want a tower defense / shooter hybrid get SANCTUM, not this pile of crap.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970692296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1326096000}
review: Tower defence in a nutshell. You protect a portal from invading orcs that come via air or ground. You have several traps at defending this portal at your disposal. As you progress in the game you can upgrade these traps and gain access to more. As the hero, you are capable of assisting the traps with a crossbow, a sword, or magic which can also be upgraded as you progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003237653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1468699487}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197998568769', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 818, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1456803503}
review: I had difficulty getting into this, especially after having playing Orcs Must Die 2 co-op with a friend.  Many of the levels, it seems, require you to run back and forth between two different entrances.  In co-op this works marvelously (10 of the original maps can be played in the second title in the series), as each player can hold an entrance, calling the other when things get hairy.  The number of weapons and traps is also less than the second game.  Perhaps this is an unfair criticism, but at the very least, perhaps this review will be helpful to others who are tempted to visit the first game after trying the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1103, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1572034448}
review:
[i][b]Orcs Must Die![/b][/i] est le d√©fouloir qu'il vous faut !

Le but est simple : emp√™cher des vagues de monstres en tous genres (orcs, kobolds, gnolls, ogres et j'en passe) d'atteindre la pr√©cieuse faille qui leur permettrait de se rendre dans vos cit√©s et ainsi de les d√©vaster. Pour ce faire, vous sera propos√©e une large panoplie d'armes, de sortil√®ges, de pi√®ges et de talents, parmi lesquels il vous faudra piocher. Hormis les armes, chacun d'eux a un co√ªt : en mana pour la magie, en argent pour le reste ; argent que vous r√©colterez apr√®s avoir vaincu trois vagues successives, mais aussi √† chaque ennemi tu√©.

Si l'histoire est rudimentaire, voire franchement convenue, le prisme par lequel on la d√©couvre - √† savoir le personnage principal, rien moins qu'un [strike]sombre cr√©tin[/strike] mage de guerre - lui donne une tournure hilarante, surtout gr√¢ce √† son analyse de la situation pour le moins... singuli√®re. D'ailleurs, d√®s l'introduction, le ton est donn√©. Quant √† la musique, bien que r√©p√©titive, elle n'en demeure pas moins tout √† fait entra√Ænante. Le level design est impeccable et permet d'exploiter la plupart des pi√®ges avec une libert√© tr√®s appr√©ciable.

A la fin de chaque niveau, votre performance est √©valu√©e, score √† l'appui. Vous est ensuite attribu√© un nombre de cr√¢nes plus ou moins √©lev√©, selon que vous avez rempli ou non certaines conditions. Ces cr√¢nes s'av√®rent tr√®s utiles, dans la mesure o√π ils permettent d'am√©liorer les pi√®ges de fa√ßon significative. En difficult√© mage de guerre, obtenir les cinq cr√¢nes dans les derniers niveaux n'est d√©j√† pas une mince affaire, aussi, pour peu que vous vous attaquiez au mode cauchemar, le challenge sera-t-il au rendez-vous.

Bref, je ne suis pas du tout un adepte du genre, mais, pour autant, j'ai ador√© d√©zingu√© de l'orc √† tour de bras.

[h1]Verdict : 4/5 - Tr√®s bon, une valeur s√ªre ![/h1]

review:
HANDS DOWN - The Best Purchase Of The Year

There simply aren't a lot of games these days that really bring to the table what Orcs Must Die does. The concept is simple, easy to learn, harder to master. Very addictive and very satisfying to play. 

Not sure yet? Looking for a description of the game? Basically it's an indie 3rd POV Tower Defense, with Warcraft look & feel and the action of Team Fortress 2.

If your looking for a reason not to purchase, I really can't give you any and that's been while since I've had that with any game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198113908364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3180, 'last_played': 1465848642}
review:
Excellent! Simple to play, easy to learn, definitely a one-of-a-kind Third Person Shooter + Tower Defense game. Gameplay is easily summarized - Defend your rift(base) from orcs, with melee, range weapons, magic, traps, and guardians. There're over 10 different types of enemies, and 22 weapons, traps and guardians added up altogether. I would strongly suggest downloading the demo first before trying (I got hooked on the game this way). Maps are playable in 3 different levels - Apprentice(Easy), WarMage(Normal), Nightmare(Explains itself). The game has practically no ending, you can replay your maps as many times as you want. No rewards, but the gameplay itself is rewarding. The only "ending", is probably when you completed all achievements, upgraded every single trap, and 5 Skull-ed all maps on all difficulties. Pretty fulfilling!

Pros
- Graphics are cartoon-ish. Great for casual players. Graphics which are too clear makes me really stressed.
- Gameplay varies, dependent on the type of player you are. Melee, magic, shooter, you choose!
- Achievements are all attainable. Last broken achievement was removed, hence, 27 workable achievements.
- 24 different maps, excluding 5 DLC maps(Might as well get it).
- There's a difference shooting at the head, and at the body. Dealing different damage really draws the line between players who only want to complete the game, and those that REALLY wants to perform. You can't just spam.
- Simple upgrades. Basically you complete a map well, you are given up to 10 skulls per map, then you upgrade it. There is simply no need for a guide on what to upgrade. Just do it. Eventually, all skulls will be used, and everything upgraded.

Cons
- Single player. Might not be too optimal for couples, or a group of friends. Orcs Must Die 2 has co-op though(Recommended as well).
- Despite "Practice makes perfect", some really tough maps are really argh. You would be finding yourself restarting the map many times just to achieve 5 Skulls(5 Star Rating).
- Endless isn't available, so once you're done with the map, you're done. Clearing the map isn't tough, but getting 5 Skulls for it might be a chore for some.
- Too damn addictive. You really can't stop playing!!

On the overall, apart from perfecting this game by achieving 5 Skulls for all maps on all difficulties, even as a casual game, it will not fail to entertain. Definitely. 

On a scale of 1-10, I would give it 9.5 (: Lack of companionship in this game kinda killed it for me, but I still completed it nevertheless! Fantastic game!!

review:
One of the best games I have ever played! 
Great music, even greater gameplay and tons of humor!
The first few fortresses are very straight forward, easing you into the game, but as you get more traps and more orcs coming at you from more passageways, it really is intriquing to figure out how you can keep them away.
The game is so fun that once you finish it, you really do want to start over on the harder difficulty! And now that I have finished that too I am sad that there is no more... Gonna have to move on to Orcs Must Die 2, hopping it's as good!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006619832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3231, 'last_played': 1459943811}
review:
After playing some OMD Unchained I decided to replay the first one and it's still as good as I remember.
Sure, the second one has more stuff, a more interesting upgrade system, 2 player co-op and is overall the better game but the first one is still fun.

It has a better feel to kill orcs than Unchained and the progression pacing is more fluid.
Maybe not worth the 10 bucks anymore as OMD2 is out for years but owning OMD1 gets you 10 extra levels in OMD2 so alone for this it's worth at least the sale price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970338535', 'num_games_owned': 7613, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1565803058}
review: The Original, and still my favorite of any of the OMG games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002238719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1459670126}
review:
Un tower defence super entretenido, eres un mago encargado de que los orcos y criaturas malignas no penetren en las fisuras y accedan al mundo real, como tal dispondras de una serie de herramientas, habilidades y compa√±eros que te ayudan a conseguir tu objetivo. El objetivo es evitar que estas critaturas accedan a las fisuras por lo civil o lo criminal, ellos, como no son tontos, vienen en oleada rezando para que no los desnortes con las trampas que habilmente has colocado por el camino y que al menos algunos de ellos consigan realizar su malevolo plan.
De graficos tipo comic super resultones y un sonido y BSO lograda el juego es super entretenido y divertidisimo de echar unas partiducas, si bien el sistema es super sencillo y no da mas de si: colocar trampas en donde consideres mejor (hay bastante varierdad) y esnafrar orcos,ogros y otras criaturas de satan sin piedad con tu ballesta y artilugios magicos, siendo un juego de accion muy destacable.

Puntuacion 7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198079970072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1558750940}
review:
It has great replayability
You have to constantly re-think  best strategy to pass the level and to maximize the number of skulls
It has several improvements on magic, devices as you level up
Story is fun and is refreshing to hear the funny comments with those voices.
It doesnt stuck me to the computer hour after hour,because
passing each level is so rewarding that 
I can play one level and have all the fun that I need for a long time
in which I can work , talk with my family and other everyday thing

It a simply superb game , dont count the hours you can waste on it but all the satisfaction you will have with it

author: {'steamid': '76561198016659877', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1471772233}
review:
Amazing action tower(traps?) defense gameplay bound together by a great theme and execution. 

You're given great customization options on what to use to slaughter thousands of orcs. Fireball them from afar, push them into lava with a gust of wind, slice them with your bladestaff or mash/mince/grid/slice/incinerate/freeze/mind control them with any combination of traps you  desire.  

Level variety and design are also good. Each level feels different and presents you with its own set of challenges and you have to figure out where best to set up your killing fields. Some levels also have some "consumable" one-time traps, that you have to trigger manually and have a powerful effect.

Sound design is good, dialog is funny, soundtrack is tense and epic and really makes you feel like you're the last bastion of defense, protecting your home from an invasion of orcs. 

Overall great game, lots of fun, good challenge for those who seek it, so get it and start killing some orc!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040685225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1456677252}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009339950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6169, 'last_played': 1456475906}
review:
An absolute gem!  Tower defence mixed with 3rd person shooter and rpg elements.   The game is also hilarious, seemless, and the mechanics are fluid and easy to grasp, yet hard to master.  There is more than one way to pass each level.  

A friend bought me this game as a joke when it was on sale, and it ended up taking over our lives for a few months!  Think about how much fun your $10 will buy you at a movie theater or a coffee shop... I guarantee this game will give you way more fun for less money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998785996', 'num_games_owned': 1956, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1558740286}
review:
Quick Summary: Orcs Must Die is a combination of third person action and tower/trap defense, similar to Sanctum but with humor and medieval weaponry. The game is a lot of fun, but unlike the sequel, there‚Äôs no co-op gameplay :(

You take on the role of a cocky student war mage trying to hold back the onslaught of orcs coming through into our world. The hero is pretty dumb, but fortunately the orcs are even dumber and their paths through each level are almost completely predictable. With your magic traps and artifacts (for casting spells) you need to make sure as few orcs as possible get to the end of the level and enter the rift (sometimes there‚Äôs more than one rift to defend). 

The game is broken up into individual levels, each with a different map, and on each map can be multiple orc entrances and exit rifts. At the start of each level you are given unlimited time to run around and see the layout, as well as set up your loadout (which traps or spells you can use during the level). Once you‚Äôve started the game you cannot change your loadout, you‚Äôd have to restart the whole level. You have a ton of traps to choose from, although a few of them aren‚Äôt much use and you‚Äôll likely be sticking with the basics like wall arrows, tar pits, and barricades for most of the game. You‚Äôll be facing only a few different kinds of orcs (fast runners, arrow shooters, ogres), but they‚Äôll be coming in large numbers so the key to beating each level is channeling the orcs into choke points where you can use fewer numbers of traps. The traps cost money so you can‚Äôt just fill the map with them (and unlike many other tower defense games, you cannot upgrade the traps during the levels). 

The biggest difference though between Orcs Must Die and traditional tower defense is the fact that you the hero are on site blasting enemies alongside your traps. You‚Äôre armed with a reasonably powerful rapid fire crossbow that‚Äôs able to kill small numbers of the slow moving orcs, or the really fast runners that die in one shot. Your traps usually have cooldown times so you cannot rely on them to catch every orc. For example, a spike trap might only trigger every 5 seconds, and during those 5 seconds, more orcs might run over it. It‚Äôs up to you and your trusty crossbow to fill them with arrows while waiting for your traps to be ready again. Every level you beat unlocks a different trap type or spell (like fireball or lightning) so by the end of the campaign you‚Äôll have a massive arsenal to choose from. 

Pros:
+The difficulty ramps up slowly and gives you a chance to learn various strategies for tackling levels. In the meantime, enjoy the humor. ‚ÄúOh no he di‚Äônt‚Äù ‚Äì Orc, as he‚Äôs knocked into lava
+You can go back and replay levels with your newly unlocked traps and spells. The game tells you the top scores for each level that your Steam friends achieved. I‚Äôm not that competitive though, I just wanted to finish each level and see the story.

Cons:
-I mentioned the difficulty ramps up, and by the end some of the levels seem practically impossible to get max score if you‚Äôre trying the Nightmare difficulty.

Overall, Orcs Must Die is a little known gem. The metacritic score is high, but nobody really talks about it. Some of the Steam achievements require mass grinding though, which is a little annoying. 9/10

review:
Orcs Must Die ist ein klassisches Tower Defense Game mit Comic Grafik. Eure Aufgabe besteht darin das gr√ºne Ungeziefer von den sogenannten Spalten (Wie bitte??) fernzuhalten. Wie ihr das anstellt ist ganz eurer Fantasie √ºberlassen. Hierzu stehen euch eine ganze Reihe unterschiedlichster Fallen zur Verf√ºgung. M√∂gt ihr euren Ork lieber gegrillt, in Scheiben geschnitten oder als Muus zerstampft. Auch fl√§mmen, teeren und federn ist m√∂glich ;) . Im Laufe des Spiels erhaltet ihr Zugriff auf die Weberinnen. Diese erm√∂glichen es euch aus einer Palette von Aufwertungen f√ºr eure Fallen und Zauber bzw. Verst√§rkungen f√ºr die NPC-Wachen zu w√§hlen. Die Level werden von Stufe zu Stufe schwerer, ohne dabei unfair zu werden.
Der Hauptprotagonist wirft immer wieder mit dummen Spr√ºchen um sich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009679229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2194, 'last_played': 1460281833}
review: It might be easy to dismiss OMD! as a FPS/tower defence variant reliant on its tongue-in-cheek humour and simple gameplay to appeal. While these are two of its key strengths, there is far more to OMD! however; it has very well designed levels, plenty of weapon choices and types of enamy, as well as many different potential styles of play. Nightmare difficulty (available after the campaign has been completed) requires particular dexterity and speed of thought and adds further longevity to the mix. All that said, the real reason this game is recommended by so many people is that killing the titular orcs is immensely good fun. Eviscerating an orc wondering whether its parking has been validated as its friend explodes a day before it is due for retirement (the back stories courtesy of the grumbles the orcs utter as they amble towards you) frankly never gets old. Having just completed Nightmare with over thirty thousand kills to my name, I can safely say I would happily sign up to melt, crush, shoot, detonate, squash, burn and generally mangle the little gits all over again. Given this was released in 2011 it comes on sale quite often and is definitely worth a go.
