author: {'steamid': '76561198055725979', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 2367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1459863576}
review:
Tower defense basado en el arte de la destruci√≥n.

Muchisimas t√°cticas v√°lidas, que funcionarian eficientemente.
Enemigos pesados y super ligeros como Kobold y Ogros.
Varias vias por donde el enemigo puede pasar.
0% Inteligencia artificial del enemigo para atacar, son nuestras marionetas.
Ambientacion medieval con trampas divididas en varios tipos de da√±os
En el fondo es un juego de acci√≥n de combates con armas y habilidades magicas en tercera persona con sistema de estad√≠sticas, cifras y matem√°ticas, t√©cnicamente bien trabajado para servir de base en momentos cr√≠ticos o necesarios.

No es un tower defense acumulativo o progresivo. Cada vez que pasamos un nuevo nivel se debloquea algo nuevo disponible, que puede ser una trampa, un hechizo, un arma, una clase de aliado, o incluso una deidad que nos especializa bastante. Con un dinero que si acumularemos y que sirve para dar esencia o sentido a ese arte de la guerra, colocaremos las trampas, cuanto mejores sean las muertes, m√°s nos premiar√°n con trampas u otras cosas para comprar.

En teor√≠a se debe hacer un estudio del nivel y elegir limitadamente qu√© vamos a tener disponible para la segunda fase de juego en tiempo real, deberemos hacer primero una medida entre trampas, aliados, especializaci√≥n y habilidades/ataque b√°sico del personaje.
El juego potencia un arte de la guerra antes que la experiencia acumulativa, haci√©ndonos ver que una buena mec√°nica de trampas puede conseguir que no necesitemos actuar con nuestro personaje para completar un nivel, o inclusoo viceversa.
La accion 3d servir√° perfectamente para nutrir al juego con todo lo necesario para la propuesta, como un buen dominido de la espada o la ballesta.

Son unos 25 niveles divididos en tres episodios. Los episodios har√≠an aparecer nuevos enemigos u otras combinaciones, tambi√©n cambiaria bastante el aspecto de los gr√°ficos. Los escenarios se ir√°n agrandando hasta darnos la sensaci√≥n de defender un castillo.

Es el cl√°sico juego de defender tu base, en este caso "la fisura" de una horda de enemigos nutrida sobretodo por orcos, ogros y seres voladores que tratar√°n de atravesar tus defensas.
El juego no tiene una historia muy profunda, pero los peque√±os trozos de gui√≥n son graciosos y amenizan tu defensa.
La calidad gr√°fica es bonita y la jugabilidad es muy interesante, pudiendo resolver las defensas de muchas maneras distintas.
Le doy una buena puntuaci√≥n a este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967459119', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 5940, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5294, 'last_played': 1470416090}
review:
At first glance [b]Orcs Must Die![/b] looks like a tower defence game. In reality if you rely solely on towers to kill enemies you will lose very quickly. It's more of a hybrid over-the-shoulder 3rd person action & tower defence game. Yes, increasingly difficult mobs lumber brainlessly toward an exit, but they may also try to kill you directly. Around half of your kills will come your main character using his trusty crossbow and spells than by the towers themselves.

This is generally a good thing but if you're looking for a pure tower defence game this isn't it. It does however keep the action fast as you sprint around each level where you need to help bolster defences on various ends of the map. You can't just "set it and forget it" for most levels.

While the different traps are fun, they generally come in 3 flavors: Single use (destroyed after one trigger), episodic traps (deals damage and then cools down), and constant (constant damage to all enemies that traverse it). As later levels and difficulties feature tougher and more numerous monsters, you will have no choice but to use traps that deal constant damage, of which there are a limited amount. This makes many of the more entertaining and flavorful traps pushed to way side. There are at least 3 traps I never used.

Regardless the game is still fun. Planning how to handle each wave and setting up a circuitous kill zone is extremely satisfying. The whimsical art style and humorous protagonist also helps things immensely. There's tons of replayability with multiple levels, 3 difficulty settings, and a decent expansion pack to boot. Well worth the sale price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032312813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2015, 'last_played': 1539466851}
review:
Who wants to have fun killing orcs?  Everyone, that's who.  Few things are more satisfying that setting up deadly traps and watching orcs be violently ripped apart, sliced and crushed with wonderful cartoony blood and guts splattering everywhere.  And who doesn't love cartoon gore?  No one, that's who.  I'm not really into the tower defense genre myself, but this game is not one to pass up.  Fast paced action and dasterdly traps await you.  It's also the first game that allowed me the pleasure of hearing a ten year old girl cackle madly after filling her spellbook with nasty traps and proclaim, "It's so easy to be evil!"

Yes it is, small female human.  Yes it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061996204', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1457277694}
review:
I bought the franchise pack and debated starting with the 2nd game or the first. I decided to start with the 1st one. I love it, I found my self thinking about different strategies at work even :)
I like to use different strategies all the time, so I never just stick to one. It is easy to beat this game using only 1 type of strategy but the fun lies in tinkering about.

Stability: 8/10 - can hang for extended periods of time during loading screens
Art: 9/10 - Suits the atmosphere of the game and is consistent through out
Sound: 8/10 - Fits the mood the game tries to portray. Fire crossbow sound get's messed up if you strafe shoot.
Gameplay: 9.5/10 - fluid and responsive, a joy to play. One downside is that orc attacks will hit you even if you are out side their attack animation.
Story: 4/10 - interesting potential but is very sparse and lacks any detail
Replayability: 9/10 - I love going back to get higher combo's and 5 skulls

If, like me, you bought both games, start with the first 1, it's extremely fun and the story does carry over to the 2nd game

author: {'steamid': '76561198165090247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 25, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1709797392}
review:
This is a great game and I am really enjoying playing it. It's basically a FPS & Tower Defense game. Your job is to prevent the orcs from reaching the rift. If too many do, you lose the level.

The orcs come at you in 'waves' and you have different ways of defending yourself. From traps to extra support (guardians). The key to success in the game is choosing the right traps in the level as well as placing them strategically.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020740602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1492655501}
review:
This is a tower defense game where you can run around killing off what your towers don't get. A lot of levels are challenging, and if you beat them just barely then you can come back later with better towers and upgrades to get all the points from it. 
It's really a lot of fun. The graphics and story are great too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106152551', 'num_games_owned': 1225, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1457288120}
review:
Orc Must Die! √® uno strategico sullo stile di Plants Vs Zombies ma in terza persona. Lo scopo infatti √® quello di predisporre delle trappole lungo percorsi sempre diversi allo scopo di fermare l'avanzata degli orchetti e compari. Oltre al fattore trappole c'√® da considerare inoltre l'estrema importanza del vostro personaggio che, grazie all'utilizzo di varie armi e incantesimi, far√† il grosso del lavoro per sbarrare la strada ai nemici. Quest'ultimo punto d√† personalmente molto dinamismo al gioco, in quanto non dovrete solo aspettare che le trappole facciano il loro lavoro ma vi occorrer√† muovervi da un capo all'altro della mappa per uccidere i nemici rimasti o sfoltire il grosso delle truppe.
Il buon numero di armi e magie diverse, e anche la presenza di nemici dotati di abilit√† differenti rendono senza dubbio il gioco versatile e divertente. 
Per quanto riguarda il livello di difficolt√† l'ho trovato eccellente, con livelli pi√π o meno difficili, ma sempre pensati per mettere appunto strategie diverse.
Per concludere Orc Must Die! √® un titolo che consiglio fortemente a tutti, sia per gli appassionati del genere che non, inoltre io l'ho preso a un prezzo misero attraverso le offerte di steam, quindi se lo vedete in offerta prendetelo assolutamente !

PS Il protagonista ha un senso dell'umorismo fantastico ~

-Al

author: {'steamid': '76561198060672703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1042, 'last_played': 1457548662}
review:
I got this on sale for less than the price of a piece of cheese at the local convenience store.

Pros:
For a game released in 2011 the graphics are still holding up strong
Solid Third Person Shooter/Tower Defense game with a challenge that doesn't feel intimidating.
Simple, fun, seemingly arcade style gameplay.
Music is basic, appropriate, and not annoying.
Better than cheese, and I really like cheese.

Cons:
I waited to long to find out that Orcs Must Die!
I still want a piece of cheese.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000403136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1457339438}
review:
I have only played the first couple of levels, but the best way to describe OMD! is as a cross between QUAKE and a tower defense game. The screenshots don't do it justice.

I can't decide if it's worth getting at full price, but I am so glad I grabbed this game (and the sequel) when the bundle was on sale. 

If they make another sequel, I hope they figure out how to make a co-op multiplayer. It would be nice to be able to compete with a friend to see who can make the most kills, most headshots, and all around biggest mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041085655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1558916309}
review: No es simplemente otro juego de tower defense, es divertido y adictivo. Una mezcla muy lograda de tower defense y shooter de acci√≥n en tercera persona. Jugabilidad divertida y simple con una curva de dificultad correcta. Las pegas son la escasez de niveles solo 30 incluyendo los 5 del DLC, auque son rejugables al incluir 3 niveles de dificultad y tabla de clasficaci√≥n para competir con tus amigos. La banda sonora personalmente no me gusta demasiado y se me hace repetitiva. Tambien se echa de menos un multijugador pero Robot tom√≥ nota y lo incluy√≥ en el Orc Must Die 2 un juego mas completo aunque menos sangriento, imagino que para conseguir una calificaci√≥n por edades mejor. Mi favorito siempre ser√° este por ser mas gore. RECOMENDADO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198169161582', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1461121744}
review:
Si te gustan los juegos con un estilo a Dungeon Defenders, este es tu juego pero barato. 

Desmembrar orcos para que no pasen por la fisura (una especie de vortice) es lo menos que haras en este juego poner trampas, pelear cuerpo a cuerpo, con arco, poner arqueros, guerreros, etc e jugado solo 1 hora en steam pero este juego me ha dado mas de 500 horas por steam verde. compralo no te arrepentiras 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198100942623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1488700815}
review:
First Person Tower Defense.  FPTD‚Ñ¢.    :P
This game is a ton of fun.  Played it lots elsewhere.  Was happy to get it on my PC with expansions.  
Great game, good quality.  Good challenges, always keep you looking for a better gimmick or technique.  
Part FPS, part Puzzle (sort of, in a strategy way), part Tower Defense.  
I would HIGHLY recommend this game.  Lot of fun, and humorous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192332317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1456631370}
review:
If you are debating whether to get the 1st or 2nd game, get the 2nd or the 2nd and the 1st. If you get both (get them on sale and it'll only be around $4 total), you get extra levels and DLC. 

Also be warned that the first game has super high mouse sensitivity, so if you don't have a very small mousepad or super slow mouse DPI, get the 2nd game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982204029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1613277735}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094168972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1456697574}
review: No built in key bindings. Big convoluted mess to try to get the game working with your own key bindings. On top of that, you can't even have a controller or something your PC THINKS is a controller plugged in to make it work correctly. Not worth the time and effort when there's a ton of other games out there to play. If I hadn't gotten this in a bundle (not to mention hadn't spent over 2 hours of game time trying to get it to WORK), I'd refund the heck out of it. This should not be acceptable. I can't believe how many positive reviews this has. It boggles the mind.

review: Ah, how I love tower defense games. I love this just the same. maybe a little more since i can clean up the messes my tower wont. only been playing a few hours and already addicted. bought it during their 90% steam sale just cause it was cheap and, now I wonder, "WHY DIDN'T I BUY THIS SOONER?!" It has humor, fun, decent strategy, good music, decent voice acting, and even a story to go with it. Whats not to love?

author: {'steamid': '76561198065865418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1456535641}
review:
Juegazo, Lo fundi en la version "gratis" y por tanto era una compra pendiente por la cantidad de horas que en su dia me proporciono esta franquicia.

Un Must Have en toda regla, desenfadado, arcade, mezcla de tercera persona y tower defense.

Engancha y divierte, ahora encima con Workshop, Compatibilidad 100% con el Xboxpad y un precio que den ganas de regalarselo a todos tus colegas solo para ver como quedan por debajo en el Ranked global.

Si te lo estas pensando por 90 centimos no merece la pena perder el tiempo dudando.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028319174', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1600895531}
review:
Ok, let's get this straight: wanna kill orcs? you have 2 options: Warhammer universe or this game, the later option is SO F****ng fun!!
This seem to be the kind of game that were so well developed that the devs had time to put fun monologues, jokes, extra-orcish-gore and a bro-wizard who knows how to celebrate victory... 

OMD intends to be fun, not a AAA game, so, the grafics are good, and they work just fine to show the locations and the gore of killing orcs with a really interesting arsenal.

buy this game, seriouslly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087833410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1457506791}
review:
So much fun to be had in this oldie but goodie.  Very well laid out and easy to get into.  The controls are similar to an fps.  the gameplay is a mix of  tower defense and fps genres with great graphics, sounds and a humorous story thrown in to keep the fun coming for hours!

Strongly recommend this to fans of tower defense games looking for something fun that gets more challenging and addicting as you progress.  If you are looking for a multipalyer component go with the second.  You won't be disapointed with either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214837901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1454092069}
review:
[b]Bonjour ! Voici l'√©valuation de Orcs Must Die![/b]

[h1] Graphismes [/h1]

[b]Les graphismes sont dans un style manga tr√®s agr√©able √† regarder, les couleurs sont vives, les ennemis sont tr√®s bien dessin√©, notre personnage aussi. Les explosions et autres effets sont sans erreur, tr√®s pr√©cis. Bref, un chef d'oeuvre pour l'oeil ! [/b]

[h1] Sons [/h1]

[b]C'est pour moi l'une des forces du jeu : la musique omnipr√©sente nous permet de nous plonger correctement dans le jeu dans un style m√©di√©val tr√®s rap√Æde pour nous donner du punch ! Du c√¥t√© des sons, encore une fois, on sent bien les sons tr√®s √©pur√©s et travaill√©s au maximum afin de rendre le tout tr√®s agr√©able √† l'oreille !
Petit b√©mol : les voix des personnages PENDANT une map sont inaudible, on doit baisser le son de la musique mais les bruitages passent au dessus ![/b]

[h1] Gameplay [/H1]

[b] Vous √™tes dans la peau d'un apprenti qui a r√©cup√©r√© une arbal√®te et quelques pi√®ges pour affronter une horde assoif√©e de sang compos√©e de Kobold, orcs, ogres et autres cr√©atures ! Vous allez devoir r√©fl√©chir √† la mani√®re de poser vos d√©fenses ainsi que la nature des d√©fenses que vous allez placer ! Si vous placez des d√©fenses √† la mauvaise place, cela peut vous co√ªter cher ! [/b]

[h1] Dur√©e de vie [/h1]

[b]Le jeu est tr√®s court ! Seulement une vingtaine de carte sont disponibles et celles-ci se r√©alisent en 10-15 minutes si on g√®re bien. Le mode cauchemar nous permet de mettre plus de difficult√© mais en gardant les m√™me maps. Vous n'aurez simplement plus de temps entre vos diff√©rentes Waves. C'est ici son b√©mol, vous l'aurez compris, il est trop court ![/b]

[h1] Sc√©nario [/h1]

[b]Ce dernier est presque inexistant. Nous avons un sage qui se fracasse la t√™te au sol et un apprenti qui reprend le flambeau pour au final fermer des portails dans lesquels des orcs affluent. Apr√®s, l'histoire est mise totalement de c√¥t√© car le gameplay ne s'y pr√™te pas ! [/b]

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

[b]Un jeu tr√®s √©nergique, proposant du challenge √† celui qui en veut mais pas assez de map √† ceux qui en sont fan !

author: {'steamid': '76561198055871058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1452985294}
review:
[h1] Simple, Fun, Addictive[/h1]

This game is very simple, defend your crystal from orcs! I know that sounds pretty booring but trust me, this one is good.

First of I wanna talk about the gameplay. The gameplay is actually really addictive and fun, its not hard to understand. First the gameplay seems really simple but after some time it gets harder.
The graphics are nice and cartoony, something that I really like! and the controls are nice and tight.

Is this game worth the full price? Freaking yes! its a total hidden gem!

Will this game run on a older PC? yes it will and good too!

1-10? I give it a 8 out of 10.

All in all its a great indie game with alot of fun hours ahead for you! I totally recommend it.

Per finirilo a difficolt√† normale ci vogliono una decina di ore, ma se volete avere 5 teschi su ogni mappa preparatevi a sudare, alcune sono davvero toste.
Prendetelo quando costa meno di 5 euro e, se vi piacciono i tower defense non ve ne pentirete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053229942', 'num_games_owned': 1399, 'num_reviews': 1092, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1388966354}
review: An okay tower defense game. Gets boring very quickly, but to be honest I really dislike the genre, hence why I might be prejudiced. If you like tower defenses, ignore my review, otherwise I recommend to pass on this one. It's just building traps and watching enemies walk into them and die. Sure, the game provides some challenge, but the gameplay itself is just setting up traps as quickly as possible and shooting some enemies from time to time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034211169', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1449742121}
review:
Il est facile de se prendre pour Gandalf luttant contre le Balrog sur le Pont de Durin en jouant √† ce jeu.

Des hordes d'orques, trolls et autres cr√©atures mal√©fiques d√©ferlent pour √©radiquer l'esp√®ce humaine et vous n'√™tes que le seul rempart entre ces monstruosit√©s et votre monde bien-aim√©.

Les m√©caniques de jeu sont tr√®s simples, c'est en somme un tower d√©fense √† la troisi√®me personne. Vous allez pouvoir monter des pi√®ges tous plus machiav√©liques les uns que les autres afin de renvoyer les orques dans les tr√©fonds des Enfers.

Au niveau graphismes, c'est tout √† fait satisfaisant. 
La difficult√© est √©galement bien dos√©e et les nombreux modes de jeu disponibles vous garantissent une grande rejouabilit√© .

Le seul point noir est l'impossibilit√© de jouer en coop√©ration ou en multijoueur.

A acqu√©rir √† petit prix, il vous permettra de vous divertir quelques heures.

review:
Un excellent Tower Defense avec un syst√®me de jeu tr√®s dynamique, avec une phase de pi√®ges et une phase de tir √† la troisi√®me personne. 

Reste cependant quelques niveau assez difficiles et certains √©l√©ments mal √©quilibr√©s, probl√®mes qui seront r√©solus pour la plupart dans le 2 (ce qui signifie un nerf global de toutes les armes cheat√©es du 1 ^^)

Les musiques, bien que pas assez nombreuses sont excellentes et rythment bien l'exp√©rience de jeu. Le sc√©nario est simple mais les blagues de notre personnage sont assez agr√©ables. Les graphismes sont tr√®s beaux m√™me en low et les d√©cors sont assez captivants (on a vraiment l'impression d'y √™tre. Quoique certains pourrait trouver que les d√©cors font plut√¥t carton p√¢te de pr√©s, enfin perso j'ai bien, on se croirai dans un parc d'attraction, mais sans la file d'attente ^^ encore que pour les orcs....) 

Le gameplay est tr√®s dynamique et jamais r√©p√©titif, on en redemande toujours plus, dommage que la difficult√© soit parfois mal dos√©e (j'ai personnellement parfois failli lacher le jeu √† cause de cela, apr√®s, je suis peut √™tre mauvais, mais il semble que pour r√©ussir, il n'existe qu'un seule vrai m√©thode parfaite, √† r√©p√©t√© sans se poser de question. On perd un peu le plaisir de jeu je trouve du coup).

author: {'steamid': '76561198233010172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1506788674}
review:
I wanted to give this game a legitimate chance before I wrote my review. I am an avid tower defense gamer; there is just something undeniably satisfying about stoping someone from reaching their goal.... its actually kind of sick really. This brings an intresting change of pace. The humor is pretty engaging, I find myself eager with each new level to hear what kind of quip the War Mage will say. The traps are creative and encourage you to find new ways to supress the Orcs. Will your bombard them with Archers while they are arduously walking through a tar pit, or perhaps you would like to take them on yourself while cattle them into a grinder. Whatever menacingly creative way you wish to protect the rift, this game has something for you.

Play it if : You love tower defense (I assure you, you won't be dissapointed)
Avoid it if: You are an Orc Lover, You are not creative, or obviously if you don't like tower defense 

9/10 in my book
The only thing holding it back is no mutiplayer, but the second game remedied that issue

author: {'steamid': '76561198035186086', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1447388418}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a fun, addictive game that combines twitchy, arcade shooter goodness with tower defense mechanics to hold back the neverending tide of Orc invaders.  The levels are well designed and the traps are some of the most unique I've seen in the genre.  From bubbling pools of lava, to spring boards that launch enemies into ponds of acid, as well as the classic spike and arrow traps, you'll have more options than you know what to do with.  The story is basic but complimented by funny banter from the main character and is told through voice over and still images.

Perhaps the games greatest strength relies in the the 3rd person shooter elements.  You're not relegated to simply laying traps and hoping for the best.  Instead, you can fight alongside your machinations, whether it's with a spear, crossbow, or magic; you yourself lend a hand in achieving victory.  It's fun and fast paced and keeps the player engaged in each level as well as providing room for error when setting up traps.  This is something, I feel, the genre as a whole is in need of.  Too often in these style of games, the player is relagated to one or two winning strategies that are only uncovered through tedious trial and error.  In Orcs Must Die!, the player can create endless combinations to achieve victory precisely because they can shoot and stab the orcs alongside the traps.

In the end, it's a fun, addictive game with 3 difficulty levels and plenty of replay value.  There's also a sequel worth mentioning.  So if you like tower defense games, this is a must buy.  If you don't, I'd still check this out on the cheap during a steam sale.  It just might surprise you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995132155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1708568042}
review:
This is a fun game but it's definitely quirky.

+ Interesting level design
+ Configurable upgrades with Weavers

- Some levels way too open with too few options to build defenses
- You can't refund skulls; so you anticipation/guessing plays into unlocking items
- You can't redefine keys (defaults to WASD) which is ... short-sighted
- No option to create your own maps

author: {'steamid': '76561198021432590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1378339746}
review:
8/10

A great tower defence game, with the addition of an FPS side it makes for a great game.

Making traps for orcs is great, the difficulty isnt overly hard, theres a wide range of weapons, levels and traps to keep the game interesting.

Worth a pickup.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989390503', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1443980832}
review:
Some games you can tell are going to be good from the first 10 minutes of playing them. Orcs Must Die is one of those games. From the moment you start playing, its slick presentation becomes very apparent, ranging from a charming artstyle, to nice fast-paced music, and a comedic tone. 

But presentation is not the only thing where the game shines. As a tower defence game it has some pretty ingenious trap ideas, such as trapdoors that release scorching flames, spring pads that launch orcs into the air, as well as acid bombs and even knights and archers. The level designs are also very well made, at times providing very obvious spots for where traps are ideal. And in addition to traps, you also unlock weavers, which are sorceresses that provide you with passive skills for the duration of the level. Upgrading these skills makes either your abilities or your traps/guardians more effective at what they do.

At the end of each level, you get a score (which is shown against scores of people on your friends list) and a rating out of 5 skulls. You can then use the skulls to upgrade some of your traps.

Overall the game was loads of fun. I've had a blast. Perhaps the only minor criticism I have is that when starting a new level that has more than 1 enemy entrances, it's often impossible to tell where the enemy is going to come through first. But it's a very small nitpick. The game is fun. If you like tower defence genre, get it now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024587625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1442288052}
review:
I absolutely love this game!
It clearly did not have a huge budget. There are no super expensive intros and the graphics are rather simple (but effective and not bad in any way).
But it is the concept that is so much fun. Building traps for the Orcs to run into and get killed in the most hillarious of ways is incredibly satisfying. The dialogue and voice acting are well done. The music fits the theme (but is a bit repetitive). The animation is great. The story is funny. The hero is likeable.
My only critique would be that it is a bit short if you paid the full price. It feels like the game only just started when it is already over. You really want to make use of the last few types of traps more often before the game ends. And I never really got to ues the Weavers that much either (there never really is that much money). I wished there had been more levels to explore this upgrade mechanic and the last few traps a bit more. 
Because of its shortness, best wait until it is on sale. 
8 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999086625', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7575, 'last_played': 1651196603}
review:
I have both OMD1 and OMD2 and I must say that OMD1 still holds up very well. The graphics and playbility remain strong today despite the fact OMD1 is now 4-years old.

OMD1 and OMD2 is all about killing massive numbers of orcs, ogres, and all manner of creatures in a fun, cartoony-violent way.  Yes, the game has a large amount of "gore and violence" but it is "fine and acceptable" because of the "fun" way the developers render the graphics.  If the graphics were done "realistically", the "gore and violence" would make it unacceptable for kids and even many adults who have queasy stomachs.

For example, I find it funny when you kill an ogre, you see slices of meat / chopped meat to represent the killing than a rendering of what a mutilated ogre might look like "realistically". It is also funny to watch all the orcs "suffer" and otherwise react to being tortured and then killed. I know it might sound really bad when you read this but it is really a credit to the developers who pulled off this magical feat (no pun intended) of making all the killing and violence fun and amusing.

Ultimately, this is meant to be a fun, humorous, and fast-paced game where one can escape to kill hundreds of digital creatures.  And as of the game and the DLC's wasn't fun enough, I bought OMD1 at a steep Steam discount.  When you play a fabulous game for dozens of hours and you buy it for a steal, it just doesn't get any better for a gamer.

OMD1 is a winner.  When you get done with OMD1, go to OMD2.  So much fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062452046', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1439164024}
review:
Great gameplay.  The upgrade system is different for a tower defense game (you buy one upgrade for a tower, such as more damage or making it cheaper to use in-game, and it then persists for the rest of your campaign, rather than upgrading each tower individually in combat), but it works pretty well all the same.

Some of the protagonist's ejaculations get quite annoying, as they're pretty limited in variety, and often don't make sense.  For example, when laying a simple barrier tower, he'll shout, "That'll hurt!".

Overall, the game is great.  I played the entire thing in one sitting. :P

author: {'steamid': '76561197990539789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1428837649}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a tower defens / shooter video game.

I'm personal really big fan of this games.
You not only try to defens yourself and the portal with traps and towers.
Because you have the option to fight your own.
Charcter has a small amount of upgrades and new weapons to unlock and choice.
It's has a very big number of challanges to complete to clear the full game.
Very nice to play alone.. and alone because there is no freaking multiplayer... for this buy part 2.
Easy to control video game and playing it with a controller plays very nice.

No co-op multiplay still.. a must have game for the tower defense / shooter lovers.
I give this game a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041998485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1439035872}
review: It took me cce 8 hours to complete first run on standard (not low) difficulty. Game offers variety of traps to serve one's "style" - are you a direct damage dealer, tricky tactician, do you like traps to do all the work or do you like being engaged in a fight? These and many more options are offered. The variety of monsters, their stregnth, number in comparison with your abilities, traps and magic is well balanced. There are points in game where player must be very flexible. When you finish game, you can start with all upgrades and traps unlocked from previous run and do campaign from scratch. There are tougher monsters coming in already at start. This is sad, because I would welcome ability to play new game already on highest. I am not going to play again. Not because I wouldnt enjoy it, but because I have no time and want to finish other games, too. In short - great chillout game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169022165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1438039019}
review:
Orcs Must Die is at its core a tower defense game, but in 3D, with a below average FPS element. If you are a fan of tower defense games, I'm sure you'll get a lot of enjoyment out of the game, since there is a lot of content.

If you are a FPS gamer however, you'll probably get bored very quickly, as I did. Orcs Must Die was probably never intended to compare to "real" FPS games, and as such, the combat, difficulty, and enemy diversity and adaptation is lacking when you compare it.

It's really annoying that you can only recommend a game, or not. If you are tower defense player, Orcs Must Die is amazing value. If you are an FPS gamer, Orcs Must Die is disappointing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007817556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 3295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3001, 'last_played': 1571315471}
review:
[h1]NOT-Kid-Friendly:[/h1]
It‚Äôs very bloody and it‚Äôs basically you killing thousands of living creatures who have feelings while some of them don‚Äôt even want to march this assault of doom.

[h1]Dear Brother:[/h1]
I played this game near its release and I rocked nightmare mode and then after a long while I didn‚Äôt play it because I couldn‚Äôt perfect some levels. When I went back to play it, it felt like a new game again because I was able to become more creative with devising new trap set-ups. Simply put, this is easily a very enjoyable game that we can keep going back to from time to time until the sequel comes out!

[h1]Dear Wife:[/h1]
Strategy is the key to winning this game. It invites you to be creative and rewards you with being efficient. Unfortunately, murdering thousands of orcs may not be your cup of tea, so to speak. We‚Äôll definitely pass this one.

[h1]My Last Thoughts: [/h1]
KEPT. I allowed it to stay in my hard drive until the sequel came out.
IMPRESSED. Nightmare mode always puts me on the edge of my seat but it never pushes me off as there are always many options to accomplish the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096016912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1440216472}
review:
24-38-12
[h1][b]IF YOU WANT CO-OP  GET OMD2!!![/b][/h1]
If you like single player better, get OMD1, or if you like a challange get both!
Tower defense + third person shooter is the easiest way to describe this, this game is so fun, you can choose character upgrades or buy traps, those can be upgraded with skulls which are awarded based on how well you did on a level (how many rift points you have and weather you completed on time) completing on time awards 1 skull and having all rift points left awards 4.

[h1]Traps[/h1]
There are a large variety of traps instead of listing them off myself here's a link to the [url=http://orcsmustdie.wikia.com/wiki/Traps]wiki page[/url]
My personal favorite trap combo is tar with floor scorchers and pretty much any wall trap,  but pretty much anyone's strategy will be different!

[h1]Weapons[/h1]
Another wiki page [url=http://orcsmustdie.wikia.com/wiki/Weapons]link[/url]
Weapons all feel different and unique and all weapons have good uses (unlike *cough*[i]tf2's wrap assasin[/i]*cough*)

[h1]Progress system[/h1]
I like the progress system, pretty much every level you unlock a new toy to torture orcs with, well I guess you're killing them too fast for it to be torture....
About half way through you get weapon/trap enchanters, who will upgrade your weapons and traps for a price, you can upgrade your crossbow to shoot FIIIRRREEEE!!!!

I'd definatly reccomend this (and Orcs Must Die! 2)

I love the graphics style, it isn't laggy even on my dad's 1 year old potato laptop and I just have to say I can't reccoment this enough

Final review?
10 out of focking 10
Because I won't forget this game ever, shame the new one is "f2p" which almost always means P2W

Also WHY DOESN'T STEAM LOG MY HOURS CORRECTLY I HAVE ATLEAST 50, I FINISHED THE GAME AND HAVE ALL BUT 2 ACHIEVEMENTS!!!!... Maybe because I don't usually have internet ):

author: {'steamid': '76561198083667852', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2199, 'last_played': 1385664255}
review:
Cartoony, and humorous slap-stick style turret defense with added fps elements.  Extremely fun and engaging from start to finish. You are the guardian of the warp-gate thingy... baddies (orcs, trolls, bats, goblins, etc) spawn at a specific location and traverse the map to get to the glowing blue pillar of light that must be protected at all costs. The AI isn't amazing but it will alter its path if there is one of lesser resistance, or even move to attack you directly if you're close enough to them. Your task as the guardian is to stop them by any and all means necessary. be it shooting them with arrows, magic, or traps that you've cleverly placed along their selected path. All the while upgrading your skills/traps along the way to improve your chances of preventing them from escaping.

In short, Orcs must die! like, a lot...

author: {'steamid': '76561197987583311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1635187371}
review:
[b]'Orcs Must Die!'[/b] is a well designed [b]indie game[/b] to play a fast round without thinking of playing 'CS: GO' instead.

[b]Desc:[/b]
You have a portal with (dependent on difficulty level) 20 lifes, each orc getting into it decreases the life. You goal is to place traps/units and use magic to kill all the orcs without losing any life. At the end you gain skulls for each completed level to upgrade your traps/units. Easy as that.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ 'Pointless' killing orcs
+ Humorously dialogs/story
+ Awesome level design (no level is the same and each level has its own gimmicks)
+ Active melee and ranged fight (sword / crossbow)
+ Terrific trap and unit design (no pointless traps/units)
+ 3 magical sections
+ 3 levels of difficulty
+ No Bugs/Glitches
+ Downloadable Demo
(+ Achievements [some are hard to get])
(+ DLCs)

[b]Cons:[/b]
- no Multiplayer (there was a lot of potential to have a MP implemented)
- I would write more cons, if I would find some ^^

[b]Recommended[/b], but only if it's [b]on sale[/b], because there is still the sequel 'Orcs Must Die 2!'.

[b]9/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044567406', 'num_games_owned': 1718, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1480902526}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a game that asks a few questions.

1. Do you like tower defense games?
2. Do you like 3rd person games?
3. Do you like RPG elements mixed into either of the above two?
4. Do you like any combination of the the above 3 questions?
5. Do you like shooting orcs in the face?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then get Orcs Must Die!, and trust me you'll have a blast. It's challenging, fun and the dialouge is funny. Worth it all the way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025806217', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1713, 'last_played': 1529954681}
review:
Orcs must Die! is a third person action Tower defense game and probably the best when its about the gameplay. You play as a War Mage who needs to defend Gates from ugly Orcs. To do this task you can use Traps and Weapons as well as some envoirmental stuff. 

The Gameplay is pretty straight forward. The first Wave and every 5 Waves you have unlimited Time to decide what to Build. Between each other wave you have a time limit until the next wave starts. You can purchase Traps with money. You get money for killing Orcs and you get even more money if you kill Orcs with more than one Trap. The trick is to get as many traps on one place as possible. You need of course something to fight for yourself. For that you can use a magical crossbow that can shoot bolts very fast or a Sword. You can also use magical items to shoot fire or ice and with the DLC you get some interesting items like a pot full of acid which you can throw on the orcs to kill loads of orcs with one attack. All items have a secondary attack that uses mana (In case of the Acid pot it always costs mana to balance it). You can refill your mana at the Gate that you need to defend. Or you can use a magical contraption that refills your mana if you stand next to it. Later in the game you get the wavers, which sell upgrades if you have a spare coin for them. 

The grafics are nothing special but the artstyle is great. I always considered that the artstyle is more important than the grafics of a game and Orcs Must Die! is the best example for that. The medival comic look fits nicely with the theme of the game.

The Soundtrack is pretty good. It is mostly medival rock music and fits perfect to the artstyle and the Gameplay. 


If you like or dont like this review than please tell me why. If there are grammar problems in the text please let me know.

Zadanie jest proste jak budowa cepa, zabij ork√≥w, ale jak ich zabiƒá? Mo≈ºemi ich spaliƒá, po≈õekaƒá, poƒáwiartowaƒá, naszpikowaƒá strza≈Çami czy rozpu≈õciƒá w kwasie. author: {'steamid': '76561198018698258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2555, 'last_played': 1558893848}
review:
Orcs Must Die¬†! est un jeu de Tower Defense/Action fort sympathique et addictif.
Le th√®me abord√© est inspir√© de Warcraft (Orcs, graphismes un peu cartoon √† la Warcraft...), le doublage en fran√ßais est r√©ussi, l'ambiance, les combats, les pi√®ges et l'attitude des diff√©rents types d'Orcs, d'Ores et autres joyeuset√©s conf√®rent au titre ses lettres de noblesse. 
L'aspect action est tr√®s correct, bien g√©r√© et les pouvoirs (bagues qui permet de repousser, geler, br√ªler ou foudroyer les ennemis) permettent d'aborder votre intervention directe de diff√©rentes fa√ßons et surtout des les adapter (les Ogres de glace sont insensibles √† la bague qui g√®le les ennemis, logique!).
La vari√©t√© des pi√®ges est int√©ressantes et il est possible de les am√©liorer avec des points que l'on gagne en fonction de nos performances pour terminer un niveau. A ce sujet, on peut recommencer un niveau ind√©finiment et quand on le souhaite et le jeu retiens le meilleur score que l'on ait fait (donc pas de syndrome perte de score li√© √† une moins bonne prestation). A noter que lorsque l'on recommence n'importe quel niveau on peut le faire avec toutes les connaissances actuelle (c'est √† dire avec des pi√®ges d√©bloqu√©s qui n'√©taient pas disponibles au moment o√π on a fait tel niveau).
Enfin, notons que le joueur doit faire un choix au d√©but du chaque partie, le nombre d'emplacement pour les pi√®ges et/ou les bagues √† utiliser pour le niveau sont limit√©s et une fois d√©cid√© ce choix reste jusqu'√† la fin du niveau (que l'on peut recommencer √† loisir comme vu pr√©c√©demment).
Dans les pi√®ges disponibles √† noter 2 pi√®ges un peu particuliers puisqu'il s'agit d'archers et de paladins qui peuvent √™tre am√©liorer au cours du niveau (voir ci-apr√®s).
A cela s'ajoute ¬´¬†les tisseuses¬†¬ª, il s'agit d'am√©liorations qui se remettent √† 0 √† chaque d√©but de niveau mais qui conf√®rent des avantages indispensables, soit pour les pi√®ges, soit pour le joueur.
On peut terminer un niveau uniquement en utilisant les pi√®ges mais l'intervention du joueur est parfois recommand√©e voire n√©cessaire dans certains cas.
Certains lui reprocheront une dur√©e de vie pas trop longue malgr√© ses 24 niveaux et 3 modes de difficult√©s (sachant que le mode Cauchemar porte bien son nom mais n'est pas insurmontable et force √† adopter des strat√©gies diff√©rentes du mode Mage de Guerre) mais ne faisons pas la fine bouche, il est tr√®s bien et surtout tr√®s abordable de nos jours.

√áa m√©rite bien [url=https://youtu.be/H4I5ckiG5CY]un petit clip vid√©o fait maison[/url] ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079125411', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1658184018}
review: This game is one of the best combinations of hack and slash and strategy I've ever played and ever will play. The core concepts are engaging and easy to grasp, making conquering a new level never feel like a chore. The mindless killing is backed up perfectly with very strategic trap placement: after a good setup, watching it just run it's course is absolutely worth it. The replayability is totally there, as new solutions to levels and better scores are always there. Even someone who just wants to blaze through it without caring for scores will have a fun and difficult time (but you should try to 5-star every level, as every new star earned in a level is 1 point in the shop, used for upgrading traps and weapons). And traps isn't all there is: the traps would be useless without you, the player, hopping in and doing some killing yourself. And those achievements (if you want to get them all) will tack on many hours to this amazing game. In short, I think everyone should have a chance to expirience this masterpiece (and the sequel). Too bad the MOBA sucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041134370', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1433669818}
review:
Bueno, despues de haberme pasado el juego creo conveniente hacer este analisis.

Orcs Must die, es un genero que combina lo mejor de los juegos estilo "castle defender" con lo mejor de las peleas entre Orcos y Magos, lo que lo convierte en un juego muy completo.

VENTAJAS:
- 3D, con las posibilidades que esto incluye.
- Multitud de trampas para ayudarte a defender el objetivo.
- Soldados con toda movilidad, para apoyar la defensa.
- Un persona, con movilidad total.
- Unos decorados, que pegan a la perfeccion con el tipo de juego.

DESVENTAJAS:
- Echo de menos un modo donde se intente sobrevivir el mayor numero de rondas.

Es por ello, que recomiendo totalmente este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170514177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1436633121}
review: nice game

author: {'steamid': '76561198049581151', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5874, 'last_played': 1353398400}
review:
[quote=The TL,DR Genie]I installed [i]Orcs Must Die![/i] and played through the first two difficulties with a constant smile on my face, pretty much bewitched by the fun combination of traps and spells I could use during each mission. I refused to let it go until I beat it on the hardest difficulty and got all the achievements. I give this game five skulls (and a horned helmet to boot)![/quote]

[h1]A fun, addictive, and enjoyable experience that keeps on giving.[/h1]

[i]Orcs Must Die![/i] is not the type to focus on its lore or story more than it's necessary. There's a legion of baddies out there and it's up to you and your ridiculously generous array of traps, weapons and spells to stop them. The simple and funny cinematics and voice acting cover the rest. The protagonist is witty, easy-going, wise-cracking, and arrogant to the point of annoyance. And as such, I lovingly refer to him as Bruce Campbell.

The HUD and menus are minimalistic and have been built for easy and simple navigation with a gamepad. Even so, using a keyboard is in no way inconvenient especially when considering that all of the action is paused while looking through the menus.

The graphics are in no way elaborate or any form of high definition but they are far from being poor or shoddy. Considering the high level of action and running around required, they are quite appropriate as nobody wants to have to restart a mission because they got overrun by orcs while looking at the pretty walls. The sound effects fit with the visual style amazingly well, the music is very fun and needs a lot of time for the repetitiveness to become annoying, which sadly cannot be said by the quippy voice acting which does get old pretty fast.

The controls rarely feel awkward and only become a problem for perfectionists (such as myself) who wish to align all their traps perfectly. The heat of battle on higher difficulties makes for split-second perfect placement which when failed might require users to restart the mission. The Options menu is quite modest but fitting to the purpose of [i]Orcs Must Die![/i]. The Achievements don't ask too much from the user and completionists will get almost all of them by the end. In regards to the Leaderboards, some of the higher scoring users got there with cheats that allowed absurd numbers but ranking among friends works just fine and in real time.

I installed [i]Orcs Must Die![/i] and played through the first two difficulties with a constant smile on my face, pretty much bewitched by the fun combination of traps and spells I could use during each mission. I refused to let it go until I beat it on the hardest difficulty and got all the achievements. I give this game five skulls (and a horned helmet to boot)!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998720529', 'num_games_owned': 1150, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1941, 'last_played': 1343026800}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a drama of apocalyptic dimensions. You‚Äôll run around killing them with a mixture of clever traps and third person shooting but this tower defense game is really the story of the poor Orcs that you decimate. Every Orc‚Äôs story is told with a hallucinatory intensity, whether they were tossed off a cliff by a spring, slowed by tar before being perforated by poison arrows, burned to a crisp by ground based fire traps, or stabbed to death by the merciless protagonist. Orcs may not be real, but their trials and tribulations have taught me more about the fragility and splendor that we call life.

I can‚Äôt express how transformative this masterpiece is. Let‚Äôs be clear, it‚Äôs not just a masterpiece of the tower defense genre, but of humanity itself.  Orcs must die has turned me into a better person. As a result of this game I‚Äôve decided to clean up my act. I will no longer leave spike traps on the floor lest my future offspring trigger them. Also, I will try being friendly with strangers rather than freezing and shattering them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064593529', 'num_games_owned': 1355, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 1465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1442451437}
review:
Incredibly fun, but takes a little while to get into.
At first it seems like you just plow away with your crossbow, but it quickly becomes about strategy.
Very entertaining graphics and physics. Gameplay is very fun, and yet still challenging.
I highly recommend this game if you're into Tower Defense games.

Other games like this are Sanctum (1 and 2) and Dungeon Defenders. All of these are great games, and the FPS/TPS slash Tower Defense genre really needs more games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2781, 'num_reviews': 1449, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1430338570}
review:
A superb 'Tower Defense' game that will have you coming back for more. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uJRtNMrV-PY

Slice them, burn them, skewer them, and launch them - no matter how you get it done, orcs must die in this fantasy action-strategy game from Robot Entertainment. 

As a powerful War Mage with dozens of deadly weapons, spells, and traps at your fingertips, defend twenty-four fortresses from a rampaging mob of beastly enemies, including ogres, hellbats, and of course, a whole bunch of ugly orcs. Battle your enemies through a story-based campaign across multiple difficulty levels, including brutal Nightmare mode! 

Will you roast orcs in pits of lava, pound them flat with a ceiling trap, or freeze and shatter them with a slash? No matter the weapons and traps you choose, you‚Äôre sure to have an orc-killing blast!  - Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985543092', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1430858530}
review:
Orcs Must Die es el t√≠pico juego para jugar en los ratos muertos. Uno de los primeros Tower defense "reformados" que nos har√° pensar en alguna que otra misi√≥n para conseguir las tan preciadas 5 calaveras.

Para quien no lo sepa, OMD es un juego donde llevamos a un mago. Al principio de cada misi√≥n tendremos que escoger las trampas, armas y magias a utilizar para repeler el ataque de orcos, diablillos, ogros, etc. El enemigo ir√° directo hacia nuestro nexo, y ah√≠ es donde tendremos que darlo todo. 

No es un t√≠tulo demasiado complicado, aunque el modo "pesadilla" si es algo a tener en cuenta en cuanto a dificultad. 
Hay que tener claro, que el juego est√° orientado al cachondeo, y ese es uno de sus puntos fuertes.

Un apartado sonoro bastante cuidado, dise√±os m√°s que buenos y gr√°ficos correctos har√°n de este juego algo muy entretenido para esas tardes aburridas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989179135', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 2234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1213, 'last_played': 1511679365}
review:
i hate tower defence games, but this game is amazing.

this is the best tower defence game ever made, hands down.

the goal is simple, keep enemies from getting from point a to point b.
you use elements to help you do such, like place and remove all sorts of different traps that do all sorts of different things.
use all sorts of different weapons and spells/magic.

if you have never played or seen this game before, buy it. YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!

i have over 1000+ games that i own and play...not to mention games ive owned in the past on consoles. this is by far in my top 3 favorites, maybe even number 1.

so even if you are like me, and hate tower defence games, give this a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999926754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 2713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2713, 'last_played': 1429995989}
review:
This is a really great and fun tower defense game mixed with real-time action game... once you get the hang of it. Not to imply that it isn't fun right out of the gate, but it doesn't take very long for you to sort of realize that the game wants to be played in a very particular way, and if you aren't picking up the game's hints, it can get frustrating. There are frankly a lot of things about this game that are VERY USEFUL INFORMATION that it doesn't do a particularly good job of explaining to you. Here are just a few examples of things that are confusing and will drive players to consult ye olde Google:

1. How in the hell does the skull system work...???
2. I'm kicking a** and no orcs are getting into the rift, but I keep getting low scores...???
3. I have no idea what I'm supposed to do with this steam trap...???

Here are the short versions to those answers:

1. For 5 skulls, beat the level, get lots of combos, don't lose any rift points, and beat the mysterious "target time" that you have no idea exists or what the specific target time is unless you finish the level and select "statistics" from the end-of-level options then look for the fine print.

2. Combos. It's not enough to just kill all the orcs and keep them away from the rift. You have to kill lots of orcs simultaneously, really fast, as much as possible.

3. The steam trap is a worthless piece of crap that does nothing useful (and it's not the only one). Just ignore it.

If you want to head down the path of victory instead of the path of what-the-hell-is-going-on, then here is where you should start:

1. Wind Bracers
2. Archers
3. Tar pits
4. Barricades
6. Ice amulet
7. Steel Weaver -> Death Augmenter

You'll unlock these as you progress, but those are probably the most useful traps in the game. Orcs plodding slowly through a snaking trail of tar while 15 archers fire flaming arrows at them simultaneously? While you simultaneously use the bracers to blow huge crowds of them into a lava/acid pit? Victory.

You'll pick up more tricks and variations as you go. Swinging mace trap + tar pits = virtually unstoppable. Expensive, but heavenly.

Are fliers a problem? Or maybe ogres? Or maybe hunters? ICE AMULET THOSE A-HOLES.

It's really fun once you get the feel for it and find the optimal strategies, but aspects of the game can definitely feel mysterious and frustrating at first.

I'm just three levels away from 5-skulling the entire game. It's been a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027053873', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1668671514}
review:
Es un tower defense combinado con un shooter en tercera persona. En cada nivel habr√° hordas de orcos y otras criaturas que intentar√°n cruzar el escenario para alcanzar una brecha m√°gica que debes defender. Para ello podr√°s usar tus propias armas (ballesta, espada y varios conjuros) a la vez que puedes conjurar trampas a lo largo del recorrido. Hay gran variedad de trampas y escenarios, y es parte del juego buscar los combos m√°s adecuados para cada ocasi√≥n. 

El juego es muy accesible (las trampas y conjuros se van desbloqueando poco a poco) y la curva de dificultad es muy razonable. Es apto tanto para el jugador casual que quiera desconectar un rato como para el m√°s hardcore, que tendr√° que romperse el coco para pasar los escenarios a m√°xima dificultad.

En mi opini√≥n es un juego superdivertido, muy adictivo, que va directo al grano y te arrancar√° m√°s de una sonrisa con los comentarios del protagonista.

review:
I recently replayed this after a couple of years.
And it's still just as good as it once used to be.
Visuals still look beautiful, that was surprising.
The gameplay still feels satisfying, really great.
It does run great even on a modern computer.
And even the DLC's are great to have fun with.
This game was definitely just a fun experience.
No bugs to be found, It is polished and great.
I have to give it a big positive review for sure.
And I just really have to recommend it for ya.
This game was definitely worth checking out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997037562', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1359100800}
review:
I was a staunch hater of the Tower Defense genre at the time of launch for this game. They were everywhere, everyone played it and I found them insanely pointless. Back then they were limited to simple wave-defending, waiting for inevitable death.

After trying the demo, I bought the game immediately. Orcs Must Die! was (and still is, in my opinion) the high point of the Tower Defense genre.

With amazing art, ingenious level design, creative traps and a hilarious main character whose idiotic banter can lighten even the darkest days, this game stands out among its many peers.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198054926744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1584654775}
review:
I absolutely love this game. Great tower defense game. It has a great and memorable soundtrack.
I would get tracks stuck in my head that would compel me to play more Orcs Must Die. The orcs are funny, the graphics are smooth and visually appealing, and a game that has enough challenge without taking away the most important part; the fun. There are few games that after I have completed that would whisper in my ear "dun-dun-dundundun now that you've finished Nightmare difficulty you gotta go back and get 5/5 skulls on each map" Which I did, and loved every second.

You won't regret buying this game. Do it, for the orcs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028818880', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 364, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1425586615}
review:
Kazdy jeden Orc sa tuzi raz dostat do Orkskeho neba. Tato hra Vam dovoli splnit im toto skromne zelanie.

Pomahat Vam v tom budu zbrane, kuzla, povolani vojaci, ale hlavne desiatky originalnych pasci.
Musim ale dodat, ze ma to bavilo hlavne prvu polovicu, tu druhu som uz dohral len zo zotrvacnosti. Dost rychlo som sa Orcs Must Die! prejedol.
Ide v podstate o klasicku tower defense strategiu, len s tym rozdielom, ze na vsetko dohliadate s vlastnou postavou a mozete tak Vasim vopred pripravenym nastraham pomoct v zastaveni privalu Orkov osobne.
Cielom hry je ubranit svoju pevnost a ako sa k tomu dopracujete je len na Vas. 
Kludne ich upalte, rozrezte, roztrhajte na kusi, vyhodte do vzduchu, ale Orkovia proste musia zomriet!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968395460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1426124353}
review:
Fun Fast-paced Tower Defense Third-Person Shooter.

PROS:
- Highly replayable
- Decent challenge
- Fun, lighthearted story
- Adrenaline-pumping metal soundtrack
- Fast-paced gameplay with strategic elements
- Clever mix of Tower Defense and Third-Person Shooter
- Cartoon aesthetic reminiscent of Torchlight and Team Fortress 2

CONS:
- Single-player only
- Little musical variety
- No custom keybinding support
- Generic-looking male protagonist
- Blatantly misogynistic and anti-intellectual
- Barely audible dialogue during heavy combat

author: {'steamid': '76561198016227517', 'num_games_owned': 1026, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1583021099}
review:

[i]Si lo empiezas querr√°s terminarlo.[/i]
Un ‚Äúdefender la torre‚Äù muy bueno,  Juego en 3¬∫persona en el que vas colocando trampas en posiciones estrat√©gicas con el dinero que te otorgan al comienzo del nivel. Cuando est√©s listo pulsa G para desatar la orda de orcos. Puedes entretenerte matando a orcos con tus propias manos con el Personaje tanto a Distancia, con una ballesta como a mel√©, con espada. 

O bien intentar hacer la combinaci√≥n perfecta de trampas para pasarte el nivel sin tener que usar el ataque de tu personaje. Para esto necesitas haber completado el juego al menos 1 vez, pues conforme terminas Escenarios te otorgan Calaveras que son usadas para subir el nivel de tus trampas, y te resultara imposible pasarte un nivel sin usar al personaje si no tienes ya un cierto nivel.

Una historia simple pero curiosa.

[b]Lo mejor:[/b]

[b]Lo peor:[/b]
Que es un vide-juego anti AIM, yo tenia buena punter√≠a en el Counter Striker Global offensive y despu√©s de pasarme este juego y el 2, mi punter√≠a se a reducido a un 22% de un 49% que tenia antes de Disparo a la Cabeza.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113782241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3085, 'last_played': 1424224065}
review:
A good combination of first person shooter and tower defense game with some low brow sarcastic humor.

Pros:
+ It is not an easy game on the higher difficulty levels and in later stages of the game.  You will have to know your traps, choose your traps wisely, and get good at quickly placing them.  Be prepared to lose often and a whole lot on the Nightmare difficulty.  However, I do feel like I earned the win after I have been getting my ass handed to me on levels that I have had trouble with.

+ Sound effects, music, and the voice overs from the orcs are cute though a bit repetitive.  

+ Graphics and level design are nice to look at.  

+ While a single set of traps can get you through many levels, some levels have a design that occassionally forces you to rethink whatever strategy you have settled into.

Cons:
- When using the crossbow while the monsters are at point blank range, I often shoot through a monster.  Not sure if this is a bug or a feature to force you to use the melee weapon.

- While there are a variety of trap types that are unlocked as you progress they seem to fall into categories of use that make them seem like "upgrades" of older traps instead of a new unique trap.  For example I found that I pretty muched replaced the Spike Trap with the Tar Trap and the Wall Grinder replaced the other wall traps when making my trap selections.

- The Gnoll Hunter moves through barricades without breaking them first.  This might be a legit ability of that monster but with their speed and ability to poison it feels like this is less "increasing the difficulty" and more "cheating."

- Some issues with the camera that I mostly notice when backing up against a wall that has a small alcove and when standing under the Swing Mace Trap.

- Some of the spash screens that pop up while loading do have some scantily clad characters that could cause some awkwardness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021754642', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1699, 'last_played': 1476120254}
review:
Un petit jeu au principe tr√®s simple, mais diablement bien fichu, joli, agr√©able, p√©tri de fun, et √† la dur√©e de vie plus que satisfaisante.

Une faille. Des orques. Et au milieu, vous, vos armes, vos pi√®ges, et vos couilles, afin de vous assurer que personne ne passe.
D√©fouloir digne d'un Serious Sam, Orcs must die! fera rire n'importe qui en voyant les champs de cadavres et s√©ries de morts aberrantes que l'on peut faire dans ce jeu. Et ne croyez pas que le jeu est simple, ni qu'il manque de vari√©t√©s : les pi√®ges et armes sont largement assez nombreux pour satisfaire tout le monde, et le mode Cauchemar, ou m√™me le succ√®s de faire toute la campagne en difficult√© Mage de Guerre (Moyen) en parfait sur chaque map vous donneront du fil √† retordre ! 

Et en plus de √ßa, il n'est pas cher et vaut tout √† fait son prix. Si vous ne l'avez pas encore, vous pouvez foncer !

author: {'steamid': '76561198024730417', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 9259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7827, 'last_played': 1558990931}
review:
I played a lot of tower defence games in Warcraft 3. But Orcs must die sets a new level in this genre.
Combining a 3rd person action game with tower defence, it created the ultimate action survival game.
Set in a fictional fantasy universe, you have to defend humanity against hordes of orcs from another dimension. For that, they built big fortress' around the portals, you have to defend.

For that, you not only have weapons and spells, but a big arsenal of traps and mechanical defend systems, from ordinary spike traps to big swinging clubs, burning pits and big brutal mechanical grinders.
Every level is made of one or several floors with one or several directions the enemys can spawn. You have to defend the rifts to the normal world, so the orcs dont conquer it.

Using the right collection of traps, wisly using your abilitys and being a tactical genius desides about victory and defeat. The game doesnt take you lightly. With the first levels being easily understandable and mostly fast to solve, some maps are difficult beyond everything encountered before. Some maps need tricks you have to find out all by yourself, some just need you to be fast like sonic, defending two rifts at once.

Having a small storyline, mostly living from comedy, the campaign is really fun to play. After one playthrough you unlock another difficulty, that is a serious challenge (and was a real pain for me).

It isnt a real game for casual players, but a good game, for tacticans, that not only want to think but slay their way through their enemys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041577824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1422744905}
review:
This game is very, very entertaining, the objective of the game is to kill orcs, gnolls, kobolds and ogres before they reach the end of the level. We could say this is a light game as is easy to win, however, for getting the perfect mark is another history. Is a strategy game as you can choose which traps, spells and special guardians to use for each level and you can upgrade them as you got better marks in each level. However, if you play in the nightmare mode, the strategy gives places to your skills as everything will change and will be very challenging to finish the game, and worse if you try to get a perfect mark in each level. 
More is not enough to say, the game is very addictive, sarcastic history, and probably will be enjoyed by everyone. Thought is a good idea to get all the DLC in one single bundle as will help you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075376669', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1424273154}
review:
Orcs Must Die! ist ein Fantasy Strategie Tower Defense. Man selbst spielt einen Kriegsmagier, der mit allerlei Waffen und Fallen, versucht eine Ork-Horde zu besiegen. Neben den normalen Orks gibt es nat√ºrlich noch Oger sowie andere H√∂llenkreaturen. Das Punktesystem und die Rangliste sorgen f√ºr Wiederspielwert. Die Fallen kann man im Laufe des Spiels zudem noch verbessern und das ganze Spiel hat verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade. Ich w√ºrde nicht sagen, dass es wie ein typisches Tower Defense ist. Es ist viel mehr als das!

Pro
- Gutes Kampfsystem
- Viele verschiedene Gegner
- Verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade
- Gute Steuerung
- Hohe Anzahl an Waffen/Fallen
- Upgrades der Fallen

Contra
- Manche Maps sind relativ schwer


Fazit:
Ein geniales Spiel. Mehr muss ich nicht sagen. Empfehlenswert!

Punkte
- Story 6,0/10
- Charaktere 6,5/10
- Grafik 8,5/10
- Gameplay 9,3/10
- Musik 7,0/10

Ergebnis: 7,46/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086917932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1422664283}
review:
This will be the first half of our review for the Orcs Must Die! series. This is the review for the first game, the overall score of which will be averaged with the overall score of Orcs Must Die! 2 to give us our final score for the series as a whole. So far, it‚Äôs prospects of a solid score are looking fantastic. Let us begin.

I ‚Äì Story [7/10]

Orcs Must Die! is a third-person tower defense game from Robot Entertainment, in which, the player assumes the role of the Hero; an otherwise unnamed character and the last living member of the Order. The Order is an ancient and powerful guild of War Mages who have taken it upon themselves to guard Rifts (magical portals that connect the human world and the ‚ÄúDead World‚Äù which also provide a source of magic throughout both worlds.)

The Dead World is home to a faction known as ‚ÄúThe Mob‚Äù and is comprised of various creatures such as gnolls, ogres, and (of course) orcs. The Mob is lead by a former student of the Order known as the Sorceress. During the course of the game, the Hero is fighting to keep the Mob at bay despite their every increasing aggression and frequency of attacks.

Spoiler Alert: In the end, the Hero steps through a Rift and closes it forever by means of a spell. Although he saves the human world from destruction at the hands of the Sorceress and her limitless legions, he also destroys the source of magic for both worlds. The human world, now dependent upon magic, begins to steadily deteriorate. The Sorceress, stripped of her powers, is trapped in the Dead World with a gratuitous amount of angry monsters.

The of OMD! should be thematically familiar to the vast majority of gamers, moviegoers, and readers alike. It is tried and true and it worked wonderfully for the game. That being said, it has still be done before.

II ‚Äì UI [9/10]

The user interface was great. It was simple, the minimap worked like a charm, and I kept pressing the ‚Äúready‚Äù button long before I was actually ready. (Please note that that was not the game‚Äôs fault, it was all mine. It felt necessary to talk about it though.) In-game HUD was very user friendly and all of my stats/currently equipped traps (towers) and equipment were easy to refer to. However, the menus seemed to feel a bit clunky. Maybe it was just me, but I felt that they could have used a little tweaking.

III ‚Äì Gameplay [10/10]

As I mentioned in a previous article, I wasn‚Äôt always a fan of tower defense games. In most cases, I‚Äôm still not crazy about them. But, every now and then, one comes along that attaches itself to my heart like a parasite and sticks with me for the long haul. Orcs Must Die! is one of those special little parasites.

The vast majority of the maps are incredible free form as far as defensive strategies go. The game starts you off with fairly easy maps and they continually increase in complexity as you hack and slash your way through the campaign. As someone who is (in general) not very good with strategy, I weirdly loved this. It gave me a good chance to brush up on my defense skills and figure out what needs to be where so I‚Äôm not eyeball deep in orcs in a few minutes. Should I build outward or inward? Do I need to worry about aerial a-holes or not? Loved it.

As far as using your character in combat, the third-person perspective was implemented expertly. A reticle is clearly displayed (and not easily lost) so that I can wade straight into the action if need be or snipe fools out from afar. Primary and secondary weapon functions are easily used and easily mastered. Movement is very fluid and the character‚Äôs sprint speed is comfortable fast.

IV ‚Äì Content [10/10]

Orcs Must Die! has a lot of content, especially for a tower defense game. The core game has 24 maps, 6 weapons, 19 traps and minions (in total), and 11 different enemy types. Not only this, but any upgrades you purchase for weapons, traps, etc. are permanent and stay with you throughout the entire game. This is fantastic, in case you were wondering.

There are two different DLCs for OMD! (Artifacts of Power and Lost Adventures) and both add their fair share of extra content as well. Really though, if you end up purchasing this game, you‚Äôll probably end up picking up the DLC at some pint as well because you‚Äôre going to want more.

V ‚Äì Visual [10/10]

Every last graphical detail of Orcs Must Die! is enchanting. Character and enemy models are very well done and have a charming, cartoon-esque quality to them. The environments are wonderful and every map has something new for you to ogle in your downtime. When you‚Äôre not setting traps or slaying orcs, it‚Äôs really worth it to take a few minutes to just explore your surroundings.

VI ‚Äì Audio [10/10]

Seldom has a game had a more fitting soundtrack than Orcs Must Die! does. Seriously though, just phenomenal. You can annihilate thousands and tens of thousands to this epic score and never grow tired of it. That goes for the annihilation too. It has a very metal feel to it on the whole and I‚Äôm sure that War Mages the world over could happily crush skulls to it all day long.

On top of the score, the voice acting is absolutely superb. The Hero is hilarious and you‚Äôll find yourself laughing at his one-liners and his celebratory dance moves map after map.

VII ‚Äì Overall [9.3/10]

Overall, Orcs Must Die! is a great game and a true testament of what a tower defense game should be, in my opinion.

review:
A fantastic, if not unorthodox version of the tower defense genre. Now you get to defend from the inside! As the War Mage, you defend the rift between worlds from orcs trying to get into our world.

How do you do that? Why, by using traps, spells, and weapons, of course! Brutalize orcs with spikes, arrows, acid, and more!

See more in my short video that asks the simple question: Why didn't I play this game earlier?!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sH1I2j5D2p8
