author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1493860312}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Tower defense third person action game.



[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]


There is a how to play.
There is a controls overview.
You can't change your controls.
You are able to toggle gore.
You are able to play this game with a controller.
There is a mouse sensitivity slidebar available.
There is a sound volume slidebar available.
There is a music volume slidebar available.
There are some different resolution sizes available.
You can make multiple profiles and they are shared on each machine.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

In this tower defense game you will have to protect the core by building traps and killing orcs with your main character. There are different trap types such as floor/wall and ceiling traps. Support/defensive and aggressive traps. You can also equip some character spells such as fire or freeze items. Your character has a mana and a health bar. Once a wave has been started you will have to kill every orc to proceed to the next wave. There are a couple of "mini" breaks before you will go to the real break. Mini breaks will start automatically after a short period of time while real breaks requires a button to start. Earning skulls is totally dependant on your performance so by getting 5 skulls in a match. Well You will have to do your best.

Main character has some jokes.
Different and variety of traps.
Has difficulty settings.
Skulls are shown on each level at the level selection.
There is an option menu ingame.
Has a minimap with a wave counter.
Able to upgrade your traps permanently by using skulls.
Has mini and real breaks.
Has 5 skulls a level.
Enemies has a health bar.
Addictive.
Good music.
Good graphics.


[h1]Other things.[/h1]

Beautiful hacked leaderboards.

-------------------

I Give this game a 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198146500214', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5417, 'last_played': 1535651390}
review:
English:

I'm not an expert in video games, or graphics, or hardware, or anything, I'm just someone who likes to play video games for fun and to tell the truth, with this game I've had tons of fun. What I like is that it combines well the action and strategy parts, you have plenty of options to kill your enemies and that means you can play and play again and again the same level and you'll always find new ways to beat it. Also, if you like the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãbeing a wizard and control the elements, cast spells and above all ... to kill thousands of orcs! then this is the game for you.

Therea are many traps at your disposal (you can improve them to make them even more effective) and weapons to choose, to find your own style of play, either fighting melee in the heat of battle or observe from your safe zone at the fortress and let your traps do the dirty work. The learning curve is well achieved with 3 levels of difficulty. If you are the one who doesn't like stories and always skips introductions, prefaces, videos and sometimes even the tutorials, then this game will not give you problems because the story is told as you do the levels and only has a few cinematics so that you can focus on the main task, killing orcs !!!

The only thing I dislike is that if you play in offline mode it won't let you use the orc slayer costume with the double sword, which although pure aesthetic makes you see like a badass XD
Finally in short, a great game, plus the sequel is also very good, if you find any of the 2 games on discount, don't hesitate to buy them, you will not regret it.

Espa√±ol:

Creo que otro an√°lisis sobre este juego esta de m√°s, pero aun asi escribire mi opini√≥n. Para empezar no soy un experto en videojuegos, ni en graficos, ni hardware, ni nada, solo soy alguien a quien le gusta jugar videojuegos para divertirse y la verdad que con este juego lo he hecho bastante. Lo que me gusta es que combina muy bien la parte de acci√≥n y la parte de la estrategia, tienes muchisimas posibilidades de acabar con tus enemigos y eso hace que puedas jugar y jugar una y otra vez un mismo nivel y siempre encontrar una nueva manera de pasarlo. Adem√°s si te gusta la idea de ser un mago y controlar los elementos, hacer hechizos y sobre todo... matar miles y miles de orcos! entonces este es el juego para ti.

Tienes muchas trampas (que puedes mejorar para hacerlas a√∫n mas efectivas) y armas a elegir para que encuentres tu propio estilo de juego, ya sea combatiendo cuerpo a cuerpo en el calor de la batalla u observar desde tu fortaleza y dejar que tus trampas hagan el trabajo sucio. La curva de aprendizaje esta bien lograda junto con sus 3 niveles de dificultad. Si eres de los que les aburren las historias y se saltan todas las introducciones, pr√≥logos, videos y a veces hasta los tutoriales, pues este juego no te dara problemas ya que la historia te la cuentan conforme haces los niveles y solo tiene unas pocas cinem√°ticas para que te concentres en lo que es importante, matar orcos!!!

Lo √∫nico que no me gusta es que si juegas en modo desconectado no te deja usar el traje de mataorcos con la doble espada, que aunque es pura estetica hace que te veas como todo un malote XD
En fin en resumen, todo un juegazo, adem√°s la secuela tambien esta muy buena, si encuentras cualquiera de los 2 en descuento no dudes en comprarlos, no te arrepentir√°s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029100203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 3847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2488, 'last_played': 1697999795}
review:
How does a TD (tower defense) sound combined with a third person shooter? combine it with crazy enemies and you've got Orcs Must Die! This game and its second version have small differences like the enchanters(or whatever they called themselves) OMD2 is more polished and has multiplayer but isn't as good for 1 person so get this if you have no real friends(like me) 

If you're interested look up some gameplay videos on youtube :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197998705293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8419, 'last_played': 1350198000}
review:
OMD1 and OMD2 are great games! 

Generally i don't like 3rd person games but have for this series to be a ton of fun. 
OMD2 is better of cause with more options, traps and maps. 
Good replayablity as i keep coming back for weekly bashes and always keen to try differant trap combos. 

Can't think of and negitives, but a first person view would be a nice touch. maybe something for OMD3 Ha!

Highly recomend!

review: Solid third person tower defence game.  I've played this entire game through and I can tell you it's great. It's a great way to kill time and an awesome strategy game. The DLC is great and adds some really useful weapons, but it is in NO WAY pay to win. Pick it up when it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010099519', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1412472056}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987082336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1403115240}
review:
Orcs Must Die, is a first person tower defence game which pits you as the last master builder to stop the oncoming hoard of endless orcs from destroying your home land!

build traps and defences in interesting levels in order to stop the orcs from making it through your portal.

If you like tower defence games, you'll love Orcs Must Die!

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198077624633', 'num_games_owned': 7602, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1387171290}
review: Orcs Must Die ! est un tower defense √† la troisi√®me personne unique en son genre et purement jouissif. Il vous propose de prot√©ger, seul, un donjon dans lequel d√©ferlent des vagues de peaux-vertes enrag√©es. Des phases de pr√©paration m√©ticuleuses, durant lesquelles vous devez rivaliser d'ing√©niosit√© pour placer vos pi√®ges le plus judicieusement et le plus sournoisement possible, alternent avec des phases d'action fr√©n√©tiques et jubilatoires o√π vous vous surprendrez √† hurler "You shall not pass !" au plus fort du combat. L'ensemble forme un cocktail diablement accrocheur, servi par une bande-son tr√®s efficace. Pr√©cisons toutefois que la version d√©mo n'est pas repr√©sentative du potentiel de ce titre que vous pouvez acheter les yeux ferm√©s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042403075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1395865631}
review:
Ok so this game represents everything wrong with society in my opinion, What the actual fuck is so bad about Orcs that we just need to keep killing them and killing them and killing them. Like I bet if we just treated them fairly they would be just really chilled out and help us out and shit but noooo just because they are stronger than us (Insecurity much?) and have different colour skin (Racism much?) we have to spike them and shoot them and smash them up. Y'know what? Fuck this. I wanna be an Orc.

10/10 would think I'm playing Sanctum again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129101111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1420104956}
review:
An entertaining and comedy-oriented trap dungeon defense game.

It took me a bit to get used to the trap difference vs the usual tower defense games I play - but it pans out well in a very entertaining, challenging and rewarding way. The traps set up have a limited area of effect and react on a reset timer for most of them, so its a mixture of combinations of traps and your own wits with weapons and the enviroment to pull it off well.

It proves to be a good game that is well worth its value.

review:

Also the story, even though it is in the background, is kind of interesting. Main hero has great catchphrases... :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198043871920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1419645372}
review: Very fun 3rd person tower defense game - plays out a lot like team fortress 2's MvM mode without the co-op. Just enough variation in the levels to keep it interesting and the option for nightmare mode with all of the unlocked upgrades boosts its replayability. Expect about 10 hours for the first run through and if you're a perfectionist, ample more after that on nightmare mode trying to obtain 5 skulls. Definitely recommended, especially since it can be founds cheap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008713703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1629, 'last_played': 1514543515}
review: The best mashup of TD (tower defence) and FPS I've ever played. This game takes the best of both worlds and putes them in one game. Visually pleasing and fun to play, I couldn't think of a bad part about the game. Characters are amusing and the sound effects are nice. I highly recommend this to everybody!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025408365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1420053264}
review:
I've only played this game for a few hours but so far it has been a very fun experience. The early levels are fairly easy but it gets trickier and more strategic as the number of possible enemy paths increases. The cartoon graphics are an acquired taste but bring an appreciable casual twist. A good aray of weapons eventhough the crossbow is completely OP!

I do regret the fact that there is no other game mode available different from 'Campaign', keeping in mind each level warrants a second or third playthrough due to the ability to utilize newly acquired upgrades in played levels to increase score. THIS IS A SCORING GAME. If that is not your thing, you might be dissa.pointed by a too short game. However, if you find it a under 5$ (Holiday sales yay!). It's totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027141250', 'num_games_owned': 1727, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 2221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1341298800}
review:
Simply put, this game is huge amount of fun. It's an excellent blend of tower defense and action, with an almost comedic atmosphere. If you like hack & slash and/or tower defense, I highly recommend you take a look at this game. Actually, I recommend picking up the franchise pack since both the first and second games are a blast to play.

Comparing this game with its sequel, I liked the levels better in general in this first game, but the second just has a lot more stuff including a second playable character with different traps and abilities, more monster types, and best of all, coop. So do yourself a favor and just get the franchise pack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021706491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1581, 'last_played': 1590125539}
review:
You grin with malignant satisfaction as you watch the Horde of Orcs slog through tar, pelted by arrows, dying in scores, whilst their numbers are also gradually being decimated by wall mounted blades, crushed by crushers, knowing that, should one of the kobolds manage to survive this, the lava awaits.

(cue maniacal laughter)

MUHUHAHAHA...!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085422500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1518959644}

author: {'steamid': '76561198133628702', 'num_games_owned': 2145, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1129, 'last_played': 1418682909}
review:
Trap defense game that pits you against hordes of orcs with each their unique abilities. At your disposal you have a number of traps and spells to keep them at bay. One of the best things I liked about this game is that on other tower defense games when that one straggler makes it past your defenses you have to just sit and watch as it wakes right into your nexus. On OMD you have the option to run over there and kill that bastard yourself! Very child friendly but also mature and challenging enough for older audiences without seeming unfair.

4/5
One of the best tower defense games I've had the chance to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059038406', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2736, 'last_played': 1480881530}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a third person, action, tower defense game.  You play as the War Mage, who's job is to kill Orcs, often in rather comical ways.  In each level, the Orcs will spawn in waves and try to enter the rift and it's your job to kill them.  This done via laying traps, using weapons, or placing guardians to fight by your side.  After each level, you will be given a new power to use and skulls based on how well you did; the less Orcs that make it through the rift and the faster you do it, the more skulls you earn.  These skulls can then be spent on upgrades for your traps and guardians. 

After many hours of gameplay and tens of thousands of Orcs slain, I can safety say that this game IS FREAKING AWESOME.  I've sunk about 45 hours into this game (counting the dlc missions).  Let that sink in: 45 hours of gameplay!  There are triple A games out there that give a fraction of gametime with several times the cost.  It's a steal, esspecially if you can get on sale.  

However, this game is about exactly one thing: killing Orcs.  Beyond that, there's really nothing else to do, but for its price, its a hard deal to beat.  If your own the fence, try the demo or watch some clips on youtube.  And if you like what you see, buy it.  Especially if you can get the entire series bundled and discounted.  

TLDR: 10/10  

Disclaimer: No Orcs were harmed in the writing of this review.  Harmed before, oh hell yes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081155023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1629854754}
review:
This is a brilliant core defence/tower defence mixed with action combat.  With the well thought out ability to upgrade perks within the levels, high customisation of object placement and damaging objects already built into the maps ready for you to trigger; this is a must have title for any core defence lovers.

The only downside I have found so far is the inability to foresee what is coming on the next wave so you can plan accordingly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037920209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1205, 'playtime_forever': 1164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1661342207}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a dynamic combination of arcade game and tower defense. The action takes place in a fantasy land where the biggest threat to humanity are hordes of orcs. We, as an unlucky mage, must keep order in the whole castle. Simple, isnt it? Graphics looks more than good. Whole, maintained in a characteristic, slightly cartoon style is conceptually shapely, ingenious and simply pretty, works flawlessly. Hours pleasant annihilation of opponents.

Because good orc is a dead orc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067496196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1422510595}
review:
Pros: Fantastic mix of tower-defense and FPS genres, allowing you to tailor your experience to whichever you prefer.  Additionally, decent graphics and music, and hilarious tongue-in-cheek narration (you may recognize the voice actor as Axton from Borderlands 2
Cons: Extremely difficult to get 5 skulls in some of the levels, which requires many replays (it reminded me of the rating system for Angry Birds in that way)
Recommendation:  Buy the game.  It's so addicting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981087823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1413663643}
review:
This review was written after I beat the game.

Fun and reasonably challenging. The dialogue, voice acting, and story, though sparse, are pretty funny, too. 

Each level is really a puzzle to be solved - there's not necesarilly a "correct" solution for how to place your traps, but there's "aha" moments when you discover a feature of the level that makes a certain setup very effective. 

The fact that you get to control a hero makes the gameplay much more fun - you can have a big impact on the enemy waves with skilled shooting and use of the various magic spells.

There's plenty of replayability in competing on the leaderboards or among your friends for a high score.

My one major complaint is that several of the levels have a split design where you can't force all of the enemies through one choke point, so you have to split up your attention between them or set up lots of traps and hope they're working well enough. It's kind of annoying to mentally deal with this and spend time running back and forth. I understand the point of the game is to be mentally challenging, but this task is more mentally exhausting than it is fun.

I also don't like that you aren't told in advance exactly what enemies will be coming through which doors before each round. If you want to go for really good scores, it's just an unnecesarry and un-fun memorization tax upon you to remember each wave.

review:
A dosis iguales entre acci√≥n y estrategia, el juego es realmente entretenido y, para mi, toda una sorpresa. B√°sicamente el juego consiste en defender un portal, poniendo trampas antes de que lleguen los 'malos' y, una vez llegan, acabando con ellos entre las trampas y tu personaje. 

Lo dicho, sin grandes pretensiones ni el m√°s m√≠nimo intento de tener una buena trama, el juego cumple su objetivo de resultar ameno y muy desestresante. Su nivel de dificultad y la gran variedad de niveles, enemigos y trampas hace que el juego no se haga nada mon√≥tono y sea bastante rejugable.

En definitiva, si lo encuentras en oferta, c√≥mpralo, no creo que te arrepientas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012403435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1466, 'last_played': 1389029281}
review:
When I was young, I played a lot of tower defence games in Warcraft 3. But Orcs must die sets a new level in this genre.
Combining a 3rd person action game with tower defence, it created the ultimate action survival game.
Set in a fictional fantasy universe, you have to defend humanity against hordes of orcs from another dimension. For that, they built big fortress' around the portals, you have to defend.

For that, you not only have weapons and spells, but a big arsenal of traps and mechanical defend systems, from ordinary spike traps to big swinging clubs, burning pits and big brutal mechanical grinders.
Every level is made of one or several floors with one or several directions the enemys can spawn. You have to defend the rifts to the normal world, so the orcs dont conquer it.

Using the right collection of traps, wisly using your abilitys and being a tactical genius desides about victory and defeat. The game doesnt take you lightly. With the first levels being easily understandable and mostly fast to solve, some maps are difficult beyond everything encountered before. Some maps need tricks you have to find out all by yourself, some just need you to be fast like sonic, defending two rifts at once.

Having a small storyline, mostly living from comedy, the campaign is really fun to play. After one playthrough you unlock another difficulty, that is a serious challenge (and was a real pain for me).

It isnt a real game for casual players, but a good game, for tacticans, that not only want to think but slay their way through their enemys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 2086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2086, 'last_played': 1412610383}
review:
Spielwertung: 8/10

Orcs must die - Teil 1 - ist ein sch√∂nes Spiel f√ºr zwischendurch, das durchaus auch f√ºr einen l√§ngeren Spieleabend taugt. 

In der ersten Phase entwickelt man ein Verst√§ndnis f√ºr das Spiel und schaltet nach und nach weitere Fallen frei, w√§hrend man neue Level freischaltet. 

In einer zweiten Phase versucht man, nach und nach seine Lieblingsfallen und -strategien zu finden. Es gibt neben den Fallen noch 3 Spezialisierungen, in jedem Level muss bzw. kann man sich f√ºr eine der 3 entscheiden. Das kostet zwar dringend ben√∂tigtes Gold, das sonst in Fallen investiert werden k√∂nnte, gibt aber m√§chtige Verbesserungen. Ich w√ºrde die 3 Spezi. als "Utility", "Fallen&W√§chter" sowie "Ego" bezeichnen. Gerade mittels der Egospezialisierung kann man ganze Level alleine leerr√§umen, ohne oder nur mit sehr wenigen Fallen, also quasi in Ego-Shooter Form mit Armbrumst, Schwert und quickcast Zaubern. 
Nat√ºrlich gibt es besonders kuule Wege, m√∂glichst gro√üe Combos zu bauen und Orks auf zig Wege zu t√∂ten, aber im Endeffekt will man wohl nur die 5-Sch√§del-Wertung haben und das Level schaffen. Deswegen k√∂nnen nicht alle Fallen gleich gut √ºberzeugen, aber das scheint bei einer so gro√üen Auswahl normal und ist kein Problem. 

In einer dritten und finalen Phase, wenn man das Spiel im Prinzip durch hat, versucht man sich vielleicht auch mal im Alptraum-Modus. Also dem 3. Schwierigkeitsgrad, wobei der 1. ziemlich unn√∂tig ist und ignoriert werden kann. Der Alptraum-Modus tr√§gt seinen Namen zurecht, hat aber dennoch eine faire Frustrationskurve, um es mal so auszudr√ºcken. Frustration werdet ihr n√§mlich auf jeden Fall haben, wenn ihr auch hier auf 5-Sch√§del-Jagd gehen wollt, aber ich kann euch versichern, es ist alles machbar, ohne zu viel Aufwand zu betreiben. Einige Level sind genauso leicht wie auf normal dank guter Schlauchstellen, andere bringen euch ganz sch√∂n ins Schwitzen. Vor allem die Streichung jeder Pause und der insta-Start machen h√§ufig erst mal ein paar Neuladungen zwecks Orientierung notwendig, aber wenn man vertraut mit den Fallen, der Levelarchitektur und seinen 3 Spezialisierungen ist, bleibt alles nur noch eine Frage der Zeit. Wer nur alle Erfolge einsammeln will, kann auf Akptraum sogar getrost auf die 5-Sch√§del-Regel verzichten, durchkommen ist alles. 

Nach knapp 35 Stunden hab ich alles durchgespielt, inklusive einem DLC, der 5 extra Level beinhaltete. Die Zusatzwaffen konnte man jedoch schon davor nutzen. Ein bisschen Spielerei, aber gerade die S√§urebomben waren zu Anfang sehr hilfreich, sp√§ter habe ich sie jedoch nicht mehr benutzt, sondern ausschlie√ülich Blitz- und manchmal Eiszauber. 

Fazit: Ein Spiel, bei dem man nicht sehr viel falsch machen kann ;) Die Erwartungen an dutzende von Spielstunden sollten aber nicht gehegt werden. Ich sehe jedenfalls nicht, wie das Spiel mehr als 40-50 Stunden motivieren soll. Aber 35 Stunden sind mir auch v√∂llig ausreichend, von daher ist das kein Kritikpunkt. Wer auf Coop oder Highscores steht, kann hier sicher 100 Stunden und mehr verbringen. Andererseits gibt es ja noch Orcs must die - Teil 2. Und genau den schaue ich mir jetzt mal an.

review: This game helped me discover something important about myself. The fact that I apparently can never get tired of watching orcs die on traps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969646061', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1372601746}
review: Eine Horde Orcs droht die Tore aufzubrechen und in den heiligen Hallen das Wichtigste zu zerst√∂ren. Das Ziel ist es die Gr√ºnlinge daran zu hindern - hierzu baut man nette Fallen und sonstige Hilfen auf, dazu hat man auch eine entsprechende Bewaffnung um diese Orcs mit allen Mitteln daran zu hindern. Ein gelungener Zeitvertreib der auch eine Abwechslung zu sonstigen Spielen. Einziges Makel ist, dass es hier wie auch im zweiten Teil leider keinen Multiplayer-Betrieb gibt, der mir hier als COOP durchaus noch spassiger vorstellen k√∂nnte.

review: A simple action game about fighting hordes and lasting in a contention zone (a la Delta 8 Nova Prospekt in Half Life 2), with the twist of putting a lot of crazy defenses. A game for only fun and laughs, but that usually enough for a great time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055360258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2056, 'last_played': 1437098808}
review:
A fun take on the tower-defence genre. Well-designed levels and trap variations provide endless ways to kill orcs! There is no set blueprint to beating a level and it is easy to try out many different strategies. OMD is suited for casual players who want to breeze through the slaughter but also provides a challenge for those who want one -- 5-skulling all the levels on nightmare took quite a lot of strategy tweaking and redo-ing. My only big complaint is that in nightmare mode you don't have any time to set up before the level starts. The game should be about planning a good defense, not how fast you can place your traps.

Overall great game: 9/10

The humor coupled with good voice acting was an added bonus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064703848', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1447277331}
review: Awesome game!Unique gameplay and defense tactics, very nice upgrades. Lots of humor and you get to kill LOTS OF ORCS! :D I recommend this game, it's playable by all ages, no matter whether you are 12, 20, 40, 70... :D You will like it! It's lots of fun. I would give it a 10/10! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022548223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1445879621}
review:
great, orcs must die is a great franchise. the premis is simple: orcs, kobolds and trolls attack your castle and you build traps and shoot them with your spells and weapons. if you do it correctly it will be a breeze, do it wrong and you will curse the day you chose to do that level.

the good:
- many hours of playtime
- nightmare mode
- is both fun and funny

the bad:
- upgrades are permanent (no refunds)
- orcs must die 2 gives much more (also value for money)

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998211883', 'num_games_owned': 1365, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1409059531}
review:
Bon jeu, mais des fois trop difficile : sur une mission j'ai essay√© de leur faire un max de d√©gats, de les ralentir √† fond, de les pousser dans le vide, y en avait quand m√™me 6 ou 7 qui passaient √† chaque vague !
Je recommande quand m√™me, mais √ßa devient vite chiant de devoir reccomencer 20 fois le m√™me niveau en mourrant √† la vague 3 ou 4 √† chaque fois..

review:
O que dizer de Orcs Must Die?
Um "tower defense" mesclado com action super interessante, que exige intelig√™ncia e agilidade.
Estrat√©gias falhas mais cedo ou mais tarde ir√£o te mostrar como as coisas realmente funcionam.
A jogabilidade √© √≥tima, a ambienta√ß√£o √© bem bonita apesar de n√£o ser t√£o variada. O enredo √© conceitual por√©m divertido e o personagem principal, esse √© o que faz toda diferen√ßa no jogo. Simplesmente hil√°rio.
Para todos os amantes e n√£o amantes do estilo eu recomendo, e muito esse game.
O √∫nico defeito, e que foi adicionado no segundo jogo, seria o modo cooperativo que esse, propriamente dito n√£o possui.
De resto, s√≥ jogando pra ver.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009922165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1528, 'last_played': 1545289091}
review:
Solid twist on the Tower Defense Genre.
Good introduction to the series if you get the whole franchise pack.
Personally, I prefer the second game because there is significantly more flexibility in your game experience, more weapons, more traps, more levels, and more longevity, but the game is still money well spent.
Like killing things with traps and weapons?  Check.
Like good solid humor?  Check
Interesting and motivating game soundtrack? Check
Like a game that requires strategy and thinking?  Check
Like mass chaos that puts constant pressure on you?  Check
Like a overall solid game design concept?  Double Check
(You will get the partial joke here, if you have ever finished the sequel).
Just get the game and play it, and you will understand in less than 5 minutes.
Lightning in a bottle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991741967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1407602770}
review:
Bullet Point Review :

+ Action packed and fast paced
+ Challenging when reaching the endgame
+ Cool soundtrack
+ Witty humor
+ Smooth looking graphics
+ The game really motivates you to finish it, which immediately sets it aside from 9 out of 10 games.

- Danger of getting stuck, especially for casual gamers. ( Real casual gamers, not the term 'casual' hardcore gamers like to use for the average gamer )
- Repetitive to a certain degree
- Bullet projectiles make no sense ( you have to aim above the head to get a headshot )

Conclusion : 9/10

review: Another version of a defense game.  This one however has its addicting factors for me.  As you do beter in stages you are able to unlock upgraded version of your defense structures.  I would advise playing this one before the second one for the sake of story and getting a feel for the game, however once I started playing the second one, its overall fun and the much greater pool of things you have to unlock increased so much I find it hard going back to the first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042818519', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1330675200}
review:
WTF is it?   -   Orcs Must Die! is a third-person trap laying orc slaying monster delaying tower defense game. It is the second game made by Robot Entertainment whose studio is made up of people from the now defunct Ensemble Studios. Why is that significant? Well at one point in my life I was a console gamer, I won't go into specifics because those were dark times filled with low framerates, but I digress. The game that I played the most on xbox was Halo Wars which was developed by Ensemble. Being the amazing devs they are, they have yet again impressed me with Orcs Must Die! The objective of the game is to stop orcs from reaching the rift(s) on each level by placing traps and using weapons. Each level has multiple waves of orcs that increase in difficulty over the rounds and if enough orcs enter the rift(s) the rift score drops to zero and you lose. The plot of the game is surprisingly interesting aswell since you play as a War Mage who is the last member of an order dedicated to defending the rifts which are sources of magic for the two worlds. I think they could have gone more in depth with the story even though this is a somewhat silly game.

Verdict   -   Well worth the time and money.

BTW   -   This is better than that Rift mmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146750903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1595466987}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198049183341', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 1210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1440532294}
review:
"Orcs Must Die!" es un divertid√≠simo juego de estrategia "Tower Defense" en el que tendremos que defender nuestra fisura de enormes oleadas de orcos (y no solo eso, a medida que avance el juego).

En el juego controlaremos a un mago en tercera persona y para hacer frente a todos los orcos, tendremos a nuestra disposici√≥n un gran arsenal de trampas con las cuales podremos empalar, triturar, derritir, trocear, etc... a los ogros (las trampas son cantidad de crueles, pero muy gratificantes). Las trampas se iran desbloqueando a medida que avancemos en el juego y son cantidad de originales y distintas cada una, cosa que har√° que nos planteemos utilizar o combinar o unas trampas u otras seg√∫n los enemigos que nos esperen en ese nivel en concreto.

Pero no s√≥lo dispondremos de trampas, si no tambi√©n de distintas armas y magias que nos ayudar√°n a crear devastadores combos con las trampas o acabar con los orcos que se nos colaron y no fueron asesinados por alguna de nuestras trampas. Tambi√©n podremos invocar a arqueros y paladines para que luchen para nosotros. En algunos niveles, habr√°n elementos del escenario que nos ayudar√°n, como ahora cazuelas llenas de √°cido o l√°mparas de ara√±a

Otro elemento que le da algo de profundidad al juego son las tejedoras, que se organizan en 3 ramas (s√≥lo podremos escoger una rama, por nivel) y nos ayudar√°n a potenciar las trampas (haciendo que por ejemplo, se recarguen un 30% m√°s r√°pido), la magia y las armas o el estado de nuestro personaje.

Gr√°ficamente es un juego simple, no nos vamos a enga√±ar. El juego tiene un dise√±o caricaturesco que le queda fenomenal y tal vez no sea tan gore como deber√≠a (la verdad es que con seg√∫n que trampas, eso deber√≠a ser un ba√±o de tripas y sangre)

El Soundtrack del juego es buen√≠simo, puros themes rockeros medievales que quedan de perlas cuando se rompen las puertas y empiezan a llegarte los orcos. 

Un juego buen√≠simo y que se lo recomiendo a todo el mundo al 100%, te gusten o no los "Tower Defense". Muy divertido y disfrutable, de mis favoritos en este g√©nero.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971397616', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1407286811}
review: I'll keep this short and sweet.  This game was a great mash-up between strategy and tower defense.  Only took me about 4 hours to beat the whole game.  Would have been nice to have some multiplayer/co-op, but for that I'm am looking forward to the sequel.  Grab it when it's on sale and spend an afternoon or weekend enjoying this game.  Excellent replay value as well.

Very entertaining. You can lose several hours easily with this games.

But overall its a very nice game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972568578', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1407113756}
review:
A very simple premise of a game - stop a whorde of orcs from making it from one end of a maze to another utilizing a couple of weapons and a variety of "semi-humorous traps." The orcs come in a series of waves, and those waves get longer and more difficult until the end of each level. As you complete levels, you gain additional types of traps, and the more you succeed, you gain points to spend to upgrade those traps to make them more powerful.

Overall, this is a very simplistic game... first person shooter meets tower strategy. But, it's kind of addicting, as the traps lend a bit of humor in to the fray, often being used to knock orcs around the maze and off ledges - and a variety of other things that aren't worth spoiling for anyone.

Wait for a good Steam Sales (such as the weekend one presently going on) and add the entire franchise to your collection for less than $10. It's definitely worth that for some nearly-mindless entertainment! And, with a Steam-based leaderboard, you can compete with your friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986360343', 'num_games_owned': 1561, 'num_reviews': 845, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1651977172}
review:
Orc Must Die is typically one of those indie games that must be in the library of those gamers who a) like the RPG genre b) are fond of indie games. This game is not just an RPG but also a strategy one.

It is a tower defense game, basically, but as opposed to the usual top-down approach this game uses a third person perspective. It is an interesting choice but certainly makes the game convenient to play. The rest is the usual stuff: the orc waves are getting more and more difficult and the player unlocks more types of traps. Oh, and of course, on later levels we have to look out for more areas as the enemies can approach our base from several directions.

If you are bothered by the fact that one single orc reached your base and because of that you lost a couple of points you are free to replay all previous levels for better results. This replayability and the dozens of available levels make sure OMD is a long-lasting experience. At the time of writing this review the game has a 75% discount and its GOTY edition certainly is a catch for just 2 euros.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096186456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1407275924}
review:
If you are looking for an Insanely fun and bloody TD/TPS hybrid game (possibly the best of it's genre available on the market) and If you like slaughtering tons of orcs and other nasty creatures in brutal and creative ways then this is the game for you! Orcs must die! 1 has many unique traps, weapons and spells which you can experiment and play with. 
I'd personally recommend that you play this one before you play the sequel because it has a nice little story to it, though it's not necessary.

On the other hand If you don't like singleplayer tower defense/third person shooters then feel free to go straight over to the sequel where you can play with a friend or random partner throughout the entire game, which is also what the maps are balanced for. The sequel also adds a lot of new stuff along with DLC's that are a bit overpriced, but still worth it.

TL;DR: A fairly challenging game fit for both casual and hardcore players. The story is ok, but at the end of the day it's all about the gameplay.

review:
Excelente jogo. Sou um gamer adulto e com pouco tempo para jogar. Ent√£o n√£o costumo jogar jogos que (embora bons) demandem muita dedica√ß√£o -- como Fallout, Skyrm, etc. Prefiro os que permitem jogar um jogo curto, parar, jogar mais outro dia. 
Este jogo √© √≥timo nesse sentido -- desafiante, mas poss√≠vel de vencer sem ficar lendo cheats. Usa-se a cabe√ßa para colocar armadilhas, e tem a adrenalina de correr no campo de batalha fechando as falhas no seu sistema de defesa.
Gostei tanto que completei no modo Mago de Guerra e depois no modo Pesadelo. Tamb√©m batalhei todos os achievements. Agora vou partir para Orcs Must Die 2 -- que estava guardando para depois de degustar OMD!
Se voc√™ gosta de jogos no estilo Tower Defense, como Fieldrunners ou Plants vs Zombies, mas quer um pouco mais de a√ß√£o, experimente OMD! -- n√£o vai se decepcionar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089781514', 'num_games_owned': 1232, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1613405603}
review:
Horrendously good fun. My main grievance is that the Warmage (the protagonist) is a complete idiot and the game takes every opportunity to beat you over the head with that fact. Fortunately you can mute the game so you don't have to listen to him. Another small issue I had was that there are occasionally little nuggets of exposition during the game, but you can barely hear them over the sound of orc giblets spraying across the level.

Putting those issues aside the game rewards you with an army of orcs and associates to slaughter your way through with a variety of pokey, burny, zappy and crushy things. The score system gives you an incentive to go back to earlier levels with your new toys and make orcs die in new and interesting ways. You can approach each level in a variety of ways, so if you prefer setting up a death alley and watching the carnage from afar you can do so. But if you prefer getting up close and personal with a blade whilst a tar pit slows your enemies down, that's a valid option. Later in the game you unlock 'Weavers', giving you mid-game temporary upgrades for your traps and skills which add to the number of strategies you can use.

I didn't have any technical issues with the game although on an older machine the game did slow down a little when a lot of enemies were around, but otherwise it runs well.

Overall I'd recommend it to tower defense fanatics as well as action or strategy game fans.

review:

Out of ten I would give this game a solid 8 - because is easy to get to grips with, its fun, interesting and did i mention fun? personally I loved it so much i brought all the DLC for it and the follow up 'Orcs Must Die 2'.... yet to play that though.
If your still unsure look at videos on YouTube of the gameplay, playthroughs or let's play videos. I started a lets play series on this game on my channel so you could check that out and see if this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997741349', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1405503724}
review:
[h1]Recommended 5/5![/h1]

[i]Orcs Must Die![/i] is a really well made and optimised game. The graphics are adorable yet not too cartoony. The animations of the enemy and the main character are funny. Music and sounds fit perfectly into the game but after some battle, the same battle music might get boring. Even a "low-end" PC can play it well. 

The game mechanics are well engineered. You are controlling an apprentice Warmage. On every map, the enemy attacks in waves and you have to use Traps and spells to stop them. Don't judge in advance, its not a simply Tower Defense game. It is kinda complicated because you have some kind of a talent trees. 3 of them. This way, you can costumize your gameplay so its not the same every time (You can focus on traps, guardians or spells). There are 25 levels and 3 game difficulty. The Nightmare mode is really challenging and you will enjoy completing the game in Nightmare. 

Some achievements are hard to achieve but definitely doable. You have to finish the game in Nightmare mode. It took me 20 hours to get every achievement.

[h1]Spoiler:[/h1]
[spoiler]There is a background story but nothing fancy. You are an apprentice Warmage as I said before. Your master died and every other Warmage is being killed by a mysterious enemy which will be revealed. Of course you save every castle and close every rift. You save the world but without the rifts, there are no magic left.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063847085', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1487591923}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968441615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1388201187}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a mix of tower defense and a third person "shooter".
Singleplayer only

Graphics:     5/10

The textures are quite simple. I know the game was intended to look like a cartoon, but if the developers added a few more details and colors, the game would look much better. Visually I like most of the enemies, but some of them have a truly awful design. For example: The animations of the dragon-like, winged "things" (enemies) fluttering in the air are far too static and the textures are not more than mediocre. The particle effects are very fitting for the game. The traps are well made, but in my opinion the look of the "Shock Zapper" trap doesn't fit its function. I suppose that's a matter of taste though. The details of the map are quite low, but this provides a certain overview that the game needs in order to keep the building site highly visible. I rate the graphics of the game as moderate.

Sounds:     8/10

They really did a good job here. The background music fits perfectly and enhances the game's quality a lot. The trap sounds are amusing and adequate. The only thing I really miss are enemy sounds. Yes, there are enemy sounds, but you will hear them quite rarely. With the orcs being silent you can't really tell when they appear behind you. It may not be that important because the developers added a minimap, but that's a missed opportunity to make the game a little bit better.

Gameplay/Handling/Equipment:     9/10

Both killing orcs with your weapon and with the traps is a lot of fun. The developers offer you a nice arsenal to protect the magical rifts. Spike traps, shocker, mushrooms, floor scorchers, archers and much more will help you slaying the orcs. The only thing what I really miss are really interesting weapons besides the crossbow and the alchemist bombs. The controls are easy to handle and building traps is no trouble at all.

Level design:     5/10

On the one hand the developers built some well structured tower defense maps (which isn't that hard I guess), on the other hand they really missed to add more details. You have the same wall and floor colors in almost every level. I would say you could rebuild those levels in minecraft with a good texture pack and it would look almost the same.

Enemies/AI:     4/10

The AI is - what a surprise - really poor. But I honestly didn't expect a complex AI from a tower defense game. So I will skip the rating for the AI and take a closer look at the enemy diversity. 
Besides the normal orcs there are big tough ogres, fast little kobolds, fast gnolls and flying creatures. The game doesn't actually need more enemies, but why did they just recycle the enemies and put a "frost-" "fire-" and "armored-" prefix to avoid designing more creatures?
This kind of recycling is not necessary. 4/10.

Story:     3/10

Yes, it actually has a story. I was surprised. The hero is a sorcerer's apprentice who is now in charge of protecting the magic rifts (teleporters to the world) from the orcs because his master is dead who protected the magic rifts before. It's not quite a story, but a reason to fight against the orcs. I think I will give 3 points for the good attempt and the humor.

Critic summary:     5.5/10

Personal fun rating:     7/10     [good game]

Well. It's a funny little game. No big title, but worth 5 bucks.
I finished the game and I don't regret it.
If you like tower defense games this might be an option.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992664721', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1587073609}
review:
I liked Dungeon Defenders a lot, but Orcs Must Die is even better. There is just something so incredibly satisfying to watch hordes of Orcs get blended in a maze of traps. From spikes on the ground or the walls, massive popup furnaces that churn walls of fire, milling barrels, rotating axes and the most epic weapon of them all in my opinion, the swinging mace. Or if you want to have some fun, the spring trap that makes them go airborn. You can either make them fly over the halls from one side to another using spring traps that face each other (it's just funny to do that :D ) or you simply throw them in lava or acid. Don't feel like blending the orcs? No problem, you can shoot them yourself with crossbow or use various other powers on them as well as place archers and knights that will fight for you. And when you think you exploited all the options, there are also powerup cards that give you special abilities like stronger player characteristics, stronger and faster traps or more powerful weapons. You invest some of the funds you have to buy traps into them and make yourself or the traps more efficient. Just awesome blend of FPS, lite RPG and tower defense. It's brilliant and i can't wait to play Orcs Must Die 2. Just have 3 more missions in the first game, but so far i'm totally in love with this game. Oh and unlike in the Dungeon Defenders, you can re-route their paths with barriers, so you can funnel them through one hallway to make your defending job easier, create a choking point where they all clutter together. It gives the game a proper tower defense feel and a lot more options to exploit on for maximum Orc blending power!

The game engine is also fantastic. From what i can tell they are using their own engine, but it's super fast, looks really good and has really nice character physics (really love the way how player's dress is affected by the movement) as well as physics that affect the orcs. And they achieved all this without the stupid PhysX. Thumbs up for that! And all this packed with quite well placed humor and player character making fun of himself and the orcs. And the way how developers presented the main character as the most stupid person in the world. It's just really funny game as a whole and love it for that.

And since there are so many different options to play through the maps with various approaches to horde control you can have countless hours of fun with the game. Highly recommended as i guarantee you countless hours of insane fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985881367', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1394227749}
review:
It's tough to talk about this after having played 2, but here goes.

I enjoyed this game enough when I first played it.  Some of the later levels get tough, and there are really only a few viable traps/weapon combos, but it works out.  There isn't a lot that I would say is bullshit, which is more than I can say for 2, but there also isn't much challenge, either.  Nightmare mode isn't necessarily hard, it just removes the strategy part of the game.  You're not given time to think/analyze/change placements, really.  I mean, yeah, that's hard, but it's also not really upping the difficulty in anyway.  Of course, maybe that's the best way to increase difficulty in a strategy game: removing much chance to strategize.

There is, believe it or not, a story to this game.  I wasn't really aware of it for a while, but it's totally there and you might miss it if you're not paying attention.

One quip I have is that things get redundant quickly, but whatcha gon' do.

It's an alright game, good even, if a little stale/boring/dry at times.  Like I've indicated elsewhere, though, Two is an improvement in every way, from the interface to map design.  The addition of co-op was a much needed boost to OMD as well.

If you skip this one you're not necessarily missing much.  A lot of the traps/dialogue/maps are carried over into two.  Still, this was an alright game.

review:
This was a very well done action/defence game. 

The game has a really nice art stlye and the graphics are nice. I just like the look of the game. 
The gameplay Is fluid and well done. The controls are easy to learn. There is a good amount of traps and abilities for you to use on the vast amount of orcs you will be slaying. 

Overall the game is fun. I would recommend giving the game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054799536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1527535455}
review:
A lot of games try to blend tower defense and action-based gameplay. This is one of the few titles that actually pulls it off, with a quirky sense of humor to boot.

On the other hand, the game is rather short, and could use moddability and/or custom levels. Replayability is, accordingly, rather limited.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023890771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1404063077}
review: Fire casting, lightning wielding, crossbow shooting, sword swinging, trap placing goodness. You are some dude who has to protect some portal from the orcs who want to use it. You do so by killing them yourself by means of fire, ice, lightning, sword, crossbow, lifestealing, etc. You can also place traps to make an unpassable death hallway which you can sit back and watch. You even has access to archers and Knight minions to place to kill the orcs. Really Really fun! Running around killing the stuff. The game looks beautiful, the main character is funny and has nice remarks and stuff to say while your killing the orc, very funny. It is part strategy with placing the traps on walls, floors and ceilings while also being a 3rd person view 3d game where you can run around and kill stuff. I have no idea why this isn't more popular.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969018797', 'num_games_owned': 2043, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1399862552}
review: I love Tower Defense games and this definitely has a unique twist to it. Instead of towers, you set traps and fight as yourself in 3rd person. You are rewarded for comboing multiple traps and slowly unlock new traps and powers. I also like the cartoony art style, makes me not feel as bad for slaughtering hundreds of Orcs. Very fun times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971672468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2777, 'last_played': 1448795654}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198051520578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1527450486}
review:
With Orcs Must Die!, the game starts off slow and seems to get quicker and more faster paced as you gain experience and get access to more abilities.  Graphics are nice in this game as well.  It Does seem to get a bit tedious after a long while and the pace at which the orcs spawn and rush in increases. 

If you do not have a lot of time to be able to play because of work, schooling or family schedules but would like to spend 15 min, 30 min or an hour just relaxing, I would recommend this game.   

So overall this game is enjoyable, especially if you dont always have tons of time on your hands.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994154869', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1404258390}
review: I had heard a lot about this game from friends and online review sites but I never really thought this game was for me. Boy was I wrong! Seeing it in a bundle I ended up buying it and Orcs Must Die! 2 and I am so glad I did. Being able to setup traps and try to link combos is so fun it's stupid. For anyone that read about this game or seen videos online and thought it wasn't for them, give it a try. You won't regret it! Now only to get more free time to play the game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198051858556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1451141473}
review: Great game, lots of fun while killing monsters :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042952896', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1427907818}
review:
This game is great to play when you want to have a quick fun.
Each party does not last more than 20 minutes, so you can play it every now and then. 

The gameplay is easy to grasp and the challenge is well balanced so you get the incentive to start over some levels to get all the points.

I'm going for 100% achievements for this game, because it makes me feel like I can do it. 
I will do it at my pace, one play at a time, every now and then. 
And when I'm done with it, I'll download the sequel to keep the fun going.

That makes for a fun game, that I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012418534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 78, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1710112922}
review: There's just something about deploying the traps, bottlenecking the Orcs, and watching the combos fly that balances its charm between arcade tower defense and creative puzzle making.  This game has kept me from jumping back on World of Warcraft...FOR THE ALLIANCE!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964120751', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1592400357}
review:
Good game, very original.

Third person combat combined with tower defense, reasonably well executed. I'm not sure there's a point to all the stuff in the game - there seems to be some equipment and spells that are just objectively better than others - but then again that might just be my play style. Reminds me a bit of Dungeon Keeper, if it were possible to place traps while posessing a minion. That said, I haven't played anything quite like it, so it gets points for an original fusion of genres. The player character is highly irritating - I think he's supposed to be an endearing doofus, but he just comes across as an out-and-out arsehole. Even so, this is worth getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053895039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1466, 'last_played': 1394579129}
review:
You like tower defence? You like slaying orcs? Or crushing them? Burning maybe? Or penatrating them with arrows? All whilst listening to comments of the most selfcentered douche since duke nukem? Well then this is the game for you. Fend of orcs in an epic onslought, using your wits and your crossbow to prevent them from entering the rifts. With lots of different traps, spells and a decent amound of enemy variety this game does one hell of a job in the third person TD genre. The game is not perfect though. The levels are all very gray and brown and as you are nearing the end of each lv, your defence has usually become so solid that there is no need for you to even be there. 
But if you can live with that (and I know I could), then this game sure is a hell of a lotta fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082904865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1401034369}
review: A single player tower defense action game. As the name suggest your character must defend a room from an onslaught of orcs. The orcs will come through a door as their starting point. Each will proceed to the end goal at the opposite end (usually) of the room. You will run around setting up traps of all kind. Along floors, walls, and ceilings. Traps consist of lava, tar, spikes, and so on. Unlike alot of other defense games this game has more interaction. During and in between rounds you can purchase and lay your traps through out. However, you can also attack the oncoming orcs with one of two weapons. A melle and range weapon set this game apart. Being able to actively attack enemies makes this that much more fun. No need to feel as just a spectator to the game. Most enemies wont attack you as they are driven to their goal. However, as the levels proceed difficulty increases. With newer enemies comes new threats, and new threats begat new traps to counter. If strategy and defense is your cup of tea. I highly recommend this title as the ability to attack will bring something new that you will enjoy. However, if it is not your cup of tea. I still recommend it for the very same reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987047936', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1326009600}
review:
I usually don't like tower defense games because they often turn into just sitting around waiting for the enemies to die, but with the blend of third-person action, Orcs Must Die! is a lot more fun and engaging. It gets especially intense when you have to monitor multiple paths at once. I'm not sure whether I'd recommend the DLC, since it doesn't add that much to the game -- but on the other hand, it's not very expensive. So, play this game! It's awesome. 

Full review here: http://postlaunch.blogspot.ca/2012/01/orcs-must-die.html

author: {'steamid': '76561197990121928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1652870193}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996912854', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 747, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1558979959}
review: I played Orcs Must Die! 2 before this one, and I must say, the second one is better. For those that wants to know what happened in this one, I will spoil it for you and say there is no boss fight with that woman. There is no upgrading your actual weapons, there is only upgrading once on your traps. The DLCs' made this game easier. Skip this game and get Orcs must die 2 if you want gameplay rather than story.. If you want to know how this all started, then feel free to get this when it is on sale. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026633656', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1606, 'last_played': 1392327562}
review: Orcs Must Die! Is one of my favorite games to be honest! This game is filled with humor and has a really nice gameplay. The only drawback is that it's a pure solo game. Something which it's sequel Orcs Must Die! 2 remedies! you take the role of a warmage, protecting the world from invading hordes of Orcs, Gnolls, Ogres and other creatures wishing to enter our world through magical rifts. The story-line is actually quite nice. If you enjoy tower defense games then chances are good that you'll enjoy this game as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045910264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1402773155}
review: A fun active tower defence game, each level unlocks a new defence item and you can bring those back to past levels to help you get three stars, a very cool game with a nice style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022007643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4595, 'last_played': 1410039028}
review: Requiring a degree of strategy and finesse (especially by the time Nightmare levels present), Orcs Must Die! is lots of gruesome fun that will test both your mettle and ability to adapt in ways that will bring you back time and time again to see just how many ways those pesky orcs really can die!  Kobold sappers can really be frustrating as can minor bugs with trap placement on a few levels, but overall this is a very enjoyable experience.  I definitely can recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998173438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1565174423}
review: i enjoy the fun 3D tower defence game. Having returned to it after a few years, there are a couple of things that could be improved. Some of the levels are much easier to solve by spamming with cheap traps and I haven't been able to make much use out of weavers yet. Still the characters are fun, the environment is cool and the challenge is still exciting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114998782', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1593521190}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041066484', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1872, 'last_played': 1456175327}
review:
Orcs must die! That one sentence is actually all you have to know about the game with the same title. It's a mixture between tower defense and an kind of action-rpg, where you have to prevent orcs and all their fellow companions like ogres, flying wyvern, and all that good stuff to enter the portals to the outer world. To do this, you have to... kill them. Of course.

Story:
If you actually want to play this game because of the story, you're considering buying the wrong game. There is basically no story, except if you call that little bit of dialoges between the hero and the villain a story. They're fun to listen to, as mentioned below aswell, but nothing special. Just the regular "evil person wants to destroy the world, hero has to stop her"-story.
2/10, but f*ck that, that's not what makes the game the great game it is, so read on.

Gameplay:
Before starting a game, you have to decide which items you want to use. There are about 25 different defense elements and 5 weapons for the player, such as a lightning ring, an ice ring or a blade, and of course the crossbow, which is your standard weapon.
Then, after having built your line of defence, you enter "G" and the actual fun begins. Orcs and other creatures come and run to the portal (or portals, as you have multiple ones to protect on higher maps). Depending on your build you'll have to do more or less yourself, while your defence units are killing the mobs.
There are three difficulties, one for beginners, "Warmage-Difficulty" (which is the standard one) and "Nightmare-Difficulty", which you unlock after beating the game on Warmage-Difficulty. On nightmare, you have only 3 seconds before the game begins, then you can't stop it anymore, so you have to think fast and play fast. There's actually skill required.
9.5/10

Graphics:
The game is not the newest. It hasn't got high-end graphics, but I like the comic-style of the art design. It's playful, fun, and excentrical. It fits perfectly to the game and to the main character, who's a little bit narcisstic, sarcastic and feels over-the-top, which makes him super fun.
7/10

Sound/Music:
The entire sound is great. While fighting, there's a mixture of rock/metal music with old, somehow medieval music playing. It's fast, it's hard, it rocks, it's just excellent if you like this kind of music.
If you headshot enemies, there sometimes might be special e-guitar riffs played, which makes them quite satisfying.
The monsters sometimes may comment your actions or say stupid things like "why does his crossbow shoot 1000 times a second?" with ultra-stupid voices, which makes them REALLY fun to listen to. Also, they make somehow fun of themselfes, which fits into the concept of Orcs Must Die! pretty well aswell.
The hero - the Warmage - is nice voice acted and sometimes also comments the action going on on the screen in his sarcastic way. Pretty fun aswell.
The villain is nice voice acted aswell, and the dialoges between her and the Warmage are in most of the cases really fun to listen to.
10/10, definitely.

Overall:
Orcs Must Die! is a great tower defense game. It's fun, challenging, entertaining, humorous, and hours fly by like a few seconds when playing it. I love it.
36.5/40 (as story isn't important, if you want to consider it, you get a 38.5/50; but trust me, it's a 50/50 for me personally.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198067109130', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 4067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2834, 'last_played': 1529671466}
review:
Con este agresivo t√≠tulo, salio (12 - 10 - 2010)  a la venta en formato descargable el nuevo juego de estrategia y acci√≥n desarrollado por los chicos de Robot Entertainment, una empresa que no cuenta con muchos t√≠tulos en su haber y cuyo primer trabajo fue el notable Age of Empires Online, un juego que ahora se encuentra en manos de otra desarrolladora.
A pesar de que Robot Entertainment no es una empresa muy conocida para el gran p√∫blico, es importante saber que sus integrantes cuentan con gran experiencia en el g√©nero de la estrategia a tiempo real, ya que muchos de ellos fueron miembros de la antigua desarrolladora Ensemble Studios, conocida por la famosa saga Age of Empires.
 
Orcs Must Die! nos muestra una visi√≥n m√°s desenfadada del g√©nero, aunque cuenta con un gran componente estrat√©gico mucho m√°s profundo del que puede darnos a entender a primera vista. Su mec√°nica es la del cl√°sico juego de defensa de torres y en √©l manejaremos a un aprendiz de mago que, despu√©s de morir su mentor, se ve obligado a asumir la peligrosa misi√≥n de defender una fortaleza a la que cientos de Orcos y otros malvados seres pretenden acceder para alcanzar una especie de portales denominados fisuras, distribuidos por las diferentes fases del juego, con el fin de gobernar en un reino de tinieblas.
 
Con esto no queremos decir que el juego sea un camino de rosas, es m√°s, habr√° momentos en los que deseemos estampar el mando contra nuestro televisor por su exagerada dificultad. Las fases iniciales no son excesivamente exigentes y las oleadas de enemigos son menos numerosas, pero la dificultad subir√° considerablemente seg√∫n vayamos abriendo niveles, aparecer√°n enemigos desde diferentes frentes cada vez m√°s resistentes y, para m√°s intriga, nunca sabremos el orden de salida de los mismos. Por todo ello, ser√° fundamental conocer el mapa de cada uno de los niveles a la perfecci√≥n, para poder as√≠ elegir una estrategia √≥ptima que nos permita enfrentarnos a las hordas de enemigos con ciertas garant√≠as de √©xito.
 
A lo largo del juego, nuestro h√©roe se ir√° haciendo con una serie de armas, tanto de largo como corto alcance, que cuentan con una habilidad primaria y otra secundaria que nos permitir√°n frenar los ataques de nuestros enemigos, aunque las verdaderas protagonistas son una serie de trampas y ayudas que se ir√°n desbloqueando progresivamente cada vez que superemos un nivel. Estas ayudas se mostrar√°n de muy diversas formas y nos encontraremos con trampas de pinchos, eficaces arqueros, barriles explosivos, sierras que se activan de forma autom√°tica, trampas de vapor que elevar√°n a nuestros enemigos hasta el techo o plataformas trampa impulsadas mediante un muelle que har√°n que estos salgan despedidos en la direcci√≥n que deseemos y ser√°n ideales para colocarlas cerca de abismos o dep√≥sitos de √°cido. Estas trampas son esenciales para evitar que nuestros enemigos consigan acceder a las fisuras y para ello, deberemos ir coloc√°ndolas estrat√©gicamente en distintos lugares del escenario que consideremos m√°s adecuados, con el fin de machacar "literalmente" a las innumerables hordas de Orcos, Trasgos, Trolls, etc√©tera, que ir√°n apareciendo a lo largo del juego.
 
Esta variedad de trampas son, sin duda, las que hacen que se convierta por m√©ritos propios en todo un referente dentro de los juegos de defensa de torres, ya que, por regla general, este tipo de t√≠tulos suelen caracterizarse por contar con unos sistemas defensivos algo limitados a la hora de proteger la fortaleza en cuesti√≥n. Sin embargo, las trampas y mecanismos con los que cuenta Orcs Must Die! son innumerables y su original aplicaci√≥n nos har√° disfrutar de una gran diversidad de ejecuciones de lo m√°s gore, que hacen que esta aventura sea una experiencia realmente gratificante.
 
Nuestro h√©roe cuenta con un inventario que √∫nicamente le permitir√° llevar de forma simult√°nea siete elementos a la misma vez. Por otro lado, no podremos utilizar las ayudas de forma ilimitada ya que deberemos pagar un precio cada vez que queramos colocarlas. Ser√° esencial que organicemos bien nuestros recursos y conozcamos perfectamente la fase que estamos dispuestos a afrontar, sobre todo en los momentos m√°s avanzados del t√≠tulo, donde un simple error puede ser sin√≥nimo de muerte.
 
Cada vez que superemos una fase, se mostrar√° una estad√≠stica con nuestros resultados y obtendremos una serie de cr√°neos como recompensa. Su n√∫mero depender√° de los puntos de fisura conservados y del tiempo que hayamos necesitado para finalizar la misi√≥n y estos nos servir√°n como moneda de cambio para obtener mejoras en los distintos elementos de ayuda. De ese modo, los pinchos ser√°n m√°s da√±inos, las plataformas ralentizadoras aguantar√°n m√°s tiempo a nuestros enemigos y la compra de arqueros podr√° resultarnos m√°s econ√≥mica, entre otras muchas mejoras. Esto da una gran rejugabilidad al t√≠tulo, ya que si queremos obtener un buen n√∫mero de cr√°neos con los que mejorar nuestras ayudas, deberemos superar de nuevo fases ya finalizadas.
 
El entorno gr√°fico resalta por un marcado estilo cartoon que ayuda a potenciar el car√°cter desenfadado del t√≠tulo, aunque los escenarios se muestran algo vac√≠os y demasiado cuadriculados algo que, por otro lado, nos ayuda a obtener una visi√≥n m√°s clara de su estructura a la hora de colocar nuestro arsenal armament√≠stico. Por √∫ltimo, nuestro protagonista y los propios enemigos cuentan con un dise√±o bastante result√≥n y sus movimientos resultan bastante suaves y agradables a la vista.
 
El juego cuenta con tres niveles de dificultad, aunque al principio √∫nicamente podremos jugarlo en f√°cil o en intermedio. El m√°s dif√≠cil se har√° accesible una vez hayamos finalizado con √©xito el nivel intermedio. Aconsejo el comienzo de la partida desde este nivel (intermedio), ya que es el que va a ofrecer una experiencia de juego m√°s satisfactoria y el que obligue a estudiar con mayor detenimiento las posiciones de las trampas que vayas a colocar para hacer frente a las numerosas oleadas de enemigos
 
Una de las cosas que m√°s hemos echado de menos en este t√≠tulo es la posibilidad de jugar en cooperativo con alg√∫n amigo en la misma consola o a trav√©s de la red. Se trata de una modalidad que finalmente ha quedado fuera del juego, a pesar de que se adapta perfectamente a la mec√°nica del mismo y, con toda seguridad, nos habr√≠a ofrecido much√≠simas m√°s horas de diversi√≥n.

Por √∫ltimo, comentar que viene totalmente localizado a nuestro idioma. A menudo escucharemos de boca de nuestro protagonista divertidas expresiones como "el mejor trabajo del mundo", "ahora que el viejo est√° criando malvas" e incluso a mitad de una batalla le escucharemos decir "qu√© desastre" en tono ir√≥nico, cada vez que un grupo de Orcos es masacrado. La banda sonora y los efectos de sonido tambi√©n se encuentran a un buen nivel y han sido bien implementados en el juego. Mientras preparamos nuestra estrategia reinar√° un silencio continuo y una vez empiece el show, diferentes melod√≠as realmente pegadizas nos acompa√±ar√°n en nuestra encarnizada misi√≥n.
 
El lanzamiento de Orcs Must Die! supone una grata sorpresa para el extenso cat√°logo de juegos descargables. El t√≠tulo ha mezclado sabiamente elementos propios de los t√≠tulos de estrategia con pinceladas de las aventuras de acci√≥n, cre√°ndose una combinaci√≥n de elementos realmente adictiva y bien ideada. Sus m√°s de veinte niveles (24 en el juego y 5 extra) te mantendra a la PC durante mucho tiempo, aunque no seras conscientes de ello y las horas te parecer√°n minutos mientras preparas sanguinarias estratagemas contra las numerosas hordas de enemigos que iras encontrando a lo largo de este divertido t√≠tulo.
