author: {'steamid': '76561198010180088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1398719610}
review:
[b]This is a long review so if you want just a brief summary of why I recommend Orcs Must Die! then skip to [u]Results[/u] and read from there.[/b]

Robot Entertainment mixes elements of different game types to conjure up a brilliant rendition of the tower defense genre. Taking action packed battles and mixing them with strategy you get a game that pushes both hack ‚Äòn slash as well as base management. 

[b]Story:[/b]
The order has fallen, the last War Mage is dead, and protecting the realm is now left up to you his apprentice. You must fight your way through the unlimited hordes of orcs as you defend the rifts from falling into the wrong hands. As you press through your adventure you come to learn the evil forces are being led by a corrupted War Mage who plans to destroy humanity. Will you be able to save the world from falling into darkness? 

[b]Campaign:[/b]
The campaign is broken down into three acts. The first act has ten levels, the second act has 8, and the third act has 6. Despite each act having fewer levels than the last they are all about the same length as the number of waves increases throughout the campaign. Each level unlocks a new element to the game and once you‚Äôve completed the level you gain the new item for any preceding or future level. Each time you beat a level you get a rating of one to five skulls, unlike most games these skulls actually are given to you as a currency which you can use to upgrade items. You can only get five skulls per level, meaning you cannot beat a level scoring five skulls then play it again to get another five skulls. Each level you can choose from a mastery tree that allows you to kit yourself out for that level, based on your strategies this can vary greatly throughout the campaign. You will progressively unlock more tower/item slots, which start as you only being able to equip three towers/items but later on you‚Äôll find yourself with 10+ slots. You play the entire game in third person, and similar to other games of the genre you are able to join in the battle and help your towers out. This means you are not just sitting there waiting between waves, but rather taking an active part into the gameplay. Some levels you may find yourself not needing to join in, while others you will be right in the fray. 

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
Each level allows you to equip an inventory which allows you to choose from a combination of spells, weapons, and towers. There are two weapons (crossbow and bladestaff), four spells (flame bracers, ice amulet, lightning ring, and wind belt), two guardians (paladins and archers), and 17 towers. I found myself typically sticking to the same set throughout the entire campaign, but there are many different strategies you can go for. By placing player activated traps you can take a large part of the game, you can sit back and use guardians to do most of the work, or even mix and match. The gameplay is fast paced and really pulls you into the mix by getting you to experience new elements each level. 

[b]Artifacts of Power DLC:[/b]
Artifacts of Power is a DLC that includes new items and towers. The DLC includes two traps (Shock Zapper and Floor Scorcher) and two spells (Vampiric Gauntlets and Alchemist Satchel). I used the Floor Scorcher and Vampiric Gauntlets a few times, found the Shock Zapper completely useless (as you need a roof for it to function), and used the Alchemist Satchel to get a +50 kill streak for the achievement. All and all this DLC isn‚Äôt exactly necessary, but if you can get it on sale and included in the pack it‚Äôs worth grabbing. 

[b]Lost Adventures DLC:[/b]
Lost Adventures is a DLC that includes new level, enemies, and even a new tower. There are five new levels, which offer more skulls allowing for even more upgrades. There are two new enemies the Frost Bat, and Cyclops Mage. It also includes one new trap the mana well which allows you to refill your mana gauge. This DLC is completely worth it as it adds additional content, new enemies, towers, and refined leaderboards. If you can get this on sale or in the bundle you will not regret it. 

[b]Results:[/b]
Orcs Must Die is an epic tower defense hack ‚Äòn slash game that keeps you pressed and wanting more. With rating systems that actually give you rewards, fun and interesting enemies, a long and arduous campaign, and an amusing little story Orcs Must Die is a Must Buy (too easy). If you are looking for something similar to Sang-Froid or Sanctum this is pretty much in that line. Once you beat Orcs Must Die you‚Äôll feel like you need to buy the second one as it makes you just want to play more. 

Pros:
+Leaderboard system that allows you to rank yourself amongst friends.
+Level rating out of five skulls which can then be used to buy upgrades.
+Loads of spells, weapons, and towers to choose from.
+Skill trees which can be customized each level to allow you to change how you play (more player intensive, tower support, or mixture of both).
+Smooth graphics which look good and don‚Äôt push it too far.
+Funny and amusing dialogue which gives you a laugh without being offensive.
+Intense amount of action, keeps you pressed and fighting between each wave.
+Built in level traps (such as rolling locks, acid pots, lava pots, and ballista).

Cons:
-I had a few levels glitch where an enemy wouldn‚Äôt leave the spawn point and thus I couldn‚Äôt kill it requiring me to restart (this was annoying if it was at the end of the level).
-If Gnoll Hunters fall into acid pits they do not die (as I learned when I set up a level that used nearby acid pits to kill enemies). 
-One of the DLC levels (Reverse Tower) is just The Tower in Reverse. I know this is obvious from the title, but if you purchase the DLC before playing the game its disappointing to find out one of the levels is the same thing just backwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071706064', 'num_games_owned': 1960, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 796, 'last_played': 1387056461}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a third person tower defence game. You play as the magicians apprentice and you must stop the Orcs from reaching the Rift, which is a portal to your universe.
Each level the Orcs break through the doors (or fly through holes in the ceiling) and make their way to the Rift coming in waves. You lay traps in their path, from spiked floors to swinging blades the Orcs blunder through your traps becoming so much meat and with each death you get more money to place more traps. Of course should you get bored of watching them die you can enter the fray yourself firing either a rapid fire crossbow or engaging in melee. Once you complete the level you get skulls based on how well you did which you use to purchase and upgrade traps.

This game is pretty good, if a little repetitive and the difficulty really ramps up in the later levels, especially if you haven't got the right traps or upgraded them enough. It's very satisfying to see a horde of Orcs be decimated as they wander through your traps, all the while never firing a single shot yourself.

For ¬£6.99 it's a great game, well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975051410', 'num_games_owned': 1443, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1336028400}
review:
Excellent tower defense-ish game!  It's smooth, colorful, bloody, violent and pretty damn difficult at times.  It's a lot like a single player Dungeon Defenders.  Removing the multiplayer makes it easier to see whats going on, and allows for more creative thinking.  Each new level, trap and ability you unlock will leave you thirsty for more and more Orc blood!

The traps are extremely divers and fun to experiment with.  Some combos work better than others, and some strategies are easier for different people.

The pace of the game will keep you on your toes, and the learning curve is well balanced.  With the constant addition of new enemies and new traps, your tactic will have to change throughout the game.

Its a good length for the content as well.  If it was longer, it would feel drawn out or not leave enough room for omd2.

Over all, this game is a lot of fun and worth buying ‚Äì on sale!  I only stress that this is bought on sale because you can play all of the omd maps on omd2 ‚Äì with or without a friend.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=7261685

review: Very fun game with awesome traps to kill the orcs. The intro of the story is funny and adds to the fun of the game.  I recommend playing on War Mage dificulty to have maximum fun rather than just starting on beginner dificulty. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069797359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1397259105}
review: Orcs Must Die is a game where there's orcs... and... they must die. Why? Fucking, I don't know, they're evil and they're breaking into your castle or some shit. Anyway, it's basically like a 3D tower-defense where you play as a douchebag with a crossbow who can put traps in places to mercilessly slaughter all the orcs. You gotta make sure they don't all get through, or else you'll lose, or if you're like me, if one gets through, then you gotta start over because that's prevented you from getting the highest possible score. In all seriousness though, this is really fun game, and if you can catch it on sale, consider yourself lucky.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069204713', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 965, 'last_played': 1413211917}
review: It is an intensly fun game to play, with great humor, and strategy to boot. I like graphics and the mechanics of the game, as it drives the focus on simply killing orcs, yet you must build the skills required to set the appropriate traps on a given map; failure to do so means your DEFEAT, to only have to try it again.  I give the game a 9.9 out of 10: I never thought I would have this much fun with a game such as this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044640183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1457896475}
review: A fun, cartoony, tower defense/FPS hybrid game. The controls are fluid and easy to pick up. There's a satisfaction that doesn't come with normal tower defense games where you just sit back and watch. If you liked Sanctum, this is better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017868757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1395760969}
review: I simply have to share a quick review/opinion on this game stating that despite its rather silly visage and initial portrayal, it is really one of the most fun-packed and relatively easy to pick up games that I've played in a while. A perfect game to fire up on an off-hour to let off some steam murdering pesky orcs in every single way you could ever imagine. It delivered everything it promised and more, with the possibility for what seems like some rather deep strategy and cooperative gameplay later in the game aswell. I still have to play more to form myself a perfect opinion on the game, but still felt that I had to give my highest regards to the creators of this games already, and to highly reccommend it to anyone looking for a bit of a fun fast-paced thought-requiring time sink.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054887912', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1782, 'last_played': 1590156871}
review:
This game is one of the best games ever made, this is the game that brought me to steam.
It is a 3rd person tower defense with great humor.

You are the last warmage that left to protect earth by preventing orcs and monsters to get into the rift.
Well.. you are not a true warmage.. you are the apprentice of an warmage that died in a very stupid death.

So it is only you VS tons of monsters that wants to kill you and then kill the human race.. BUT you are not just an apprentice., no no no , you are the most idiotic one! You are the last hope of the human race (you and your spells and traps).

Dont worry earth people , the apprentice is here to save you (you are doomed :P )


Score section :
Humor : 9/10
GFX : 7/10  great cartoon graphic
Voices : 9/10
Storyline : 7/10
Gameplay : 8/10

Score : 8


One of the best tower defense game ever made, worth every dollar

author: {'steamid': '76561198063823409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1449756474}
review:
You know from the developer said about Orcs Must Die:

Slice them
Burn them
Chop them
Pound them
Freeze them

You can use any methods to kill Orcs in this game, simple concepts but varies of executions. Your war mage is become like one man army, dealing with thousands of orcs every time you play this.

You got traps, guardian, spells and weavers to help you killing the orcs, you'll never regret it how things works out if you play this. 

This is a hybrid of 3rd person shooter and Real Time Strategy (RTS) because you need to know what kind of trap that will make orcs unable to enter your rift and don't forget of Big Boys such as Ogres and Bat for the Air units.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047022152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1362902400}
review: Kill all humans

author: {'steamid': '76561197993891197', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1737, 'last_played': 1408269113}
review:
I have very fond memories of this funny and polished third-person tower defense game. Slaughtering orcs, trolls, goblins, and other mobs is hugely satisfying, especially when racking up combos and abusing skill trees and environmental traps.

The game's only flaw is that the hardest difficulty, Nightmare mode, is a bit on the unfun side, as it immediately starts all attack waves automatically, removing the element of careful planning. If you're a completionist aiming to 5-star every level, be prepared for the tedium of restarting every single level dozens and dozens of times from scratch until that one magical run where nothing goes wrong.

Aside from that, highly recommended game. If you've never played Orcs Must Die 2, get this one on sale and play it first, and see if you get as hooked as I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002990097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1328342400}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is an extremely fun Tower Defense game, with a very nice mix of tower (trap) defense and third person action game.

While there are clearly some traps which are much more useful than others and you will tend to gravitate towards them, there is still a large amount to choose from, so you can easily set up some deadly combinations to defeat the invading orcs.

The gameplay is where the game really shines, while the level design is so-so, the sheer amount of variety in the game compensates for that.

The only major fault of the game is that it appears personal abilities are very strong and can overshadow the traps themselves, so if you are strategy minded you might be disappointed since, especially in the early waves, you will have to rely heavily on your character to do most of the work.

Great game let down by balance issues and level design.

8 / 10

review:
Einer der besten Spiele die ich kenne! Meiner Meinung ein Must-Have!

Das Spiel ist eine Mischung aus TowerDefense und Third-Person-Shooter.
Anstelle von T√ºrmen werden Fallen und Wachen aufgestellt, welche die Orks verletzen, durch die Luft schleudern oder zerschmettern.
Im Laufe des Spiels werden immer mehr verbesserbare Fallen freigeschaltet, welche eine Vielzahl an Verteidungskombinationen erm√∂glichen.
Die Horde an Orks werden des weiteren mit Armbrust, Schwert oder Magieangriffen abwehrt, wodurch es nie langweilig wird.

Den n√§chsten Teil "Orcs Must Die! 2" kann ich ebenfalls nur empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017168358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1558797433}
review:
Gameplay is similar to tower defense games, but instead of towers, you defend rifts. You prevent orcs from crossing the rifts by setting up traps AND fighting them using your crossbow/blade/spells (3rd Person). You can also customize your warmage (minor spoiler) by using the weavers, which give specific boosts whether you prefer casting spells or being crafty with traps.

Highly recommended for the casual gamer, it's easy to pick up and go. Maps typically has 15 rounds which take no more than 3-5 minutes each (much faster if you are good)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091451306', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1523561344}
review:
[Critique tir√©e de mon SensCritique !]

La Fantasy, de mani√®re g√©n√©rale, est montr√©e comme un genre plut√¥t s√©rieux. Il n'y a qu'√† voir les innombrables cr√©ations litt√©raires ou cin√©matographiques : la grande majorit√© se veut s√©rieuse comme avec la Fantasy √âpique, voire dans certains cas un peu trop s√©rieux si ce n'est compl√©tement sombre (Dark Fantasy oblige). Alors, de temps en temps, cela peut d√©tendre de se laisser aller √† plonger dans un univers de Light Fantasy, √† la recherche de burlesque et de bonnes d'oses d'humour et le moins que l'on puisse dire, c'est que le jeu Orcs Must Die ! nous g√¢te comme pas possible !

Alors que les Hommes vivent en paix - les invasions Orques √©tant retenues par des paladins faisant parti de l'Ordre - le plus grand mage de guerre vient √† mourir √† la suite d'une √©ni√®me d√©fense. La protection des Failles (passage entre le monde des Hommes et des Orques) revient alors √† son apprenti. "Voil√†... Le monde est condamn√©..."
Pas plus de spoil !

Orcs Must Die ! est un jeu d√©velopp√© par Robot Entertainment de type strat√©gique en "Tower Defense" : en effet, durant plus d'une vingtaine de tableau, il va vous falloir armer, pi√©ger et d√©fendre des salles toutes aussi surprenantes les unes que les autres pour emp√™cher les Orques de d√©truire votre monde. Et pour ce faire, on ne va pas de main morte !

En soi, le jeu est fort sympathique, revigorant et monstrueusement fun, facile √† prendre en main, simple dans son fonctionnement. En effet, √† chaque niveau, votre personnage (l'apprenti du mage de guerre) doit d√©fendre une salle en y d√©posant moult pi√®ges afin de stopper l'invasion. Donc, pas de prise de t√™te et c'est sans aucun mal que l'heure tourne tandis que les niveaux s'enchainent.
Alors, attention ! Il ne faut pas non plus s'attendre √† un jeu tr√®s recherch√© ou m√™me tr√®s profond sc√©naristiquement parlant. N√©anmoins, le travail propos√© fait largement l'affaire !

Pour expliciter quelques points du jeu :

L'histoire est simple mais il y en a une. En m√™me temps, ne pas parvenir √† faire d'histoire avec un th√®me aussi banal que la d√©fense de salles, il faut le faire. Cependant, si elle est amusante - les √©l√©ments comiques viennent nous faire sourire plus d'une fois - elle est √©galement facilement oubliable...

Le h√©ros ! Je dois avouer que de tous les h√©ros jouables (j'entends √©galement non personnalisable, √† la The Elder Scrolls), il entre facilement dans mon top 10 des h√©ros favoris. Il est (du moins, je l'ai trouv√©) absolument g√©nial gr√¢ce √† ses punchlines d√©clar√©es selon les massacres ou les situations.

Bien √©videmment, pour un "Tower Defense", impossible de contourner l'√©l√©ment principal : les pi√®ges. Ils sont tous inventifs en plus d'√™tre propos√©s en large catalogue. Pas seulement des pi√®ges, mais √©galement des armes, des unit√©s et autres amulettes. De plus, au fur et √† mesure des parties et des salles d√©fendues, on re√ßoit des cr√¢nes (monnaie du jeu) permettant d'am√©liorer efficacement notre arsenal.

Et pour clore le point par point, les ennemis. On ne se borne pas √† attendre seulement des Orques. C'est toute les arm√©es qui viennent avec la ferme attention de nous d√©rouiller la figure : des Ogres aux Kobolds en passant par les terribles Gnolls, il y a de quoi faire et de quoi trouver sa hantise !

Pour conclure, Orcs Must Die ! est vraiment un jeu qui m√©rite le coup, ne serait-ce que pour l'essayer tant il est jouissif et reposant (en un sens). Les niveaux sont assez vari√©s pour ne pas avoir l'impression de d√©fendre deux fois le m√™me endroit, le panel d'armes et d'ennemis est colossal, la bande son est accrocheuse - le th√®me principal peut facilement rester en t√™te, le h√©ros est totalement d√©jant√©... En bref, un jeu que je ne peux que recommander et qui assure (presque - parce que ma critique l√†, elle est tout de m√™me pas mal subjective) un amusement poilant ! Ce qui est s√ªr, c'est que √ßa va laisser des traces !
Et n'oubliez pas que la Fantasy nous appartient !

review: A good game at it's heart but not enough excitement to get me to play regularly. The only reason to come back is to see what different traps do, and that's not nearly entertainment enough. review:
OMD Review:
This game is a solid pickup.
Gameplay: Solid. You can take two main approaches: weapon-based or trap-based, as well as various upgrades throughout the game that can improve the cost of your traps. The controls are solid and traversal of levels is easy.
Graphics: Good, runs on most anything.
Aesthetic: Interesting, lends itself to the game's unique humor.
Music/Sound: The music isn't the greatest, and the Archer and Paladin lines get EXTREMELY irritating. Also, if you happen to minimize the game, it will loop the current sound playing.

review: One of the most helarious tower defence games I‚Äôve played. I do very much enjoy this genre and orcs must die does shine as one of the best. Even though the gore and the graphics design is "cartoony"; mowing down the hord with well placed traps or jumping into the frey with a meele weapon is still extremely satisfying. The humor is well done but taylored for younger players with reasonably subtle hints to more adult subjects. The plot is simple but entertaining non the less. The maps can be quite fendish but once you work out the best arrangement it all falls into place and you can work on that high score.

review: Okay, so how come it starts off easy, then suddenly a few levels in, BLAM, I can't get through it?? All the previous levels took me one go, then I get hit by a level I cannot pass. I am NOT going to YouTube for a solution. That is dumb. That is for Candy Crush Saga. Frustrating, and I should blame myself. But I won't, I blame the developers. Anyway, if you like tower defense games, this is one. But up close in 3D.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988936522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1522540219}
review: I picked this game up cheap in a bundle and was very surprised at how very awesome it is.  It combines FPS, tower strategy, and humor in delicious proportions.  I find it hard to quit.  Each level requires its own analysis to determine the best defense, the options are endless, and I don't always get it "right" and get overwhelmed the first time through.  A perfectly played map leads to total personal satisfaction.  Orcs Must Die can be played casually in 15 minute bursts, but it is easy to get sucked into multi-hour sessions that leave you tense, sweatry, and carple-tunneled out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040564286', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1653680852}
review: Just a lot of fun to play. Simple, fun story and wave after wave of orcs to kill. It does seem like the traps are a bit unbalanced and I do find myself using the same ones again and again while ignoring others but it remains fun all the same. I do wish the barricade were more cost effective; this one simple change would add a ton of strategy. Still, you will get $10 worth of fun out of this one easily.

review:
In this fantastic third person tower defense, you get assaulted by Hordes of Orcs...

...and you can push them, stab them, pierce them, slice them, burn them, cut them, stomp them, zapp them, shredder them, scorch them, throw acid at them, set them up the bomb and kill them in many many gory ways. 100% uncensored splatter fun :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050453461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 5629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2334, 'last_played': 1520731427}
review:
What games used to be.  Simple in concept, fun to play and very addictive.  The orcs must die!!!  Bit of strategy with FPS action a great stress reliever.  Don't take it too seriously and you'll love it.  

The easy levels are just that easy, the harder ones are much much harder and will make you work for it.  

Never knew there were so many way's to kill orcs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121751955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1389829725}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a very enjoyable mix of the tower defense and third-person shooter genres with plenty of comedy mixed in.  The objective of the game is to place traps in order to prevent waves of orcs from making their way through to your world.  As you progress, you unlock more traps which you can also upgrade.  Furthermore, you can supplement your traps by attacking the orcs directly.

I highly recommend this game.  The gameplay and comedy are highly enjoyable.  For those looking for a co-op experience, you'll want to check out Orcs Must Die! 2.  Which as a bonus includes levels from Orcs Must Die! in addition to it's own, new, levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972448343', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 5527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5527, 'last_played': 1333350000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! 

That's a pretty dumb name. 

Although I ended spending way too much time on this silly little game. Orcs Must Die would fall in the "Tower Defense" Genre but it has so many different twists. Firstly being, there's a pretty funny story and hilarious characters. You not only make traps, you also run around with a sword or gun or frost magic and fight as well. It's entirely possible to win the game without a single trap.  It's also entirely possible to win without a single sword swing but both would be incredible difficult. I loved wasting time on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079872156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1388265500}
review:
Overall a good game for slaughtering Orcs. Being a fan of the Orc race myself in video games, it was enjoyable to slaughter thousands of goofy Orcs as they rushed towards you in the many different levels this game's storyline had. Many different games these days have vast differences in graphical designs, yet this game struck a good balance between keeping it simple and looking good at the same time. The same goes for the different skins and models available throughout the game.

The cutscenes explaining the storyline are a bit short, and lacking information at times, but the idea of this game is pretty straightforward; you kill Orcs. Lots and lots of Orcs. You've got many different ways to do it, all ending up in the brutal slaughter of Orcs. There are many different contrapments and weapons to help you along the way. Considering the purpose of this game, I would say this is one of the best Indie games I've played in a while and I look forward to playing Orcs Must Die! 2 as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986336546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1392478709}
review: Orcs Must Die! is a nice twist on the traditional tower defence genre. Instead of building towers to defeat creeps (orcs), you set traps along their path. The game is played in third person view, so you can also kill orcs with your own spells and weapons too (similarly to Sanctum). OMD is exactly what it says on the box. You kill orcs in hundreds of different ways as they make their way to the end of the level. The premise is simple and it's fun to work out various strategies to kill orcs. Items, weapons, spells and weavers (special abilities) can all be used. Some levels are frustrating, though a bit of logical thinking goes a long way. The visuals are very smooth and fit into the laid back, humourous style of the game. The storyline and voice acting are a bit cheesy, but OMD doesn't take itself too seriously, which adds to the charm. Great game to play casually.

review: I took a chance buying this game and i'm glad i did, It's fun and addictive, The beauty of this game is that theres no specific way to set up the traps, Set them up your way, The joy of watching your perfectly arranged traps mowing down hordes of Orcs like a well oiled machine is wonderful to behold, With good graphics, sound and humor, I totally recommend this game, you'll almost feel sorry for the Orcs, Almost.

review:
Orcs Must Die! √â um Tower Defense (g√™nero onde o objetivo √© impedir que os advers√°rios percorram um mapa e atinjam determinado ponto especifico) de a√ß√£o e estrat√©gia, com vis√£o em terceira pessoa e combate em tempo real para um jogador. Foi desenvolvido e publicado pela Robot Entertainment, respons√°vel por jogos como Age of Empires Online e Hero Academy, e lan√ßado somente em formato digital para Xbox 360 e PC em Outubro de 2011.

O enredo gira em torno da Ordem dos Magos de Guerra, um grupo de magos, respons√°veis por proteger as Fortalezas da invas√£o de Orcs (e outros monstros), para que eles n√£o atravessem as Rupturas localizadas dentro delas, estas s√£o a fontes de poder m√°gico vital para manter a vida na terra e um portal entre o mundo dos homens e dos Orcs. A hist√≥ria se inicia quando o Velho Mestre (e narrador) sofre um acidente ao defender uma das Fortalezas e aparentemente morre, cabendo ent√£o ao seu aprendiz (o protagonista do jogo, chamado apenas de o Mago de Guerra), defender as fortalezas em seu lugar, lutando contra as invas√µes crescentes e cada vez mais organizadas dos Orcs.

O jogo n√£o possui uma hist√≥ria profunda e detalhada, apenas um conceito, que √© uma justificativa para os acontecimentos do jogo, o foco principal √© a jogabilidade. O enredo √© contato atrav√©s de cutscenes com imagens est√°ticas ao fim de cada ato, e atrav√©s de di√°logos do protagonista ao inicio de cada fase. A trama √© focada no humor muitas vezes negro. O Mago de Guerra √© um personagem muito carism√°tico, seus coment√°rios e di√°logos durante o gameplay s√£o realmente bem engra√ßados.

O jogo possui um total de vinte e quatro fazes, dispostas em tr√™s atos. Voc√™ come√ßa cada fase dentro de uma fortaleza diferente, o objetivo √© impedir que os Orcs atravessem as Rupturas, e voc√™ tem uma certa quantidade de pontos de Ruptura dependendo da faze, voc√™ perde pontos caso algum inimigo atravesse ou voc√™ morra, se estes pontos chegarem a zero √© Game Over e vai ter que recome√ßar toda a faze novamente. Os inimigos surgem em hordas, cada faze tem um numero diferente de hordas, e voc√™ tem um intervalo de dez segundos (tr√™s no modo pesadelo) entre uma e outra, e alguns momentos de pausa para se organizar, comprar seus itens e posicionar melhor suas defesas.

Para conter os inimigos voc√™ tem um arsenal de armas, magias, guardi√µes (que s√£o NPCs que te auxiliam ao longo da partida) e principalmente armadilhas com diversos efeitos e usos diferentes a sua disposi√ß√£o, que podem ser melhorados com a utiliza√ß√£o de caveiras dadas ao fim de cada faze, al√©m de tecel√µes que servem para melhorar suas habilidades. Uma boa estrat√©gia √© vital para vencer, voc√™ deve estudar muito bem a faze antes do inicio da partida, fazer um bom posicionamento de cada armadilha ou guardi√£o durante as fazes √© essencial para conter os advers√°rios. Mas apenas isso n√£o basta para segura-los, √© necess√°rio utilizar armas e magias, e ser r√°pido e preciso, tomando cuidado para n√£o levar muitos golpes, pois seu personagem √© muito fr√°gil e procurar controlar seu reservat√≥rio de Magia para que ela n√£o se esgote, felizmente voc√™ pode se recuperar rapidamente chegando perto de uma Ruptura.

Os inimigos do jogo s√£o bem variados desde Orcs normais, Kobolds pequenos e fracos, passando pelos mortais Gnolls, at√© grandes e poderosos Ogros, entre muitos outros, cada um com comportamentos e habilidades diferentes. Por isso √© bom tomar cuidado, al√©m de inimigos mais poderosos causarem mais dano, custam mais pontos de Ruptura.

O gameplay √© r√°pido e fren√©tico, voc√™ vai se ver muitas vezes correndo de um lado pelo outro pela faze, algumas com v√°rios caminhos, a fim de conter seus advers√°rios, felizmente o jogo responde muito bem aos comandos, tocar de armas, para armadilhas ou magias √© r√°pido e feito alternando as teclas num√©ricas ou scrolll do mouse (e gatilhos no caso do controle), tornando o jogo r√°pido e din√¢mico.

A ambienta√ß√£o do jogo √© por vezes repetitiva as fortalezas s√£o bem parecidas umas com as outras, com mudan√ßas de design em cada faze, mas sempre com mesmo visual, apesar disso elas s√£o bem feitas e detalhadas. Os gr√°ficos do jogo seguem o estilo cartunizado, as cores s√£o vivas e combinam muito bem com todo o resto, apesar disso a viol√™ncia gr√°fica √© moderada, com Orcs sendo fatiado e suas partes voando pelo cen√°rio (e desaparecendo logo em seguida).

O jogo apresenta total localiza√ß√£o em nosso idioma, com menus e dublagem em portugu√™s, sendo um dos pioneiros na Steam nesse quesito, o que para um jogo independente √© algo digno de respeito. E de fato a dublagem √© excelente, todo o di√°logos e piadas foram muito bem executadas, e n√£o possuem qualquer erro, al√©m das vozes combinarem muito bem. A ressalva fica por conta do gameplay com frases sendo repetidas a exaust√£o, o que chateia um pouco, mas nada que tire o brilho do jogo. A trilha sonora apesar de limitada cumpre seu papel nada de especular, ela √© agitada nos momentos de combate e calma nos demais momentos.

Orcs Must Die! √© um jogo bem divertido e desafiador que vai proporcionar v√°rias horas de divers√£o, ele pode parecer dif√≠cil a primeira vista, mas a medida que voc√™ progride aprende, ganhas novos itens e habilidades e tra√ßa estrat√©gias ele se torna bem mais f√°cil. Ele seria melhor √© mais completo com um modo multiplayer, que foi adicionado em sua sequencia Orcs Must Die! 2, mas ainda sim √© um jogo excelente e merece ser jogado, principalmente se voc√™ gosta de a√ß√£o e estrat√©gia. Orcs Must Die! custa R$ 16,99 a vers√£o normal e R$ 21,99 a vers√£o GOTY com todas as DLCs.

DLCs:

O jogo possui duas DLCs, j√° inclusas na vers√£o GOTY Edition:

Orcs Must Die! - Lost Adventures, inclui mais cinco fases que expandem o jogo original, elas s√£o bem mais desafiadoras que as da campanha principal, e s√£o uma boa pedida quem quer um pouco mais de desafio ou caveiras extras para melhorar seus itens. Al√©m disso jogo apresenta dois novos inimigos o Morcego de Gelo e o Mago Ciclope, e um novo item.

Orcs Must Die! - Artifacts of Power, que acrescenta duas novas armas e duas novas armadilhas.

Aqueles que fizeram a pr√© compra do jogo receberam a roupa alternativa Cavaleiro da Ordem, que nunca foi lan√ßada via DLC. Todos os monstros, armas e roupas, lan√ßadas como conte√∫do adicional neste jogo vieram por padr√£o em Orcs Must Die! 2.

O QUE PODE AGRADAR:

- Jogo viciante e realmente divertido, rende muitas horas de gameplay.
- Legendas e dublagem totalmente em portugu√™s brasileiro, que ficaram muito boas por sinal.
- O jogo √© realmente leve e possui excelente otimiza√ß√£o, n√£o h√° quedas de FPS mesmo com a grande quantidade de elementos na tela ao mesmo tempo.

O QUE PODE DESAGRADAR:

- Di√°logos muitas vezes repetitivos durante o jogo.
- A ambienta√ß√£o tem poucas varia√ß√µes entre as fases.
- Aus√™ncia de um modo multiplayer, muito comum neste g√™nero de jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006785556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1682105917}
review: The title of the game says orcs must die but I dont think they should

author: {'steamid': '76561198105593328', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1414324315}
review:
There are a lot of orcs in this game.
They all need to die.

The story isn't great but the game itself certainly is. The game is challenging but can also be played in an easier mode if that is more your cuppa tea. For the die-hards, there is also a nightmare mode.
Finishing the game for the first time should take a reasonable amount of time (<10h). The replayability is good though, the achievements are fun to try and get, and generally not of the grinding type. Since the way to play a level will completely depend on how you approach it (which traps you use, which weaver, etc) you can do a level multiple types without feeling like it's always the same thing.

It's a lot of fun to find and try out new methods of making Orc-paste (a)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970735557', 'num_games_owned': 1153, 'num_reviews': 258, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1459283655}
review: This FPS / tower defence game is real fun. There's a speed and energy to the traps and your participation in the level, plenty of emergent tactics, and an appropriate level of panic and improvisation in some levels. Occasionally you get completely minced by a level, which can be annoying if you have half a dozen stabs at it, and I did 90% of the levels relying on 40% of the equipment, but that's the only downside to this excellent game. Oh, and the music is fabulous. Gonna buy OMD2 on the strength of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966055543', 'num_games_owned': 1124, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1407772161}
review:
Burst the orcs into pieces!
Quite a few weapons and tons of traps promise orc-slashing fun.
Nice mechanics, pretty good overview, and a funny background story (which is not all too important, I claim :P ).

All in all a rather nice game to play.

review: Orcs Must Die! is another entry in the recent surge of Tower Defense games popping up all over. Fortunately, the good humour and overall silliness of it is what makes it stand out from the rest. With a protagonist resembling a medeival Bruce Campbell, this is a game everyone should give a go.

review:
This game is a brilliant blend of the Action and Tower Defense genres. It never turns into a brainless shooting gallery, but it also never slows down, and it's always keeping the player engaged. Advanced players will want to tackle the leaderboards or play with less conventional setups. 

It's also funny. Seriously, go play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006872207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1390652233}
review:

Es una combinaci√≥n muy interesante, en vez de torres se tienen trampas que se han de ir colocando a traves de varios pasillos y mazmorras, como todos estos juegos hay diferentes enemigos, voladores, bajitos, fuertes, etc...

Adem√°s de que te dejan potenciar bien tu lado guerrero o bien tu lado de estratega con un peque√±o arbol de tecnologias.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972476232', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1387236933}
review:
Must orcs die!? And why is the death of ogres and gnolls a foregone conclusion of this? The title's inherent racism is not really questioned at any point. The only option towards a peaceful resolution is to buy drugs that become available late in the game and which you can never afford enough of to avoid bloodshed anyway. The player character is a smug, chauvinistic jock who relishes in the slaugher of people of different skin tones. Utterly disgusting.
Servicable gameplay though if you can look past the developer's obviously politically inspired agenda behind this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987389179', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1470, 'last_played': 1388387005}
review:
Here we have a very fun game, but it can get you very angry when you try to complete it perfectly. I completed with multiple rage quits.

The proposal is simple, tower defense, prevent the orcs from reaching the portal, there are different types of enemies with different behaviors. The fun is to develop a strategy with the available traps, exploring the scenario in order to exterminate all. The vision in the third person possibility you to actively participate in the struggle, something different in these types of games.

With a fun and intuitive gameplay, the graphics also pleases with his cartoonish appearance, the sound of stacks of orcs being crushed and torn is comforting. The plot is simple, just an excuse to kill orcs in many ways.

7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198035423381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1398371351}
review: It's like tower defense meets action RPG. Orcs Must Die! is quite fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994300102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1396741592}
review:
Well first of all: Only god knows why this game is rated for 16 years old teens and above in Germany... 

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ Casual Instant-Action Fun
+ Lovely design of environment and player- and npc models
+ Great narrator
+ Orcsorcsorcsorcs
+ Good plurality of weapons/traps

[b]Contra:[/b]
- You get new weapons/traps to the beginning of the next level, this is good, but in this level most of the new weapons/traps are useless
- ... which is also for the whole game. There a few items you absolutely not need.
- For Core-Gaming, this game can get really boring. The level-design seems repititive after a long session.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016827623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2008, 'last_played': 1414803593}
review: I really enjoy this game. I'd describe it as a desktop tower defense game in which you are a player amongst the traps that you lay, directly engaging the Orc horde. The graphics are great, the maps are challenging, the traps and obstacles at your disposal are fun, and it includes a nice sprinkling of humor. A great single player game, especially when you need a break from your coop/MMO game of choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062128104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1549053145}
review:
Oh yes! This game's atmosphere is awesome, never has killing hords of orcs felt better than in this game. While you are busy killing waves of orcs, a pretty good soundtrack will play in the background, which gets you hyped up for the coming battle. Prepare for one hell of battles, if you can't kill Orcs because they look cute, than you are going to easily fail this game, the difficulty in the game is really high and only the toughest players will make it to the end.

With a little plot, which consides of 4 "Cutscenes" this game will keep you excited for the next levels, however be warned that the lines get easily repetive, it helps to only play 3-4 levels a day maximum, to enjoy the game at it fullest.

It's one of the most fun wave based game there is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043327000', 'num_games_owned': 1108, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1484517173}
review:
An excellent Tower Defense, in Orc Must Die our goal is to kill orcs. The concept is simple, but the execution was ver good. 

This is basically a Third Peron shotter mixed with Tower Defense, and our goal is to defend our portal that is inside a castle. Orc Must Die has 24 levels, and everyone level has a different approach, in each level you will fight hundreds orcs. 

Now you must be thinking that you are alone on this fight, well no, you will have many traps and magic powers to help you on this journey. On the beginning of each wave you have unlimited time to prepare your set up. Since is the first wave you won't have too many coins but don't worry because on the firsts wave, archers and barrels are the perfect combo. 

Graphically speaking this game goes for a sort of cartoonish look that fits fairly well, also the OST does the job equally.

If Orc Must Die has COOP - OMD2 has COOP - would be a much better experience. 

After i decreased my backlog a bit i sure want to re-play this game again! 

Recommend! 

~ 7/10

review:
There aree dirty dirty orcs coming into your castle. Take a spin on tower defense by defending your tower with a custom job of sikes, traps, and magical weapons. Pretty much to the point with what it offers. Simple functions for a game that's more of a pallet clenser from larger games, or if you just want to blow some time with a casual game.

Get it if your a fan of tower defense.

review:
Original, Fast Paced and Damn Addictive.

All 3 describe this game to maximum precision. It is such a fun game, hours can be eaten away form your hands playing through the extensive single player campaign. It does lack the single most important thing that would make this game more fun. 

Multiplayer.

Seriously, without it, this game is bland, you want to experience the Orc mayhem with your buddies. Skip this one, go for the sequel.

WompWompWommmmmp/10

review: Tower defense with action rpg elements? Count me in! If you've ever enjoyed playing a tower defense game (even those little flash ones) then you HAVE to try this game. Rather than having defense towers, you will be equipped with an impressive collection of traps. This allows for a good amount of strategy and frantic gameplay. Fun, addictive, and challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017713708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1387607357}
review:
Fun, cartoony and addictive gameplay. Maps are reasonably sized, and portals add to the strategy.  Only real peeve is that some traps never feel useful (looking at you ceiling shock zapper).  

Levels can be completed within 5 - 15 minutes, so this is a fun game to pick up and play if you have a small amount of time to kill. Highly recommend for fans of tower defense genre.

review: Orcs Must Die! is a fun, fantasy FPS mixed with tower defense. The storyline and humor are very enjoyable.  The combination of action and strategy is a fresh take of this kind of gameplay. author: {'steamid': '76561198038787228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1387561973}
review:
While steam says i currently have 0.2 hours recorded playing this, I own it on xbox 360 as well and Ive completed the game. 
Honestly this is one of my fav games of all time. Absolutely love it so I dedcided to be the first to share my thoughs and opinions. 
Now on to the review :) 

Its a hybrid third person action game with tower defense. this means all your descisions and actions play out all in real time so when your defending against those nasty orcs, timing and well thought out traps are crucial. Yor goal is to keep the orcs from reaching a certain point on the map called, the Rift.The Rift was built in a forsakened fortress to keep everyone safe but now the orcs want to get to it and destroy you if you get in their way. Your teacher fell in battle so now it's up to you, The apprentice to defend the rift! The story is not really what this game is about but you are greeted whith the occasional cut scene. The game starts off with only a few waves and the basic set of orcs which are fairly easy to kill, as long as you don't sit there and let them attack you....but who would do that right? Each level in the game has a set number waves, each increasingly more difficult. The good thing is you always know what you're up against and just how many Orcs your going to slaughter in that particular level. The Orcs also range from ground units to archers to flyers and big tanks that take alot of damage. Also, each orc has a weakness so exploiting it in your traps and strategy will help alot. While the onslaught of orcs never stops, you have plenty of weapons and traps at your disposal, which brings me to my next topic, The traps! Each trap has a set fuction and there are a number of them which can only be placed on walls, floors, ceilings etc. 
They range from your simple barricades to huge swinging ceiling axes, to decoys and meat grinders, to archers and guardians. You also have weapons to choose from to kill the orcs yourself, thats what i love about the game. Youre not just looking down and watching the fight, youre in it. So it is up to you to work with your traps and stop the orcs from reaching the Rift. Although, in later levels you must defend more than one rift at a time which means the game can get pretty tough.  The rift will heal you when your close enough so if your ever in a pinch, you can go back and refill your hp which is nice. The game also scores you on your accuracy and headshots and the amount of kills in a row. Depending on how well you do, your awarded with up to 5 skulls, these are your currency. However, you cannot move on to the next level(s) unless you have earned enough skulls in previuous levels. So doing well, is essential. Yes the game can get challenging fast and you can lower the dificulty, but that reduces the amout of skulls to be earned, so its sort of a trade off. With the skulls you can purchase new upgrades and traps as well as bonuses that effect you and your traps, later on in the game. Now again i will say have not played this on pc yet but on xbox, there were no problems as far as framrate and lag. So I would check the system specs before you go ahead and make the purchase, as with all games. The visuals are quite nice and really stand out compared to most other tower defenses. The art style is a little silly and cartoony but dont let that fool you. When your killing orcs or watching your traps bruttally tear them apart..the gore and sense of pain does make the game feel less childish. Controls felt great on my xbox game pad although I would imagine mouse and keyboard is slightly better, accuracy and speed do play a big role here. Now i will say the game may have some flaws but I personally think Its close to perfect. And Im sure OMD2 fixes any issues this one may have. 

Theres more to the game than I've mentioned but I wont spoil it all. Lets just say if you like tower defense games and third person shooters/action, you should deffinitely give this a go. Robot Entertainment's Orcs Must Die! gets a 5 out 5 

edit: I mainly bought this to replay levels in OMD2, and yes i will be reviewing the sequal when I finish it!

review: I...I think I just realized I don't like tower defense games after all the ones I've tried. I can recognize this as being a well made hybrid of that and a third-person shooter, and there are definitely things about it I can appreciate, but even after trying it twice a couple years apart, I've bounced off it both times. Thanks, Orcs Must Die. You seem like a good game...for someone else.

review:
Orcs must die √® uno di quei giochi che all'inizio dalla presentazione sembra uno dei tanti giochi senza nulla di speciale che si trovano ovunque su steam. All'inizio l'ho sottovalutato ma mi stavo decisamente sbagliando.
Questo gioco offre un gameplay divertente misto fra un tower defense e un action in terza persona con livelli che diventano gradualmente sempre pi√π complessi senza per√≤ sfiorare in nessun caso l'impossibile..
Ci ho giocato poco visto che l'ho acquistato da poco ma per me √® decisamente un s√¨. Questo gioco merita i soldi che costa!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023535139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2187, 'last_played': 1387757111}
review:
I am not a fan of tower defense games, but this game (and it's sequel) give a refreshing spin on the genre. It combines 3rd person shooter with tower defense. This allows you to actively participate in the defense. You'll be shooting down enemies while managing your defenses.

The level design gives you enough choice to try out different tactics. Sometimes there is one obvious tactic. Other times you have to try out different combos. Even though not all traps are as powerful/balanced, you can't always use the same traps. This gives enough variation through out the game.

[b]Orcs Must Die 2 adds a few new features:[/b]
+ Co-op
+ Endless Mode
+ New playable class (mage)
+ More customization

author: {'steamid': '76561198043285599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 5371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1683, 'last_played': 1527981136}
review:
I think this game is a sin... yes a straight up  biblical sin; it's  far too fun to be anything but sinful, wrong or cancer causing. I'm serious. There is nothing I can find to dislike about this game. The graphics are crisp. even in the pitch melee you can always pick out high priority targets, the music is very nice for the background and the sounds ... on the slicing of metal and the funny wails of agony never sounded so good.

It is also frustratingly difficult at times, don't be fooled by the early missions, it starts ramping up fast but it's a good challenge, the sort that has you reformulating your strategy when you lose and dancing when you win.

There's also the humor... it is actually funny to listen to the voice overs at time, it sounds like something Blizzard would have done about 8 years back.. around the time of Warcraft 2/3...you know.. before they stopped making games and started designing payment portals..

Give it a try, you won't regret it.  Defense with a twist. Now if you'll excuse me... I have a bridge to mine with catapult traps.

review: This is a very fun puzzle game with different ways to defend each dungeon. I highly recommend this game to anyone. One downside is the highly sensitive mouse scroll speed, which I still don't know how to reduce. However, you soon get used to it and it doesn't become a hindrance. The graphics and designs are amazing; the audio and voice acting are outstanding; and the game mechanics (level design and weapon design) are dynamic and intuitive. Some players may find it easy - however this is a thoroughly enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049490160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1582508747}
review:
The idea is that you kill orcs. How you do that is up to you, and therein is where the fun in this game is found. It has both shooter aspects (you move around shooting a crossbow and possibly other weapons) and Tower Defense elements (you need to design good trap combos to win). Simple enough, but well executed, high quality, and fairly fun.

The only shortcoming is that on some levels there is only one 'correct' build to easily win, and finding that can be a pain sometimes. And, unlike it's successor it does not have Co-Op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003880852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1386870389}
review:
Fun fact: I dislike Tower Defense games for being boring, repetitive and unpersonal. Oh, and boring, just to mention it again.

Another fun fact: Orcs Must Die is NOT a tower defense game, even though it could easily be mistaken for one. But I would rather consider it a 'Tactical Defense TPS'. You're not a commander building towers, you're a guy building traps which are meant to aid you in wrecking Orcs. Lots of them. And boy, it's fun.

Let's begin with the art style and sound. Both are fluent, coherent and quite fine. I won't say superb, because the game obviously is neither an AAA title nor top-actual, but it's well above what would be necessary as a minimum.
A big point of the game is it's humor, that clearly hit my favour. Whether it's Orc's philosophing and quoting famous memes, or the utterly retarded-charming protagonist, or his even more retarded monologues, the game makes you chuckle. Whilst orc's get gibbed left and right.
Which is literally all this game is about: Killing orcs in the most fashionable/efficient/hilarious way possible. You got a wide array of different traps, weapons and champions at your disposal, and often the level'S themselves have special environmental hazards, high bridges ideal to kick orcs off from, lava pits...
Even as an enemy of TDGs, the game was great to play.

Which leads us to it'S only downside: 'was'. The game is terribly short. I've beaten the entire campaign + bonus missions at this point, with a perfect completion on about 75% of all levels (many of those on first try). Yes, there is a 'Nightmare' difficulty, but I'm not sure whether I will go for that or rather switch to the sequel ofthis game instead.

But hey, it's a budget game,so we can't exspect 40h playtime, can we?
Result: 8/10 Solid and extremely satisfying way to waste time. ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198107466003', 'num_games_owned': 1158, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1629058052}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971279033', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1332745200}
review:
A tower defense game mixed with RPG elements and a 3rd person perspective on your hero. A really enjoyable game where you are a young wizard defending the onslaught of orcs. You set up each mission by placing your "towers" (in this games case, traps) to slow the orcs down. This is only your first line of defense as you control the young wizard once the round starts. Cast magic, go melee, fix traps, and much more.

I would recommend getting this game before purchasing the sequel. Sure the second one has two player co-op, but this will be cheaper and allow you to get a feel for the game. If you really enjoy the game and, like myself, find yourself wanting co-op play to add new deminsions and strategy, grab the second one. If you are quick, grab both games from Humble Bundle (as of this posting 12/10/13) and get both games, all DLC, for $4.25.

I highly recommend giving it a try. Watch the video/trailer to see if the playing style is what you are wanting too. If not, then don't waste your time because you will not be satisfied. If you are intrigued or thinking, "yeah I will give it a try. looks fun!" then you should buy this right away.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048004902', 'num_games_owned': 1195, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1370539570}
review:
Nice tower defense-ish game. Basically you have to control the flow of Orcs in such a way that you manage to kill them all (either with traps or by yourself).

I think it is quite a good game. Also you can get it cheap enough as it currently is in the Humble (Jumbo) Bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000249349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1707521189}
review: Excellent tower defense game - simple and responsive controls, crisp graphics, fun storyline. A good mix of strategy and skill. The 'level grade' system and Nightmare difficulty add extra layers of replayability to the game, forcing you to adapt your strategies and use a wide range of skill and trap builds for different encounters, while simultaneously demanding better playskill from you in the form of aiming (ie. headshots can cause significantly more damage) and laying traps under pressure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041251844', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1448109334}
review:
One of the most addictive and energetic games I have played lately is Orcs Must Die. At first I was somewhat alarmed by the fact of non-stop killing with the help of various mechanisms, but when I started to play it I was totally absorbed in the process. It can be classified as Tower Defense game, but among other rivals in this type of computer games it is IMHO one of the best. 

 The aim of Orcs Must Die is very simple ‚Äì not to let hordes of orcs, trolls and the like into our world. You are given a tower with one or several portals to be defended from numerous waves of monsters. Upgrading from level to level you are also provided with new different devices, skills, mechanisms, as well as earning money to money to buy ambushes and modernize them. The two most brilliant features of the game are in my opinion the highest level of action tension (what I feared most while playing is that somebody of my household would call me for something) and the elements of tactics and strategy.

read more http://www.viewforum.net/gaming-dept-171/orcs-must-die-2767/

author: {'steamid': '76561198009547755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1385925065}
review:
The gameplay is gritty, easy to learn, and difficult to master.  The game is quirky, doesn't take itself too seriously, and is easy to pick up, but hard to put back down.  It has a few shortcomings (no CoOp), and Nightmare isn't quite as difficult in this original as it was in the sequel, but the gameplay is still going to challenge players of every skill level.

For those of us who love Tower Defense/FPS hybrids, this game is a solid purchase at anything under $10, and a steal when it dips below $5.  If you play through the achievements (all of which are reasonable), you can expect about 15 hours of very enjoyable gameplay.

review:
This game is fun!
The combat is clunky, but very nice and meaty. The variety in enemies, traps and weaponry is also quite impressive.
Also, it's a pretty good challenge.
It is kinda repetitive, though, and the campaign will only really take you about 12-15 hours.
For what you get, though, it's definitely worth the $10/¬£7.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044641727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1285, 'last_played': 1391295196}
review:
Tower Defense - Check
Shooting Stuff/Third Person Action - Check

If you like either of those, then you should like this game. Even if you dislike strategy games I feel like you'll like OMD! It's more of a "blood pounding, hope my arrow traps reset in time, must race with orcs to stop them from getting to the rift" than a monotonous "set trap here to kill this orc." 

I'd recommend it to anyone who likes killing stuff, shooting stuff, and just generally wreaking havoc with a swinging ball mace repeatedly killing orcs stuck in the tar pit below it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057849814', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1527427416}
review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Orcs Must Die!
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2011
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] Tower Defense; Action; Strategy; RPG; Casual  
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] A-
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 15-25 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Casual gamers
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
[b]Orcs Must Die![/b] is an amazing take on a tower defense/3rd-person action combo.  Attributes of both genres are blended together perfectly to form an addictive and entertaining little game. This is a game that is very easy to enjoy.

[b]Orcs Must Die![/b]  does a great job taking 3rd-person action elements and blending them with some tower defense to establish a good basis. Then they sprinkle in the lighthearted atmosphere and charming characters with the simplistic-yet-captivating mechanics of the game‚Ä¶ and it shapes up to be a really fun, delightful experience. It‚Äôs definitely the kind of game you can dive right into and get hooked for hours. 

There is a relatively large amount of different towers and abilities in the game when compared to many other games in the tower defense genre. You have plenty of options and can have fun experimenting with different strategies. The level designs also vary enough that they call for different approaches to beat them, so you will have to try out different tactics in order to succeed. And there is a fair amount of different enemies which keeps things fresh as you progress through the game.

There is also a scoring system and leaderboards to add replay value.

This game is just downright fun.

[i][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/murphyslawyercuration#curation]Follow my curation page to see more of my recommendations![/url][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032573928', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1584, 'last_played': 1384395806}
review:
This is a game about killing orcs. The concept is simple enough, but the execution is high quality. 

The game is basically a 3rd person shooter in which you have to defend a magical rift in a castle from a horde of orcs and other monsters that are trying to get through it. If too many monsters make it to the rift you lose. 

One man against a relentless horde of monsters may not seem fair, but you have a lot of advantages. In addition to your trusty crossbow, you'll have a large arsenal of spells, traps, and guardians to help out. Furthermore you earn skulls for completing levels, and you can then spend these skulls on further upgrading your arsenal.

At the start of each level you'll have time to plan and set up your defenses and get a feel for the layout of the area. You'll be told where the orcs are coming from, what route they are likely to take, how many waves there are, and even what monsters you can expect to come knocking down your door.

This is important because, despite the simple premise of "orcs must die," this is really a tactician's game. The first few levels you may be able to survive using just your crossbow, but as the difficulty level increases you will have to diversify your tactics or perish. You'll start facing more orcs, tougher monsters, monsters that come from multiple entrances, and even multiple rifts that must be defended simultaneously. 

I will give one bit of warning that is not mentioned in the game-- if you intend to play on the default (war mage) difficulty level as I did, in order to earn the maximum of 5 skulls per level you not only need to prevent any orcs from reaching the rift, you've also got to do it within the par time. Once you start the initial wave the timer starts, and it doesn't stop even during the "break" periods you sometimes get between waves.

The game is single player only. The graphics and music are adequate, but not AAA quality (this is an indie game, after all, and I don't expect AAA quality here).

There is a storyline which is short, simple, and entertaining. Borderlands fans will recognize the voice of Axton the Commando as the War Mage.

If you like third person shooters or defense-centered gameplay you'll like Orcs Must Die!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008117830', 'num_games_owned': 1135, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1370578306}

review: One of the most fun tower defense games I have ever played! review:
Traps, weapons, minions, towers, and (of course) orcs abound in this third-person tower defence game. The dialogue is surprisingly funny and adds a bit of zest to the already-fun task of creating the world's least orc-friendly castle hallways.

Tip: Use a row of wall blades and tar pits (with some barricades, if necessary) to create a single-file orc slaugherhouse. It's as much fun to build as it is to watch in action.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961124823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1344495600}
review: An alternative perspective on the Tower Defense genre. The objective is to prevent several waves of Orc's and other creatures from reaching your portal. You have an array of Traps you can deploy to help slow & kill the approaching enemies. Any that slip through can be taken out with your choice of Hand held Weapon or Spell. It's so much fun, once I started playing this I couldn't put it down till I completed it.

review: Orcs must die is a action strategy defending game with a tower defense feel. orcs must die brings these kind of games to a whole new generation into games. Orcs must die is addicting yet really fun. Your main goal is to not allow Orcs from getting into a portal. While Defending you build traps, barracades, hire guardes, and much more. While defending you also learn spells at one point in the game when the orcs get harder and stronger. Orcs must die is easily one of my favorite games to play on steam and has a lot of replayability. Orcs must die is probably one of my favorite games of all time, so if you're a fan of these games get it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045753129', 'num_games_owned': 1864, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1502151341}
review:
This is a game that I consistently come back to. 
Orcs Must Die is a 3rd person action tower defense game. You are given a countdown timer to run and place your objects, road blocks, and towers before the doors break down and a horde of Orcs, Goblins, Kobalds, Ogres and more come storming through. It's  up to you a battlemage to use your spells and wepaons to stop them from running into a portal that takes them into your kingdom. 

After a certain level, you unlock Weavers which give your character special bonuses and skill trees. To an extent it's a level-by-level RPG as well. You choose from a backpack of skills and utilities that you have hot keyed to your 1-9 keys. 

I got this game for $3.74 during a special, but I'd recommend it at full price no matter what. It's really worth it.

This game has no multi-player, however Orcs Must Die 2 is multi-player.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964153663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 5676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4421, 'last_played': 1415558928}
review:
Orcs Must Die is the classic tower defense game with the added twist your character being controlled in the first person perspective and equipped to help out when those wall mounted axes isn't quite getting the job done. First person tower defense is nothing new but it is how solid and streamlined Orcs Must Die feels that makes it stand apart from it's competitors.

You are the last of the War Mages, not the brightest, not the strongest, just the last one. And you are all that stands between the peasants of the land living in an idyllic medieval utopia and being introduced to the business end of a rusty axe. To stem the tide of orcs pouring in through magical portals you must progress to a succession of levels killing increasingly larger and more diverse waves of enemies. To help you on this task you have your trusty crossbow and variety of traps and magic.

You start each level by choosing which traps and weapons you want to use, completing missions unlocks more and completing them well allows you to upgrade them. As you slay orcs you earn gold which can then be used to place more traps or to gain various in-mission upgrades. As the levels progress you are introduced to all the classic tower defense enemies, the fast runners, the big slow damage sponges, the attackers that run straight for you, the suicide bombers that can kill your barricades, the fliers that follow completely separate paths from their ground dwelling kin and every other enemy that has been in every other tower defense game to date.

Graphically the games goes for a sort of cartoonish look that works fairly well most of the time and the music does the job equally adequate. The various juvenile one liners being spouted by your character grows tiresome rather quickly however.

There really isn't much to set Orcs Must Die apart from any of the other tower defense games out there, it does everything they do and never strays too far from the path of tried and true. What makes it shine however, is how extremely solid it all is. No action is wasted and every item in the game feels like it serves a purpose. The gameplay is tight and satisfying and although the nature of the genre makes it repeat itself quite a lot as you reach the higher difficulties it manages to maintain a longer lifespan than most tower defense games.

All in all Orcs Must Die is your standard first person tower defense game, extremely well made and a must have for any fans of the genre but not a game that will attract any newcomers or a game that brings anything new to the genre. A tried and true fomular, executed solidly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018559357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1344754800}
review:
Know about tower defense games? Know about fantasy creatures? Know about humour? Know about shooters? You'll see all of them combined in this amazing action-strategy game by Robot Entertainment.

The main objective is that all orcs must die. But in order to complete that objective, you'll need to place traps and learn spells and forge weapons and train an army and... use your head. And your muscles. Because there are many ways to finish a level. If an orc or one of their allies (kobolds, ogres, goblins) lives long enough to reach the rift you're bound to protect, then it's over. Remeber: you're a War Mage, and War Mages need to protect the rifts at all cost.

You can use the environment, hire troops, place traps, engage them with your weapons, do as you please, as long as you get to carry your objective.

Slice them, burn them, skewer them, and launch them - no matter how you get it done, orcs must die!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007759510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1201, 'last_played': 1380807994}
review:
Orcs Must Die! to gra akcji wzbogacona silnymi elementami strategicznymi. Tytu≈Ç zosta≈Ç przygotowany przez Robot Entertainment, czyli firmƒô za≈Ço≈ºonƒÖ przez czƒô≈õƒá by≈Çych pracownik√≥w Ensemble Studios, znanego z serii Age of Empires.
Tytu≈Ç zaprojektowano jako mieszankƒô zrƒôczno≈õci√≥wki i RTS-a. Zadaniem gracza jest odparcie kolejnych fal atakujƒÖcych ork√≥w. Otrzymujemy bezpo≈õredniƒÖ kontrolƒô nad ruchami naszego bohatera (kamera umieszczona zosta≈Ça za jego plecami) i sterujemy nim niczym w tradycyjnej grze akcji. Jednocze≈õnie dostƒôpna jest opcja zastawiania pu≈Çapek oraz przywo≈Çywania innych oddzia≈Ç√≥w.
Akcja Orcs Must Die! toczy siƒô w krainie fantasy, w kt√≥rej najwiƒôkszym zagro≈ºeniem dla ludzko≈õci sƒÖ bandy ork√≥w. By uchroniƒá ≈õwiat przed zalaniem hordami zielonosk√≥rych, Zakon dowodzony przez Wojennych Mag√≥w wzni√≥s≈Ç system fortec odgradzajƒÖcych ojczyznƒô ork√≥w od pozosta≈Çych ziem. Teraz, kolejna inwazja wystawi mury tych twierdz na ciƒô≈ºkƒÖ pr√≥bƒô. Gra siƒô w to bardzo fajnie ale trzeba sobie ja dawkowac.
Grafika 8/10
D≈ºwiƒôk 8/10
Gameplay 8/10 wiƒôcej ni≈º 2 godz lub 3 dziennie odradzam

author: {'steamid': '76561198067139097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1426426076}
review: Orcs Must Die! is a strategy - trap - killing orcs - thingy-majiggy type of game. It's kind of hard to explain. But you start off with a few traps, and you must defend the "Rift" by killing orcs.If orcs start passing through the Rift, a "Rift Point" is taken off. You're weapons at the start of the game are the Crossbow and Sword. As you progress through the game, you unlock a series of traps and weapons to enhance your ability to kill orcs. And there will be more enemies. And harder enemies. So basically, in a way, you're never "stronger" than the orcs. It is a pretty hard game if you try to get the perfect score, so I recommend not aiming for the prefect score just yet. But killing orcs has never been so fun! So the final score is: 9/10 stars. Fun fact: If you have played Borderlands 2, he kinda sounds like Axton.
