review: This was a game i didnt think i would like but in the end i loved it. Its a great game with an odd and funy storyline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026575104', 'num_games_owned': 2064, 'num_reviews': 428, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1326528000}
review:
Hero-comedian, armed with spear, crossbow, spells, lots of traps and three chicks against hordes of (dumb/small/big/fast/explosive/funny) Orcs.

Excellent tower defense style game, except towers and aliens, we now have traps and Orcs. 

And one dim-witted hero.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986693181', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1527444376}
review: Highly responsive (UI, sound, controls) FPS tower defense game with a great art style and direction. Leaderboards incite long-term commitment and replay of already consumed content, and the death animations are hilariously fun. Highly recommended for anyone looking for an easy to pick up and fun short game session.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004579862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1326182400}
review: It is the fucking twenty-first century and games are still being produced that do not allow you to change key bindings in-game. Why? I don't know why, maybe they're just grossly incompetent. But apart from locking you into a potentially shitty setup, it's not a bad game. There are orcs, you must kill them, bonus points if you do it in an amusing fashion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015263467', 'num_games_owned': 682, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1326355200}
review: For the Horde !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970649545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1327737600}
review: Easily the funnest action/tower defense game I've ever played.  Great variety of trap types, weapons and character customization.  Fun fun game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993836379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1326096000}
review: An action tower defense game. Because the player is actively involved in the action of the game, via setting traps and using weapons/spells, this game is actually fun compared to all those boring tower defense flash games and the like. The traps are mostly all useful in some way, allowing for players to be creative with them. Highly recommended to all, because killing orcs is just to much fun in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978018598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1458711198}
review: A trap defense game. Fun fun. Well worth the $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982604215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1332140400}
review: Skvela singlovka :) ,kde se rezete s orcama :) ,ktera ma strategicke a akcni prvky :) U tyhle hry bych nevahal :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991945590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1132, 'last_played': 1362124800}
review: Most fun I got from an indie game yet! OMD is basically a revolutionized tower defense game. You play over the shoulder of an arrogant wizard apprentice who must defend rifts from orcs and other beasties. OMD Has some extreme replayability,. Your first run through the campaign will be to complete the story, then you will want to 5-skull everything, after which you then continue to combine traps like grinders, brimstone, archers, and more to rack up serious combo points. A great value of a game, and who doesn't like their orcs extra crispy?

author: {'steamid': '76561198000116925', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4519, 'last_played': 1331366400}
review: One great over-the-shoulder shooter / tower defence game. Challenging toward the later levels with just the right amount of story and charactation to give context to why you slauther so many orcs. Great death animations with  gobs of gibs and gore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970430575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5682, 'last_played': 1584802482}
review: Macht total Spass und fesselt  - aufs Schlafen vergessen ... heute ist schon Sonntag?

author: {'steamid': '76561197961596531', 'num_games_owned': 320, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1326268800}
review:
Bought in the steam sale, but oh my goodness...it's been a while since I literally started playing a game and could not stop, but killing orcs was so much fun! The story is just enough to push the story forward. The interface is simple and functional, though don't expect to be able to place traps in the middle of first person orc killing. Graphics seemingly inspired by Blizzard and WOW (not a bad thing).

Overall it was worth the original ¬£11.99...but it feels like a steal from the steam sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001896508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 997, 'last_played': 1327305600}
review:
This is just dirty, goddamned fun.  Gotta think, gotta react, and most of all - gotta stay calm.
Definitely worth the lucre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038223705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1509105705}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041246251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1465837811}
review: If you want to have fun while being challenged in a tower defense type of game OMD suits your needs. Keep in mind that this game doesn't has CO-OP. If I had to give it a score 7.5/10 will be my rate.

review:
What a bargain price game. 
Set  traps in your castles to stop the advaning hordes of orcs. The early levels build you up nicely to show you how to use the various orc killing machines at your diposal. Very addictive.
This is how a game should be done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997432631', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1740, 'last_played': 1339657200}
review: This is game is ridiculously fun and addicting.  There is just something so satisfying as figuring out the puzzle of defending the Rift, and building a killing machine to slaughter thousands of orcs.  It's hilarious to watch after you've got a great kill box setup.  This one might event be worth full price! (I got it during the christmas sale)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026674109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1348470000}
review: This is a fun, action-oriented tower defense game with crisp graphics and good action.  I recommend this to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027009681', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1326096000}
review: What a fantastic game.  I really love it.  Fast paced action combined with some strategic thinking, a healthy dose of Bruce "Ash" Cambell style humour.  Devilish traps and some well thought out weapons.  This game has also really has made me laugh a lot.  A very enjoyable and polished game that you can have a quick game of or spend hours playing.  So much fun to be had and lots of replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050046736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4501, 'last_played': 1602352900}
review: A truly awesome tower defense style game. Incredibly addictive and can also be a fun party game, hours and hours of fun. The difficulty level actually means something in this game, I would recommend to anyone 95/100 one of the best games in 2011 in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992533261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1326873600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965038766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1326355200}
review: Tower defense is really growing on me lately and this is essential massacre fun.  The traps require lots of strategy and many games will leave you on edge taking out the few who make it through everything.  Later on you focus on traps on increasing your own power to deal with the invasions yourself!  Nice variety of orcs too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032496819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1327737600}
review: Now i was expecting some great plot twist and turns and great character development. it did not meet me expetations but it did have some good gameplay. For example the part when you kill the orcs is cool. But i did not understand the story line to well nor was there any charater development. Overall i give this game a 7.9.

review: This is the kind of game that you can find yourself losing hours to because it is just so much fun to watch the carnage! From the first voice-over, it doesn't take itself too seriously and rather enjoys the absurd action for what it is.

The only draw back outside of the weapon DLC being a bit overpriced for what it gives you is that the main charecters limited repitor of speech files can get a bit grating after a few levels. review: Delightful, dorky, rambunctious fun. It can get frustrating at times when you lose ‚Äì but naturally that‚Äôs part of the game. I will admit I am disappointed that levels I am doing exceptionally well on seem to be over in a few heartbeats, so that‚Äôs somewhat disappointing. Nonetheless (and particularly when on sale), it‚Äôs worth considering.

review:
One of those games for wich you can easily find a justification to put on your quarrel hat and go out to people to argue that this is the essence of gaming. An amalgam of various ingredients formin' a peculiar blend catering to many - if not everyone - and yet, still challengin'. The game quickly makes you go "Whoah, it's gettin' late... Oh, one more level..." And then you play three more, untill you finally lose. Easily enjoyable entertainment.

The only bad thing I can say about the game is it's length. It's not that bad, but it just leaves you cravin' for more. At least a survival mode would be nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966235253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1472764790}
review:
[b]Orcs Must Die! - Ein Tower-Defense-Erlebnis voller Action, Humor, Waffen, Fallen, Orks und noch mehr Fallen![/b]

Orcs Must Die! erinnert im Grunde an ein Tower-Defense-Spiel. Die TD Maps von Warcraft 3 blitzen auf jeden Fall kurz vor dem inneren Auge wieder auf. Das Spiel bietet eine einzigartige Mischung aus strategischer Planung und intensiver Action und hat mich damals, als ich es entdeckt hatte von Anfang an fasziniert.

Die Grafik von ist charmant und stilvoll, auch 2023 muss sie sich noch nicht wirklich verstecken und ist aus meiner Sicht ganz in Ordnung gealtert. Die Umgebungen sind farbenfroh gestaltet und die Charaktermodelle sind detailliert und gut animiert. Besonders beeindruckend sind die verschiedenen Fallen und Waffen, die man zur Verf√ºgung hat. Jede Falle hat ihr eigenes einzigartiges Design und ihre eigene Animation, was dem Spiel eine zus√§tzliche visuelle Vielfalt verleiht. Insgesamt ist die Grafik solide und passt perfekt zur humorvollen Atmosph√§re des Spiels.

Das Gameplay ist packend und macht s√ºchtig. Das Spiel kombiniert Elemente des Tower-Defense-Genres mit Third-Person-Action. Der Spieler √ºbernimmt die Rolle eines tapferen (und extrem selbstverliebten) Kriegsmagiers, der sein Reich vor Horden von Orks und anderen feindlichen Kreaturen verteidigen muss. Um die Feinde aufzuhalten, kann man Fallen platzieren, wie zum Beispiel Bodenstacheln, Feuerfallen oder Pfeilwerfer. Zus√§tzlich stehen verschiedene Waffen zur Verf√ºgung, darunter ein Bogen, ein Schwert und magischer Krimskrams.

Die Level sind gut gestaltet und bieten eine Vielzahl von strategischen M√∂glichkeiten. Fallen sollten strategisch platziert werden, um den besten Effekt zu erzielen um m√∂glichst alle Feinde zu erwischen. Das Gameplay ist schnell, hektisch und erfordert schnelle Entscheidungen. Das Spiel belohnt geschicktes Timing und taktisches Denken, was den Wiederspielwert erh√∂ht.

Obwohl Orcs Must Die! haupts√§chlich ein Tower-Defense-Spiel ist, verf√ºgt es immerhin √ºber eine unterhaltsame und humorvolle Story, auch wenn es jetzt nicht das gro√üe Kino ist. Wir schl√ºpfen in die Rolle des Kriegsmagiers, der das Land vor dem b√∂sen Zauberer und seiner Armee von Orks retten muss. Die Dialoge zwischen den Charakteren (Dir und deinem ‚ÄûAusbilder‚Äú) sind witzig und voller Charme, und die Geschichte wird durch Zwischensequenzen vorangetrieben, die den Spielverlauf auflockern.

OMD! bietet eine angemessene Herausforderung, die sowohl f√ºr erfahrene Spieler als auch f√ºr Neulinge geeignet ist. Die Schwierigkeit steigt im Verlauf des Spiels an, da neue Feinde und herausforderndere Level freigeschaltet werden. Es gibt auch verschiedene Schwierigkeitsstufen zur Auswahl, die den Spielern erm√∂glichen, das Spiel an ihre eigenen F√§higkeiten anzupassen.

Neben der Hauptkampagne gibt es zus√§tzliche Spielmodi und Herausforderungen, die es zu meistern gilt. Es gibt auch ein Punktesystem, welches den Spielern erlaubt, ihre F√§higkeiten und Ausr√ºstung zu verbessern, um noch effektiver gegen die Feinde zu k√§mpfen. Der Wiederspielwert wird durch die M√∂glichkeit, verschiedene Fallen und Waffen zu kombinieren, weiter erh√∂ht, um neue Strategien auszuprobieren. Klar, irgendwann ist die Luft raus, aber f√ºr 20+ Stunden kann man hier sehr gut unterhalten werden!

Fazit: OMD! ist ein herausragendes Tower-Defense-Spiel, das sowohl mit seinem Gameplay als auch mit seinem charmanten Stil begeistert. Die Kombination aus strategischer Planung und schneller Action sorgt f√ºr eine spannende und unterhaltsame Spielerfahrung. Die humorvolle Story und die vielf√§ltigen Charaktere tragen zur Gesamtatmosph√§re des Spiels bei. Orcs Must Die! ist ein Muss f√ºr Fans des Tower-Defense-Genres, leider gibt es im ersten Teil noch kein Coop. Wer also diese Art von Spiel sucht um es mit Freunden zu spielen, der sollte einen Blick auf die Nachfolger werfen!

Von mir eine 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197964850344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review: Orcs Must Die! is an orc racism simulation. You play as a white guy, the apprentice of another white guy, and spend literally the entire game killing orcs. That's super racist! I mean, it's not like it's sort of racist or anything like that. The name of the game is "Orcs Must Die!" It's not "Orcs Must Die if Convicted of a Capital Crime" or "Orcs Must Die if it is Necessary to Employ Lethal Force in the Course of Self Defense" or "Orcs Must Die if they are Soldiers in a Justly Fought War" or anything like that. Replace "Orcs" with any other race in the title and you'd have a lawsuit on your hands! The only reason this game isn't banned in Germany is because nobody cares about orcs. I give this game 13 out of 16 race riots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029172370', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2031, 'last_played': 1347692400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027265213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1371163624}
review: Proactive tower defense. That's the best way I can describe this game. Lay out your traps and minions along the path to the goal, let loose the dogs of war, and out pours the horde of orcs, goblins and assorted ghoulies in droves to rush into slicing, searing, piercing and so many more ways to meet the reaper. But the traps alone won't cut it, oh no. Taking up blade, crossbow and sundry magical widgets steps our  protagonist, a cocky, arrogant, sneering wiseass with an ego the size of Cleveland, delivering orcish genocide with a level of 'Lovable Bastard' charm not seen since Ash Williams (Evil Dead guy), or Booster Gold. I admit, I haven't beaten it yet, it gets hard rather quickly on any setting but easy, but I'm having fun in the chances here and there I get to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971599442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review: Surprisingly fun! Addictive tower defence gameplay with the added effect of being a defending unit yourself. Lots of fun trap combinations to try out, plenty of Orcs to kill, and some downright sinister level designs (though only a few). Highly recommend for short burst play!

review: Tr√®s bien foutu, dr√¥le, fr√©n√©tique (surtout pour un Tower Defense), Orcs Must Die est excellent. Seul dommage : pas de mode "endless" sur une map sp√©cifique :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197965450629', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1356854400}
review:
A third person tower defense game based around traps and killing orcs. Addictive and very fun gameplay. Has a large variety of levels offering many fun challenges. Nightmare mode offers a little more of a challenge as you need to know exactly how you want to set up your traps and make sure you don't do any misplacements. I was really addicted to this game when it first came out, and bought Orcs Must Die 2 to play with my brother. 

Pros:
+ A large selection of fun traps you can use to maximise killing efficiency
+ A good selection of levels to play 
+ Addictive, fast-paced gameplay where you have to use your hero to his maximum potential alongside the traps.

Cons:
- I tend not to like it when games offer dlc for extra cash, however the game of year edition is quite cheap when on sale, do it doesn't matter quite so much anymore.

My Score: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983310928', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1326096000}
review: Like cocky heroes who's vast array of weapons include their razor sharp wit and one-liners? Like building death traps in the bowels of dungeons? Like having a horde of orcs charge you only to fall dead at your feet? Then definitely check out Orcs Must Die! It's a fast and furious action game that also has you thinking strategy as you set your traps and slay oncoming swarms of orcs after your slice of the pie!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995104251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1443583907}
review: The game can easily be summed up by its title. Orcs Must Die is about making a large amount of orcs into a large amount of dead orcs (and orc pieces). Of course, there's more to it than simply "Use crossbow on orc" as there are a number of fiendish traps, magic, and AI guardians that you can employ, making it something akin to a tower-defence game. There's more focus on action, though, as you're encouraged to jump in and do your part in causing a bit of death and dismemberment of your own. On top of it all is a somewhat basic story, though there is so much character and humor packed in that it still seems fresh and entertaining. To call the game "mindless fun" would be a little misleading as there is some strategy involved in trap placement and personal upgrades, but the real fun lies in watching a group of clueless orcs wandering towards a corridor full of all manner of blades and spikes and being reduced to "orc salsa" while you giggle softly to yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961402664', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1757, 'last_played': 1326787200}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995269772', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review:
Ever played Trapt (PS2, 2005/6)? It's kinda like that except without as much charm, difficulty, atmosphere, synergy or interesting narrative.
This game is another one of those innovative third-person shooter meets tower defence games that definitely have not been cropping up by the dozen lately, but don't let that out of the box thinking put you off of this title. As harsh as my opening line might have been, this isn't really a bad game. (Certain) Traps are interesting, the tone of the game is quite tongue-in-cheek and it's very easy to lose a lot of time while playing.
Strangely this game puts more emphasis on the actual fighting yourself rather than tower defence mechanisms. Traps are expensive and nearly always fire off too early, catching only the first thing in range and letting the horde behind which through.
Still, a fun little arcade title. Worth it in a sale.

review: Orcs must die! ist der absolute Oberknaller. Wer auf Tower Defense bock hat, aber auch gern Shooter spielt, der ist hier an der richtigen Stelle. Hierbei handelt es sich aus einem Tower Defense Spiel mit Rollenspielelementen. Die Level sind unterschiedlich schwer. An einigen bei√üt man sich gut die Z√§hne aus, an anderen eben nicht. Orcs must die! kommt in 3 Schwierigkeitsstufen daher und ist meiner Meinung nach auf der mittleren Stufe sowohl f√ºr Fortgeschrittene, als auch f√ºr Anf√§nger gut spielbar.

review: Don't let the fact that this is an indie tower defense game put you off. OMD! is an example of superb craftsmanship, a fast-paced, strategic, and genuinely funny game that also happens to look and sound exceptionally well. The artistic direction is smooth, coloful, and appropriately stylized, and the sound and music combine to create an immersive experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990833154', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1828, 'last_played': 1324713600}
review:
A FPS tower defense that's actually fun to play. Unlike some of it's predecessors... *cough* Sanctum *cough*.

The developers knew what their strengths were and focused on them. The result is a game that's enjoyable for what it is, without losing its way trying to be something it isn't.

While it's relatively short - it'll only take a couple days to "beat" - there's plenty of replayability if you want to perfect your strategies or just enjoy shooting Orcs in the face.

Even though I'd never pay $60 for a game like this, it's hard to go wrong with an MSRP of $15.

Try the demo, you'll know right away if this game is for you.

review: Orcs Must Die! is a deceptively simply and utterly engrossing tower-defense/third-person shooter/brawler. The strategy and on-the-fly thinking is superb; the sense of humor is fantastic; and the overall feel and atmosphere is very well done. Just buy the game and kill some orcs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009740815', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1328774400}
review: This game is great.  I love tower defense, classic swords and magic rpg gameplay, and using my head to generate interesting and effective strategies for dealing with my enemies.  Want to focus on your crossbow?  Go right ahead; make some slowing or moving traps and shoot away.  Want to watch them fry?  Make a self repeating gauntlet of fire traps.  Good stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004299096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2025, 'last_played': 1353744000}
review: Best 'tower' defence game I've played. Great visual style, humorous and challenging. It helps that you're part of the action at all times and feel very powerful.... however, you can't be everywhere at once and this game doesn't hesitate to stretch you. Even after you've completed the campaign it's still great trying out new tactics on earlier levels with all the new traps you've unlocked as every completed level gives you something new to play with!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980617077', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1343890800}
review:
Orcs Must Die is one of the best Tower Defense games, I've played, to date. Being a huge fan of MOBA (ARTS) & Tower Defense games; I looked at Orcs Must Die with some glittering hope. The combat looked good, the adventure seemed fun, and everything seemed to work together.....

Boy was I dissapointed when I learned that I bought Dungeon Defenders first. Not that Dungeon Defenders was bad, or even not on par with this game; they're just two different experiences. DD is a multi-player TD game designed to challenge you in a completely different fashion. 

On the other hand, Orcs Must Die is a single player game challenging you to work within game mechanics and limitations of resources to build the best killling machine you can. It does this with ease for that matter. 

The combat is viceral, allowing you to "feel" every kill. The sword based combat could have been more refined, but each time a trap goes off, or you hit someone, you know you did and you just want that action to happen more

author: {'steamid': '76561197970799950', 'num_games_owned': 1069, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1962, 'last_played': 1355299200}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014161701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1733, 'last_played': 1491341478}
review: Do you like killing orcs? what about gnolls, ogres and kobolds? what about using traps to cut them, pinch, burn, slice, throw, and crush them, all that sprinkled with some magic spells; kill orcs, be creative doing it, have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017851315', 'num_games_owned': 14395, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15604, 'last_played': 1561528188}
review: Orcs Must Die! is an outstanding, well done Indie game with excellent, quick and ongoing support in the Steam forums by Robot Entertainment. This game can be played several different ways, so there is great replayability. Examples: 1) You can play just to complete the 24 War Mage mode levels followed by the 24 Nightmare mode levels, followed by 5 levels more for each if you own the DLC, 2) You can playthrough to "5 skull" all the levels, and 3)You can playthrough trying to achieve higher or top scores by using different combinations of traps. You MUST, however, make sure you have at least a dual core processor as this game heavily uses the second core for its animations. I highly recommend this game!

There  are plenty of Tower Defense / Shooter types out there, but this is the most satisfying one yet.

review: For me, more outright fun than [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/91600/]Sanctum[/url] or [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/65800/]Dungeon Defenders[/url]. Dungeon Defenders suffers from a Sisyphean feeling of level and item grinding common to MMO's, and Sanctum feels too prescriptive in what approach you need to take to win like more traditional tower defense games. Orcs Must Die avoids this rewarding you with a new toy on each level, and only requiring grinding to beat highscores. Gaining access to new combinations, and highscore tracking, keeps replaying earlier levels interesting.

review:
A great combination of strategy and real time FPS. Your maze making, and trap combinations will either save your bacon, or doom you to difficult last second battles against hoards of Orcs and other nasties. The balance is great, the visuals fresh and smooth, and there‚Äôs more of a story than it first seems, (Cocky apprentice takes over for crotchety old wizard. How many times have we seen that right?) with actual character development.
This is "must buy" in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009567660', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1326009600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052491613', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1882, 'last_played': 1341730800}
review:
Preface: Keep in mind that I am going to review this game... without the DLCs. They're not bad. It's just that I haven't bought them... yet. Even though I've had Orcs Must Die for a while.

 The story of the game is about a young-adult, sarcastic, nameless Warmage who's defending rifts in dungeons, which is gateways to the Warmages' medieval world, against waves of Orcs.
 I do not wish to spoil any quotes or scenes from the game, because that would just ruin everything.

 The gameplay is Tower-Defence... but not in a traditional way with a birds-eye-view. You play as the Warmage in 3rd person, like Gears of War(except, you can't take cover).
 You run around in the dungeon, place traps and choose which weapon and spell you are going to choose for the wave.
 At the end of each wave, you are presented with a high-score. Depending on how well you played, you will earn orc-skulls to level up your traps/magics/weapons.
 The Warmage doesn't Level-up. This game is more based on tactics, than brute strength. Unlike Dungeon Defenders, which came out almost in the same time-frame.

 The music in the game is medieval but with a crazy tone to it. I like it.
 Sometimes when the Warmage kills an Orc, The Warmage makes a sarcastic/hilarious statement. I can't give away what he says. Like I said, it would just ruin the fun.
 It is important that you do not mute the Warmages voice. Because the story presents itself on flashbacks and what the Warmage says during gameplay.

 It's a Short-and-Sweet game with a special twist to the story and the gameplay.
 Orcs Must die! gets an ''above-great'' 9/10. I highly recommend this game.

[Review in a nutshell]
This hilarious game, with green Warhammer 40k orcs, is a ''must have for anyone who loves Tactical-Tower-Defence games''.

review: Simple, yet incredibly fun.  You start with just a few tools for defence and unlock more as you  move through the levels.  Tools range from traps that slow down enemies to those that deal direct damage and spells/weapons that allow your character to hurt or affect enemies himself.  Levels start small and grow in size considerably as you play, and many feature additional traps or guardians that aid you in defeating the coming swarms.  The game's a must-play for anyone interesting in the tower defence styled genre.

review: Variety is what keeps this third-person tower defense game going. With the myriad scenarios and cartoonishly gruesome methods of dispatching orcs at your fingertips, it's hard to put down. My only gripe with Orcs Must Die! is that there doesn't appear to be any sort of multiplayer mode or level editor, things that would vastly increase the game's replayability. However, despite being a single player game it's very entertaining. Even after you beat it the surprisingly deep combo/scoring system will keep you coming back for more as you try to inch your way up the leaderboards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972032622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2531, 'last_played': 1334559600}
review: Orcs Must Die is easily my favorite downloadable title for 2011. Why? Because it takes classic tower defense and makes something new, innovative, and fun out of it. The game blends third person action with tower defense strategy creating a very unique experience. The game is very well designed on that regard, meaning that it is impossible to beat a level using only traps or only spells (you must use both). You play as a War Mage able to use spells and weapons to stop the Orcs from entering the Rift. You also have the ability to lay traps throughout the environment. Each trap is uniquely designed and offers different gameplay elements. Some examples of traps are tar traps to slow enemies, swinging maces, spike traps, arrow wall traps, etc. You play a good amount of levels progressing through a very simple but entertaining storyline. Overall, Orcs Must Die offers a very new and unique experience for Tower Defense fans. To put it simply, if you like tower defense, GET THIS GAME!

review:
A very fast-paced tower-defence/3rd-person-shooter game.  Lots of fun and a strong sense of achievement.  The strategy of trap-placement and variety exercises the mind, while the continual stream of foes exercises the trigger-finger.  

Just forget about the plot and characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997770548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1324972800}
review:
Surprisingly fun and well put together tower defense game. In a similar fashion to Sanctum, you place traps in the path of your enemies to protect the gate from every wave of increasingly stronger Orcs. You can also use multiple spells and weapons at your disposal to help even the odds. Managed to get 15 hours on my first play through so lots of good gameplay there for the price!

TL;DR: Game is good n' shit. Go buy it.

review:
Kill the Orcs, slay the Orcs, destroy the Orcs

You returned late home that night
Evidence all around you from the flight
You see your family's blood spilled on the ground
There's no trace of the Orcs to be found

Take the broadsword in your hand
Follow the Orcs to their camp
You will have vengeance in blood

With their heads they will pay the price
Spill blood
On their trail we hunt them tirelessly
Spill blood
Bloodshed eases their loss
Spill their blood

Their decapitation leads to the cessation
Of the sadness, of the woe

Spill the blood

review: Saying that this game is just slightly addictive would be completely unjust. If you're a fan of tower defense and hack and slash games then this game combines the best of both worlds. Plus this game has tons of load out options for each level, requiring your choices to be well thought out depending on the layout of each level. The game doesn't just entertain you with great gameplay but also with a quirky sense of humor. I definitely recommend this title be bought and played!

review: Fast-paced and hilarious combination of tower defense and third-person slaughter. Lots of great humor, lots of brutal ways to murder orcs to pieces, fun and challenging and all around a great game, held back only by the lack of some form of multiplayer. Definitely a must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985175846', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1495432642}
review: The fact that, with all the games I could be playing at this point, I've been going back to this one repeatedly to finish a new level, says a decent amount about it alone.  I love classic Tower Defense style games, which this most resembles, and it does those parts well.  Even if it was just setting the traps and watching the Orcs gib, that would probably be enough, but the FPS aspects (with which you can win without setting a trap at all on some levels) and are also well done and fun to use or (as I tend to do) supplement your traps by stunning orcs in range.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030025164', 'num_games_owned': 1788, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2170, 'last_played': 1353225600}
review: A ridiculously fun game that combines all the best aspects of FPS games and tower defense games into a  comedically sleek and satisfying whole.  Barely has any flaws worth mentioning and surprisingly does just about everything right that you could ask for, breathing new life into a ton of stale Tolkien and D&D-derived cliches.  Even if you can only buy one game this year, it should be this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962638465', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1330070400}
review:
Paid like $4 for this game during a sale but would pay $15 without blinking... They're onto a new genre of game here, its the first of its kind and the best "tower defense'ish" type game I've ever played. It'll suck 20-30 hours out of you easily and you still won't have it complete. You can also compete against friends with the game for high scores.

Highly recommend! Awesome game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982720220', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review: I never really enjoyed playing a tower defense game, until I played Orcs Must Die! Orcs Must Die! is a third person shooter perspective of the tower defense genre, but the time to complete each wave feels faster than your typical tower defense, like Defense Grid, depending on how well you do. Also, Instead of building towers your building traps (upgradable) against waves of enemies and on top of the traps you build your also given weapons (upgradable) to fend off individual enemy types.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008151793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1342594800}
review:
This or Dungeon Defenders or Monday Night Combat or... well, approach the notion with this question: do I have ANY friends at all? If the echoing response happens to be a sheepish "...no..." then call Orcs Must Die your newest and only bud.

Orcs Must Die shares more in common with the likes of Lock's Quest than any of the previously mentioned seige-style titles. You, as the Apprentice, are the sole line of defense for a series of interdimensional whatsits. Good, hands-on slaughter earns bonuses; creative execution of traps earn you multipliers. This set up should dispell for you where the focus of Orcs Must Die sits: action first, clever second.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988055697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1372876887}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960283937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2391, 'last_played': 1333609200}
review:
The sleeper hit of 2011.
As we all know (and the title suggests), Orcs must die.
And to do so, they run into traps. Get zapped. Catapulted. Perforated. Burned. Stomped. Slashed. Shot. Cut. Frozen.
It's just one of the most fun games there are out there.

review:
Crazy fun action tower defense style game, you'l be hooked within one level.  Funny and enjoyable.

It's a healthy blend of Shooter with Tower Defense, allowing you to build traps on the walls, ceilings, and floors to create unique kill zones.  But also letting you equip spells and weapons to fight off the Orcs that way if you'd like.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979742479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2566, 'last_played': 1595277949}
review: The most fun i've had playing a game in ages. Great for pick-up-and-play after a long day by just chunking orcs to bits, but the nightmare mode and leaderboard rankings actually require a lot of strategy and forethought. Have played it for countless hours (well, ok... 33 in two weeks) and have gotten 5 skulls on every level on NIGHTMARE... and that this is from a guy who can't even be bothered togo back and finish the last level in MGS4 because it would require fiddling around behind the TV to plug it in which should tell you all about how addictive and enjoyable it is.

review: This is easily one of the most intelligent (and yet, one of the most stupid) tower defense games I've ever played.  It lures you in with a gentle learning curve, then smashes your face through the curve before discarding your limp form into a pool of acid.  Via a floor catapult.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984133129', 'num_games_owned': 877, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1651738559}
review:
OMD plays a little like Sanctum, but with a greater focus on personal power and less on mazing. The engine also has several physics based traps enabling you to reposition the creeps, enabling fun things like flinging orcs back to the beginning of your kill corridor or tossing them up to the top of a wall covered in instruments death to tumble back down it in bloody chunks. The only bad thing I can really say about this game is that there's no co-op.

Highly reccommended if you even have only a passing interest in TD games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962877482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1706, 'last_played': 1343977200}
review: The name of the game is defend teleportation rifts from onslaughts of hundreds of orcs with hilarious lines. You can do this with several weapons, spells and strategically placed traps, all of which are unlocked one by one for completing each of 24 different levels. While the game probably won't keep you glued for hours at a time due to its repetitive nature, it's at least 8 hours in length or more if you hope to achieve 5 stars (or skulls in this case) on every map to get the most out of your trap upgrades. I for one love traps and defensive structures in games, so needless to say, it got all the more amusing watching my traps grow to an un-escapeable nature by the last few waves of growing orc numbers and other varying monster types. It's great casual fun with a nice challenge and I reccomend it to anyone, as long as you can get past the fact that the options menu is quite limited. Oh, and no re-bindable keys. For shame!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962016682', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1403484435}
review:
This game is AWESOME. Extremely well-polished singleplayer experience full of humor and fun.

The art, the audio, the gameplay, it's all quite solid and well-executed. The maps are significantly varied in layout (though not so much in art style) and all leave room for different strategies and play styles. The game really starts to open up as you unlock more abilities as you progress through the campaign.

I would highly recommend this game if you enjoy singleplayer, action games, and/or tower defense games. There are some pretty crazy sales for it, but honestly I would still feel like I've gotten my money's worth at full price.

The DLC is definitely worth buying if it's on sale, but maybe hold off if it's full price and you haven't fallen in love with the game yet.

review:
Gioco con regole semplici ma molto divertente, che richiede un certo impegno strategico per riuscire ad evitare che le orde fameliche di orchi riescano a raggiungere il nostro mondo attraverso una breccia, tra la nostra e la loro dimensione.
Il gioco √® della tipologia Tower Defence ma con varianti al gameplay rispetto a quello tradizione, √® interamente in 3D con visuale in terza persona alla Max Payne per intenderci. Nel gioco impersoniamo un mago-guerriero che ha il compito di difendere le brecce uccidendo tutti gli orchi che tentato di attraversarle. L'arma principale √® una balestra per il combattimento a distanza, ma dispone anche di una grossa spada per il corpo a corpo, in oltre essendo un mago pu√≤ lanciare svariati incantesimi e con essi piazzare trappole su muri, soffitti e pavimenti, succhiare la vita a gli orchi per curare se stesso, evocare barili di esplosivo da far esplodere a comando o lanciare su gruppi di orchi ampolle piene di acido corrosivo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982074343', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 2922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2922, 'last_played': 1347433200}
review: The nearly simultaneous release of this game and Dungeon Defenders has led to inevitable comparisons between the two games, and rightly so. Both games are Tower Defense games played on a personal level rather than a top down perspective. Both have the player control a character that can run the course of maps, place a number of defenses and traps, use different abilities and go toe to toe with the advancing mobs with melee and ranged weapons. The difference comes in the approach. Dungeon Defenders distributes the different abilities among different classes making the game virtually unplayable in single player especially if you‚Äôre playing a support class. Orcs Must Die has no multiplayer but gives all the abilities to one character with new abilities with each successful mission. Orcs Must Die also feels much more action oriented. If you‚Äôre looking for a good tower defense game that you can play by yourself, look no further than this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013880325', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3705, 'last_played': 1701018331}
review:
Orcs Must Die is like Pulp Fiction--a cult classic. Longtime supporters like me love Orcs Must Die for its seamless combination of tower defense and third person action. In 2011, Robot Entertainment was one of the first studios to attempt this genre blend. In the decade-plus since, I have not found a game that does a better job (besides the other installments in this series; a close second are the Sanctum games). What makes Orcs Must Die standout are its varied maps, traps, and mobs. As soon as you think you've found the ultimate setup, a new map with different enemies and unlocks forces you back to the drawing board.

I'm nearing my second complete playthrough on both warmage and nightmare difficulties. This game is flat-out awesome. Both DLCs are worthwhile too. The only thing it lacks compared to OMD2 is multiplayer, but as an entry into the series and this genre blend, Orcs Must Die simply cannot be beat. It's a classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993547526', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1705, 'last_played': 1328169600}
review: This game is quite unique perhaps on the PC because whilst it is a tower defence game, this is a tower defence game built on pure action. It is a fast, fluid third person game with a high frame rate and a frenetic pace that never lets up. The controls are responsive and easy to get used to, and the gameplay is as tactically deep as it is fast and furious. Add to that just a lot of great humour that is expressed in the hero's opening lines to each level and this is definitely one of the best indie action games of recent years.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990770204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1356854400}
review:
Digo yo, para mi, este juego, es el hermano bravo, sanguinario y violento de Plantas vs. Zombies.
Osea, me parece BRILLANTE la idea de pensar en pasar los niveles, en que podes planear todo antes de que vengan los orcos, encima la cantidad de niveles que hay (encima rejugarlo en pesadilla, aunque le quita la buena jugabilidad, ya que es mas estresante y no te da el buen tiempo para preparar todo ya), de trampas, poderes... is amazing.
Los graficos son puro de caricaturas, encima muy bien optimizado (eso creo, tengo dos fierros q todo lo veo optimizado ._. ) y muy simpatico todo. Hasta la banda sonora que es SENSACIONAL!!! no me esperaba que tuviera ese tipo de musica clasica con mezcla de rock o metal, precioso.
Despues otro punto es que... comprarlo a 3.74 dolares es lo mejor que hay para darle horas y horas de vicio, cuesta aburrirse y mas comprar los dlcs, que te agregan un par de trampas y poderes y niveles (con 2 nuevos enemigos).
y las trampas podes mejorarlas, para que sean...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970476640', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1334818800}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a very fun game - it focuses on one core concept (killing orcs) and sets everything up around that. A mixture of Tower Defence and 3rd person action, you lay traps to slow down, maim, and kill orcs to prevent them from getting to your base. You have to get your hands dirty, though, as you won't be able to kill everything in the early waves with traps alone.

I haven't had so much fun with a game in a long time!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979305072', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1336633200}
review:
Picked this up at 75% off for the steam achievement for the holidays, but quickly ended up spending an hour in it. And then another... and another. The game is just really clean and does what it sets out to do really well. This puts a ton of creativity back into the bland 'tower defense' style genre and plays to different strengths. If you're confident with a crossbow or a sword, you can dump money and items into improving that. If your trap strategy is top notch, dump all your money into a maze of tricks and traps designed to do only one thing; Kill. All. The Orcs.

Would have paid full price if I knew what I was getting into. It's got great gameplay, a smooth engine, just the right dash of humor and a lot of things to kill in a bunch of different ways. And if you ever find yourself with nothing to do, scratch your chin at the leaderboards and fine tune your strategy to not only survive the orcs - but kill them efficiently and brutally.

Mainly comedy and random orc genocide all in one game.

review:
I'm loving all these games that take the defense genre and make it a bit more interesting. So much so that I can't even call the category "tower defense" any more.

Orcs Mus Die is a third-person shooter defense game. You lay traps for the orcs, then once they start coming, you use your sword and crossbow to kill the ones that get past the traps. Solid conttrols, good gameplay, quirky humor and an interesting spin on the genre.

review: Orcs Must Die is a decent 3rd person perspective tower defence game. You try and stop the attacking Orcs from reaching the portal, you have assorted weapons and traps at your disposal and new ones unlock as you progress through the levels. I enjoyed it for the short time i've played it, but apart from the new perspective on Tower Defence games, it offers nothing ground-breaking in terms of gameplay. A neat idea that for some unfathomable reason doesn't translate as well as it should, still worth a try though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968235953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1995, 'last_played': 1417527532}
review:
There is:
-Deadly Orcs
-Some really deadly Orcs
-Orc friends to are trying to kill you
-Lots of killing
-Lots of traps for said killing
-Lots of ways to lay said traps
-Lots of options for said ways
And lastly,
-One crazy witch

Need I say more? 
GET IT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995327248', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1339743600}
review:
I have to say that when i first heard of this title i thought it didnt sound much fun. but i have to say there is a great deal of joy when you just basically curbstomp some orcs with magic. its VERY polished and pleasing to look at. the sound effects and music are as if midevil musicians decided to play some form of hiphop. its definitly a game that is hard to put down. basically it just feels rewarding and the things you use to kill them vary widely, and they all have a nice look to them that fits well in its suroundings. 

though i am cheap i say wait for a sale. but if you really REALLY like tower defense games and a bit more polished version and a little bit more thrilling version of dungeon defenders, this is a title for you. 

as much as i would like there to be a multiplayer, it shows that they spent their time focusing on the game in place of a split focus of how to make multiplayer work and how to make the game look nice and better yet FEEL nice. it just has a great feel!

review: It's a fast paced Dungeon Defenders with a little Sanctum mixed in. Reminds me of Dungeon Keepers (a really old game) where you get to make your own dungeons and set up traps. This has that same feel to it as you're essentially laying traps (some straight forward, others are interesting) and shooting/attacking the baddies before they make it to the end of the level. It's actually quite fun and I'd highly suggest to buy it even if you've already played DD and/or Sanctum a bunch. =3

author: {'steamid': '76561197968278647', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1343545200}
review: A very fun game that has the best sense of humor since Portal! I first thought OMD! was a low-quality indie game, but it is actually a fantastically made, very well-presented title! The graphics and art style are gorgeous, the animations are flowing, the controls are super smooth, and the traps and sound effects are very impactful (pun intended). Basically, the art, sound, and controls outdo many AAA titles! Plus the humor, wow, this game is truly hilarious. I laughed so many times at the quirky humor. Although the defense aspect isn't super strategic and does rely on trial and error, it is very fun nevertheless. Plus, I love that I can employ my quick reflexes and twitch gaming skills to headshot Orcs left and right. Unlike other defense games where you often indirectly fight, there's always something to set up, shoot, or blow up. Overall, OMD! is nonstop carnage, mayhem, and hilarity! A true gem for fans of defense games, third-person action, and quality humor!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011749389', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1351407600}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983269703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2337, 'last_played': 1382058295}
review: Get it.  Seriously.  Although I like tower defense, I was on the fence about games that put you at the front of the action.  This one does more than convince me of this take on the genre - it keeps me coming back for more, time and again.  It's a simple game on the surface, offering an incredible amount of depth and replayability.  The story, though rather stark, is carried by a hilarious, well-acted lead (think a somewhat less intelligent Ash meets a less annoying and offensive Duke) and I genuinely wanted to know more about the world.  This is certainly a franchise I hope Robot Entertainment expands on in the future.  Go get it now and duke it out with me on the leaderboards!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993388546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1324540800}
review:
Hello, Gamers.

Look at your Steam Library, now back to mine, now back at your Library, now back to mine. Sadly, yours isn't mine.

Why? Because if you stopped for a moment with all of your other games, you could be bisecting, stabbing, flaming and otherwise giving hordes of Orcs a very bad day, all while having an absolute blast of a time.

Okay, I'm horrible at copying Old Spice commercials... Orcs Must Die! is a game that describes itself right in its title, there's you, there's the Orcs, the latter must die. The fun is in how you have them die. The game is blindingly simple, the "plot" is idiotically brilliant, and it's fun all around.

Kind of like Warhammer Fantasy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008693173', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1342076400}
review:
An excellent single player indie game.

Has 3 game modes - warmage, nightmare and high scoring. Played within that order. Once you have completed the game on nightmare you can aim for the highscore tables, but high scores are achieved by getting combo kills, so require entirely different tactics. 

The traps are interesting, there are a handful that you will never use and others you will use in some levels. The swinging mace is one of the most deadly traps you can use.

2 DLCs - Lost adventures adds 5 maps, 1 is a map already in the game played in reverse (a very unique map and a very entertaining map, playing in reverse does make it harder). They also added a handful of new monsters, like the frost bat. Well worth getting. 
              - the second DLC is not as worth while, contains a few new traps and weapons. Accessable from the start of the game as well, which makes the first few levels extremely easy if used. 

However, both DLCs are worthing picking up when on offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970819060', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1326182400}
review:
A variation of tower defense where you have to place traps to defend cores from invading monsters. While there's lots of toys (with new ones being thrown at you every level), some get left in the dust/unused (boom barrel, steam trap), while others get progressively more broken as the game goes on (archers, paladins, decoys). My biggest complaint is it's missing the stat tracking most tower defenses have to help you maximize your gold usage,  leaving you to guesswork if your traps are laid out properly. The maps are uniquely constructed, often requiring specific tactics to clear effectively, making each map tense and engaging. About a third of your arsenal are weapons for your character which keeps you in the action most of the time, unlike most games in this genre.

With 24 maps you're looking at a sizable tower defense game with plenty of crossbow-twitching, fireball-slinging, ice-shattering orc carnage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033572613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 2338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2338, 'last_played': 1323763200}
review:
Orcs Must Die's formula is simple, but what little it does it does very, very well and is a riot to play. The traps are a ton of fun to use and trap deaths look fantastic and satisfying. The later additions of simplistic spell trees and spells round the game up nicely and killing orcs was never this much fun xD.
If you get into the competitive nature of the game you'll find out how surprisingly deep it is as customizing your character and traps and selecting the 'right' ones can greatly impact your final stage score and the speed at which you move and place your traps can mean all the difference.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197977171864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1330329600}
review:
This hate-speech-disguised-as-tower-defense is just another example of anti-orc racism to add to the ever-growing pile. The orcs as portrayed in-game are dull and dimwitted creatures who walk straight into spike pits right after seeing their fellows impaled before their very eyes, a disgustingly prejudiced parody of these noble souls. Additionally, you play a single human against waves of orcs, a design decision that encourages speciesist imperialism in a decidedly unsubtle way.

But I'm sure you'll agree the gameplay's a lot of fun, right Adolf?

review: Pretty fun game. It's a tower defense game, but it's also a 3rd person action game. I do not like regular tower defense games, as they are all about setting up a defense and then waiting for the wave to end. In this one, you get to pick various weapons to fight off the enemies, while setting traps and defenses. Definitely give this game a try, and buy it if it goes on sale again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010201914', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1342940400}
review: Fun, quirky tower defense game that is simple to pick up, and allows you to defend your castle the way you want to. With all of the DLC(new weapons/traps), you are given a wide array of weapons and traps to set up to help you kill invading orcs. Just take a look around your map, learn the path the orcs are going to be taking to get to your Rift(the "main base" you're trying to protect, if you will), pick your arsenal for the map, and let it begin! Each Rift will allow only a certain number of orcs to be let through, but let any more than the maximum run through it and it's game over. Campaign lasts a good 7-11 hours depending on how fast you play and how good you become at the game, and then the rest is just playing the game because it is a fun way to pass the time. Recommended for those who enjoy strategical games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010553208', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1666711792}
review:
The tower defense genre has always been evolving over the years and seeing FPS games now entering this arena made me nervous at first , but after letting sanctum slip by I thought I would try this instead and......WOW!
Frantic gameplay that really makes you use the noggin about what types of traps should go where and how to lure the orcs into them.
Great level design and colorful crisp graphics.
The arrogant none-too-bright d-bag protagonist made me laugh out loud at times and the story was cute.
For the  $5 I spent (including all the DLC) I'd say I got one hell of a deal here , considering I would have paid full price had I known just how much fun this is.
If I had to rate it : 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197963562298', 'num_games_owned': 3346, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 884, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is an excellent blend of tower defense and third person shooter. You're cast into the role of a "War Mage", caught amidst turmoil from a beastly invasion. Poised with the duty to defend humanity, you must now prevent the orcs from entering the rifts that bind your world to theirs.

OMD is a joyous, albeit mostly mindless affair. It offers the delightful satisfaction of mowing down hordes of enemies and making you feel like an empowered hero (as most games should). There's room for strategizing, but not so much as to make the experience trying.

With over two dozen traps, variety is in no short supply. Players are encouraged to adapt to each map and pick traps that will maximize your deadliness. However, I found myself defaulting to the same half dozen traps each round, indicating that balance might be a slight issue.

Nonetheless, OMD is overwhelmingly enjoyable. For $15, it's a great buy, offering hours of fun. For under $5, it's a must have!

Grade: B+

author: {'steamid': '76561197963902299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
A very fun defense romp. It feels a little more "puzzley" than Sanctum or Dungeon defenders, as opposed to hectic and shootery. Very well-crafted, and quite funny to boot. It's very hard to pull off an arrogant, irreverent, wise-cracking protagonist who doesn't just come across as obnoxious; but in this case, I think they did a great job.

UPDATE: I found this game much more fun than the sequel, and if you're only going to play one of them, I recommend this one.

review: It's Lord of the Rings meets Sanctum in this brilliant action/tower defense game. From the moment you lay your first trap you will be drawn in by the distinctive characters. As the title implies there is only one objective, you must kill every last orc that charges into your keep. The myriad of traps at your disposal, as well as your keen sword and spells, get this task done with prejudice. It's wickedly entertaing and slightly demented watching the orcs hurl themselves into spinning blades and explosive barrels, all the while taunting you and laughing about their impending victory. I had childish glee when the hero started trash talking back. For a game with only one hero and a handful of enemy types it is dripping with charm and style. However it is not without minor issues. The animations could use a little more work and the single minded gameplay won't last forever, but these are barely worth mentioning. The dark sense of humor and the variety of death mark this as a must play8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002510306', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review:
There are Tower Defence games, and then there are games like Ork's Must Die. I very action packed game with a major focus on letting the player getting some insane kill counts and the like along with some brutal animations to follow. It ramps up the challanges as you progress, and offers allot of tools for you to pick, choose, and play around with to figure out what stratergys go best with your play style. This game also never once holds your hand, expecting you to figure things out on your own and run with it. 

If there are any real flaws towards this game, it's base price at times feels a wee steep in my pocket for a 20 stage ( x2 if you count nightmare mode's alt mob waves ) single player experance with maxing out skulls, and climbing the leaderboards the only thing left once done with it. But admittily for $15, you are getting something that looks and plays like a full buget game as well, and that's pretty nice for a new devloper.

Regardless highly recommended.

review:
Of all the recent first-person tower defenses to come out recently, OMD wins on variety and comic relief. A bit annoying you can't take your upgrade points back, though.

One note: Get the Artifact DLC. The poison satchel has saved my butt several times, and it alone is worth the price of the pack... well, the sale price anyways.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012200220', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2006, 'last_played': 1336546800}
review: Innovative and fun. You can tell that the developers really put time into this, and that's a big deal considering that half the games that come out these days are just made to make a quick buck and lack a "wow factor." Just beating it is fun, but it has replay value in its Nightmare Mode. You might also try to get one of the coveted spots on the leaderboard. The leaderboard adds another fun, challenging aspect to Orcs Must Die. Robot Entertainment doesn't overcharge for the DLC, and it is also worth the small price. The game has been on sale twice in the past month, and I'm sure it will be again in the future. It's worth the price they put on it. When you get it on sale, you're getting an amazing deal. Buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962071163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1343545200}
review: The game blends 3rd person shooting and tower defence incredibly well. If you prefer playing it as a shooter it gives you a handful of ridicilous weapons that can throw orcs around or freeze them in place. If you'd rather play a tower defence game it gives you tons of traps and towers that let you turn orcs into gibbed bits in creative ways. Overall it's a colourful, energetic and all around great game. Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975132018', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1434840342}
review:
I'm a big Bloon Tower Defense player, so I thought that I had the end all of tower defense games on my iphone already.  Oh how wrong I was.  This is a great tower defense game, with a nice bit of hack-and-slash thrown in.  I'm about halfway through the first act ( I think) and while some towers I have now seem to serve no purpose, and although I keep picking them when I first get them (eg steam trap without a combo for it) I'm sure later in the game they'll have a great combo (certain trap seem to be designed to be put together).

The only thing I wish is that I could choose from any trap/weapon whenever I want, instead of picking and choosing a certain amount at the start of a round.  It's just something I'm used to from playing Bloons, but I've gotten over it already.  Thats part of the challenge.

I'd give this a 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197961167439', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 720, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1636935074}
review:
This is a really clever and fun TPS tower defense strategy game. The dungeon atmosphere really makes it stand out from the growing crowd. Lots of weapon and trap unlocks give the right incentive to want to push further in the campaign missions. It does get quite difficult as a single player game because the monsters often attack from opposite sides of the map and it's hard to be fighting two places at once--they do provide portals to shorten the journey but they always seem to be poorly positioned (would have been nicer if you got to place the portals yourself). There is also a high dependence on your shooter skills because the trap reload times take forever in the heat of battle, although it is possible I haven't figured out the right mix. So far, I've only seen upgrades for traps, not weapons which is a bummer.

No coop is the game's major weakness, but it is enjoyable despite.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996311925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 923, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a real gem of an indie game. It offers a creative take on the tower defense genre with plenty of options to approach each challenge. The mixture of strategy and action game elements coupled with tight controls flow together very well, leaving you with one very satisfying experience. The game also has a good sense of dark humor that, while it may get repetitive at some points, has yet to come across as annoying.

All in all, I highly recommend this game. If you love the tower defense genre you shouldn't think twice about getting it. The game offers a great experience that is well worth the price and is still fun to play again and again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980683930', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1322208000}
review:
Yet again, this is NOT a recommendation. More like a warning to steer clear and spend your money elsewhere on more worthy titles.

The game has some very nice video's that hype the game up to levels if completely fails to reach when you finally start playing the game. And while this is not appearant at first. It slowly start sinking in after about 2 - 3 levels of this non-stop ogre killing.

To be honest, it's trying to be a tower-defence game but utterly fails at it as there are worse looking titles out there that are more fun and more challenging.

The game runs on most computers, looks nice, has some funny animations at times, but utterly fails at delivering any type of gameplay that was promised. Well, to correct myself, fails to deliver any type of gameplay that is FUN and was promised.

Recommandation is to go buy warcraft 3 and play tower defence there.

Rating 9 of 100

author: {'steamid': '76561197988922281', 'num_games_owned': 3128, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
A really fun and frantic "TD-ish" singleplayer game.

Though it isn't really a TD game; I think it's safe to say that the game got quite the inspiration from the tower defense aspect but instead makes use of traps, utilities and whatnot to defend your fortresses. It's even possible to make use of "pathing" with well-placed barricades as to lure the waves into chokepoints.

I don't have much to say about this game except that I enjoyed it for what it was worth. The downside with this game is the rather short campaign/story and once you've got the right set-up it''s just a matter of adding stuff for overkill. In my opinion it would have a lot more replayability if it had some sort of survival mode or challenges with increasing difficulty.

This is however subject to change with possible DLCs but as for now, this is the verdict..

Definitely a fun game, worth a playthrough but unless you're obsessed with killing greenskins over and over again, it won't offer much replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994133145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2409, 'last_played': 1546981257}
review:
Quite possibly the most underrated game of the year, this gem is filled with fine-tuned and "always fun" values that I never see anymore. It combines the best elements of effecient defense strategies with TPS/beat-em-up gameplay. The variety in different ways you can play each level gives it immense replay value. Only downside is that the first playthrough might be a bit easy for experienced players of either genre. Fortunately, there's a Hard Mode included that can appeal to you.

Ever played tower defense games, and wished you were on the field to make up for the terrible micro happening before your eyes? This can put your abilities to the test if you use tactics that empower your own character instead of countless traps and guardians.

There's a goddamn demo, see the glory or yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002391261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 2280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2280, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review:
You may think this game looks boring and is pretty one sided but the moment I saw the trailer this definately looked fun. And then I won the game and later bought the DLC on a sale.

This game is hilarious. I'm loving it. You pretty much have to fight against waves and waves of orcs but you get all these brilliant contraptions such as flip tiles, wall arrows, your own archers, floor spikes, explosive barrels so you can build up your defences and hold off against the enemy waves. It gets really challenging when you have a few entry points but if you think well and have a good defence structure, it's a breeze. Endless action, a very funny protagonist and visuals that make you feel like your in a cartoon, it's awesome. 9/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044915116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1623, 'last_played': 1324022400}
review:
Ostensibly a Tower Defense game, Orcs Must Die is a downright fantastic take on the genre.  With an art style reminiscent of Torchlight and a light-hearted sense of humour revolving around all the myriad ways to kill Orcs, OMD is as fun to watch and listen to as it is to play. The game offers a lot of options, and it does a good job of making them all viable.  You can be just as effective using traps to decimate Orcs as you can be wading in with Crossbow and Bladestaff.  You can use traps to deal direct damage, or take advantage of physics and fling the Orcs around like ragdolls.  You can also opt to be a weapon-wielder, lopping heads and shooting faces, or you can load up with spells and lay all kinds of elemental smackdown.  Or any combination of the above.  

Orcs Must Die is an aesthetically pleasing game that transcends its origins and does not disappoint in living up to its namesake.  This game is excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972230166', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1345618800}
review: Orcs Must Die takes the tower defense formula and tweaks it just enough to be something a little different; there's greater emphasis on both traps and your own combat abilities rather than just towers, allowing you to become more involved in the action. Combating the invading orcs and either watching them run through your stabbing, slicing, or smashing traps or dicing them up with your bladestaff and puncturing them with your crossbow bolts rewards you with some entertaining gibs, and the quips from both your character and the green brutes is good for a few chuckles. If you're looking to kill a short time with one or two rounds or fill out a boring afternoon with several more, Orcs Must Die is definitely an entertaining diversion worth looking into.
