author: {'steamid': '76561198002181744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1342162800}
review:
I bought this game expecting to maybe play it for an hour and move on, but I ended up marathoning it from start to end. The gameplay is fun and innovative (you get a feeling of reward for creating complex traps and you really develop your own playstyle as you go), and the characters (that is, yourself, the mage, the enemy leader and the orcs) are easily likeable.
I recommend it to anyone who's ever liked a tower defense game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044441900', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1690, 'last_played': 1422402165}
review: Wow this game is addicting! Part shooter, part tower defense, this game is AMAZING! Not to mention hilarious! The point of the game is to defend Rifts, and to do this you must place traps on the floors, use magic, and your trusty crossbow. But the funny part comes with the way you can defeat the opposing Orcs. One way is to place Spring Boards on the floor that launch the orcs whereever you aim the board. This can result in humorous and deadly outcomes. Another example is the dialogue, just plain goofy! Plus....drum roll please....ACHIEVEMENTS!!! Yup another game with achievements to keep the gamer coming back for more slightly-stoopid bragging rights! Pick this game up! Its unique, funny, fun, and OMG FUN!!!

review: A very fun game. It's kind of like Sanctum but with a fantasy setting instead of a science fiction setting. Build traps, unleash the horde and kill waves of orcs with your crossbow/sword and the traps you've build. At first I thought it was a little easy, but obviously the further you progress teh harder the levels become. I recommend this game to everyone that likes towerdefense-shooter hybrids. The only downside is the lack of multiplayer, but that's what Dungeon Defenders is for I guess.

review:
Dont go into this game expecting a story or a overly contrived chracter.... The game is exactly as the title suggest... and boy is it satisfying 

It promises nothing more than orc slaying. 

To understand the game think of it in the "Tower Defense" genre. 

Its real charm is how it does not take itself seriously. 


For what it is the game is an easy 8/10 But as a TD game it is a 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009068740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1319698800}
review:
Get this game. It's got a great art style, cartoony - but not excessively so, bloody - but not excessively so, and fun - excessively so (sic). 

The DLC is worth every cent as well, the few new traps and spells are great fun, and the new missions are challenging as heck. Turn it up to Nightmare for additional fun and frustration. 

This game makes me feel like the defense of Helms Deep, every single mission. It's you against hundreds, thousands of orcs. Cannot recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997632863', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 1851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1810, 'last_played': 1429050576}
review:
An awesome FPS/Tower defense combo game which seems to be really in these days. A Single player worth every penny. Alas its graphic engine is comparable to Valve's Source engine... this means it's rather unstable and causes the "Graphic card not responding" bug on certain levels or using certain abilities. If you are farmiliar to that bug dont buy it unless on the discount rack.
Edit:
Using Nvidia's "Alternative rendering mode 1" resolves the problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985686775', 'num_games_owned': 2177, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1882, 'last_played': 1343458800}
review:
Orcs Must Die is a dating simulator based on actual events, about a guy who lives in a castle and joins a shady online dating service. He then spends the rest of his life attempting to interview these would-be green suitors to find the love of his life. Sadly, his dates often rush the gates and fall victim to the castle's insanely jealous defense system. It's up to our fair prince to use his trusty Crossbow of Love and his Sword of Choosing to place that special touch on the suitors that meet his fancy, and who aren't grieviously injured by the castle.

All in all, I found this to be a very tragic tale, as well as a cautious reminder of the horrors of online dating. It's also a really great game, even if you don't usually happen to like historical-based dating simulators.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999469389', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2748, 'last_played': 1376697596}
review: Fuck me! all the money I waste on "big name" games. Sometimes i want to just have soe fun and not have to remember hundreds of buttons, tutorials, and every other dynamic in the book. Same time I may want something simple..but not low production indie crap(not saying all indie is crap). THIS game totally suprsed me..concept is simple..production values are very high and it is one of those games you play, you enjoy and you think it will soon pass....a few hours later there you still are. One of the best games i have played in a long time. It has the simplity of the 80's but it has some cool tricks up it's sleeve and is the perfect mix....fuck civ 5 lol get this and actually smile about your purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968399174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1345791600}
review: Highly recommended! If you enjoy tower defense or are a fan of Dungeon Defenders, this humorous game cranks up the difficulty accordingly as you go along and offers an abundance of towers and weapons to use. While the DLC is debatable (you definitely want the map pack, though), the grenade-like acid weapon in the weapons pack makes things a little easier and gives you a reason to use your mana. So, pick this up while it's still cheap!

review: Honestly one of the best indie game i have had the chance to play, simple premices and tons of fun, the closest thing u'll find to a dungeon keeper, one of the rare games i just play after a bad day :) just makes me laugth and relaxes me, only thing i would say agaisnt it would be it's too bad they didn't addedd a coop mode, many dungeons you play woulda been perfect for a 2 man team, also it's too bad they didn't added a loot system, the game lends itself to collecting loot to upgrade ur war mage but unfortunatly they didn't go for that aspect, oh well can't have everything.

review:
Great Tower Defence kinda game. 

You play a hero that you can upgrade/boost during levels, place traps on ground/walls or even roof.

It isn't only a "place so much towers as possible" kind of game. You can use tactics or even try to fight orcs away with your hero only.

I recommend this strongly.

review: Awesome, really addictive, FPS/strategy/combat/tower defense game. You wield powers and use traps to kill orc invaders! You can choose whether you want to upgrade your traps or abilities. Not to mention the comedy is pretty entertaining. The fact that you can actively involve your character in killing the orcs rather than just sitting there waiting for a wave takes out some of the tedium of a typical TD game. Great idea!

review:
Why do you not all ready own this game?

Orcs Must Die! combines 3rd person shooter with tower defense and wise cracking jokes. Highly addictive game that is enough fun that you might find yourself trying to acquire all the achievements!

Currently has 1 DLC that grants 2 new traps and 2 new spells. A new DLC will be released soon that adds 5 new maps, 2 new enemies, and 1 new trap.

For 15 bucks, you can't go wrong!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034389778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1364972400}
review:
An over the shoulder shooter / tower defence game. Brings you right into the middle of the fray as you try and stop orcs from entering the rifts to your world. Slice em, dice em, burn, em, freeze em, and a whole lot more with your varied arsenal of traps and spells.

Some of the earlier levels might be a tad boring, however as you progress you unlock more toys to decimate your foes with, and you can go back to older stages with all your unlocks. 

Fun for hours on end. Come forth young Warmage, defend your homeland, and remember ORCS MUST DIE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005554700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1320912000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000625372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Orcs Must Die! is a beautiful game.  That's not just the graphics, though the art is highly stylized and very fitting of the game's comical atmosphere.  OMD takes the addictive mechanics of the tower defense genre and the fast-paced gameplay of an action RPG and creates a hybrid that works far better then would be expected.  At first it just gives you a new tower every level, but then you get magic gauntlets and paladins and skill tree and meta-upgrades; there's a tremendous amount of content in OMD, and a tremendous number of orcs waiting to break through your defenses and charge your portals.  If only you had aimed that fireball a little more accurately or placed those tar traps a bit further apart...

Oh well, "Retry Level."

author: {'steamid': '76561197969417125', 'num_games_owned': 528, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1954, 'last_played': 1342767600}
review: Orcs Must Die! is one of the most enjoyable games I've played this year. The combination of tower defence and third person combat gives a perfect mix of strategy and fast paced action. There's an interesting variety of enemies and traps which allows for good tactical depth. Some traps seem weak by themselves, but when combined with other traps, prove to be very effective. The map layouts are filled with opportunities to take advantage of, such as chokepoints and lava pits, and then you can use your avatar to plug the gaps in your defences. The hard rock background music adds to the intensity, and there's a nice Plants vs Zombies style sense of humour. There are hours of fun here even after finishing the campaign, as you can try to complete the maps on higher difficulties or go for 5 star ratings and high scores. The low purchase price equals great value for money. Its also very stable and bug free. Buy this game NOW.

review: This game is the perfect combination between a hack and slash and a tower defense game. review:
Das Spiel "Orcs Must Die!" ist ein Lustiges Tower Defense Game mit Action Elementen. Das Gameplay ist schnell erz√§hlt,  man muss als ein M√§chtiger Kriegsmagier verschiedene Festungen vor einer Horde Orcs Verteidigen und hat dabei verschiedene Waffen und Fallen zur Auswahl. Es gibt genau 24 Missionen, und f√ºr jede Erfolgreich beendete Mission schaltet man eine neue Falle oder eine neue Waffe frei. Die Spiel dauer betr√§gt ca. 7 Stunden bis man alle Missionen beendet hat. Dann kann man entweder vorrige Missionen wiederholen um die Maximale Punktzahl zu erreichen die man vorher nicht geschafft hat oder Spielt den zus√§tzlichen Modus "Albtraum", mit dem man alle 24 Missionen auf einem Schwereren Durchlauf absolvieren kann.

Fazit:

Wer Tower Defense und Action nicht gerade √ñde findet, kann bei Orcs Must Die! sorgenlos zugreifen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008905080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1465021340}
review: This game is well worth the 14.99, its all about stopping the orcs (And additionally cobolds and ogres) from reaching the rifts, which are the source of magic. The plot, while slightly lacking, is well written and ties the game together nicely, with a good ending. The only downside to this game is there's no multiplayer, but for 14.99, it's still more than worth it. Enjoy expermenting with combinations of traps, magic and crossbows, while watching countless orcs die. Once you've completed the game on War Mage difficulty (normal), play nightmare mode for some added difficulty and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969519712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3605, 'last_played': 1336978800}
review: I'm hooked on this game. It has the right blend of puzzle solving and shooter gameplay to keep me coming back for more. There are variable solutions (aka trap combinations) to deal with the endless orcs, gnolls, kobolds and hellbats which keeps me coming back trying to get that last elusive skull. The main character apprentice war-mage is great; it's like Charlie Sheen playing Harry Potter (he even says "Winning" in the game). The difficulty curve does get steep about 3/4 of the way through the game, where it starts to feel impossible to get perfection on a level. Would be cool if there was some form of co-op multiplayer on this, but I'm hopeful that this game will have DLCs in the future to include new traps, levels, player-characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960566151', 'num_games_owned': 815, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1185, 'last_played': 1659890549}
review: Orcs Must Die takes the classic Tower Defense formula and flips it on its head by allowing you to take control of a protagonist, the War Mage, and let's you take control of combat. There are ~25 traps, spells and weapons at your disposal to take out the Orcs any way you can. The most fun part is mixing and matching between the different combinations of traps, spells, weapons and skill trees to find the best way to tackle each map. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989117548', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 2158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2158, 'last_played': 1324454400}
review:
Its been years since ive played a game as entertaining as this!! the large amount of traps(allowing many combinations) and the large variation of fortresses(where in each you can find a certain advantage) allows one to play them over and over,another bonus is that every trap you unlock and every upgrade you buy is persistant so you can go to an earlier level to experiment with the new traps. the "Nightmare" difficulty also picks up nicely where the war-mage dificulty ends. this game is all about making facing hordes of orcs fun and they have done a excellent job with that!!

the Quotes that the orcs spill are also funny.
the Normal difficultty campaign took me about 8 hours to complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970482178', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 3142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3142, 'last_played': 1333868400}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009288616', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1343631600}
review:
It's fun, but personally I prefer Sanctum.

In orcs must die, there's no coop, which I find really saddening. The paths are also pretty much set, and my hand's going to die from carpal tunnel from the amount of clicking I have to do with my crossbow at times D: (no hold LMB to fire; you have to repeatedly click, and your crossbow fires like a submachine gun).

It's difficult at times, but overall I sort of dislike the lack of path freedom. Sure you can build barricades, but those don't hold up to well. In sanctum, you can actually build the path that the enemies are going to take.

However, it has alright graphics, and seems like it will have an adequate campaign length; I haven't finished yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4492, 'num_reviews': 1009, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1324368000}
review:
Wow, the tower defense titles these days actually improve on what is already a fun game genre. In Orcs Must Die you control a warmage, in third person view. So instead of building traps in an isometric sort of  view, you now run around setting up traps and actively killing enemies with your character. There's never a dull moment and the fact that you gain new traps after finishing a level gives incentive to keep playing. You'll want to come back for more, it's THAT fun.
Other than that, the game mechanics are pretty much the same as any other tower defense game; you kill enemies, earn cash, upgrade traps, and try to prevent enemies from taking over your rifts.
Only downside, in my opinion, is that it's a single-player affair. I'm sure it would've been more fun when played in co-op mode but maybe that's something for the sequel.
Don't let that stop you from buying it though !

[Rating: 87/100]

review: First off: Play this, even if its just the demo; don't be fooled by how easy the demo is --this game gets fairly difficult pretty quickly. And when you finish the story mode, you unlock Nightmare Mode, which involves hard versions of every level with more, tougher enemies, next-to-no downtime between waves, and no breather "Unleash the Horde!" events. Great art, fantastic gameplay, witty dialogue. Completely worth its low price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979987597', 'num_games_owned': 2176, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1342335600}
review: This is a fun and interesting twist on the tower defense genre. The graphics are really great a mix between WoW & Dragon's Lair. The difficulty ramps up, but it never feels impossible. I would recommend it to anyone who likes the genre. It is almost as enjoyable (but right up there in quality) as Plants vs. Zombies. I am interested in seeing what the DLC will be like and how it will be priced.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986236936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1369589207}
review:
Cost of spring loaded trap? 500 coins. Hearing an Orc mention he was going to retire the next day right before he is catapulted into a pit of lava? Priceless.

Best $15 I ever spent on Steam. Do yourself a favor and buy it if you haven't already. Funny dialogue, interesting levels that let you get creative, and a great soundtrack with a fun art style have kept me replaying levels just for the lulz.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995731610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1342940400}
review:
If you like tower defense and strategic action games, this is the game for you. Build clever arrangements of traps and upgrade your weapons to fight endless hordes of monsters, with different strategies required for each stage.

The graphics are beautiful and cartoony, the music is fabulous, and the plot is simple and unintrusive but still fun. It's all wrapped up in a presentation that is amusing and charming, and honestly, I can't get enough of it.

It is easy enough that, with some persistence, even a casual player will be able to complete the story. For those of us who like a challenge, there's trying to get five skulls on every stage in nightmare mode!

The game comes at a low price, has 24 stages, three difficulty settings, and will likely have expansion DLCs in the future with more monsters and stages. So what's not to like about it?

author: {'steamid': '76561197970051770', 'num_games_owned': 1306, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1324368000}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999043186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1320998400}
review: If you're reading this, give Orcs Must Die! a try. I'm serious. I love the protagonist and his one-liners, and even without that the music is great, the gameplay is great, it's just not your usual run of the mill tower/traps defense. You have to plan, be smart, diligent, and slaying orcs is always its own reward.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972092514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1985, 'last_played': 1624063745}
review: Definitely try the demo first. If you grin and chuckle at all like I did while playing it, you'll enjoy the full game. Priced currently at $15, I've already gotten my money's worth with 7+ hours invested and more on the way. There is enough replayability to go back to earlier levels and refine your trap setting and weaver upgrades. My only problem with the game - no coop. This game is just crying for it. I've paid 50 bucks for games that I've only enjoyed 1/4 as much as this one. 8.5+ rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985998458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1357545600}
review:
While writing this review, I have not yet beaten this game.  In fact, I'm pretty sure I still have ways to go.  However, after quite a bit of anticipation, I'm glad to say that this game is worth its weight.  Its a unique spin to a genre that is getting more popular and offers a ton of variety.  Without having to due any calculation whatsoever in terms of placing down this or that, I simply go with what I prefer.  There is plenty of choice and strategy. 

 The flow of the game goes quite well with its style of humor and aesthetics.  It reminds me a bit of Heretic/Hexen in terms of weaponry/magic and the music strikes a resembling similarity to Warcraft 2.  

My only complaint is the lack of multiplayer.  While a great game on its own, having the ability to play with someone else would make it much much more entertaining.  However, one can only hope that it will be future content... otherwise I'll just get Dungeon Defenders when it is released.

5/5 Rating

author: {'steamid': '76561198006437466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1688493712}
review:
A hugely entertaining solo tower-defence/RPG hybrid which doesn't take itself too seriously.
(Also a contender for most self-explanatory game title ever!)

The game has a healthy mix of personal combat and summoning of minions/traps to prevent the orcish horde from reaching the portals that lead to our world.

A rating system which allows you to improve your kit, along with an online scoreboard are a worthwhile addition to a fun and in places challenging game.

Worth checking out :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039362011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1513462396}
review:
Very easy to get into. EXTREAMLY FUN!
As casual games go there few that can offer you this much fun. Killing the hordes of orcs and vile creatures that storm your castles never gets old. The maps gets very interesting as you move truought the campaign and your unlocked traps and upgrades are persistent so you can use them all the time anywhere.

ORCS MUST DIE 
MUST BUY!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993876381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1322553600}
review:
Its fun, its cheap, its slaughtering loads of orcs :D

This game has a great feel and is quite challenging.  The humor is quite good and it presents an interesting take on the first/third person lane defense gametype. Except... in this game there are no towers, just traps... lots and lots of traps. They all feel very satisfying and you can upgrade your favorite ones by completing levels.
Your own weapons arn't too shabby either, ranging from a kick ass crossbow and bladestaff to powerfull magic spells.

If your looking for something to waste short bursts of free time on, get this game ^^
